review_body: Great and luxurious hotel in the heart of the chaos of Tokyo, the transition from outside to the top floor of the building where the hotel is located is relaxing in itself. Luxurious facilities as expected, especially with the pool and the main lobby area. Staff are really incredible which is consistent with most hotels in Japan. A great way to spend a special couple of days in the city, although book if you're not too busy since you'll enjoy the hotel too much.

The Ritz Carlton in Tokyo is the most luxurious hotel I have ever stayed in. Usually all Ritz Carltons are luxurious but this one tops the Ritz Carltons in Osaka and Singapore that I previously stayed in. The rooms are 52m big with a huge bathroom and very luxuriously appointed. I stayed there for 6 nights but did not manage to use any of the hotel facilities as I spent all my free time exploring Tokyo. The hotel is next to Tokyo Midtown shopping mall and close to Roppongi and Akasaka where there are a lot of restaurants. This is one hotel that definitely impressed me.

■Location:Midtown in Tokyo.位置：東京ミッドタウン■Our stay condition:泊数For 1 night一泊■Room:部屋Type: a one bed room deluxe twinデラックス・ツイン・ルームLocation: Nice with a city view眺望：街並みAirconditioner: Comfortableエアコン：快適Lighting: Sufficient照明：十分TV: 1setテレビ：１台Bath & Shower : Excellentバス＆シャワー：素晴らしいToilet: 1roomトイレ：１室Free Wi-Fi: AvailableフリーWi-Fi：利用可能Mini Bar & A fridge: Availableミニバー：利用可能Safety box: Availableセイフティー・ボックス：利用可能Gym & Pool: Available. I recommend the pool because gorgeous.ジム＆プール：利用可能。プールはおすすめ。■Response of staff: Perfectスタッフの対応：完璧■FoodBreakfast & Dinner: Delicious & gorgeous with a nice city view at the Member's Lounge. You can only enjoy a special sake here. Amazing!食事：朝食&夕食：メンバーズ・ラウンジでシティービューを楽しみながら、美味しい料理（ビュッフェ）を楽しめる。ここでしか飲めないお酒あり。最高！■Others私の誕生日祝いでここをチョイス。スタッフが、私が行く先々で、おめでとうございます！を連呼。これには、感激した！その他：I stayed here for my birthday celebration. every staff said "Happy Birthday"to me wherever I went. It was impressive!

Lovely, comfortable and relaxing hotel that is very much at ease with itself in providing the highest standards of service to guests.Too many good things to mention but the highlights were the outstanding housekeeping service - our room was relentlessly refreshed but we never saw any staff at any time - and the wonderful Reika, who stopped to ask us on our way out for the day about our plans and/or on the way back to see if we had enjoyed our day. She was particularly helpful in making us aware of a national holiday which, had we not known, would have seen us travel to a place of interest that would have been deserted. She advised us to change our plans and instead we went to Ueno Park, which was buzzing and the highlight of our vacation.All staff are wonderful, kind, generous and professional. It was a pleasure to stay here.

I just arrived after spending 5 nights at The Ritz in Tokyo. Love the hotel. The common areas, the spectacular views and stunning floral arrangements in the lobby were all next level. The food and service for breakfast was incredible friendly and the food was delicious. The bar service was excellent. So many little extra touches for making a traveller travelling alone feel so comfortable. I highly recommend the hotel and would not hesitate to stay here again. The room was spacious clean and very well appointed. The gym was great as well. Unfortunately I did not get a chance to use the spa but definitely will on my next visit. I spent a lot of time deliberating where to stay and I am delighted with my decision. The location and attached shopping centre with cold rainy weather was a huge plus! If I had to point out one small thing it would be that the room could use a paint refresh. A small concession after such incredible service!!

We love the spa here. We love the treatments. We love the afternoon tea we love the champagne. We had the best meal at Azure 45 and from start to finish this is the best hotel in Tokyo :) I would stay here forever if I could but the apartments are too pricey!

Lobby on the 45th floor!!! Insanely incredible! Upon my arrival, the lobby staff meet and greet me and bring me straight to my room and the persobal service to privately check me in IN my room. The hotel staff are so accomodating to our request. The comfort and convenience of it all after a long day of travelling was just excellent. My room was absolutely beautiful with an amazing view of the city skyscrapper!! I was also given the vip access to the club lounge and i must truely say that the service just as tip top as my arrival to the hotel. The service staffs, the chefs down to the house keeping staff are all amazing! Little details to personalise my stay that gets me feel of that personal touch which is lack of in these modern stressful day. I love my stay and wish it could have been longger but my 3 nights of stay has been memorable experience. I will definately come back to stay with them again when i'm back in Tokyo!

On our first trip to Japan, we spent our initial days at the Ritz-Carlton. The logic being that our jet-lagged brains needed something familiar and cushy to crash at before taking on Japan. So, as expected, the staff is on-point. Exceptional service from the moment you walk into the hotel. The room was fairly spacious and the views are stunning (I’d imagine) from any room as the hotel doesn’t start until the 45th floor in the building and is the tallest for a few blocks. The room was as expected from Ritz-Carlton. Lots of extras.Nepresso machine. Kettle for tea and tea bags. Lots of items in the bathroom in case you forgot something. Our room had a separate tub and shower. Breakfast was great but pricey. $100+ for two people even with a discounted rate. We did it once and then hit a few spots in the ‘mall’ in the building for the other days. Lots of amenities as far as spas and pools but we missed that. Concierge service was helpful and friendly.
user_name:
OhFranklin
New York City, New York

review_body: I was stunned with almost every aspect of this hotel- the luxury of the room, the amazing view, the amazing staff...I would have easily given the place a 5 star review...but then I visited the pool/spa. It is beautiful. We visited earlier in the day so we could see whether It was worth going there later. It was beautiful, and it certainly seemed worth it. They walked us around and showed us all the facilities, and mentioned the steam room, sauna, etc. They never once said anything about use of the facilities costing extra money, even for hotel guests. For the record, there is no mention of an extra cost even on their spa menu that I grabbed, or on the website under the spa menu. But when we showed up to use it at the end of the day, they very casually handed us a sheet of paper letting us know there was a $30 charge per person. Now granted, I have no problem with the hotel with us upfront about additional spot charges. If they are upfront, that is up to you to decide whether or not you want to pay it. But for a hotel where the rooms are in the $500s at a minimum, and upwards $1000, it is extremely strange to nickel and dime on use of a steam room/sauna, without even being transparent about it. After feeling irritated and doing a lot of searching, I finally found mention of the additional charge on the website for the gym facilities. I also noticed a lot of other people have commented on this as a complaint on review sites. I hope they fix this little detail, so that they can truly become one of the best hotels in Tokyo!
user_name:
Dragonlady15
New York City, New York

review_body: The design of the intimate interior to the fast elevator to the high floors, you are ushered in arrival to RC high floors. The bar and lobby restaurant have fantastic views, as did our room. The room was extremely comfortable with an excellent bed, quality appointments but the housekeeping. Oh wow. So good. They were so attentive and when we expressed concern that the room smelled like cigarette smoke they dealt with it immediately (to great affect might I add).We enjoyed pre-dinner drinks in the lounge but did not eat at the restaurant. It was great.Post check out I was concerned I had left something in the room and the follow up and thoroughness of the housekeeping department and staff was outstanding. I cannot recommend the Ritz Carlton Tokyo more highly. Also the location is really my favorite, close to Roppongi Hills and walk able to so many train stations and even by foot locations.

Excellent does not begin to describe our stay at the Ritz in Tokyo Club Level. The staff, each and everyone of them, were so kind and made us feel so special. The amenities of the Club lounge are excellent in choice and quality. Our room was spacious, as was the bathroom, housekeeping and turn down service at our desired time, incredible attention to detail. Our room was on the 53rd floor and the views were spectacular including Mount Fuji!Our sincere thanks to Alexandre Prouvost (I hope this is spelled correctly) the Club Floor Manager and the entire staff for making our stay and my companion's birthday a memorable occasion.

If you're reading this, you're tormenting yourself over Park Hyatt vs. Ritz vs. Westin vs. Prince, etc., as I've done before. You're thinking it's a long trip, an expensive one, you want everything to be perfect, don't want to get all the way there and wish you were staying elsewhere, etc. Stop the hand-wringing and torment, and go with the Ritz Tokyo. I just completed a 4-night stay at the Ritz-Carlton Tokyo with my family. An absolutely incredible property, amazing staff, and in an ideal location whether you prefer taxis, subways, or walking. Pool, fitness center, and sauna area is awesome. Views cannot be beat - you'll either look across the city at Mount Fuji, the Sky Tree, and/or the Tokyo Tower. Our room was large by any standard, bathroom was perfect, and closet space was exactly what we needed. The views from the room are breathtaking. Everyone from the hotel was fantastic to speak and work with, however I need to single out David (Davey) in the bar, Kitano, Yumi, Saeka, Mathieu, and Omar from the front desk and concierge area, and especially Jimmy in the Towers restaurant and Nakamura from the Lobby Lounge restaurant. On two different nights, Nakamura provided an incredible experience (carrying the girls' dessert to our room one night, and on another setting up a small table for my wife and me at the window, when we mentioned it was "date night"). I usually avoid hotel meals as a rule, however do not miss the breakfast in the Towers Restaurant, or the wasabi snack mix in the bar. The hotel is connected to Roppongi Station, which allows truly easy access to anywhere in Tokyo. Great ramen and udon shops are right around the corner, as is shopping, sightseeing, Starbucks, etc. At about 1,800 nights in hotels and counting, these may have been my favorite 4 nights yet. In all those nights, this is also the first review I've ever written - it's just that good. Amazing place.

The hotel sits atop of the large Midtown Tower right on the outskirts of Roppongi. The lobby starts on the 45th floor and it only gets better from there. Lobby level is gorgeous with spacious seating areas, an amazing looking bar, and a high quality (but expensive) restaurant. Having a cocktail in the lobby is a must! Rooms are luxuriously appointed, lots of amenities, and even the rooms with mediocre views are gorgeous. International staff speaks many languages and usually are pretty fluent in both English and Japanese.Bed is turned down every night, convenient light controls on both sides of bed, full bathroom with separate shower and tub.This was my best hotel stay and a benchmark. I don't recall hearing any hallway or adjacent room noise, and of course you're so far up there is no street noise as well. Easy access to an amazing mall, subway station, and nearby businesses. If you have the means or you can find a few nights under cap for your business stay, you must check the Ritz out!

if you are considering to stay, I strongly recommend to select at club lounge level roomyou will enjoy 5 defferent service at lounge in only one dayservice of staffs, taste of food, atmosphere, everything is perfect !specialy at morning-breakfast, if you are lucky enough to see Ms KANAE chief cook for eggsyou will be surprise for her way of cooking eggs !!this hotel is the tallest in Tokyo so far,view from room, regardless of direction, is totally enjoyable

Every staff member was welcoming and wonderful to us the rooms were gorgeous amazing location great beds high end luxury and service to match. Concierge was perfect in recommendations and made our end of 17 day adventure hands down the best experience. Worth the $$

So we booked a new year holiday using Bonvoy. To our surprise when we arrived at the hotel at 5pm, we were told that the room was not ready for check in and that it would need ‘15 minutes’ for additional inspection. I’m a Titanium member and travel 80% of the year staying at numerous Bonvoy properties around the world, this was definitely a first encounter where a hotel charging $1k a night would have the balls to tell their most loyal guests in early evening hey sorry I don’t have a room for you. The check in staff took her time to explain the titanium benefits; she took out a piece of paper that says 4pm ‘guaranteed’ late check out but at the same time told me with a straight face that the room needs to be returned by 12 noon the following day without any hesitation. The so called Titanium perks are either 1x Apple 1x Orange or some lame discount on breakfasts. Great location, but very poorly trained staff who don’t understand how to handle situations and communicate in a way international guests can understand. Not recommended, especially when they jack up the price during holidays.

No review can do this hotel justice. It is a must stay. The location is superb as you are equidistant between Tokyo Station/Ginza and then Shibuya/Shinjuku on the other side of town. The service is what really separates this hotel though. We were treated like family the entire time and were truly saddened when our date of departure came. A special shout out to the lovely ladies of the concierge all of whom were so gracious and helpful.

Any hotel with a lobby on the 45th floor is off to a good start. This hotel boasts gorgeous views of Tokyo and is located in a lively higher-end neighborhood (roppongi ) filled with plenty of great dining and shopping options. Be sure to take full advantage of the lobby bar/lounge area. The cocktails are pricey but extremely creative and tasty. The live music is heavenly. The service is across the board second-to-none. You’ll be hard pressed to find a hotel that makes you feel more valued. Ultimately, I’d highly recommend this hotel as long as youre comfortable footing the hefty bill.

My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights and we loved everything about it. The place is simply magnificent!! The views, the food, the service, and everything else in between was just wonderful. Staying at the club level was the cherry on top. Once you stay here, you won't be able to stay anywhere else in Tokyo. Simply the best. I can't wait to go back.

travel-manic215
New York City, New York

review_body: We very much enjoyed our 4 night stay at RC Tokyo - the view of absolutely gorgeous Tokyo and the staff were equally impressive. There are a *ton* of great restaurants and shopping in walking distance. Uoshin Nogizaka and Jomon Roppongi both super fun and delicious, nearby, and well priced. Don Quijote is also a few blocks away, where we got a cheap suitcase to bring back some purchases. Barney’s and the like all around. Hinokizaka and Towers, both in the hotel, also super for dinner, but with a fancier pricetag - we did all the above, and would repeat. Tea in the lounge area with live music was a definite highlight. They are very accommodating of children, to the point of doting on them. (Smart.) My five year old daughter left with a tiara, several handwritten cards from staff, and a “frozen” mural drawn in the bath tub. Oh, and got to sleep in a TENT. This place is run from top to bottom like a finely tuned machine. At one point I was being difficult/demanding, and they went over the top to make it (more than) right. Great location, great hotel. We will return.

Super awesome and outstanding hotel in Tokyo with fantastic service, spacious rooms with a million dollar view of Tokyo and Mount Fuji, attentive and personalized service and absolutely delicious and exquisite breakfast buffet. The attention to details is amazing, and the level of service is the best I have seen. There’s even a kids check in area (with activities) that kids loved. Lots of facilities in the hotel including swimming pool, spa and fitness center, high end boutique stores, functions rooms, restaurants. The decorations are classy and exquisite. The breakfast buffet is a must try especially the made to order french toast, waffles, eggs. Very convenient location in Roppongi and you can walk to the connected Tokyo Midtown mall easily.

We just returned back to Atlanta from a wonderful trip to Seoul and Japan. Tokyo was our last stop, and we were totally enamored by the city. Our visit was made even more special by our decision to stay at the Ritz Carlton Tokyo! After a long day of travel by train, we arrived to check in at the Club Lounge on the 53rd floor with the soothing sound of live harp music. Since it was raining, the Lounge view was literally in the clouds, so we literally felt like we had arrived in a piece of heaven! We were greeted promptly by the hotel's GM. Mr. Masato Kominami, who offered his personal assistance from the moment of booking through our arrival and stay! Yoshikazu Katori, Front of House Manager, also greeted us and handled the details of our booking and gracious upgrade to an amazing suite on the 48th floor with panoramic views of the Tokyo skyline. Shortly after getting to our room, they sent up welcome amenities of fruit and water, and the young lady who delivered the items was simply incredible! She told us she was interning as part of her hospitality career training, and she is already an incredible asset. I am so sorry I can not recall her name, but she was distraught that our arrival to the incredible view from our room was obstructed by the clouds! We told her it was fine since we were staying several days, but she wanted us to experience the view from the moment of arrival. We went to dinner later on and returned to the room to find she had delivered a personal hand written card along with several personal photographs she had previously taken of the view so we would know what we had to look forward to the next day! This was an amazing gesture, one we will never forget!Others were equally personable and kind, especially Dennis in the Club Lounge. He took great time to ask us about our plans and offered his personal advice. We especially appreciated his advice to be the first in line for the tickets we had purchased for the DesignLab's Borderless exhibit at the Mori Digital Art Museum! What an amazing experience, and if we had not been first in line when they opened at 10 am, we would have been waiting in line for hours to get in the door! In addition, he and his colleagues made excellent drinks at the Club Lounge bar, and their generous hospitality was greatly appreciated.All in all, the Ritz Tokyo is an exceptional property driven by exceptional service and timeless elegance. I hear they have plans to update some of the classic interior elements that will only enhance the experience even more, and we look forward to returning to see the continued improvements. We only experienced one small flaw our entire stay, and that was at the main lobby bar. Even though we had Club Lounge access with the incredible views on the 53rd floor, we were excited to experience the views from the infamous and dramatic lobby bar. Understandably, the venue was constantly busy, and seating at the main bar was usually scarce. However, the lovely lobby and lounge offered ample seating with some great live music and a wonderful setting. We checked each night and came back after dinner on Sunday night after 10pm to see two seats open at the main bar. We were excited and went over to have a seat and a nightcap. A waiter quickly greeted us and informed us the two seats were not available but did not explain why. He offered us a seat at a nearby hightop, so we reluctantly took it with hopes of moving to the bar. We had our nightcap, and no one ever took the two open seats at the bar. Also, other seats opened up, and we were never offered to relocate. In fact, we even had to ask to have the waiter come back over to order a second nightcap, and again, no offer to move to the bar even though we had requested that from the beginning. Compared to the warmth and highly attentive service from the entire team during our stay, his attitude was totally out of place and confusing, so we just considered it to be an anomaly for whatever reason. Otherwise, a flawless and luxurious stay, and we can't thank Mr. Kominami and his team enough for their gracious hospitality and attentive service!

Good to have a meeting in a classic place on 45th floor where Tokyo become one city with a view from all sides,,,,the lubby lounge and The BAR of Ritz carlton Tokyo is the best place to be,,,,good food, classic cocktails made with professional Bar attendance by thier good services,Met with the manager by name Mr Omar, making sure we have all we need to make our day, its been a great pleasure meeting you Mr.Omar , you made our meeting successful and fruitful, thanks for Your team for the great services,

Exceptional service and attention to detail. The management staff was mindful that it was our honeymoon and upgraded us to the suite. The concierge helped us with restaurant reservations each night. Housekeeping and turndown service were impeccable. They made our Honeymoon absolutely unforgettable. Great location with easy access to Roppongi station. Connection to Tokyo Midtown mall makes things convenient as well to grab quick snacks/drinks.

A real wow factor emanates throughout this hotel.The lobby on the 45th floor is impressive and the large windows and views are an immediate draw. Being so high up, the views form the room were great and even the standard room is large and has all the amenities as expected. Service was excellent from check in staff through to the staff at the Towers restaurant and the Lobby bar. I asked for ice one evening, and the next evening I came back to a new ice bucket.The hotel is above Tokyo Midtown, an upscale mixed used development, that also includes a supermarket and 7-11. The location known for it's night life, good and bad, and is close to two subway stations, but no JR lines.Highly recommended if you can afford it.

Ben from Ritz Carlton check-in took my five year old to the "kids check-in" section where my son got the best hotel experience of his life. He got to do a bit of a role-play, received a cuddle toy which he does not sleep without. Ritz provided kids coloring books and toys that kept him extremely engaged and happy. The house-keeping team also was extremely nice, when they found my son's doodle's on the desk, they left a note saying " Dear Tyler, I noticed you love to draw, so I left you a drawing book". I was super impressed with the service but unfortunately I forgot to write down the name of the staff. I want to thank Ben, and the housing keeping team for the great experience. I really appreciate it.

From the moment we walked in every single interaction with the team members was absolutely fantastic. Our every whim was taken care of. The in house restaurants were some of the best I've ever experienced. The room was clean and spacious and it seemed every time I returned to the room it was straitened up and refreshed with new towels. I highly recommend this property.

We were lucky to be able to spend a week in Tokyo this year and stayed a few days at the Ritz Carlton before moving to Disney’s MiraCosta Resort. From the moment we checked in (no check in desk - in room check in) to our departure everything was superb and beyond expectations. The staff were attentive, knowledgeable and very helpful. Everyone spoke impeccable English and called me by name by the first evening. Our room was amazing right down to the bidet and ..... yes.....heated toilet seats. Tokyo itself was amazing!!!! Can’t wait to go back. I’d highly recommend this Hotel. It was definitely worth it!

Posh and Plush in every way, the R-C Tokyo is a great hotel in which to stay, whether for business or pleasure. The proximity to great museums and activities is an asset as well as it being on top of a huge shopping center, full of restaurants and boutiques. The staff is ultra-professional, courteous, and knowledgeable. The views are incredible. All in all, it was a superior experience!
user_name:
GEG378
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed here for 1 night on the last night of our stay in Tokyo joining other members of our family. This is a beautiful glamorous hotel. The staff were impeccable and made us instantly welcome. Our rooms were lovely with fantastic views over the Imperial Palace and new Olympic Stadium. The night before we checked in we had watched the rugby in our daughter’s room with brilliant room service. There were nice chocolates as a welcome treat and a great turn down service. The bathrooms are superb. We were celebrating a special birthday so had booked a traditional Kaiseiki meal in the Japanese rests. We started in style in the bar which embodies old style luxury with wonderful cocktails, nice music and fantastic city views. For my husband the best thing was being able to smoke his cigar.The only negative was the meal and restaurant service. It started off ok with 5 of us ordering one of the set meals,and my husband ordering a la carte because he has seafood allergies. Our server seemed to have difficulties understanding our order although it was a set meal. After 1 1/2 hours we had only received 2 tiny courses, and my husband had not yet had any food. We don’t know whether a Kaiseki meal is supposed to be this slow or whether there were problems. We finally had to ask to bring food more quickly which made things a bit better. We had breakfast in the restaurant which was very nice, although my husband would have preferred a few more western options. The egg menu is particularly good.The hotel staff were very helpful at arranging luggage forwarding to our final destination.It is a fantastic hotel and I would recommend it for a special occasion.

Like others have said, this is a fabulous property. When you first enter the lobby it really does wow you and so does the room with the insane views. Also the location is fantastic in Roppongi Hills. Don't really want to rehash all of that again.What I do want to stress however is the unbelievable service we received. The concierge at this hotel is excellent! They helped my wife secure reservations to some of the best restaurants and events in the city. They helped reconfirm and cancel at the last minute some of our appointments. It was like having an awesome friend in Japan who would help you with anything.And oh the breakfast! This is a must do at the Ritz Tokyo. Order the poached egg, waffle croissant and french toast off the menu, you won't regret it.If someone from management is reading, my special thanks go out to the entire concierge team, the restaurant staff at breakfast, Sugimori, Leon and Aku. Thank you again Ritz Tokyo for making our stay so memorable!

Spacious and one of the top end hotel that I have stayed in Tokyo. Excellent service. Surrounding had good bars and great restaurants to enjoy.ie lots of fusion restaurants.Hotel also has a great restaurants. Will definitely come back to stay.

Stayed here for our birthday and anniversary and it was wonderful. Definitely a splurge. The concierge team got us the jiro reservation as requested and provided amazing and detailed communication. We stayed two nights, first time got upgraded to the Tokyo tower view room, the view was amazing, however the room was on the smoking floor, and I can't stand smoke, they immediately came and fumigated the room. The second time we stayed here we were upgraded to the mt fuji view room, and we actually saw mt.fuji, it was awesome. We really enjoyed our stay, the biscuits and tea in the room was delicious. Everyone is super nice, and attentive. Best service in all the hotels that we've stayed on this trip.

Well located, glamourise , you get a great value on the club level, food at the club level was really good, service was SUPERB. Staff do everything they can to make your trip a great memory. The club level offered great breakfast, morning tea, lunch snack, afternoon tea with superb 3 level cake plates , a light dinner and more. Rooms are fantastic with great views and very comfortable. You can also join their loyalty plan and earn points. very useful if you travel a lot.

We enjoyed our stay in Tokyo at the Ritz tremendously, the pool temperature and spa were world class, as was the most accommodating friendly staff. The room was comfortable and quiet, the view spectacular.

Gorgeous hotel, great rooms outstanding service. What views. Location was excellent the subway station is within the complex. I'm not a drinker however the bar wile $$$$ was outstanding. Great place to have pre-dinner cocktail. This is one of the great hotels in the world!!!

Stayed here for one night at the start of a Japan trip with my wife. From when you enter this hotel, the staff and service are excellent, best I have ever experienced. The hotel is very well located in Roppongi neighborhood with plenty of food and drink options around that won’t break the bank. We didn’t eat dinner but treated ourselves to the Breakfast Buffet - about $55 each including Tax and Service. It was fantastic with the Waffle Croissant the best breakfast dish I have ever had. I ordered another which was included and was no trouble. Hotel delivered chocolates to the room to mark my wife’s birthday which was very much appreciated. The hotel is not cheap, I stayed on points but Luxury and Service are top class

Classy hotel with an impeccable service. Wonderful and health conscious breakfast. Perfect location. Very relaxing indoors pool. The staff attention to details and to guest well being is unparalleled.

I am quite a tough hotel critic and I can not fault the Ritz Carlton Tokyo. We requested an early check-in, and they were able to accommodate this.Our club room had amazing views of the Tokyo tower and everything felt like a luxurious cocoon. The bathroom really beautiful with excellent amenities and products. We had access to the Club floor and all staff are so incredibly helpful who really go above and beyond to make your experience special. A special mention to Fumie who was fantastic who made a special occasion extra special for us. She really went above and beyond.The breakfast buffet was amazing, everything you could dream of including all your favorite Japanese breakfast items.Every time walking back into the Ritz Carlton, it feels like you are coming back home. It is truly a very special hotel with world class hospitality. We will definitely return

Beautiful building, lobby and restaurant on the 47th floor with amazing view on Tokyo. Wonderful service on every step. Everything as it should be in Ritz-Carlton. I wish I would spend more time there.

We arrived to find us in rooms that were far part from one another. The staff did a great job of getting us connecting rooms very quickly. However I must say the best part of this hotel is the amazing breakfast they served every morning. It is by far the best breakfast of any hotel I have stayed at over the years.

Every Single thing about this hotel was perfect… Pricey… But it’s worth every penny… You are taken care of from morning till night… With a smile always… The food at all the restaurants is perfect… The hotel is in an amazing neighborhood.The room was a pleasant size ....the bathroom was fabulous..

My wife and I spent 4 nights at Ritz Tokyo and were not disappointed. As expected, the hotel service was flawless. Rooms were decent size considering you are in a metro city, and with the hotel rooms being 40th floor and higher, you are bound to get incredible views. Unfortunately, even as platinum members, we did not receive free breakfast. It was a bit odd b/c they offered us free breakfast on the last day b/c they weren't as booked on that day. Not sure why that matters for breakfast, but that's okay. We were happy to pay for it as the breakfast was really good. the best part is they offer a waffle croissant - it's exactly as it sounds and it was yummm! We had dinner at azure 45 one of the nights. Being a Michelin star restaurant, we knew it would be expensive. Not surprisingly, they were incredibly flexible with dietary needs. We are both vegetarians so all courses were made vegetarian for us. With us celebrating our anniversary, they added a celebration message to our last course. They gave us a table with a view of the tokyo Eiffel tower, it was very romantic and exactly what I was hoping for. Concerige was extremely helpful as always. However, Arakawa/Dan were amazing. Always helpful and went above and beyond in ensuring we had everything we needed or help provide suggestions where we were unsure. Additionally, Cristina - host at the breakfast restaurant was amazing. She remembered our names after the first morning and would greet us by our names. While that may be common, it's not everyday you meet people who memorize your name after one meeting. We certainly didn't get the same treatment from other employees at the hotel, which is why we still remember Christina. The negatives - it's crazy expensive. Obviously the hotel rooms are expensive considering it's Ritz and Tokyo. But even the drinks. The cheapest glass of whiskey I saw on the menu was close to $40. Half bottle of champagne was over $100. On the last day, I asked the hotel for a weight scale b/c we wanted to weigh our bangs to ensure they were within the limit. I would think a hotel like the Ritz would have weight scales available, but instead they sent up a food weight scale, which was half broken and required the hotel employee to hold one side up while we placed our bags on them. The location is excellent as well, walking distance (5 min) from Roppongi where you will find many bars and restaurants. It is also a 5 min walk to the train station so that you can connect to larger train stations for other areas of tokyo. Would def. recommend again if you are willing to pay the cost (we used marriott points).

We stayed for 3 nights on reward points and were prepared for a little less service for it, but everyone we interacted with was absolute class as soon as we stepped on the property and treated us as royalty. It felt everyone knew our names from the first minute and made us feel at home immediately. The room was clean and very spacious, especially the bathroom, and the view was simply amazing. The breakfast was among we the best we ever had, continuing the very high level of excellence everyone at the hotel showcased.

Visited the bar for drinks. 100 out of 100!Superb view, maybe the best in the city; stylish bar, great service, creative drinks!Highly recommended! Central location, close to 3 key museums and a nice park.

The lobby of the hotel and the views from the room and club lounge are very nice. The hotel feels a bit tired and dated, however. The furniture in the club lounge and room is scratched and beat up and needs to be changed. The pool area feels dated. While we were in Tokyo, we stayed at the Aman and the Ritz. The Aman was nothing short of amazing (one of the top hotel experiences of our lives), while the Ritz felt like a standard business conference hotel. I would not return to this hotel.

The staff, rooms and hotel in general could not be a nicer place to stay in Tokyo.The food at the restaurant for breakfast was great. We celebrated an anniversary and ate at the beautiful restaurant. Our meal was amazing!!! The view from our room was truly gorgeous as well.We would highly recommend the Ritz-Carlton in Tokyo to everyone!!!

This is about the best hotel in which I have ever stayed. The service, decor, atmosphere, food, etc. were all about as good as it gets. I have stayed at other Ritz Carltons, but none were as complete an experience as this. I messed up on dates for my award stay and the front desk went above and beyond to help me out. I was offered free breakfast for my stay and a nice upgrade, which was above any expectation, but well appreciated for me and my family. The views from the high 50s to low 60s floors are spectacular as well (lobby is on the 57th floor). We had nice conversations with almost all of the staff we came in contact with, which enhanced our experience -- even the wonderful ladies in the Bulgari boutique! I would love to be back there if I ever get back to Tokyo.

My family and I recently stayed at this amazing property. The second we arrived we were made to feel like honored guest. The check in was seamless. No standing around at the front desk. The check in was completed in our rooms and our luggage was brought up simultaneously. Our rooms were fantastic. Quite large, with beautiful bathrooms and fantastic views of the city. We had breakfast and afternoon tea; both were fabulous. My son and I utilized the gym and spa, they were top notch. Lastly, the location is fantastic. There are tons of restaurants and a mall connected to the property along with a subway station which was critical. We will definitely be back!

We stayed at the Ritz Tokyo for two nights using reward points. Staff were extremely accommodating and eager to assist. We were upgraded to a one bedroom corner suite that had amazing views of the city! The room was well organized, clean and spacious. I would definitely stay here again when visiting Tokyo. The location is phenomenal!

Our stay at the hotel was indeed very satisfactory.. Alex especially was so kind & helpful.. although I didn’t quite catch his last name, does anyone happen to know it?i would really like to recommend him. Anyway, all-in-all the stay was great :)

Amazing hotel, kindness, location, attention, details... and you can’t miss the Sushi bar at the lobby on the 45th floor... simply astonishing. A bit expensive but definitely deserves it. We’ll come back for sure

We spent 7 nights at the splendid RC Tokyo — 5 consecutive nights, then a trip to Hong Kong, and then a return for 2 nights. Service is a hallmark here. We arrived as a party of 3 from the train station and the friendly porter quickly gathered our luggage and a host directed us up to the reception floor. The main lobby/reception on the 45th floor is lovely and spectacular. The host walked us to the reception desk and waited with us until the reception was available to check us in. Our 6-yr old Little Bun was given personal attention and whisked over to an adjacent “kid’s check-in” area where she was entertained with a check-in process and given a quest to complete during our stay. The real check-in was done efficiently and then the host took us up to our room and showed us the features of the room. Our luggage arrived quickly afterwards. For my Titianium Elite status, the hotel was not able to upgrade my room but they kindly offered us complimentary full breakfast for our 5 nights stay in lieu of an upgrade. So we had a regular deluxe king room with a rollaway bed for Lil Bun. The rollaway bed carried a charge of roughly $90 per night. The room was about 450 sq ft (42 sq meters) and the rollaway bed took away most of the free open space so the room felt tight. But this is Tokyo, so 450 sq ft even crowded by furnishings is quite a luxury. The king bed was wonderful - firm mattress, soft linens, and lofty big pillows. The rollaway bed was a twin adult size with equal quality linens. The hotel offered a child’s size set pf pajamas for Lil Bun to wear to sleep. And we had adult pajamas too. Being in summer, we did make use of the A/C system and it worked well and most importantly the gentle hum of the blowing cool air was not noticeable. The excellent bathroom had 2 sinks, separate bathtub and walk-in shower and separately enclosed Toto toilet. A small complaint would be that the walk-in shower is not large enough for a truly luxurious experience, roughly only 4 ft x 3 ft. We had a beautiful view from our windows that we enjoyed every night.The breakfast was spectacular and we came to appreciate what a wonderful treat it was every morning. The quality and breadth of the food was fantastic. There was a perfect mix of local Japanese food and western food. You had the ability to get made-to-order breakfast foods as well as the large buffet selections laid out across the sides of the restaurant floor. Service at breakfast was friendly and prompt.We also made use of the delightful pool which was a well-maintained and very clean facility. It was a joy to jump into the mildly heated water and relax after a day out & about. We absolutely loved our initial 5 nights at thr RC Tokyo.Unfortunately we departed for about a week and then came back again for 2 more nights and it was a bit of a let-down on our last 2 nights. This would be the reason I cannot give the hotel a 5-star ranking. When we checked in again, there was no acknowledgement that we had recently stayed at the hotel. It didn’t bother me but I would have thought the hotel pays careful attention to returning loyal customers. At check-in, again the hotel could not offer an upgrade for my Titanium Elite status but this time the hotel did not offer any substitute goodwill gesture. We were taken to our room and to our slight disappointment, it was smaller than the regular deluxe that we had during our previous stay. We paid for a rollaway bed again which really crowded up the space. We asked for the same child’s size pajamas for Lil Bun to wear but the hostess told us they did not have any available. So it was a very inconsistent experience from the high standards that were established previously during our first visit. We did enjoy the marvelous breakfast again. It brings a smile to my face when I think fondly about the spectacular RC Tokyo breakfasts.

This hotel is very-well located in Tokyo in a very nice area and next to a beautiful shopping-center. Excellent check-in experience at the very well-run club lounge. Great view from the 53rd floor and excellent service and food/drink offering in the lounge. The room was beautiful, very spacious, excellent bed, a lot of storage possibilities. The bathroom is quite large, with two separate basins.We also enjoyed the great gym which is large and very-well equiped. Nice indoor swimming-pool and jacuzzi also on the 46th floor. The breakfast in the lounge is excellent and the sitting extremely comfortabe, with great staff. Check-out and transfer to the airport were perfectly organized. A fantastic experience.

We are celebrating our fifth anniversary and it was the first time for my little son to stay in Tokyo. All the staff are nice and helpful. In particular, we would like to express our sincere thanks to Linda of guest relation, Eri of Japanese restaurant and Charile of Towers restaurant for their professional and warm hospitality. We enjoyed our stay.We choose Ritz Carlton because it take care of our kid by providing Kid amenities and little games for him. The room is spacious which is not common in Tokyo. The location is fine. You can go to many other places by transferring in Ginza station. One thing we would like to point out is the lighting at room is a bit dim for guest with kids, though perfect for couples. Unluckily, the Jaccuzi is under maintenance and we cannot enjoy it this time.For dinning, breakfast at Towers is excellent. They are providing great varieties. The Japanese restaurant is a place that you cannot miss. Still, it is a great hotel in Tokyo and we recommend it to others.p.s. You can neglect the following paragraph as it is written for TripAdvisor support team. TripAdvisor system forced me to type Chinese character before I can post.旅客不用理會這小段p.s.的內容。Trip advisor 一定要我打中文先俾我出個post。我唔明點解。support 個邊可唔可以處理一下，我用.hk version 係唔係唔可以打英文呢？

After a walk around the city, we went on the lounge and bar area; sat at a bar table with a great view of Mt. Fuji and watched the sunset. Good cocktail & whisky menu. David and team were awesome; very enjoyable and well with your time!

We stayed at the Ritz-Carlton in May 2019. The hotel is well-presented, the rooms are large and the service friendly. The breakfast buffet was outstanding! One evening I went to have a sauna (something I always enjoy when staying at a high quality hotel), but was told I needed to pay to access the sauna. It is pretty outrageous that a $1000+ hotel a night needs to charge guests to take a sauna! Penny-pinching like this really takes the shine off an otherwise high-quality hotel.

Great Location loved the Chandon Blossom Lounge by the Ritz CarltonThe Ladies & Gentlemen of the RC were exceptional in every imaginable way.Plushly appointed rooms & amenities excellent Resturants amazing service from the doorman to the Chef everyone was so polite and attentive with an eye for detail.This was easily one of the best experiences I've had.Alex was amazing with Planning & executing every single detail

I stayed 2 nights at the Ritz and celebrated my 1 year anniversary with my girlfriend. If you want the best view in Tokyo, then you should look no further. The hotel is located in Roppongi and has many wonderful restaurants nearby. In addition, the train station is right outside the Tokyo Midway Building where the Ritz is located.The Room: The room is very spacious and the bathroom is beautiful. The views are spectacular and we were lucky to have a view of the Tokyo Tower. I agree with another post that the decorations seem somewhat dated (like the chairs), but the bathroom makes up for it.The Service: This hotel has 1st rate service. From the moment you enter, there are staff ready to serve you. The gentleman who took us to the room was incredibly friendly and offered us free breakfast which I was not entitled to as a Gold member, so I very much appreciated it. In addition, Mr. Kominami wrote us a very nice note for our 1 year anniversary and sent us some desserts which we loved. The concierge was also incredibly helpful specifically Dan.Pros: Top notch service, best views in Tokyo, great locationCons: It is on the pricey sideOverall, fantastic hotel.

With aged cheddar, thin smoked bacon, foie gras and freshly shaven black truffles. Coupled with Japanese sweet tomatoes and demi glaze sauce.. the WOW Burger at the Ritz Carlton Lobby Lounge is the BEST burger I had by Far! I added Dijon mustard and coupled it with a Negroni! And ordered it Medium Well, Crispy and juicy! It is so surprisingly light and well balanced!

Hotel is very well located, there is a big mall just around the corner, and it is near of points of interest. Personnel were very very kind and willing to help you any time. In Japan, you can not smoke in public places, but this hotel have a very comfortable smoking section at the parking lot. Food were very good and you can choose between oriental and occidental style. Luxury accomodations were as expected. Money well spent.

Staff and service was impeccable. Nice location and great views. The only reason I am not giving this hotel a 5 out of 5 is it does feel a bit dated. But I would stay again with no hesitation. It is attached to Tokyo Midtown which has a nice selection of restaurants and shops. Good pool, hot tub, and gyn in hotel .

This hotel is obviously very luxurious with great food as one would expect from a Ritz. The service is what sets this place apart from other Ritz Carltons I’ve been to. From check in to check out, the staff caters to you. I have never been treated so wonderfully at a hotel before.Special acknowledgement to William at the front desk/ lobby area for his help and friendliness.I will be back to this hotel shortly and am looking forward to it.

The Tokyo Ritz Carlton is hands down the premier hotel in Tokyo. The general manager Mr. Tanaka has created an unparalleled luxury hotel experience. The staff are extraordinary, the club lounge is exceptional, the rooms are stunning with gorgeous city views. We are especially grateful to Yuko Sori who was highly professional, hard working and very gracious in tending to our needs. We plan to return.

Rooms were quite large for Tokyo. Location is very convenient- walking distance from much of a Roppongi. Beds are ridiculously comfortable and the rooms are SILENT which is such a treat after a long day in noisy Tokyo. Views are out if this world. Food is very good. And the concierge is top notch. Not sure I would rate this as a ‘good value’ simply because the price is top dollar for everything— rooms, food, and their other services. While I know it is part of their brand charter to be super accommodating, there were moments when the attentiveness of the staff bordered on suffocating, IMO.

This is a truly elegant hotel with absolutely AMAZING customer service! The decor in the lobby was classy and beautiful, with a combination of flowers and flowing water, and highly polished floors and tasteful furniture. The lobby flowed into an open cocktail lounge, where live jazz was playing (it was a Thursday night), and we were immediately approached by a person in traditional Japanese kimono, Moca, the Customer Service / Guest Relations manager. Moca was a wonderfully welcoming person, and took care of all of our needs. The checkin process was flawless, and Moca accompanied us to our room to make sure we understood its features, as well as the overall features of the hotel (pool, spa, exercise facility, etc.) The room was excllent and the hotel facilities, especially the pool and exercise room, were the best we have seen on our trip. DEFINITELY a top tier hotel experience!

This is my third stay in the hotel. The hotel is located in the heart of Roppongi which’s closed to everywhere but not as crowded as Ginza. It has art galleries, parks, fine dining restaurants and shopping mall downstairs which I loved most. Club lounge in the hotel’s also maintained well. However, I m not satisfied with the staff not allowing me to take a picture of Tokyo tower in the restaurant which’s the only sighting spot in public area. They could also do a better job in restaurant bookings which takes forever (almost 48 hours) for the email replies. I m sure you can always find another luxury hotel with better service in Tokyo!

Likely the best hotel I have stayed in when it comes to staff attention on guests. Most of the time I never even pressed a button on the elevator as there was a staff member that jumped in and called it. The breakfast is second to none in quality and again, staffing and attention per guest. The one bedroom corner suite was well appointed and the pictures online didn't do it justice. Finally, this property is on the 45th floor and above, so the views of the Tokyo skyline are amazing. It's also connected to one of the best malls in Tokyo with great shopping and food. Truly one of the best hotels I have stayed at period.

Comparing with Ritz OAKSA, I like the hotel much more. Very good location and quick to catch the subway to downtown. Lot's restuarants in same building (Midtown) and always enjoy for shopping in flexiable time. Good service and can provide the difference language service and well recongized the kid when check in. The breakfast is really good for everyone and we enjoyed it with my Son everyday. So beautiful pictures from my room for Fuji Mountain and City view. Strong recommendation for travel in Tokyo.

The sunset views from the room are no doubt the best in Tokyo - always loved getting ready for dinner around 6pm when the room would be bathed in this incredible orange glow. Loved the massive ensuite marble bathroom, super spacious and with sinks on opposite sides of the room. The breakfast buffet experience could have been much better -- on top of having to actually line up because the restaurant was maxed out, the food options were meager and not the most impressive.The location is in the heart of Roppongi, and was very convenient for me to get around. Always easy to get a taxi. It is close to the nightlife, luxury malls and some of the best restaurants in the city.The service was top notch. When I asked for an authentic Japanese sushi restaurant booking, we were given a tourist trap recommendation in Ginza, which I immediately called them out on following our experience. They then went ABOVE AND BEYOND to ensure that we had the best possible stay after this, going to intense measures to apologize and offer us better dining recommendations, and quickly made up for the error. Truly a mark of unparalleled Japanese hospitality. Overall, I had a very wonderful stay, and can't wait to return.

This is a beautiful hotel on top of the Roppongi subway station. There is a mall and several museums in the complex. The staff is lovely. We took my sister for her birthday and we had one paid and one free room. Her free room was huge and actually better than ours, until we were upgraded to a suite ( my husband is Ambassador level). We had lovely views of Tokyo tower in both rooms. The breakfast is amazing and they even rustled up celery juice for us. The Sam Francis paintings in the lobby are stunning.

I came here expecting it to be the best hotel I've ever slept in and boy did it deliver. We were upgraded to a Tower suite to celebrate our anniversary and it was all we could have hoped for. The hotel is gorgeous and we could have lived in that suite for months without any issue as it was so big and had everything we needed. The bed was super comfortable est the views were just amazing.Although the hotel itself is great, its staff is really what puts it above every other hotel I've been to. We could see they wanted us to be happy and to enjoy our trip and made a ton of small gestures to make it as memorable and enjoyable as possible. We got delayed on arrival and they pushed back our reservation without any issue and always seemed genuinely happy to welcome us back to the hotel after our day out. A special thank to Nanami on that front, her enthusiasm really shows and we were always welcomed to the hotel with her smile.I definitely recommend the Ritz Tokyo if you want to splurge while in this amazing city. Even if you want to save on meals, there are a lot of options downstairs including the Maison Kayser bakery that makes wonderful products. In the end, the only quirk we found was that the toilet was too noisy and that it wasted a lot of water, but I guess that's to be expected from a high-end property.Thank you for a great experience!

I dont have much to say, except that everything was just amazing. The staff are so well trained and so polite that you literally dont wanna leave this place. The buffet on the last floor with the breathtaking view was the epitome of perfection.

wonderful views and all staff were very friendly Pool and hot tub/whirlpool are on the 46th floor. Views are incredible.Room amenities are excellent and complete. Bed is comfortable. Overall it’s a good stay for us

Wonderful hotel with amazing amazing service , to be expected in Tokyo , BUT it’s really extraordinary! Great location close to museums , shopping and the Roppongi area where you have great dining and nightlife.

Incredible, smothering service, incredible rooms with an INCREDIBLE view. All aspects of our stay were fantastic and we cannot wait to return. The special treatment to our children including numerous birthday cards and special touches just topped it off.

I stayed here for 5 nights in May on a 2 week trip to Japan. Tokyo was our first stop and this was my favorite hotel of the entire trip. The rooms are a nice size for Japan and they are thoughtfully laid out with plenty of storage, closet space, dressers, and a very spacious bathroom. The bathroom is wonderful with two separate sinks with plenty of room for two people to get ready and lots of storage and even a drawer to keep makeup and personal items (why are there never drawers in hotel bathrooms?) Also, the view from all the rooms is fantastic. Even with some jet-lag, opening up the view gets you excited to explore the city and it's stunning at night as well. Another great feature of this hotel is the location. It's close enough to a metro station but almost feels like you are in a suburban area of the city with green space and parks, felt like a retreat in the middle of Tokyo. The service is also top notch as you would expect. There are nice restaurants within walking distance and it's connected to a mall so it really has everything you need. I have two tiny complaints about this hotel. 1. The bar in the lobby is stunning with beautiful views and great drinks but they allow smoking, which is a bummer. Usually it's not bad but you can smell it when you walk in, typical in Japan. 2. There aren't very many breakfast options around. We ate at the hotel, which was yummy but quite expensive. The mall doesn't open until 11am and there really aren't many places around that open for breakfast. We found a French Cafe in the Tokyo Midtown Center called Le Pain Quotidien, which was one of the only places open in the immediate area. Overall the hotel is expensive but worth every penny, I would definitely stay here again. A true luxury hotel in a fantastic location.

My husband and I recently returned from a magical 6 night stay at this property. From the moment we arrived after traveling many hours, we were treated as valued, special guests. Minami from guest relations took care of us as soon as we stepped out of the elevator! She helped us many times during our stay- she even walked us out of the hotel to a restaurant to make sure we could find it! Yuna and Kyoko- excellent concierge staff made wonderful restaurant recommendations and reservations for us. Bradley in the bar and Chef in the breakfast restaurant made everyday feel special for us. With our Platinum Amex we were upgraded without even asking, to a spectacular large room with a direct view of Tokyo Tower. The Ritz Carlton organization should be very proud of the amazing management and staff at this hotel. The level of customer service is one of the best we have ever experienced. We absolutely loved everything about our stay and will highly recommend this hotel to all who are visiting Tokyo.

What’s not to love? Amazing rooms with luxury amenities, knowledge and helpful staff, and outstanding breathtaking views! Definitely worth the spend if you are seeking high-end accommodations in Tokyo.

We stayed in this hotel in December 2018.Rooms:We stayed in superior rooms it was spacious clean and very nice! Service was phenomenal! Housekeeping did a great job! Location was not the best in Tokyo for tourists but was good in general as the hotel is attached to a nice small mall and an underground station.

Being a creature of habit and ritual, I have several requisite stops in every country I visit. While I am proud to say my haunts lean towards the more local and simple, occasionally one wants to luxuriate in the high end.Hence, my traditional last night dinner at the Lobby Bar in the Ritz Carlton Tokyo. When you combine a spectacular space, great food, live music, a cigar friendly environment and Ritz Carlton service (super-charged by Japanese hospitality), you get elegant decadence personified.As always, this was a beautiful end to a busy and wonderful week in one of my favorite cities.

We stayed on the Club floor. The room was nice. Very well maintained and the view was spectacular. The service in general was superb. We have to note that the check in and check out process on the club floor, although personal, was extremely time consuming. Check-in, for example, on the concierge floor easily took a half hour. During that time they took a drink order –part of which never came. All that written, the people on staff were terrific. We needed a cash machine and asked the bellman for directions. He not only gave us directions, he walked with us to the mall and made sure we found the machine! This is a great hotel. If you are on an expense account and the company will pay, live it up.

Stayed here for a combination of business and pleasure. And it truly was a pleasure. The views from the rooms are outstanding, the rooms are huge by Japanese standards, the breakfasts are not to be missed, and the service couldn’t be better. The only complaint I have is that the pricing at the bar is over the top. But, it’s a pricey hotel so I guess it goes with the territory. Overall, I hated leaving. Highly recommend.

harasmr
New York City, New York

review_body: Hotel was beautiful and the staff exceptional in every way.We have a toddler and they treated her like a princess. They truly went above and beyond for us all.Quiet neighborhood and yet close to everything.Restaurants were all great, Towers being our favorite. Best wagyu of the trip.Didn’t want to leave!

The facilities of the hotel are to the superb standard appropriate to its five star status: well equipped spacious suites and bedrooms, excellent spa and fitness centre, upmarket restaurants and bars. It has two further points of differentiation: i) the consistently high quality of service from its high calibre teams; and, ii) the panoramic views of Tokyo and beyond.

Great service and amazing killer views from rooms! Loved the "sky lobby" on the 45th floor of this tower - ensures that everyone has a good view of Tokyo! The hotel is located in Roppongi near many subway lines and steps away from the awesome shopping mall, Roppongi Hills.

My wife and I visited this property for five nights on our honeymoon and couldn’t have had a more tremendous experience. From the moment we arrived, Mocha had us taken care of and had all our needs seen to.I was in touch with the hotel before our arrival and they had arranged for a room upgrade (fantastic view of Tokyo Tower) on a high floor and a dessert for our special occasion. The hotel staff really pulled out all the stops and arranged for special breakfasts and drinks during our stay.The room was the biggest and best appointed of all luxury properties we’ve visited in Tokyo. The gym was great, breakfast delicious with many western/Japanese options, and location superb. Direct access to metro won many points over our previous stay at Park Hyatt Tokyo.The service is really what drives the bulk of this review. Staff applied a person touch to everything, researched many different activities for us during the day and helped us out with plans we had previously made. At one point during our stay, the button on my pants broke and the hotel staff fixed this quickly in-house without charge.When we checked out, the staff presented us with a book they had made for us to commemorate our stay. I’ve never felt an “above and beyond” touch quite like this property and we would love to return next time we’re in Tokyo. Thanks for a great stay!

We just checked in this fantastic hotel and we are going to stay here for five nights. My wife and I had been here for one night last year. We loved the location. It's just above the fancy shopping center in Roppongi Hills and so many subway lines. There are direct Limousine bus to/from NRT so it's very convenient for international travelers. Therefore, I decided to take advantage of the extra reward night before the new redemption rate takes effect. We are now here with my wife's family for a 5 days vacation. We are disappointed to the room assignment. I have explained our needs to hotel two weeks in advance. It is like this, we have two rooms (one under my name and the other under my wife's) and put us close by. If possible, we want rooms with Tokyo tower view. As a Titanium member, I feel the request was extremely reasonable. However, our rooms were not close at all. We were separated in Different Floors and NO Tokyo towers view in any room. I understand there might be requesting from other guests. But come on, I still see three or more rooms available at the moment on Marriott system and nobody bothers to work something out for us?We spent 3 nights in Kyoto RC earlier this month for the Sakura season and we had wonderful experience since the time we stepped in there. We expected similar level of Japanese service but it turns out you get what you pay. Status does not work in here.I think we might expect too much in here even it's a Ritz-Carlton.

Everything is perfect at the Ritz Carlton Tokyo, from the moment you arrive until the day you leave. I was amazed by the view from my room and then the space at my suite. The swimming pool is perfect to unwind from the flight, with refreshments available. In room equipment is amazing, including even an Apple TV for the suite. Room service is very good, the exquisite sushi form the restaurant is amazing and I loved the breakfast. Every time in Tokyo, I ll come back to Ritz Carlton!

Can’t say enough good things about this hotel and our recent 5 nights stay was great. Rooms was great (though Mt Fuji did not make an appearance). Staff were friendly and welcoming. Such a contrast to the awful Palace Hotel we stayed on our first night.Every year we come here, we never want toleave.
