New York City, New York

review_body: We have traveled all around the world and stayed in some beautiful places but the Ritz in Tokyo is now a favorite for life. We stayed for 5 nights on the first leg of our trip to Japan and absolutely loved the hotel itself, the location, and the kindest staff who went out of their way for us many many times. Our room was beautiful and luxurious and had the nicest view of all of Tokyo! The housekeeping was prompt and made up the room several times a day after we were in and out, and remembered our preferences for towels, pillows, etc. I must say the best part of the hotel was the wonderful concierge staff, who emailed back and forth with me for MONTHS before we arrived and helped us arrange many hard-to-get reservations at restaurants at peak times. Truly so helpful and kind. They were quick to assist with maps and advice whenever we asked. I have already recommended the hotel to others and would love to return one day!

We’ve stayed at this Ritz in Tokyo twice, once for our honeymoon and once for a babymoon/birthday celebration and both times were amazing. This is one of our favorite hotels in the world. The hotel is centrally located and great for getting around. It sits on top of the midtown mall which has a subway as well as a Dean and Deluca and Le Pain for a quick coffee and to go breakfast/lunch/snack. The rooms are gorgeous with giant bathrooms and stunning views. The lobby is an amazing great room great for cocktails or afternoon tea. The best part of this hotel is staff and service- the nicest, most caring people in the world who genuinely want to make sure you have the best stay possible. On our last stay for the babymoon/birthday, one employee went above and beyond, Misato Nagai. Upon check in she welcomed us in the lobby, remembered by husband’s bday 2 days later, wished him a happy birthday, decorated our room, and gave us a complimentary non-alcoholic bottle of champagne. That alone is complete WOW factor. But it didn’t stop there, when checking out she gave us a baby gift stuffed animal and packed me some decaffeinated tea for the plane ride home. We were so touched. This is the only place we will ever stay in Tokyo or recommend to friends. Best stay ever!

When my husband and I decided to go back to Tokyo for our Easter holiday, it was a no brainer that we decided to stay again at the Ritz Carlton Tokyo. We were warmly welcomed back during our late check in & was immediately escorted to our room on the 51st floor with spectacular evening views. We ordered room service since it was late and most restaurants and shops at the Galleria Midtown Tokyo was closed. Our food arrived on time as promised. We had breakfast at the Towers on the 45th floor and was met daily at the reception by Ms Cecilia Yamashina & Ms Kana who greeted us each morning with a smile, as they led us to our table & took our initial orders during our entire 6-day stay. The breakfast buffet had a good and sumptuous international selection and it also includes a special menu to choose from. My personal favourite on the menu was the waffle croissant. The best! I miss it. The rooms at the Ritz Carlton are pretty big for Tokyo standards. All rooms come with spectacular views considering that it starts on the 46th floor. Our room was always kept very clean and well made up. I greatly appreciate that the housekeeping staff kept track of our requests for the extra bottles of water and toiletries that were replenished daily. A big special shout out to Ishikawa-San for making the sprint to catch the taxi that dropped us off at the hotel lobby and retrieve my husband’s mobile phone. He came back waving the phone, to my husband’s relief. Again thank you x100 to Ishikawa-San. (I am including his photo below with his kind permission)Overall, the Ritz Carlton Tokyo is a highly recommended hotel without any need to manage expectations. Stellar service. We can’t wait to be back.

The Ritz-Carlton Tokyo is our first stop of our Asia trip. It was our first time travelling to Asia and you guys really gave us an unforgettable experience. Room was very clean and big. I finally can felt that how Japanese people it is. Your staffs all are very polite and helpful. Although their English isn't very fluent but I can feel they provided they service is from their heart. Good job, we will definitely come back.
user_name:
RobfromDC401
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Everything and everyone was wonderful. Worth upgrading to concierge level. Fumai was wonderful she not only showed me how to properly whisk my tea but told me where I could buy a whisk nearby. The views and the food were fabulous and the omelette maker offered me a special Japanese breakfast if I was interested, it was a delight, sticky rice and an egg with some special spices. Everyone at this hotel will go out of their way to help you. Thank you to the staff of the Ritz for spoiling us it was wonderful.

We spent 10 days traveling in Japan with a group, mostly staying in budget hotels like the APA and Tokoyo chains. But I decided to splurge for two nights by redeeming my entire Bonvoy account so that we could stay here. For 60,000/night, it was actually a bargain (although I think the exchange rate has gone way up since the merger).From the moment we arrived, I was so impressed. We were checked in by Matthew who was very charming and helpful. We were escorted to our room and wow, what a view!. The room was so comfortable and well-appointed. And the bed is divine!Of course, it's the service that sets a Ritz-Carlton apart. One thing that stood out to me was that employees did not hesitate to leave their post to walk with me rather than just pointing. A lovely woman in the chocolate shop walked us over to the restaurant, even though it was closed, to show us the space and talk about the different menus. The shops in the adjacent Midtown building are very nice. The only bummer is that they open so late. I need my coffee well before 11am, good to know there is a Blue Bottle shop about 5 minutes away.In summary, we had a fantastic stay and next time, I would happily pay to stay here.

It is by far the Best hotel in the world. It is Japanese precision with amazing luxury and one point service. The food the breakfast room and my room, they were all amazing/ spectacular. You have to pay the price but see the return as pure excellence.

First time in Tokyo with the family for Cherry Blossom (Sakura) and a fantastic stay at the Ritz Carlton in Roppongi. The Japanese are known for being polite and hospitable and the staff at the Ritz Carlton take it to a new level. Special thanks to Miki and Erina and at the Club Lounge and Ryan at room service for their excellent service. The quality of the room and hotel is also very good and the views are fantastic from all sides. If you are lucky, you can get a room with views of Mount Fuji in the distance.

We went to Japan for a wedding - in Kobe and also visited Kyoto and then wrapped with 4 days in Tokyo. The Ritz was an amazing experience. We upgraded to the Club and enjoyed that each morning and evening - it is open until 11 PM, which was convenient as we were out seeing sites most of the day. The service was incredible and the friendly staff made it even more enjoyable. The view is incredible - we went to the SkyTree but it didn't have anything on the view from the Club or main lobby.

My husband and I stayed here twice during our visit in March 2019, at the beginning of the month for two nights and during the peak Sakura season for five nights. We used points for the entire trip and this was definitely a good point redemption before the points increased. For the two nights, the hotel upgraded us to a very nice suite which was appreciated. The second stay, the hotel was practically sold out but our room was still very lovely and had perfect views. On both occassions, a chocolate platter was brought up the room as an amenity. My only complaint on either stay is that breakfast is not included for Lifetime Titanium members. I think this is a mistake as the Ritz in Kyoto provides free breakfast. The hotel does offer 20% off of all food and beverages for the Tianium members but we would have preferred breakfast. Also no upgrades here whatsoever unless you pay for club floor which is about $200 a day additional. Nightly entertainment in the bar area was a nice touch however beware that they have a smoking area. Service was excellent. One day we were going to eating lunch near hotel and the manager walked us to the restaurant as he felt we would not find it on our own. Now that is service. We loved being near the mall and the cherry blossoms were the best in the area. I would definitely stay here again.

Stayed 6 nights at the Ritz. Service is excellent as expected from Ritz. Facilities were excellent, great gym and warm pool to exercise in winter. The reception is a bit cramped but once you pass that, it is great. Location is excellent. The train station is below, shops and restaurant are located near by. Had a nice traditional Japanese yakitori dinner nearby but had some help from locals to get there. If you are on expense, it is highly recommended.

We just finished a super 5 day stay. There’s nothing like the views and the bar, and the bar staff to end a perfect day of Tokyo sightseeing. The entire staff was professional and attentive, and proved themselves when I needed a bit of (unrelated) Medical attention. A+++

I truly enjoy writing reviews when I experience something extraordinarily wonderful, and the Tokyo Ritz sets the standard by which all other hotels should be measured. From their extraordinary location 45 stories above one of the most beautiful cities on the planet, you will be treated to an experience that is truly unparalleled.I’ve been a business traveler for 30 years, and I’ve stayed in many of the most luxurious hotels in the world, none of them match this experience for one overwhelming reason, the service. Every single interaction with every single staff member during my stay left me saying “now that’s how it’s done!”Trust me, don’t debate over price, this is a priceless experience you will remember forever!

If you ever get to visit this beautiful hotel it’s a must to go and see the bar and the lounge! When I stayed there Omar, Emmanuel, David and Kiver were on duty and they have really made my day with their enthusiastic service and going the extra mile to get me my drink of my choice! Well done! BestAllan

Overall, it was good. The only bad was I expected more from Ritz Carlton. I had a lunch at Towers. View ad atmosphere were good, 45th floor, City View. The service level was normal.About the food, flavor was too strong, both main dash and dessert. 全体はよかったのですが、期待せずに行った方がいいかもしれません... タワーズでランチをしたのですが、雰囲気がよかったです。45階で景色も綺麗です。サービスはとても普通でした。東京料理は味が濃かったです。メインもデザートも

This was my first Ritz-Carlton experience and I must say, this was the nicest hotel I've stayed in my lifetime. We spent two nights here after a week long ski trip in the Nagano area. Pros:-Located right in Midtown Tokyo, near the Roppongyi and Nogizaka stations. I loved how the hotel was part of a high end shopping mall. Lots of options for dining, shopping, and even a 7-11 right in the mall!-Excellent, white glove service. I can appreciate this as I am in a service industry. -Lobby located on the 45th floor. Rooms start on the 50th floor with breathtaking views of Tokyo.-Beautiful, well appointed rooms. Nespresso machine. Comfortable beds. Spacious.Cons:-Shower not hot enough. I prefer hot, steamy showers. Maybe it's a Japanese thing?When we checked out, I forgot my iPad in my room and immediately, we received an email from the hotel stating that we left this behind and that they would ship it to our home address, complimentary! Now that is outstanding

Just got back from trip to Japan for the Tokyo marathon and our first stay was at the Ritz Carlton in Tokyo. We were really impressed with all aspects of the property. We took a taxi from Tokyo station and were greeted warmly by a number of staff. The hotel was fully booked upon check in so no upgrades but the room did not disappoint. Incredible city views, very posh accommodation, lots of space, (checked all the boxes and some). Add to that a super nice and attentive staff and we were on cloud 9. The food was amazing starting w/ an elaborate buffet including made to order selections. The lobby bar / lounge was always crowded and had a good scene. We had tea (full tiered presentation) and some lunch as well as drinks there. We ate dinner off property but options here are top notch. Service was great and timely. Nice gestures w/ notes, desserts, marathon prep, etc were all greatly appreciated. Really impressed! Tks for the stay.

I went to the bar in the loabby area with my husband in Dec 2018. There were some miscommunication between staffs and us. I tried to explain it and the manager of the bar, Omar Driouech, was very kind and helpful. We would like to mention it and people get the best service from the beautiful bar in Tokyo

I struggled with my rating for our stay here, as it was a great hotel, wonderful views and all staff were very friendly. It deserves 5 stars, but on our one night stay we had several service hiccups in the executive club, which we didn’t expect. Looking at other reviews, I think we just hit unlucky, so I wouldn’t want to put anyone off staying here, but on the other hand, the service wasn’t what we expected. We arrived at the hotel and were greeted and taken up to reception. We then had to wait to go to the exec club to check in. We were taken to another lift then asked to get out of it as they needed to check our access to that level, bit embarrassing, but no big deal. At the exec club, we were welcomed and seated and offered a drink, views are fab, so all was great, except that 45 minutes later, nobody had made any attempt to check us in. It was 5.30 well after check in time, so room should have been ready. Again, no big deal, we were tired after travelling all day, but my husband went to enquire and we had another drink and then nothing happened for 30 minutes until my husband finally went up to the desk and said we wanted to go the room very firmly. 10/15 minutes later check in was sorted. Bit of a shame as the tea and club were lovely, but we just assumed they were busy or forgotten us. We ate at the tempura restaurant which was really enjoyable and the service there was excellent. Back at the club, staff member apologised for the delay in check in, which was really sweet and we asked for early breakfast and checkout and a taxi to be ordered as we had an early flight. Next morning we were given a coffee and croissant in the room as requested, but we had to call 3 times for help with the bags and then we waited 15 minutes for a taxi and only got one as he dropped someone else off at the hotel. None of these were big issues but we were just surprised as usually service at Ritz is flawless. Nevertheless we would stay again, as a lovely property with great views.

Beautiful property with the lobby on 45th floor of the Tokyo Midtown business complex in Roppongi area of Tokyo. Rooms are on floors 45-53, with the club level on 53. Pool and hot tub/whirlpool are on the 46th floor. Views are incredible.Staff are extremely friendly and were very helpful. For example, I was trying to find out where I could buy a similar blow dryer (hair) to the ones in the rooms (they are GREAT blowdryers, btw) and I got a list of a couple of places, close to the hotel, where I could buy one. Service that goes ‘above and beyond’ is always a wonderful treat and I thank the staff for that!In the club lounge, the breakfast waffles are to die for. You must ask the lady who makes the omelets and she will take care of you. Such a kind woman. Thank you!Since I used Bonvoy points for the room, I paid to upgrade to the club level (20k yen + tax =~23k yen for an upgrade/per night). Using points to upgrade wasn’t allowed.The food offering in the lounge was good, not great. My son and I always compare ‘club level’ offerings to the JW in Cancun, which did an exceptional job of their meal/food offerings in the lounge. So, more variety at the Ritz would be great.Overall, a pleasant experience with a staff that goes out of their way to be helpful!

We had a group of 20 people here for work and I would like to call out David. He provided superior service and was extremely professional and considerate. It was a pleasure meeting him and he made our stay a wonderful experience. I look forward to coming back.

We have stayed in different hotels in Tokyo but this time we decided to stay at the Ritz-Carlton because we hadn't stayed in that district yet. We loved it. It's a good location, because it's in (kind of) the middle of Tokyo and lots of interesting parts of the city are close by.We had a great room at one of the top floors with a stunning view. It almost felt as if we were in a plane ;-) It was breathtaking. For breakfast we went to Pain Quotidien just outside the hotel, and we loved the Japanese restaurant Hinokizaka in the hotel, also with a beautiful view. Every night we had a glass of wine in the lounge/lobby, there was always live music and the atmosphere was very relaxed. The staff was very helpful and housekeeping was great too: they immediately noticed that we drank a lot of Nespresso, so every day they took care of a restock. We would really recommend this hotel to our friends!

No love for titanium elites really makes me question the value of the titanium status in the new Marriott Bonvoy program No upgrade even though I can see from the Bonvoy app that suites/upgraded rooms are still available Service is impeccable as always in TOP tier hotels in japan.Everyone is polite and friendly and faultless on their service

We stayed here for 2 nights. Hotel Reception people were very friendly and helpful. Room is fairly big but knowing Ritz Carlton’s standard, we feel that it’s about time to do some renovations.Room amenities are excellent and complete. Bed is comfortable. Overall it’s a good stay for us.

We stayed here for three days and found the service, ambience and rooms absolutely top notch.Concierge staff were incredibly helpful to help us navigate and one staff member who I had interacted with prior to the trip specially came up to personally greet us. The room had amazing unobstructed views toward the Olympic stadium and housekeeping was top notch.We liked the location and would come back in a heartbeat. Amazing!

This hotel is elegant and expensive. The service we received was exceptional from the time Luke met us at the entrance (and took us to reception on the 45th floor). There the desk check-in was flawless and Miamie (?) made sure our room on the 50th floor was okay. Of course it was. The room was beautiful complete with pajamas, robes and slippers to wear and a great view of Tokyo. There is a high end mall just outside the door with plenty of places to eat if you don't want to eat at the hotels restraurant. We sat in the lobby bar and had a $14 cappaccino and $20 mixed drink. Employees dress in kimonos in the evening and do a little ceremony to light the candles in the lobby each evening. Very nice especially if it is your first visit to the area. There was a manager in the lobby constantly to make sure things run smoothly, and it does. It was a real treat for us to stay at such a high end hotel.

This was our RC experience and it totally met our expectations as a luxury hotel. Service was good during check in, we were introduced to the room in a lady dressed in kimono. The room is gorgeous with excellent amenities and breathtaking views no matter day or night, we even saw snow for a few nights. We stayed a total of 5 nights using points and they are worth every single point. I contemplated between Tokyo Marriott (with breakfast and lounge access perks) and RC (without those perks), no regrets in choosing the latter. Location wise, it is walk-able to 3 metro lines (covered by Tokyo Metro Pass, which we purchased from Roppongi Hills) but there is quite some walking distance averaging 10 minutes. At the 46th floor, there is the swimming pool, common Jacuzzi and heat experience. On the last few days when our travel schedule is not too packed, I wanted to try the heat experience and I was told there is around 3000 yen required as top up (I think it is complementary for some room types). Well, I was glad I had read the benefits entitled to me beforehand that as a Marriott Plat Premier (now Titanium), there is complementary heat experience, which I reminded the reception of. Heated Jacuzzi (at 40 degrees Celsius), cold bath, sauna and shower stalls are included. The experience is separated by gender and is Japanese style (naked and no tattoos). Overall experience is really good although I feel it would be better if there is some lounge music playing in the background.

Their ladies and gentlemen are very well prepared for our stay. They taken care almost details of our requests. Highly recommend to use the swimming pool in 46 floor, the view from swimming pool is fantastic.

I am writing this review with still two nights left to leave the hotel. The hospitality, service, location and amenities of this hotel are second to none. The staff in all areas are simply perfect, the general areas and rooms are beautiful, but mostly, the attention to detail has me impressed. It's my 10th anniversary trip with my wife and by a simple casual conversation with one of the gym ladies staff on my way out on why was the reason for my visit, that night I got a Bordeaux wine bottle and a hand made card from all the gym staff, the hotel manager and someone else in my native language. My laptop has been in the desk throughout my stay and the housekeeping staff thought it was a good idea to provide a mousepad (what? really?). They even provided Ritz Carlton straps to keep all my computer wiring in its place. This hotel is simply SURREAL.Looking forward to my visit to the Ritz Carlton in Kyoto. It's gonna be tough to beat this one.BEST HOTEL EVER.

I just finished a 5 night stay at the Ritz and it more than lived up to its reputation. Live music in the 45th floor lobby, gorgeous rooms and really nice pool/fitness area. The staff could not have been more respectful or courteous. Highly recommended!

Tourist11578935202
New York City, New York

review_body: We landed in Tokyo and they allowed us to check in and access our room 3 hours early. The suite is amazing with views of the Tokyo skyline. Comfortable and friendly the staff couldn’t do more!We had a car collect us from the airport supplied by the hotel and it added greatly to the special feeling when arriving in this great city

The scenery is awesome , but I requested a room that would accommodate my tourist/ vlogger experience, stepped away from the room for a tour around town, and came back to an empty room..all of my items were removed without my permission and had I not entered the room , I would not have been able to retrieve a camera that the staff or whomever moved my items left behind, this was a horrible mishap, I spent the next day trying to inventory my items , which took away from my time to tour, I was almost afraid to leave my personal belongings behind..this was not acceptable....

I hab an Early check in and an unbelievable beautiful room. The stuff are amazing kind and did an excellent service!Great View! Large room! Kind Stuff!I'm looking forward to stay there again.Best Regards

This property was PHENOMENAL. The level of service from check-in to check-out was 5++++ stars all the way. Everyone knew it was our honeymoon when we arrived; the attention to detail was wonderful. My husband and I booked a suite, and we were upgraded to an even better suite that had 270-degree panoramic views of Tokyo. It was incredible to walk into this room at night and wake up in it each morning. The bed was incredibly comfortable, bathroom immaculate (the bath even had crazy-good views of the city), and the tea/coffee access in the room was appreciated. We felt very, very well taken care of -- by the concierge team, by housekeeping, by the staff at the fantastic bar area overlooking the city, etc. I would absolutely, 100-percent recommend this hotel. It's worth the price, because the experience is truly priceless.

Top notch hotel, the room we stayed in was huge, two double beds and one rollaway bed and we still have plenty of space. Should have requested view of Mount Fuji, which we saw from the club lounge. The club lounge is beautiful, food and drinks was good but they were not able to meet our halal food request. However, the whole experience was great. The moment, you stepped in, you know that you are going to have a great time. Staff was always warmth and helpful. The hotel is located in Roppongi, and there is a mall (Midtown Mall) downstairs, loads of restaurant. If you take Uber or Japan Taxi, the cost to go to places like Ginza, Shinjuku or Shibuya is pretty expensive so plan your trip wisely. The gym and pool was great too, very strong WiFi and the lift system was so efficient , although u need to change lifts to get to the ground level, but the lift is always available when you pressed the button. Note that the lobby is on 45th floor, so when you taxi drop you off, you need to take an elevator to 45 then to your room. Go for the club room with Mount Fuji room.

The staff, views from the dining room and our room, and the amenities were truly 5 star! Definitely recommend to anyone visiting. It’s also located right by Rippongi Station so it’s very easy to get to other destinations from the hotel.

R-oyalty (we were treated this way during the entire stay) I-nspiring T-errific (The staff, from the restaurants to housekeeping to the spa attendants)Z-en likeT-op of the the worldO-pulent furnishingsK-inglyY-ou First!O-utstanding ViewsThe grandeur of the lobby parallels the warmth exuded by the employees as you step off the elevator to check in. From the minute we dragged in after a long travel day, to the moment of check out, our family of 5 received the most attentive, kind & spectacular treatment. Yuki N a therapist at the spa and her assistants worked tirelessly to resolve a personal situation with no thought for charging although that would have been appropriate. God Bless all . This is one of the finest hotel experiences, if not the finest, I have ever experienced. From Fort Myers, Florida!

Every little detail is considered - from the way our room is set up and serviced to all the restaurants! I cannot recommend this hotel enough. Spent five wonderful nights at this terrific hotel. It is the staff and service that set this hotel apart from others. First class, professional and friendly. Congratulations.

Thanks to Valter and his team for a wonderful stay. Upgraded to a corner room with a mesmerising view of the city. Absolute luxury.Shall definitely be back to enjoy the impeccable service (and view) from this landmark hotel.

This is my second time staying at the Ritz Roppongi and I must say it surpassed my last experience. (which may I add was wonderful as well) We had such an incredible time! We had three rooms and each one had an incredible view, everything set up for us and even sweet notes to come home to. One of my favorite things about this hotel is the feeling I got when I walked into the lobby, one of feeling at home, resting into a feeling of "ahhhh yes!". The service anticipated our every need and was there when we needed anything. From our check in process to the club lounge, our breakfast and check out. An A+ for the whole experience. A big shout out to Chef Kanae from the club she was soo sweet and it felt like moms home cooked meals when she was around, (watch out for her omelets, incredible!) the rest of the staff there was great to! Thank you!

As a management consultant, I have lived in hotels for the last 5 years spending ~250 nights at SPG hotels, and have been an SPG-Mariott Platinum member for the last several years. For our honeymoon, my husband and I decided to go to Tokyo and to split our time between the Prince Gallery Tokyo and the Ritz-Carlton Tokyo, two of the best hotels SPG-Mariott have in the citey. While the Prince Gallery was an absolute delight, the service and attitude at the Ritz was some of the worst I have ever experienced, leading us to check out on the day we arrived and switch hotels.Firstly, when we arrived, we were told there are no upgrades available, though upgrades at check-in (based on availability) are a basic benefit of Platinum membership. I had booked the hotel online earlier that same day and there had been plenty of suites available at the time online. When I double checked, the associate at the check-in desk changed tracks and said they did have suites, but none were ready at the time. I said we were happy to wait, since for once, unlike when I'm on business trips, on my honeymoon I actually planned to spend time in the hotel and would've loved for it to be extra special. After some waiting, she agreed to upgrade us to an Executive Suite. So far, so good.Later in the evening, we wanted to grab a snack and drink at the Club Lounge before heading into the city but were told that Platinum membership doesn't get access to the Club Lounge at the Ritz. Of all the SPG hotels I had stayed at, this was a first. While normally I wouldn't care, but since my husband and I are both vegetarians who had been having a hard time finding good vegetarian options in Tokyo, we had been keen to have some options at the Club Lounge, which is why we had chosen to stay at an SPG-Mariott hotel. Explaining this to the manager, we requested access to the Lounge for just the one evening but were flatly denied. What was worse was the tone of the manager who told us we were being unreasonable and that he had already done us a huge "favor" by upgrading us at check-in, and that if he gave us access to the Club Lounge, it might bother their Club Level guests since the Lounge might get "too crowded". Unless I was being completely unreasonable to expect some pampering on my honeymoon at a hotel where I had been a Platinum member for years, this tone especially left a really bad taste, and we decided to check out and move back to the Prince Gallery, where the helpfulness of the staff and their effort to make our honeymoon stay special and memorable had been next-level.Very disappointed by the attitude of the manager - and would not recommend any Platinum members to stay at the Ritz - your loyalty status, and any special occasions mean zilch here!

Stayed here for business for 2 nights. It is a beautiful property, with some great staff, but the service is inconsistent and disappointing in many respects, which fall far below the usual Ritz Carlton standards.To start with the pros: - good location (connects directly to public transport and shops);- elegant interior design (both public areas and the room) which gives a classical European impression; and- good breakfast staff (two managers at the entrance were really welcoming and a member of staff at the breakfast area voluntarily offered to provide take away coffee, in anticipation, as she noted that I was in a rush).The cons:- Not much loyalty recognition (I was told by the front desk staff that Marriott Gold Elite members are not eligible for upgrades. Only platinum or above are eligible. This was quite surprising. This should be made clear on the website.).- Disappointing front desk service and welcome (it was my first time at the property but the front desk staff did not offer to take me to the room. Nobody showed us around the room and the property. You also get “lemon water” as you try to check in - rather unglamorous.- Lack of interest in guest service standards - at checkout, I was not asked how my stay was.- Cleaning Service was rather poor (I took a picture - there were unhoovered corners of the room throughout our stay).- Terrible lounge staff - was seated in the lounge area for breakfast, as there was no space in the breakfast area - the staff in the lounge was the polar opposite of the breakfast restaurant staff - cold, avoiding eye contact, unattentive, leaving dishes piling up and specifically having to ask for dishes to be taken away - really unpleasant experience.- Disappointing departure service - I asked for a cab and have my bags loaded - the lady at the bell desk asked us to wait outside the building - it was cold - if there was some common sense, maybe the guests should have been called after the bags had been loaded? - Breakfast quality - I wanted to order some eggs royale - after trying to explain what it was, I eventually just settled on eggs Benedict, which is not a big deal, but the quality was also not that great (in terms of taste and presentation) - i don’t want to compare food to Europe but just to illustrate the point, somebody should try the egg dishes at the Ritz Carlton Vienna. What I had comes nowhere near the expected European quality - better off I think just having breakfast at the shops in the shopping mall below.There are other comparable hotels in Tokyo and if you want the highest quality service, my view is that it would be worth considering them.

This is my 3rd or 4th stay and my #1 hotel in Tokyo! They do it all perfectly. We booked Club Lounge and from arrival, whisked up to the 53rd floor for check in and champagne!The rooms are so comfortable. The staff is amazing and what truly sets it apart from other hotels, and the reason for the 6th star! Kanae, the Club Lounge breakfast chef, is amazing in everything she does. She took great pride to prepare us a special breakfast each day. Clearly making each meal with great care and love! Now back at home, I am missing this daily ritual!!! Cannot wait to return!

Top notch five stars hotel! From the service, spectacular location (lobby in 45th floor) and great food.Classic beauty. The best place to enjoy Tokyo city view. Room is so spacious with breathtaking view of Tokyo. Located in Roponggi. Very high end area. Less crowded and not so touristy. We had one of the best stay ever!

My husband I stayed at the Ritz Carlton on our last night in Japan. We arrived by taxi pretty dishevelled after our train trip from Kyoto and I had quite a bad chest infection and really needed a drink. We were promptly escorted through the lobby after getting out of the taxi, our bags disappeared. A cup of water magically appeared in my hand without even having to ask while my husband completed check-in paper work.The check-in staff asked if we had any plans for the evening and if they could assist us. I suggested I might do some shopping and they were very keen to help us with that! Ultimately I ended up retiring to the room and just taking a stroll around the quiet neighbourhood but the fact that they were so willing to help was very impressive. It made me wish we had started our trip off at the Ritz. Nightly turn down service was great and they also arranged to hold our bags as we had a late flight. We enjoyed high tea with a beautiful view of the city before departure. I recommend enjoying the ambience of the beautiful bar/high tea ☕️ although if you don’t like seafood or raw fish you will not find the high tea to your liking. It’s not western style and you probably shouldn’t expect it to be since you’re in Japan. They do have other western food on the menu though like French fries Overall a very relaxing and stress free experience. Beautiful room, impeccably clean, enormous bathroom, beautiful view of the city too. This is an expensive hotel but I think you get what you pay for in terms of service and facilities.

If you are looking for the loveliest hotel experience in Tokyo, this is it. I’ll grant there are other luxury hotels in the city, but the graciousness and hospitality of the staff set this property head and shoulders above the others. I stayed here with my two children, ages 10 and 13, last April. Prior to arrival, I corresponded with Ms. Reika to inquire about a room that would offer the best views and comfort for a 10-day stay. (Both Tokyo Tower and Mt. Fuji views are stunning, so no reason to be disappointed either way.) Not only did Ms. Reika describe our room options in detail, she even emailed pictures, floor plan layouts, and a bullet-list of pros and cons for each, including very specific details such as building architecture which may allow other rooms to see into the windows. Incredibly helpful and patient! The room she recommended was perfect, spacious, and very comfortable. Upon arrival, the kids were delighted with room decorations of balloons, gifts, and a warm welcome. As Platinum Marriott members, we accustomed to complimentary club access, but this is not offered here. Don’t let this discourage you. We chose to pay for Club access, which included personalized concierge services and five food presentations a day—totally worthwhile and highly recommended. The quality is far above and beyond the club lounges that are offered gratis to elite members. We got to know many of the Club Concierge and staff, who go out of their way to make your stay special—they are truly all wonderful. Ms. Erina was particularly kind and has a natural gift with children. She offered wonderful recommendations based on our interests, and left delightful notes and treats for the kids outside our door. Upon our departure, Ms. Reika, Ms. Erina, Ms. Sayaka, and Ms. Fumie (also from the Club) surprised us by meeting us as our bags were being loaded to say goodbye and presented my children’s favorite treats (which they remembered and packed to go) and gifts. And here’s a first in our travel experience: Ms. Erina surprised us with a lovely handmade scrapbook of our family’s trip including pictures of the places we described in our travels each day! Such a wonderful and over-the-top thoughtful gift. I do not think our experience at the Ritz would have been the same without the Club Lounge. It’s a splurge, but you won’t regret it. Particularly if you are traveling with a family or group, the lounge is a wonderful place to gather--and this is not always easy to find in Tokyo, where space is at a premium and many restaurants are best suited to solo diners or pairs. The views are spectacular, the constant supply of food and drinks delicious, and the service unparalleled. They’ll make you feel like royalty. We’ve already booked our return trip!

I spent my birthday in March 2018 in Tokyo visiting my beautiful dogs' friends and their (the dogs') mothers. These would be my dear (human friends) Yuka-san, Eiko-san and Kumi-san.My husband and I stayed at the Ritz Carlton Tokyo from 21 March to 24 March . This was the second time I was staying at this resplendent hotel. INdeed it is the epitome of luxury and beauty.In any case, the Ritz NEVER FAILED TO IMPRESS. If you are there for the first time, you will be floored by the elegance of the décor, the classic furnishings and the beautiful chandeliers and bespoke rooms and architecture. Even the bathrooms and the toiletries shout GOOD TASTE! You just can't go wrong if you choose to stay at the Ritz. Every single corner drips with luxury.I am a stickler for cleanliness and I love to stay in luxurious surroundings so Ritz is an absolute must for me. As far as service is concerned, you really can't ask for anything more. We took the room plus breakfast package. On the first morning that we had breakfast at the Towers Restaurant, Mr Leon Cates, the Assistant Manager of Towers Restaurant approached our table and asked us how we found the buffet spread that morning. Being the loquacious person that I am, I told him that I found the French Toast "to die for". Leon went on to tell me that that was his favourite food item in the spread too. He explained that it was made of "brioche" and briefly told me how the French Toast was prepared every morning. I was sold on it! Leon was very attentive to us and very friendly. Unwittingly I leaked out that we were there to celebrate my birthday and to meet up with my wonderful Japanese friends. Unbeknownst to me,Leon then surreptitiously asked his chef to bake a birthday cake for me. On my birthday morning, when my husband and I went to the Restaurant for dinner, Leon surprised me with a beautiful (and yummy) birthday cake ("Arabica Sphere") which was also extra-terrestrial !!! It is made of coffee sphere, milk chocolate and hazelnut with a biscuity base. WOW !!!I had never tasted anything quite like this. As for location, it is a stone's throw to the malls. On one of the mornings my husband and I walked to Midtown and we were so delighted to see the cherry blossoms in full bloom. (You would probably know that mid March is a bit early for cherry blossoms.) . My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed ourselves at this wonderful property.It was definitely made much more special by Mr Leon Cates! Kudos to you Ritz Carlton for having such laudable employees like Leon !

First thing to say is the hotel itself is situated in a nice area and the views from the top are awesome. We were able to see Mt Fuji from the restaurant on our first day there! Most important thing to say is how incredible the hotel staff and accommodations were. Hands down the best hotel experience I think we’ve ever had from start to finish. The staff was incredible at every level, from the bellmen to the front desk. We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights and brought our 16 month old daughter with us as well. The staff was so over the top with our daughter it was appreciated beyond measure. From the gift basket at check-in, to the gift baskets at breakfast, to the handmade gifts received from the staff, the stay was one she’ll never remember and we’ll never forget! A very, very special thank you to Mr. Valeri, Mr. Takamitsu and Ms. Moca. Each of them went out of their way to make our stay as enjoyable as it was and we truly appreciate it!

Absolutely loved this hotel! First class service all the way. For comparison, we went to the Park Hyatt for drinks one night (the bar from Lost in Translation)—nowhere near the service or experience we had at the Ritz. My only suggestion? We absolutely adored the breakfast each morning, especially the Perfect Egg. Please include a small piece of toast with the Perfect Egg. I believe it will take a perfect breakfast to the next level. Thank you for a great trip! We can’t wait to return!

The Ritz Carlton Tokyo is an oasis of luxury and calm high above an extremely energetic city. Our stay there was most enjoyable. We loved the convenient, central location, in upscale Roppongi. The hotel is connected to the vast Midtown complex, which offers high-end shopping, a welcome range of dining experiences, from casual to fine dining, and an excellent hair salon that serves both men and women (the hotel concierge can book your appointment). Our room was spacious, luxurious, and beautifully appointed. Unlike many comparable hotels, the closets were quite large, and there was plenty of storage space for our belongings. The mini-bar was one of the most tempting we’ve ever encountered—we especially appreciated the endless supply of Nespresso capsules! Breakfasts were delicious and service overall was impeccable.

We specially picked The Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo for The Valentine's Day and the Chinese New Year Eve in 2018. We love the Mt.Fuji view which is available from the hotel room we chose.We were particularly pleased with the impeccable service of all the staff, from the moment once our taxi arrived at the hotel, when they warmly received us and then delivered our luggage directly to our room. When we checked out, it's also hassle-free with all our luggage which was delivered to the taxi called by the hotel at our request.We were impressed by the excellent service of the gentleman and the lady (we forgot their names) who welcomed us when we checked in and accompanied us to the taxi when we checked out respectively. Both of them were pleasant, well-mannered with a warm smile on their faces.

This hotel is a luxurious and modern hotel that is conveniently located to high-end shopping, restaurants, and the Tokyo subway (located in the lower levels underneath the hotel). The rooms are modern and spacious with spectacular views of the Tokyo skyline. The staff is very personable and accommodating. The first floor cafe is a more casual restaurant with excellent food, drinks, and desserts. We would definitely stay here again.

The Ritz-Carlton Tokyo is a beautiful hotel in Roppongi. The service was generally excellent, particularly in the Club Lounge. The rooms are modern and spacious. The food and service at the restaurants in the hotel, including the food served in the Club Lounge, are all excellent. The concierge was extremely helpful in arranging for restaurant reservations, tour guides and purchasing train tickets. The neighborhood outside of the hotel is very pleasant to explore as well. The only snafu we had was at check-in, which took much too long even though I asked to speed things up as my 10 year old was exhausted from the long flight from New York, but they seemed unable to adjust to meet the situation. Other than that, the service was excellent. I would most happily return and hope to do so!

After coming from The Four Seasons Bora Bora and Sydney. I was use to being pampered. A first class stop and home while I was in Tokyo on business. First class all the way. Arrived at 7am to find my room available and welcoming. Meals in the bar were incredible with the attention I’ve never received at any property. Andy in the bar area greeted me very day by name with attention to detail. Never felt hurried but that I was at home. The entire property was welcoming and attention to detail. This property is a must stop on my travels going forward.

Starwoodfan1990
New York City, New York

review_body: stay here for 5 nights,service quality is not consistent ,some time the quality is very poor but some time is ok. Good luck! By the way ,it seems slippeers here must be very expensive cause you throw away the slippers in garbage can and the hotel wont give you a new pair ...haha住這裡服務品質不能保持一定,有時很差有時尚可,房間裡的一次性拖鞋一定很貴,當你穿了兩天把拖鞋扔到垃圾桶,飯店是不會補給你新拖鞋...哈哈,每天整理房間的品質要看運氣,遇到好的,就整理的好一些,運氣不好就....哈哈祝你好運

What can I say? This hotel serves, in my opinion, one of the best egg Benedict amongst 5-star hotels in Asia! The chef never disappoints! FYI, I have sent egg Benedict’s back at Waldorf Astoria Shanghai because the yolk was solid in the middle... I can’t really fault this fabulous dish. Kudos to the chef! It looks deceiving my simple but very hard to make it perfectly. Because it’s so simple, chefs can’t hide their mistakes and it’s a showcase of true cooking techniques.In addition, loved their Japanese breakfast as well.

A) this is a ritz so standards are high. B) this is japan and you know they are meticulous. The Ritz Tokyo does not ever disappoint. It’s my second time staying there and I will be staying there at least twice a year going forward for the rest of my career at this job so I feel comfortable giving this place a solid review. Impeccable service - from the concierge for reservations any where (but even for Jiro you need at least a month in advance!), to printing because you are jet lagged and need a document for your meeting in 3 hours to the housekeeping. Food options are solid and the hotel bar is always busy but not overwhelming (a lot of ppl come to have tea, breakfast or a drink who are not staying there) Being connected to Midtown Tokyo is a plus for the foreigner. There are lots of food options and shopping, a metro is attached to the building and ppl speak English which helps. The location is in a Roppongi which is good if you like being in the mix of things and it’s also a fine walk to the Imperial Palace. Overall - does not disappoint and as best as they come.

We arrived at about 2:30 and left our cases with the bell boys whilst we were escorted to the Club lounge. We were offered afternoon tea and a glass of champagne/beer. We checked in from the lounge and were escorted to our room, where our cases were already in situ. It was a nice standard Club room, 5226, overlooking the city and Mount Fuji. Modern decor; large comfy bed, desk and chair, two chairs by the window, two wardrobes, huge tv, fridge-type minibar with kettle and teapot, china cups and saucers. The bathroom was large with two washbasins, large bath, separate shower, Toto. Marble, glass and wood finish.Turndown tidied, replaced towels, moved water, left ice and a chocolate.Club lounge offered excellent service. The food in the evening included beef curry and rice plus other choices. Lunch included sandwiches, hot choices and salads; breakfast had a chef preparing eggs, omelettes and waffles, with bacon, sausages and potatoes.We had to extend our stay due to our flight being cancelled, and the lounge staff were very helpful in sorting this out.

Stayed from 30 Nov to 6 Dec with my Mrs as a “honeymoon”. Location was good with Tokyo Midtown next to hotel, and Roppongi subway station a few minutes walk away. If you are a fan of ramen, Ichiran and Ippudo are just nearby. Room was very spacious and bed was very comfortable. Toilet was a plus point for my wife, as it was a 2-sink concept - no need to fight for space (you know what I mean). Staff were very polite and courteous. So with all these I would have rated them excellent/ 5 stars but except for one incident that happened on Day 2 of my stay. We came back in the evening and I found a neatly folded boxer short on a shelve, in the toilet. And of course I never got about to check whether if it was clean or used. Called the guest services and the shift manager (I assumed) came to bow and apologise profusely, and later came back and offered chocolates as a gesture of apology. I didn’t want to pursue further then since apology was given and I didn’t want to spoil our “honeymoon”.But how it got there was a huge mystery considering it wasn’t there previously. So was it the chambermaids (?), which then brought me to ponder what was he/she/they doing in my room, or was it just a simple misplacement as return of laundry washing (no receipt, no laundry bag came with it). I hope that will never happen again to others. So please get your act together.

What an incredible experience! Our stay at your hotel was to celebrate my wife's birthday and the Ritz Carlton staff went above and beyond to make our stay a truly memorable experience. From the moment we arrived and till the moment we departed, the staff was ensured every element of our stay was provided for. The guest room was absolutely perfect, from design to decorating. The views were l breathtaking and unmatched at any other facility we have stayed. Every consideration to the comfort and well-being of the guest during their stay was clearly a focus in these rooms. You really feel as though you are inyour own world of relaxation. I reserved a spa treatment for my wife during our stay. The meticulous attention to detail and care provided by the spa staff ensured her massage was a highlight of our stay. The Spa staff went above and beyond to care formy wife during her spa treatment. From the moment she greeted, through every element of her hot stone massage, her care, comfort and well-being was the priority. Their efforts did not end with my wife ... they were welcomingwhen I arrived to escort my wife back to our room after her massage. Finally, the handwritten note the following day was greatly appreciated and highlighted the tireless efforts placed by the Ritz Carlton staff on customer service. These personal touches and genuine care displayed at every facet of the hotel are unmatched! Absolutely incredible!The gym facilities were fantastic! Clean, comfortable, and a great variety of equipment to support any fitness routine. The staff was welcoming and engaged to ensure the needs and safety of any guest. When not assisting aguest, they were constantly cleaning equipment or restocking supplies. And did I mention the phenomenal views of Tokyo? I cannot think of a more motivating and majestic scenery to enjoy on a treadmill.Finally, the housekeeping staff were incredible. Anticipating every need during our stay. The room was immaculate and ready for our arrival. The evening turndown service was perfectly timed. I think the highlight was the amazing Gobi blanket that they laid out on the chair. My wife curled up in that blanket and watched the evening sunset and nightlights of Tokyo. Again, I cannot express how grateful I am to the Ritz Carlton staff for their efforts in making my wife's birthday a memorable experience. It is something that we will shall cherish for years to come.

Beautiful property in a wonderful, centralized location. Subway is very walkable. The rooms are large with a very large bathroom and amazing views of the Toyko skyline. The spa/gym and pool at the top have breathtaking views of the entire city.The staff was warm, friendly, helpful and extremely professional. They made us feel right at home.

I traveled to Japan for business and chose the Ritz Carlton Tokyo (fortunately the rate was within my company's budget) . The hotel is, hands down, the best hotel I've ever stayed in. The lobby, located on the 45th floor, has an amazing design and ambiance. The room was spacious and had a spectacular view. The Spa & Fitness center was really amazing and well maintained. And above all, the staff is extremely nice, welcoming, & professional. I will surely choose the Ritz Carlton Tokyo next time I am in town.

My fiancé and I traveled to Tokyo and stayed at The Ritz-Carlton Tokyo for 2 nights 9/26 and 9/27.CheckinWe headed to Club Lounge for Checkin. We were served matcha with apple hint, as well as a specialty coffee drink with dried apple on top. Both drinks were amazing. Although we waited for about 40 minutes until finally got into the room, we enjoyed the view and drinks. I would hope if the staff could ask whether we had other plans after checkin, and inform us how long it would take for complete checkin. Usually express checkin only takes a few minutes, but given this case, we did enjoy the welcome amenities. RoomWe got a corner room on the same floor with the Club Lounge. Room was very nice, with breathtaking views on Tokyo Tower and Sky Tree. Room was clean and spacious.Club LoungeClub Lounge was the highlight where we felt true customer obsessions. All staff were super friendly. Emiko made us feel like home. Every time we get back to the hotel, I’d like to stop by the Lounge either grab a drink, peek the view, or just say hi. When the staff knew we went to the Mori museum to see Jump 50th Anniversary exhibition, they made us a plate with a chocolate drawing Luffy! It was a true surprise to my fiancé and we still love the plate the staff gave us as a gift.The chef at club Lounge made us the best waffle I’ve ever had! At checkout, When Emiko knew I proposed to my fiancé during the stay, she felt so happy for us and offered if there’s anything she could do. The propose was a surprise since I bought the ring unplanned, so I didn’t get the chance to let the staff know ahead of time. OverallThe experience was so fantastic that we are sure we will be back at our anniversaries.

My family and I recently returned from a five night stay at this wonderful hotel. We were particularly excited about staying here as we saw their number 2 hotel rating in all of Japan (number 1 in Tokyo) in the October Condé Nast traveler reviews. The location is perfect, as it is only a few minutes walk to two major metro stops, and excellent dining and shopping options abound in the area, all also within walking distance. Tokyo Station is a five minute drive. I can’t say enough about the service we received. Immediately upon checking in to the beautiful reception area, we received a personalized welcome as we were escorted to our suite, where our luggage we had sent ahead was already waiting for us. Any request my wife and I made was accommodated, from extra incense for fragrance, to complimentary repair of my daughter’s boots that had come apart at the soles.We were honored by excellent service in the Club Lounge, particularly by Sayaka. Most of all, Valerii and Kenta in Guest Relations attended to our every need, from check in to departure. They took extra care of our children, and set up a fun camp in our room for the last night, complete with tent and luxurious bedding and constellation projection on the wall! Of course, our kids had the most memorable hotel stay of their lives, and so did we.Ritz Carlton never disappoints, but the staff here went above and beyond and created a high possibility for us to plan a return trip. We were so sad to leave but are already thinking of when we can return. Our last meal with Valerii and Kenta, views from our room of Tokyo Tower.

Fabulous staff and care to detail as one would anticipate from the Ritz and was not disappointed. Loved the lobby bar staff in particular!! Beautiful views of Tokyo from our room - this alone is worth the stay. The room was great and our bathroom was large and and well laid out with separate bath/shower/toilet areas which I always appreciate. The green marble counters are a little dated but that is getting pretty nit picky. Overall, highly recommend!!!

Our family of four spent four nights at the Tokyo Ritz Carlton Club Level. We felt that the attention to detail and service were impeccable. The room was spacious enough to house 2 adults + 2 children including our luggage for a planned two week vacation. Food in the club level was plentiful and delicious, including both western and asian options. There were times that the club level was quite full, but the staff was very accommodating in making sure that they seated us and were very attentive. The view from the club room and our club level hotel room were stunning. Location was very central - connected via indoor walkway to a high end mall, adjacent to the Roppongi area. Would definitely put this on our repeat visit list.

San Francisco, California, United States

review_body: Great hotel with immaculate service. Best way to start your day in Tokyo. Gym was clean with ample equipment. Sauna, steam, whirlpool, and cold pool. Lobby is wonderful. Centrally located and rooms are opulent.

This was my second you’re visiting the Ritz Carlton Midtown in the center of Tokyo. Many of the nice people I met the previous year were still working there and the trip was even better than the first year.The club level is terrific, with an excellent breakfast and good food throughout the day. The bar is fully stocked in the view is the best in Japan. The pool and spa are also best in class. I highly recommend to stay here for business and pleasure travelers.

After a busy day in Tokyo the Ritz Carlton was a superb place to relax and unwind. Our room was spacious, comfortable and quiet; while the level of customer service we experienced fully met my high level of expectations. Although not inexpensive, the food and beverage offerings were great and worth what we paid. One item of particular note was the staff. They were all friendly and accommodating and made us feel special. In summary, this is one of the best city hotels I have stayed in during my many trips to Asia and if you can afford it, you will not be disappointed.

Staying at the hotel is always a joy, with the extremely friendly front of house staff and efficient service provided. This is especially the case from the concierge team who are able to book restaurants and provide assistance and guidance during your stay, with nothing being too much trouble. The seasonal flower arrangements in the public areas are amazingly well crafted to look so simple, but take so much work.Breakfast is excellent with great choices.The rooms are large with the best possible squared layout and no wasted space, unlike most trendy hotels these days. Great views throughout the day and night.The central location, easy access to the restaurants and shops in Midtown make the stay very easy with a number of museums within walking distance.

An amazing room with a clear view of Mt Fuji. Incredibly attentive and friendly staff. The breakfasts were amazing - delicious and diverse. It was a delight to have an opportunity to stay there. Look forward to going back.

Not usually we stay at another part of Tokyo than Ginza / Minato, but upon seeing availability for redemption at this truly luxury hotel with perfect timing, with a lot points to spend, feel itchy to try at least once, using 240k points, 5 nights was redempt.Real price will cost me arms n legs, with recent mishap mrspgrc combine, a lot confusion about benefit and points, this is the silver line of it.After making the booking, exchange a few email with ms Yuko about the possibility of splitting rewards nights, as I have plan to go another place if it was granted, no luck for that, :D, can't blame RC as well as is not a usual request. She extends an early check-in as our flight will arrive at 9 am in the morning.Prior to arrival got a very welcoming email from hotel manager, MR Masato asking what can be enhanced to make our stay as comfortable as it can be, all our trips to Tokyo will be for shopping only, not much asked, only my wife forget to bring her hair straightener which is provided as we check-in.Upon arrival, was greeted by very welcoming concierge team, they are as responsive as one can be, once, I even saw they insist to carry someone bag, that's the utmost customer service, small line in check-in counter at LV45, oh man, the lobby is very impressive, you can feel all the luxury and staffs attention, after a few minutes waiting, upon seeing our reservation, Reception staffs greet and welcome us well, 2nd time in my life I got check-in in the room, very welcoming lady staff guide us to room, and again, insist to carry my wife cabin bag, no upgrade was given, but standard room at RC Tokyo already very big(52m), she explain thoroughly every aspect of the room, and likely want to show off the view, which is quite stunning, but that morning a lot haze, only the third day view is very clear and we can see mount Fuji at far, which is very relaxing to look at, all the amenities at the room was explained very well.Even standard room is very large, bathroom with 2 sinks for him and her, with well equipt with luxury amenities, VERY comfortable bathrobe and towel, anything you can ask for in the hotel, hair straightener that I asked earlier was already there.Rooms feel luxurious with a large window facing the city, we were assigned to 51st floor facing Ebisu area and in the clear day, you can see mount Fuji perfectly. A bucket of ice and evening turndown is provided every day. Nespresso machine also provided with 3 capsules every day, still wonder wether can ask for more, but I didn't consume as much as usual, so not asking for a refill.No BF/lounge/upgrade was extended, its expected at all RC, also no luck this time, :D This hotel is situated at Tokyo Midtown Shopping mall (Akasaka Area), with a great surrounding, Roppongi Station (Hibiya and Oedo Line) is just a walk away, with Nogizaka Station (Chiyoda Line)just minutes by walking. To my surprise many shopping/eatery that is my favourite is all in here,start from Ichiran just beside Tokyo Midtown, Jojoen Yakiniku just opposite, Donki just crossing the road, will pass Coco curry Ichibanya, Gyukatsu Motomura just open beside Ichiran, it's AN perfect surrounding, with #foursquarefind, there is Imakatsu nearby. There best of it all Konami building is just beside, oh boy, it brings a lot of childhood memories, there's a slang if you know Konami, likely your childhood is awesome.5 nights seem not enough, sadly we have to leave for another plan, as hi tier member, 4 pm check out was guaranteed, we only ask for 2 pm check out, check out is smooth with not much trouble, we did ask to send 2 large shopping box to overseas which handled perfectly, small trouble for sending 2 large luggage to HND airport, at first it was accepted, but later, very fast response staffs have no confidence that it will be arriving in timely manner, explain very politely and concerned about our luggage, we accept that explanation and just carry the luggage with us.Final words, its very worth to spend the points, lovely stays, will come back for sure if have the chance. :D

Immaculate and superb service!! The bar and views are amazing and the guest rooms perfectly appointed!! Looking forward to my next visit to Tokyo. It was truly one of my best experiences on a business trip.

I’ve done budget Japan...I’ve tried the airbnbs (which was fine. clean. convenient. wallet friendly)I’ve tried regular hotels (still over $150 a night...but I guess that’s budget in Japan)Then I decided I needed a break and opted for using my points for a night at the Ritz.Man. Worth every damn point.Hotels in Japan are notoriously small. Teeny tiny.I mean you barely have a place to put your suitcase in the floor small. And the bathrooms are the same kind of teeny tiny.But the ritz...man.From beginning to end I felt like royalty.On check in, our room was not ready so they offered us complimentary drinks while we waited.Can I tell you about the nuts they gave us to snack on while we had our free beverages? Free beverages served in the lobby on the 45th floor where we had a breathtaking view of tokyo?They were two kinds of nuts. One was assorted japanese nuts. ( I say japanese because they were those nuts that have this really yummy crunchy coating I cant explain or cant say uve had anywhere else) And the other kind...which was my personal favorite: a mix of wasabi and curry flavored nuts. Again I say nuts but I feel like they were these amazing cookies shaped to look and taste like nuts because they had a much more luxurious mouthfeel than ordinary nuts. I wanted seconds...which we got...then I wanted thirds...but my friend said no.When our room was ready, they almost all but begged to take all our bags..they already took away our luggage but I guess my purse looked too heavy for the elevator ride to our floor.You guys...the rooms were gigantic and so was the bathroom...even by vegas hotel standards...and I know we got the smallest room there.And they had nespresso and already boiled water and already filled bucket of ice and these little japanese cookies and...I just can’t.I really wanted to cry tears of joy my entire stay....and then tears of sadness when it came time to leave.And guess what guys...we got to check out at 1:30 pm instead of the usual 10am checkout all other hotels in Japan impose.Highly recommend staying at the Ritz in Japan.I might not recommend spending a ton of miney for a hotel anywhere else because usually a few hundred a night will get you a pretty nice hotel...but hotels in Tokyo are tiny to begin with...even after paying over a hundred a night...I can almost justify shelling out a few more hundos because this place is fabulous.I didn’t take enough pictures...for which I apologize. I was too busy soaking in every second of the luxury.

This is the bright spot of the recent merger of SPG and Marriott. We took the Narita Express to Tokyo Station and took a taxi to the hotel. 15 min wait for the cab and under $30 Cdn in fare. Better than dragging our bags through Ueno Station if we had taken the Skyliner and metro. Our flight landed too late for the Airport Limobus. Checkin smooth and greeted by the manager and brought to our room by a kimono clad greeter. For Spg gold with Amex plat given a club floor room on the 52nd floor but no lounge access which was fine. Gorgeous view and service was stellar as expected. Sadly the pool was closed for maintenance during our stay - if I had the kids with us and this mattered I could have called ahead to check. Complimentary free drink at the bar was a nice touch. Very convenient being attached to Tokyo Midtown centre and the subway. Mall doesn’t open until 11am so find breakfast at Starbucks at 7am or Le Pain around the corner. Christmas illuminations and the Mickey 90th pop up store were a pleasant surprise in Tokyo Midtown.

The Ritz is an old school luxury hotel. The lobby is double height, with soaring windows and views of Tokyo. The design feels dated ('80's/'90's), but is well done--water wall near elevators, waterfall beside piano. Flower arrangements are monumental and beautifully done. Room was very well appointed and comfortable (very comfy beds), with great views. Again--room was a bit dated in design, but spotless and looked to have been recently renovated. Staff are excellent (Reika, front desk manager, especially).
