r7k
New York City, New York

review_body: This is my third visit at the Ritz, Tokyo. On the first day, there were a couple of Japanes welcoming sweets, which were sweet but not too sweet. Then on the second day, after walking around Tokyo for hours, I found assortments of western style welcoming sweets along with a card from the general manager. Also, there was a note from house keeping, asking if there were anything I needed. What a nice personal gesture! The fitness center, the pool, and the spa area are clean and well maintained. It is very enjoyable to use them. There are other first class hotels in Tokyo, but I choose the Ritz. If I am happy with the Ritz, why change?

I am traveling to Tokyo in April 2019 with my parents and would like to book a room using 60,000 Marriott points per night. If we all stay in one room is there an extra charge even if we don’t get a rollaway bed? Please advise.

The staff are so attentive, we wanted a table outside and as soon as one opened up for us, we were moved outside. We had a bottle of champagne and a few finger sandwiches. So delicious. We also had a flight back home that evening but there was a typhoon warning so the manager of the restaurant actually went and checked on the status of our flight for us and the train link, even though he knew we were not staying at the hotel, he offered us a car ride to the airport if there were no trains.Absolutely amazing hospitality.And lovely restaurant.

We stayed in the Ritz Carlton at the end of our week Long trip around Japan. This included St Regis, Osaka, Kyoto, the Imperial Palace Tokyo and Hyatt’s. The Ritz is far superior in every sense; the service, attention to detail, food, location and ambiance. I can’t recommend this hotel highly enough. It’s on the pricey side, but we thought it’s actually great value when weighed up against what you receive. The check in was simple, turn down service, respectful, well spoken and trained staff and ultimately the rooms are beautiful and well proportioned. The breakfast is great. If you get the opportunity, then stay at this hotel!

The Ritz provides detailed, flawless customer service. Every detail is attended to. We stayed for one night to attend a concert, and the staff made sure everything was perfect. The views from the hotel are beautiful. The staff had our concert tickets waiting in the room and had multiple transportation options at the ready to ensure we had a smooth enjoyable stay. Highly recommended!

A bellman got my luggage from the trunk while I paid for the cab. I knew it would be a good stay when the bellman addressed me by my name as I climbed out of the cab. A concierge popped out the door and took me to the 45th floor lobby for check- in. With a quick and very friendly check- in, I was given Room 4738, a very spacious room with corner views of the fairly nearby Tokyo Tower, the Imperial Palace grounds and Tokyo Skytree off in the distance. With a full moon rising over Odaiba, it made for a spectacular view. You can even see out to the expressway crossing Saitama. Rooms on the other side of the hotel can see Shinjuku and on a clear day, Mount Fuji. With guest rooms going from the 46th to the 53rd floors, you can’t get a bad view.The bathroom amenities are top- notch, befitting the Ritz standard. The tub and shower are separate and the toilet is in its own room in the bathroom. The shower has a wall- mounted wand and a rain shower. There are two sinks. There are lots of thick towels - if you use all the towels provided, you are having a very wet day.There is a USB charging port at the desk and two at bedside. The desk also has three JP/US standard mains outlets plus one multi- standard mains outlet at desk level. The bed linens were top- shelf, and the room was very quiet the whole time.There is a walk- in closet with motion sensor lighting, gobs of space and enough hangers for a long stay.Breakfast was excellent. The coffee was great and the fresh fruits, juices and pastries were also excellent. Service was very good, and I suspect that breakfast is a proving / pay your dues ground for waiters who want to break into the lunch and dinner restaurants there; there was a clear difference in the seniority and capability of the waitstaff at breakfast vs. dinner.The staff overall are very eager to help, and you notice nice touches throughout. The ice bucket was kept freshly stocked. I showered before dinner, and while I was out the staff turned down the bed and totally cleaned the bathroom, re- stocking Q-Tips, mouthwash, towels, soap and so on – you would think you had just checked- in.The Ritz is well- situated near Roppongi and all its advantages. It’s near the Chiyoda metro line (Nogizaka Station) and just steps from the Toei Oedo and Hibiya metro lines (Roppongi Station). From the gates of the Toei Oedo line, it is a 3 minute walk to the doors of the hotel, all covered, all escalators – so even if it’s pouring rain and you have baggage, you can beat the very slow taxi ride to midtown and do it in relative comfort.The hotel is on top of the Midtown building, which brings many restaurants and conveniences along with it. So under one roof, there are about 50 different restaurants, bars and coffee shops. There is a convenience store (conbini), a drugstore, a bookstore, a pharmacy and all kinds of other shops and in addition, a high- end shopping galleria. The Ritz- Carlton has my highest recommendation.

We stayed at the Ritz Tokyo both on the front end of our Japan vacation, and at the back end (we visited Kyoto and Osaka in between). This hotel took such great care of us at every moment during both visits. We ate twice at HINOKIZAKA, once for lunch for the tempura menu, and again for dinner, ordering a la carte, from the Tempura and Teppanyaki menus. These were some best meals we had in all 3 weeks of our travel throughout Japan. My wife and I got wonderful relaxing massages at their spa on our second stay. Mai Misawa, our invaluable concierge, made our trip so memorable. We just cannot say enough about every aspect of this hotel. Gorgeous rooms, top notch fitness center and pool, fabulous bar, great location, what more can I say? I will remember the Ritz Carlton when friends ask me what I liked best about Tokyo!

We just returned from an around the world vacation which started in Tokyo. After a 14+ hour flight from the states, arriving at the Ritz Carlton in Tokyo was the perfect way to begin our 2 week tour. Luxury and class is the key to this property and they know how to treat high tier Marriott Reward members. They were awaiting our arrival and prepared all the key staff members, who knew us by name. This property oozes class. The lobby, the elevators, and the highly appointed rooms all have the extra polish and touches. The view from the room was breathtaking! We have stayed at many Ritz Carlton’s around the world and this is one is certainly one of the best. The location in the Midtown Center provides easy access to Roppongi restaurants and shops as well as the Midtown metro station. From this subway station you can easily get all around the city. There is no better way to describe this property then pure Luxury with Japanese style and grace. I highly recommend it.

I decided to stay at the Ritz for part of my time in Tokyo because I had amazing experience at their property in Hong Kong. I thought the price seemed a bit high but I had such a good time in Hong Kong I thought it’d be worth it. The property was beautiful as expected but the room was just ok it had a nice view but compared to other hotels I stayed at in Tokyo specifically the Conrad it was pretty small especially considering I paid almost double the price for it. The staff was very respectful and tried their best to be helpful but my first day I went to the concierge to get some advice on what to do and I was sent to a park that was about a 30 minutes taxi ride away from the hotel, I get their and the parks closed Mondays and everything else I was planning on doing in the area didn’t open for a few hours. That kind of ruined my day and after that I just decided to try to make my own plans but the hotel is a bit out of the way and to get anywhere your going to have to spend 3,000-5,000 Yen. Also booked through my American Express card to get their fine hotels and resorts rewards and this was the only hotel that didn’t give me a free room upgrade as a perk of booking with American Express.

We returned to the Ritz for another stay- this time as part of our honeymoon. (we got engaged on our way there last year-so we thought it appropriate to visit again to celebrate)We arrived on a very early flight into Narita so we got to the hotel around 12:00 pm. We did let the hotel know of our early arrival and they said they woudl try to accommodation us, and of course totally did with a lovely room to have shower and take a brief rest till our room was ready-- which only took about 1 hour anyway. Amazing!I will say this, DO book the club level rooms. If you can or have status to get these it is so, so very worth it.The club is on the 53rd floor and just a lovely space that hosts 5 different service times with drinks and food. Breakfast- lovely hot and cold choices. Snacks during lunch time. Formal tea time with delicious treats. Happy hour drinks time in the evening sometimes with music/entertainment And finally later evening drinks. And all these drinks and food are comp b/c of room level booked. Again- if you are a family this is a HUGE benefit.Our room was king club level room on the 53rd floor. Was beautiful. All the details, just all the little things that make a room so comforting- bed and pillows, cashmere throw to nap with-- so comfortable, towels, bath products, slippers, robes, pajamas-- all perfection. The views are all super b/c you are already on the 47th floor to start. Sound proofing is great- we heard nothing from any other room.Pool and spa is great! The Jacuzzi is amazing for tired legs and feet. 10 minute on the jets and you feel like a new person. Fitness room beautiful modern, wonderful views while you work out. Always an attendant there to help out if any questions or if you need a bottle of water or towel.The hotel itself is gorgeous- from the minute you walk in the light scent that helps calm down and relax. The staff that is so attentive and warm. It's location couldn't be better- on the wonderful Kerry Center mall with access to the Oedo Line and Hibiya line to the subways-- that can get you anywhere.I just can't say enough about this place and if it were possible I would visit again and again and again.Love it!

The title says it all.We recently spent a week at Ritz Tokyo and it was just Superb! From the excellent staff to awesome views, to non-stop service and friendly staff made our anniversary just a great experience to remember.Much thanks to Risako Miura from guest relations for the wonderful surprise upon arrival and the final picture album. So special. Great job by Miho Kanemaru and Mai Misawa for their support and follow-up.And a big thank you to Omar Driouech and Kiver Yong for their superb hospitality in the loung/bar. We really appreciate it.Kudos to the entire Ritz Tokyo team for delivering such high level of service and hospitality, making us feel right at home. All of this with a smile, whether its 5 am, 5 pm or Midnight!I know Ritz Tokyo will be on top of our list next time we are in Asia. We already miss it.

“What can you say about Carlton? He was Carlton.” -Uncle PhilIf you’ve read any of the other reviews here you’ll have heard the Ritz Tokyo is phenomenal. And so it is. As others have noted, service is as good as it gets. Much respect to the entire staff, and particularly the two ladies (did not get their names, silly me) who took care of me at the Club Lounge Oct 16 and 17. Hopefully the hotel representative that reads these reviews can track them down and give them two thumbs up from me (5327). Make no mistake - this is hotel is a slam dunk, home run, whatever else you want to call it. The real deal. But no review would be complete without some critical notes: despite the impeccable service and staff, I found Club Lounge food and drink offerings middling. They are consistent with other Ritz properties, but for having read that the Tokyo location was of a higher breed, I did expect a little more especially at this price point.And that’s it! That’s the only negative thing I have to say. If you stay, be sure to check out the spa and gym facilities. The pool and heat experience are for me a highlight. You’ll get the most out of your stay if you have Platinum or higher status with Marriott, as you’ll have some cool perks like complimentary access to the “heat experience.” Great hotel.

We stayed with Club level benefits, fantastic experience, every small detail was taken care of, best level of service in any hotel I have seen so far in my life. Staff were friendly, welcoming and extremely polite. When I return to Tokyo I would only stay here, no need to even consider other hotels. I look forward to returning in the future. Thank you to all the staff for a wonderful time.

You feel like a VIP from the moment you set foot here, the entire staff is warm and super nice. We booked the executive suite which was spectacular, luxurious and the view is absolutely breathtaking. When checking in with the nice lady at the front desk (I don't remember her name but thank you!) we chatted about our trip to Japan (our stay here was the final 2 nights in a 3 weeks trip) and she even gave us complimentary breakfast which was so nice. The location is also really nice in the heart of Roppongi with a lot of bars and resturants nearby. We absolutely loved our stay here!

Overnight stay before going home. Greeted by So downstairs - very warm and professional staff. A beautiful room and spectacular view of mid town Tokyo. Nice to feel like a VIP. Will repeat whenever possible in Tokyo. Thank you Ritz-Carlton!

We celebrated our 25th anniversary with a trip to Japan, and began it with a multi-night stay at the Tokyo Ritz-Carlton. Hands down, a first class experience. Although they weren't able to upgrade our room, upon arrival we had custom chocolates and wine, and an anniversary welcome spelled out across the bed. Nice touch. The service was impeccable and top notch. Rooms were unbelievably appointed, and everything about the stay was luxurious.

Probably the best hotel I've ever stayed at. Service was impeccable from start to finish, rooms were beautiful (that bathroom!) with great views, despite me having a base level room. The breakfast was amazing! Can't recommend enough.

Fabulous atmosphere tand amazing staff.It was awesome view on 45th floor.Bartender was really sophisticated and very friendly. Good knowledge, skill and personality.No wonder, people says Japanese bartending is one of the best.I missed Japanese bar all the time.I come here whenever I visited in Japan.It’s not cheap but it actually worth it.

We had the most amazing experience at this beautiful hotel! We stayed in a club level tower room with an incredible view of the Tokyo tower and city for 5 nights celebrating our 13th year of marriage. I cannot sing enough praise for the outstanding hospitality and service provided to my husband and I by the club level staff. From the concierge desk to the cooks and servers they went above and beyond to assure we had a first class experience. Is it okay to say we actually miss them? :-) We shared so many laughs and were always openly greeted with a warm smiles and world class hospitality; add incredible food and you can't go wrong! The Ritz is situated in the Roppongi Hills area/ Tokyo Midtown with the most incredible views of Tokyo. We were able to easily purchase a sucia card and navigate the subway system right outside the doors of this hotel. There is also a mall and shopping right are your door but we found alot of our fun in the Shibuya area. It was nice to always go back to our quiet hotel at night nestled in midtown.I must admit, that we originally booked a different hotel for our trip and later decided to spend the additional money for the Ritz through our travel agent. I am so glad we did as the Ritz has set the bar very high and we cannot imagine staying anywhere else. We plan to return in 2020 with our children and can only hope that the experience is just as magical! Overall a super fun time.....we even took selfies with the staff before we left! Can't wait to do it again.

Business brought me to Tokyo and the Ritz was recommended for its location and service. The location was excellent and there is a direct entry way to the Midtown mall where I was able to pick up a set of highly recommended Japanese knives. The service was classic Ritz, unassuming while surpassing all expectations. The room on the 53rd floor was silent which helped with sleep. And the food on the Club Level was perfect! I can only hope business brings me again SOON!

This is in the top 5 of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed at in my life for a few specific reasons.1. The views from the roomsThey did this right in this hotel. I don't know if we got lucky or what, but I'm told all the rooms have views like we did, like you see in the marketing photos. This is a rare thing for a hotel. Normally you get this glossed over BS - but you get what they advertise here.2. It was understated, nothing too flashy. A comfortable club level, talkative and friendly but VERY polite and classy staff. I approve.A few extra things; a pillow menu, great breakfast, free drinks at the top and I just can't say enough nice things about it.

Stayed twice for 2 nights in a week on August 15th and August 20th 2018.The hotel is in a mall complex and the lobby is on the 45th floor, offering really nice views of the Tokyo Skyline. The room we stayed in had almost floor to ceiling views on 2 sides of Tokyo tower, imperial palace and other skyline highlights. Service was excellent. Being a French speaker, notably, they hire a lot of Swiss and French people so I felt at home. The spa / gym area is really amaizing. On the men's side there is a hot tub right by the window offering the same view of Tokyo skyline. After my first stay we were going to Kyoto and didn't want to bring our suitcases along, they kept them for us and when we checked back in 3 days later, they were waiting for us in the room: effortless!Every night they would play jazz at the bar and I could tell a lot of local business men and others came to the place regularly (without staying at the hotel)I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Tokyo for the first time.

I enjoyed the Ritz Carlton Tokyo hotel. Very conveniently located in the Roppongi area, greta views from the rooms and on a clear day you can even see mount Fuji, the club level has a lot to offer as far as food and drinks through out the day, the food is top notch and the service is outstanding. Highly recommended

First time in Tokyo and me and my wife stayed here. Unbelievable hotel. 5 star experience. Very attentive staff. Great bar that overlooks the Tokyo skyline. My wife loved the breakfast. Its certainly not a cheap option but you get what you pay for.......A classy high end 5 star hotel. Highly recommended.

My husband and I stayed at the ritz as our last stop on our delayed honeymoon. We can both say that without any doubt in our mind this was the best way to end our honeymoon. We travel quiet a bit and have never experienced such impeccable service and attention to detail.The concierge was incredibly helpful in planning our stay. I spoke with them prior to our arrival and mentioned a few things we liked and wanted to do on our honeymoon, they sent over photos of the top restaurants with descriptions and prices. The rooms were incredible, with the most killer view of all of Tokyo. Extremely clean and surprisingly good size for being in Tokyo! Location was perfect, close to a lot of great restaurants and shopping mall. Breakfast was great, had good variety of food. I loved the fresh juice bar. Azure 45 is the Michelin star restaurant inside the Ritz. Not too many words can describe this restaurant or do it justice. Wowwowow is pretty much the best that comes to mind when I think of it. I’ll write a separate review for this restaurant, but definitely one of the best meals we have had till this day.As an example of the attention to detail we experienced on our stay, I had mentioned we love sushi prior to our arrival and waiting for us in the room on arrival was two sushi key chains (amongst other fabulous surprises) with a sentimental hand written card which we have kept and smile every time we look at it. They also knew I loved cherry blossoms and on our last night while we were eating dinner at their Michelin star restaurant (Azure 45), they surprised us with a personalized hand made and written card with dried pressed cherry blossom flowers and a cherry blossom drink, which put us to tears it was so sweet. If I’m not mistaken, I believe the person who made all this happen name was Sayaka from guest recognition. Sayaka really was the most helpful and amazing person and is truly an asset to the Ritz-Carleton name. She is the main reason our stay was as memorable as it was. It is not a matter of if, but rather when we visit Tokyo again, we plan on only staying at the Ritz-Carlton. We truly thank the entire Ritz-Carleton staff, especially Sayaka for making our stay as memorable as it was. Can’t wait to visit again!

The Ritz is a beautiful hotel located high in the tallest building in Tokyo the Midtown tower. The lobby floor dramatically starts on the 45th floor and offers breathtaking views and luxurious settings. The rooms are spacious, lush and elegant. The service is impeccable and gracious.The breakfast buffet is lavish and sumptuous.The views from the floor to ceiling windows are sensational and mesmerizing.A beautiful hotel and I would stay here again without a doubt.

This was our first stay in Japan so this was our first significant interaction with, other than our van driver from the airport, Japanese service staff. We were very tired after our flight delay and our flight and the 1.5 hr drive from Narita to the Ritz-Carlton. We got out of the van, our luggage was whisked away and then we were escorted by a hotel staff member to the 45th floor of the building, which is where the lobby was located. Then we were greeted by the manager, Alex, who escorted us to our rooms. They were very large connecting rooms on the 48th floor, one room was a corner room, so you had expansive views of the the Tokyo skyline and you could see both the Tokyo Skytree and the Tokyo tower in the distance. The other adjacent room was a smaller room, but still very nice. The overall effect of the two connecting rooms was that of a large expansive suite with great views of Tokyo. It was nice enough that we really didn't feel a need to visit the Tokyo Skytree and deal with the crowds there. We were checked in our room and our bags promptly came up. There were some complimentary small mochi balls that were delicious and we slept like babies. Breakfast the next morning was also excellent. Buffet-style with a good choice of Japanese/Asian and Western items. You could really stuff yourself silly. Of course there was a choice of eggs cooked to your order included in the buffet.We found the hotel to be pretty convenient once we figured out the Tokyo subway system. The Roppongi Metro station is pretty close and most importantly, in the really severe August heat, reachable by going through the attached and air-conditioned Midtown Tokyo mall complex located at the bottom of the hotel/office building. You don't have to get blasted by the severe heat outside before reaching the subway. The connection to the mall/office complex wasn't all that obvious. As you head out towards the front door at first floor, the doormen will see you exit the hotel elevators and ask if you want a taxi, we would politely decline and just turn into a corridor still inside the building to an exit into the mall. We did not see a sign telling us "this way to Tokyo Midtown". We found the attached Tokyo Midtown mall to be an additional benefit. There are all sorts of stores and if you're not going to eat at the Michelin-starred restaurant all the time, all sorts of more reasonably priced eateries in the mall. There are also nice dessert and bakery shops in the mall. In the upper levels of the mall, in the Garden Court, there are some more formal and pricier restaurants, some that we tried. There was also a bookstore, although I didn't check carefully, but it only seemed to contain books and material in Japanese. The main benefit, I thought was the presence of a Preece supermarket in the mall (and also a 7-11). As usual when you travel, you always forget to pack things, like sunscreen or dental floss and various small knickknacks that make traveling more pleasant. It's nice that you can just zip down the elevator and pick up some little necessities and some good snacks and reasonably priced fruit, and zip up the elevator and take them back to your room.  The fitness center and pool located on the 46th floor are nice. Nice views but fairly generic. What stood out to us about the hotel was the level of attention and the small personal touches. The staff seemed to recognize us by sight, although I wonder if a family traveling with 3 children made us stick out somewhat. Since my wife had made the reservation and she did not change her name when we married, the staff always called me by my wife's last name, as Mr. (Insert Wife's Last Name). That always made my kids giggle. I didn't have the heart to correct them. Every morning as we headed out with our backpacks and water, we would encounter the concierge staff. They would ask us what our plans were and my kids would tell them. Invariably it was shopping or sightseeing or once, my oldest child had this hankering for some exotic dessert she saw on YouTube or something and wanted to track that dessert down. The concierge staff would give us maps and tips for getting there (taxi, subway etc) and send us off. Some of the staff we got to know and told us little bits of their own personal history. It was a nice touch. But what was really amazing was at the end of the day after slogging through sight seeing/eating/shopping and the heat, we would would find, slipped under one of our room doors, a handwritten note from the concierge that we spoke to that morning, addressing the children, that wished us that we had a good time seeing the sites/stores that we visited and had a good day. In some cases, ie. when we went to the main Pokemon store (we took a cab, too many subway stops and transfers) the note contained Pokemon stickers stuck to the note along with the text. This was just simply unspeakably awesome. My kids would look forward to getting one of these after we returned to our rooms. In response, my older children, the day before we planned to leave the hotel, made it a point to visit a stationery store and find nice cards and pens to write thank you notes to the concierges who wrote them and assisted us. They've never done that at any hotel that we've stayed in before. The morning that we were leaving for Mt. Fuji, a helpful bellman (who because of his perfect English, we found out was from Hawaii) came up and picked up all of our luggage and forwarded to the next hotel, as we were overnighting in one of the climbing huts. Every single piece showed up at the next hotel and was waiting for us without a hitch. I think all of us were really sad to leave the hotel when we moved on to the next stop on our itinerary.

I stayed at ritz Carlton Tokyo for 3 nights best experience ever big rooms,excellent view city of Tokyo and the cleanest. Very professional staff polite helpful kind and with beautiful smileGreat location close to lot of attractions For sure I will be coming back

Ritz Carlton Tokyo, in Roppongi area is a Great hotel in a great location.The Midtown shopping mall is connected to the hotel & in Midtown and vicinity, you have wonderful choices of all kind of restaurants, a real foodie's paradise.

Incredible views of new Olympic Stadium and good Jazz in the background. Mt Fuji on a clar day. Worth a trip and very attentive staff (actually too attentive if you are not ordering follow up drinks fast enough). Omar who greets you at the Door and David on wait staff were terrific. Must go everytime I go to Tokyo.

Ritz Carlton Tokyo provides insanely high level of service from every member of staff, from hotel manager to the cleaner everyone is attentive and charming. We didn’t eat in the restaurant but we had cocktails in the bar which had awesome cocktails and live music. They have a diamond martini cocktail that costs £14,000, which includes a diamond (can’t remember the carat) and in a bit of a drunk moment and peer pressure from the kids I nearly ordered. The location is very central but you do have to taxi everywhere, although it adjoins Tokyo midtown shopping centre which has some really nice restaurants and shops.Anyway it’s a great hotel and we loved it.

Just booked our 3rd stay at this wonderful hotel. The location and the amenities just outside your door are boundless. We love that the Midtown Tokyo complex, where the hotel "lives", has so many dining options in addition to the amazing food choices served up at the Ritz itself. Love having a supermarket and 7-11 so close for the "must have" egg salad sandwiches everyone raves about. The staff at this venue is so wonderful - the concierge was able to make all our dining reservation dreams come true. Everyone from the bell men, desk staff and hotel management make you feel like you like you are coming home to your very fancy apartment every time you return to the hotel after a day of touring or coming back from a gastronomic experience! Both our stays were seamless and we will return again and again. This Fall we will also try the property in Okinawa - cannot wait!

A role model for what outstanding guest relations can strive for. While we experienced highly professional service throughout Japan, the helpful and friendly staff of the Ritz-Carlton was even on an entirely different level - close to perfection. From the first to the last minute of our stay. At the reception desk, the lounge, the bar, the restaurant. Making you feel at home in a really personal way. Allow me to especially mention Minami and Alexandre. This, in combination with a very convenient location for a huge place like Tokyo, rooms with wonderful view (on floor 47) and excellent restaurants, simply means....even better than at home. Would I return next time in Tokyo? Anytime....
user_name:
Eric H
Canton of Zurich, Switzerland

review_body: Lots of luxury at this hotel. Check in was smooth, bags were delivered to the room quickly and even though the hotel was at 100% occupancy- the service was impressive. We stayed on the 52 floor, club deluxe room. Modern amenities, USP ports and adapters, big screen tv and electric black out shades. The hotel was extremely neat and clean, breakfast had a good spread with western and eastern options for food. The pool area was large, clean and has an enjoyable view overlooking Tokyo. The staff really adds to the experience, extremely polite and helpful. I must have called the concierge 10 times during my 3 night stay and they were always on the mark ready to help. I only wish the AC in the room was more powerful to deal with the hot summer days in Tokyo. Otherwise, we had a fantastic stay. Big thank you to the management for their kind hospitality.

One of the best hotels ever. Outstanding location, rooms very high up with fabulous views, outstanding warm and professional service. Even the entry level rooms are huge, beautifully designed with understated luxury. Stunning bathroom perfectly designed and equipped. Amazing breakfast with a huge assortment of Asian and European food. Pricey but worth every penny.

One of the better views in Tokyo. Fantastic hotel, very large rooms with a perfect view, the bathroom is a story in itself, meaning huge. Lobby is fantastic and so is breakfast. Excellent service. Very attentive staff.

If you like awesome views, then this is the perfect hotel. Their lobby/lounge area is gorgeous...a fantastic place to enjoy a drink. We had an incredible meal at Towers. Every room in the hotel offers amazing views. The rooms felt a little dated, but we were barely in them (the bathroom was great). The Club Level was great...the perfect place to enjoy a drink or breakfast. And the staff was lovely...helpful, polite.

I had the pleasure of staying here for a business tour, and wow - Altho I’ve been before the standards have not dropped at all, the staff are amazing and absolutely nothing is to much trouble. The club lounge in the 53rd floor (which certain rooms have access to ) is another level of service. Room service menu was good and the food was great but for a treat you have to try the in house sushi restaurant - it’s amazing. Thank you to all the staff who made the trip such a pleasure (even tho it was work related).

Stay away and stay at the Shangri La or the Peninsula.This place managed to convince me to stay there and gave me a quote over the phone. Additionally they made me feel I would get upgrades with my Platinum status for subsequent nights. I agreed to get two rooms. Heck they didn’t even give me connecting rooms knowing very well that was incredibly important to me since I was traveling with four kids.Upon arrival, I was instantly told no can do - no upgrades. Right off the bat, I felt duped. They messed up on my room charge on over 3 occasions. Each time you talk to a different person who contradicts what the previous person says. They took over an hour to even bring me the bill. Finally, agreed that they shouldn’t have charged me for the breakfasts too!Additionally, their breakfast is lame, a simple request for ranch dressing can’t even be honored.Nothing special about this hotel, boring *indoor* swimming pool. I am sorry, but you guys can do a LOT better...Ritz, my foot. My money is going to the Shangri La next time.

This Ritz Carlton was fabulous. The view from the hotel is amazing- the Tokyo skyline is beautiful. Great location in Rappongi. The service was immaculate, top notch, classy. The staff was also amazing. The Activities manager Alex organized a run through Tokyo in the morning with Linus and one other activity staff (can't remember her name). They were great tour guides and very helpful. The run was so much fun. On the run, I mentioned that we didn't make it to Hiroshima due to floods. When I checked out of the hotel, there was a gift waiting for me with group photos taken on the run and a lovely book about Hiroshima with personal notes from all 3 activities staff. Such a nice touch! I left there with such a warm feeling and I just can't wait to get back. Thank you Alex and everyone!

Every hotel detail was expertly attended to by a friendly, caring staff, from check-in to check-out. Our corner room on the 47th floor was spacious and elegant with spectacular unobstructed views. Remote-controlled drapes. Sun pouring into the room in the morning, glittering skyline with Tokyo Tower at night. The morning buffet is incredible, the best and freshest, with a huge selection of Western and Japanese breakfast choices. It's the perfect way to start the day. Located in Roppongi, it's easy to reach other parts of Tokyo.

I can't give enough praise to the Ritz Carlton Tokyo. We had the opportunity to stay in the Peninsula Tokyo as well but the Ritz was still our favorite. We opted for a Club Level room with lounge access. The room had amazing views of Tokyo from the 53rd floor. The bathroom large and had some really great amenities. The king bed was perfect and had some great sheets. In our opinion the club lounge was worth the extra cost. High quality food and drinks all day long with the absolute best views of Tokyo. If staying in the club lounge, Towers restaurant, is also an option for breakfast. It is one of, if not, the best hotel breakfasts we have ever had. The staff was absolutely superb! Even before we arrived the concierge assisted us with multiple important things. My girlfriend is allergic to tree nuts and the concierge printed a card with a warning of her allergy written in Japanese! It was so helpful when we went to Japanese speaking restaurants. Also, they were able to get me a reservation at the famous Sukiyabashi Jiro Ginza! Best sushi of our lives! We wouldn’t have been able to make it with out the help of the Ritz Carlton concierge. The rest of the staff from arrival to the moment we left was amazing. I honestly cannot say enough. If you are looking for a luxury hotel option in Tokyo, look no further than the Ritz Carlton. Next time we are in Tokyo this will be our first choice.

This is such a fantastic hotel and I highly recommend staying here. The hotel itself is beautiful with fantastic attention to detail, high end finishes everywhere, and constant upkeep maintaining its pristine state. The staff is incredibly wonderful, very helpful, friendly, and knowledgeable of the area. If you are worried about making a reservation at a restaurant without speaking Japanese they are happy to assist you and book the reservation on your behalf. The rooms are gorgeous, large, and have many amenities. The view is fantastic from all locations especially the club level lounge. If you have the opportunity definitely stay here.

6 months ago, I was planning to visit Osaka from San Francisco. I was planning to go to Osaka on June 19th morning. On June 18th Monday, Osaka had an earthquake, I have to alter my iternary and have decided to stay at Ritz Carlton Tokyo (instead of Ritz Carlton Osaka). Actually, when I was planning my trip 6 months ago, I have exchanged "numerous" email with Ms. Junko Noda (Ritz Carlton Osaka) about my stay. Since I altered my trip in such a short notice, I totally forgot about the arrangements. To my very surprise, when I arrived Ritz Carlton Tokyo, thanks to Junko & Ms Sayaka Goto, all the previous arrangements were magically transferred to Tokyo!Thank you BOTH (Tokyo & Osaka Ritz) for a very pleasant stay.Will be back again for sure.

The Ritz Carlton supersedes your expectations with every detail. It's the perfect location to explore Tokyo. Spectacular views and great amenities. Most importantly very detailed personal service which made all the difference in our stay!

We chose to stay at the Ritz Carlton as a treat for our last night in Japan. After a rather long journey and confusion with the metro we made it to reception visibly hot and bothered. We were offered help with our heavy bags which we gladly accepted only to see a very small Japanese lady come out and struggle with our two bags, to which my partner and I stepped in and took our own bags. There could have at least been a bell boy with a trolley to help us.The room was incredible! the largest we had in Japan and amazing views and the bathroom was so luxurious and spacious.The spa was also a nice surprise and when i came out the pool there was a personalised note waiting for me which was a nice surprise.The bar is also worth a visit to watch the sunset with a cocktail and the breakfast buffet had a great spread on offer.In all it was a great hotel but let down by the lack of small personal touches

The Ritz-Carlton Tokyo continues to the fine Ritz tradition of amazing customer service and extraordinary amenities. From arrival to departure all of our needs were met and the pool, workout facility, and spa were top notch. We dined at the in house Michelin rated restaurant and were treated to an incredible chefs tasting menu called Okawasa. A stay here would never disappoint. Be prepared for the price and also Japan seems to be the one area where smoking is still allowed mixed with public areas. Other then that, Ritz Tokyo is worth the trip!

We used our points to stay 2 nights in this property. First impressions: very popular property. The lobby restaurant and bar were packed when we checked in. They had a ton of attentive staff to take care of us.We had a gorgeous Tokyo tower city view, on a floor in the 50s. I would recommend the city view over the Mt Fuji view especially since it is lovely both during the day and the evening. We were greeted with macarons and other snacks throughout the stay. The location of the venue itself is in Roppongi, an upscale area with tons of delicious restaurants. It is very conveniently located in the Midtown Tokyo mall, as well as steps away to the subway line. Since the per-night rate is quite high though, the clientele is mainly people who can actually afford the per-night rate and taxi everywhere, haha. As noted, we just used our SPG/Marriott points. Such amazing service here. We were helped out by the concierge Risako - she really went over the top to end our last few days in Japan. She helped us reserve at Ushigoro (a delicious Japanese yakiniku place that everyone should try), and also gave recommendations for the area. We also got a reservation at Sukiyabashi Jiro through the hotel, which is the famous sushi omakase owned by Jiro's son, such an incredible experience that is all thanks to the Ritz for helping us book (you need to reserve 1 month in advance).Amenities: gym is pretty standard, larger than regular hotel gyms. Pool is standard, hot tub has a city view, but not with Tokyo Tower. If you get a chance, you should enter the change rooms where they provide spa services. The female change rooms has a tub with a Tokyo Tower view. The male change rooms has a non-Tokyo Tower city view.We stayed at the Kyoto Ritz Carlton earlier in the trip and overall still prefer the Tokyo property because of its long tenure, so the concierge and service was so genuine and over the top. Plus, being so well located within the city is great. We cannot wait to come back again on our next trip to Tokyo!
user_name:
aimango
New York City, New York

review_body: My room overlooked Mt. Fuji and an expansive area of the city including the water. Azure 45 has amazing food and views - the service is exceptional! The entire staff was friendly, courteous, and always greeted you with a smile. i highly recommend this hotel for business as well as a romantic get away.

Me and my husband stayed in the hotel with our kids 3 nights and we absolutely loved it. As a platinum members we got upgraded to a beautiful suite and in the room we had lovely note and chocolate was waiting for us The staff was exceptional dining experience and quality of food is outstanding. The receptionist name Minami was especially nice , professional and at the same time made our stay very personal. At the end of our stay she left a note for us with her hand writing she put stickers it was absolutely amazing It's conveniently located next to the really nice mall and metro inside the mall Not to mention the view on the city is spectacular The best hotel in Tokyo.

Me and my husband stayed in this hotel only 3 nights with our 3 children and we loved it Its absolutely the most beautiful hotel in the city . The staff was exceptional Dining experience and quality of food is outstanding . Specially one of the receptionist name Minamy she made our stay very personal and unforgettable Not to mention the views from the hotel spectacular. I highly recommend it

The Ritz in Tokyo definitely lives up to its name. It is a high-end luxury hotel, with wonderful service, real attention to detail, and all the comforts one could want traveling far from home. It is Tokyo-expensive, but as long as you’re prepared for the price tag, it’s a really pleasant experience. The rooms are on high floors, affording spectacular views of the city both day and night. The staff is exceptionally attentive, and reasonably bi-lingual. The rooms are very well appointed, with all the comforts one would want in a luxury hotel. My only criticism (and it’s a minor one) is that the in-room TV could offer more international fare. Other than that an extremely pleasant and luxurious experience.

My husband and I stayed here for the first leg of our honeymoon and it was probably one of the highlights of our trip! Everything was amazing - the attention to detail, the cleanliness, the club lounge food and drinks, and most of all, the service and courtesy from the staff! I used points to stay, and upgraded us to the club lounge. Quick note for Marriott Rewards members - after doing some research, it didn't sound like Marriott Platinum members would be automatically upgraded to the club lounge if you booked a regular room - you would have to first book the club level, in order to get upgraded from there. I'm so glad we went with the club level - it made the stay even better. And we did indeed get upgraded to a suite on the club level upon arrival.I cannot say enough nice things about the staff. Upon arrival, we had a lovely note with several chocolates waiting for us. I had also been emailing with the concierge for several weeks ahead of our stay to book various restaurant reservations and activities - they were so kind and helpful! During our stay, there was a slight miscommunication about one of our activity locations - not a big deal at all. But when the lead concierge heard, she immediately arranged for a BMW car service to take us to the planned activity the next day, and we received a full size bottle of special sake as well. Not necessary, but highly appreciated! It's those little things that make your stay all the more memorable! I would absolutely stay at the Ritz Carlton Tokyo again without any hesitation. Thank you for such a memorable honeymoon!

The Ritz Carlton Tokyo is the experience of a hotel in heaven!! Amazing lobby (truly amazing lounge and bar!!). The rooms are exquisite but, most importantly, the staff is the ultimate in service, attention to detail and kind support. Beautiful environment and amazing staff. World renowned bar staff and great restaurants on premise. An amazing location and experience. Truly a special destination worthy of the journey.
user_name:
ginjammer2018
New York City, New York

review_body: I always stay I Ritz Carlton when I travel to Tokyo everytime, I have a warm feeling as the hotel staff was so nice, specially Ms Tai of front desk and Ms Sato of room division was so nice, and the hotel was in the very handy location. Breakfast was good too!

Luxury and attention to detail not seen anywhere else. While checking in one of the staff, rebecca, overheard our plans and that we were here for our sons graduation. She the made a handmade card congratulating our son and suggested restaurants and places for us to visit. I cannot praise her or this hotel enough. I will be back again and again.

Beautiful hotel, excellent service and very convenient location to most of the best sites in Tokyo. First stay at Ritz Carlton property, but will certainly try them in other locations. This also boasts to be the highest hotel location beginning with Lobby on 45th floor. Views from any room, the lobby or pool are outstanding.

I have stayed here numerous times for work and wouldnt stay anywhere else (if I can help it!). The rooms are big, the food and drink offering is excellent, location is great and the service cannot be beaten.

This hotel is a treat with beautiful rooms, inviting public spaces and stunning views. The breakfast is very good, served in airy spaces overlooking Tokyo. We loved our Tokyo Tower view room. The location is perfect. Trains are nearby and there's a really nice shopping center next door, where you can find all sorts of takeaway food and treats. This will definitely be our hotel of choice for our next stay in Tokyo!
user_name:
wholewideworld
New York City, New York

review_body: Everything was Par Excellence, the food, the service, the room etc etc.Definitely one of the best properties of Tokyo.Will surely visit again and highly recommended for all fellow travelers travelling to Tokyo.

I was fortunate to be able to stay in this fabulous hotel. I am travelling very frequently throughout the whole world and this is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. Would recommend it to everyone. Thank you Ritz-Carlton for the fantastic and personal service.

We stayed for 5 nights in the conveniently located Ritz in Roppongi. Upon hearing that it is best to get your hotel concierge to book popular restaurants ahead of visiting Japan, I contacted the Ritz a few months ahead of our visit with a list of restaurants we wanted to eat at. They booked 8 restaurants for us including Jiro and Tempura Kondo, two of the hardest to book restaurants in Tokyo. They called on the day the reservations open for the month in question which is so helpful and saved us a lot of effort. The staff always went out of their way to be helpful. There were even chocolate covered almonds in our room from the cafe when we arrived as it was our wedding anniversary. The room was impeccable and had stunning views of the city. The pool and fitness area were large and relaxing, with the same beautiful views. We were also able to get late check out at 4pm we SPG gold members. Highly recommend this hotel when staying in Tokyo. Close to several different subway lines and above Tokyo Midtown Shopping Mall.

The experience of staying in the Club level of the Ritz in Tokyo simple doesn't get any better. The team is exemplified by Kaz who made the experience exceptional for everyone in the family including a lively 4 year old. He is genuinely happy to see the guests, both accommodating and gracious and nothing seemed like too much trouble. He represents what makes the Ritz the best hotel to stay in.

Simply Fantastic Attention to detailExcellent restaurants Lobby Bar and live music nite and dayOverlooking Tokyo from the 45th floorConnects directly to the Galleria MallAnd Roppongi subwayElegance and non stop service

I'm not sure where to start.The Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo is an amazing property. First off, it's in a great location amongst lots of shopping, museums, restaurants and nightlife in Roppinga. The property itself is amazing - lobby on the 45th floor, with the club level on the top, 53rd floor. You have amazing views of Tokyo from any window. The lobby is vast and elegant. On one end a great lobby bar/lounge - live music in the main lobby and a Michelin-starred restaurant on the far side (Azure45). The rooms are fantastic - well appointed. Great views. The club level is exceptional, with ample food and drink options. What sets this apart - and what sets Japan apart in general - is the unbelievable levels of service. We've never experienced the kind of service we've had here at the Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo. It sets a new standard for service anywhere in the world. Congrats to the Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo for setting a new standard and expectation.

Stayed 3 nights and used facilities extensively. Flawless visit. Club level of the highest standard on F&B. Warm and gracious welcome at all touch points. Would recommend without hesitation. Arranged numerous car services with complicated itineraries throughout stay and all went without a hitch.

We had the pleasure of staying at the Ritz Carlton Tokyo and it was beyond my expectations. We stayed on the Club level (floor 52) and the rooms were very spacious and they gave a lot of thought about the functionality of the room. The service at the Club Lounge was amazing and so friendly (as usual at the Ritz), the food was good (we had breakfast, tea time and light bites in the evening). The restaurants at the hotel are also 5 Star! We ate at Hinokizaka Sushi and Hinokizaka Teppanyaki and enjoyed both meals. The staff went out of their way to recognize our anniversary both at the Club Lounge and at the restaurants. The concierge is very good, they helped us to secure dinner reservations in the area and also booked the Whiskey Tasting on floor 45 (amazing experience to taste some rare whiskey). We also enjoyed the jazz band at the Lobby Bar, the drinks were delicious and the performance of the band was very good. This hotel is the best in Tokyo!

We can see Fuji-san from the hotel if the weather is clear. The bathroom and amenities are great. Although there is not much choices at breakfast, all are in good quality. Staffs are nice and helpful.

The Ritz - club level - was perfect in every way. Attentive staff who helped us get wherever we needed to go and who were extra kind to my 11 yr old son. The room and amenities were gorgeous. We used the pool and gym. Club level is great to always have a spot to relax between sight-seeing adventures and to have a snack at odd times. Great location. Definitely my first choice for staying in Tokyo. We also stayed at the luxurious Conrad and it was lovely but Ritz was a one notch above.

This was our first family trip to Tokyo, and as we had stayed in the RC Osaka a few days prior, we felt that the RC Tokyo was a must. First off, the main lobby was located on the 45th floor with an expansive lobby lounge with views to die for. Check in was seamless as the staff was quite fluent in English. Our room with 2 double beds was huge and very comfortable for my family of 4. The bathroom had double vanities, a separate walk in shower and a water closet with the ever popular fancy automated toilet seat, and a large soaking tub. We were situated on the 49th floor floor with expansive views of the Mori Tower and of Mt Fuji on a very clear day. Twice daily maid service was routine. With views like these, we did not even waste money on the Skytree ($40pp) for their views. We stopped by the pool and exercise facilities, and it was impressive. We were only able to dine at the Towers for the breakfast buffet (the croissant waffles were awesome), as there were no available reservations for Azure 45 or for Hinokizaka Japanese offerings the 4 days we were there. But no matter as there were plenty of food choices as hotel sat right on top of Tokyo Midtown and the Roppongi area had numerous restaurant options. Plentiful shopping was also within walking distance, or there were two subway stations nearby that took us all over Tokyo. (A Suica card is a must!) The only one complaint was that the Lobby Lounge allowed smoking at night, but the piano player and singer were excellent. We can't wait to return!

A lot to like, location, charming breakfast location with extraordinary views and great service but the bathrooms while excellent are a tad dated and the room lighting system doesn't require a PhD but a Masters would help...

We recently stayed here for 5 days and it was exceptional. The hotel went above and beyond and it was one of the best stays ever for us. We did the breakfast and it was phenomenal. If ever in Tokyo, stay here and you will never be disappointed. We were able to walk and public transit everywhere from the hotel. We would recommend this hotel over and over again to all of our family and friends.

We stayed from May 06 to May 12th, 2018. Everything was amazing!, the staff first of, very polite and always helpfull , the food superb, the view !, the location !, We will definitely return. Highly recomended

We had dinner at Asuze 45 last August and it was a memorable experience. We planned to return for another meal and we decided to stay at the hotel this time. We had a tour of the rooms when the hotel was newly opened and we did not find them too impressive. With so many amazing hotels to choose from in Tokyo, we never thought of staying at this hotel until now and RC Tokyo did not disappoint.We had the Deluxe Corner Room with the view of both Tokyo Tower and Skytree. The view was lovely but the same beautiful view is also available from many other hotels in the city. The room was spacious but not anything special. The beds were just ok. What impressed us the most was the staff. Service was exceptional and they made our stay very enjoyable. We were addressed by names quite a few times and it was not at the Club Lounge which was quite impressive. Talking about the Club Lounge, it was a nice place to relax after touring the city and well worth the little extra that we paid.Food was another highlight of RC Tokyo. We love the buffet breakfast at Towers and the food presentation was high in quality. Again we enjoyed our visit to Azure 45. This time we also went for a sushi dinner at Hinokizaka and it was equally spectacular and I gave it a separate review. For the amazing restaurants, the great hospitality and the wonderful location, we would love to return.

Second great visit with same level of services , every think was perfect again , from concierge team to club floor , management team , food quality also still here !! Will come back again and again !!!

I love the room, we were a party of 3. Stayed in a room which is definitely very big compared to other tokyo hotel. Would definitely come back if I had a chance. The service is impeccable. Couldn't ask for more !

We have had the good fortune to stay in various 5-star hotels all over the world, and Okabe provided hands down the best, most thoughtful, and warm service we have ever received anywhere. My family and I were visiting Tokyo for Christmas (yes we stayed at the Ritz-Carlton Tokyo five months ago, and are just writing our review now - that’s how unforgettable and wonderful Okabe was! ), and had breakfast at the hotel every morning (their breakfast spread is absolutely divine by the way, and worth every penny). By our second morning at the Ritz, Okabe had remembered all of our orders from our first morning alone: camomile tea for my mum, coffee for my dad, and an earl grey for me. I was taking herbal medicine on this trip, and asked for a cup of hot water to dissolve the medicine in after I’d finished my breakfast on our first morning. Again by the second morning of our stay, Okabe brought a cup of hot water for me to take my medicine, before I even had to ask. On top of her incredibly thoughtful and top-notch service, Okabe is exceedingly warm and friendly, taking time out of her busy breakfast shift to chat and making us feel so welcome and at home at the Ritz. On our last morning in Tokyo, she even gave us these sweet origami presents which she had handfolded herself! Okabe is an invaluable member of the Ritz Tokyo and one of the most memorable parts of our stay in an incredible city. We fully expect her to have been promoted during our next stay

My wife and I, as a "bucket " list visit, made a trip to Japan and decided to stay at the Tokyo Ritz-Carlton for 5 days. Due to our flight arriving at 1:30am and our expected arrival at the hotel 3am, we expected some possible issues, but there were none. We received an email from the hotel manager about 5 days before our arrival asking if there was anything they could do for us as well as asking for our arrival information. That being sent, there were no complications what so ever. The doorman was expecting our arrival as well as Hirohito Yoshikado, the Assistant Night Manager, personally received us at the front desk, and after as few standard details, himself showed us to our room. He was extremely professional and we both felt that he was genuinely concerned with our satisfaction during our visit. Once we adjusted to the time change we went out to explore Tokyo. With the help of the concierge desk we learned about how to use the transit system and well as used their suggestions on which gardens to visit as well as get us reservations to the Imperial Palace (which is open only 2 days a year...just by chance we were there during one of those two days). Our room was always cleaned to exceed our expectations. As an example of the service we received, because of the cherry blossom trees blooming (and probably some other vegetation pollinating) I was in the need of some antihistamine. I had a fun and quite entertaining, but unsuccessful conversation with a local Japanese pharmacist trying to find some over the counter medication. Returning to the hotel we met with Reika Ohsawa, the Guest Relation Supervisor, explained what we needed and she wrote down in Japanese what we needed. We returned to the pharmacy, handed him a note, and after a big smile and a nod, the pharmacist gave me what I originally tried to ask for. As a follow-up, she remembered our request for help and asked if there was any questions about dosage.Basically this is the best place my wife and I have ever stayed at in all of our international travels. Our simple requests for help were eagerly accepted which made this trip so much less stressful than it could of been. We know that In order for this exceptional service to happen requires an entire team effort, much more than the two names we mentioned in this review, so please express our gratitude to the entire staff. Because of this experience, this will not be a one time "bucket list" visit. Next time we overnight in Japan we will be staying at the Tokyo Ritz-Carlton.

I stayed there for two nights in May. All the staffs are professional and very international. The hotel has a formal atmosphere. We definitely love the lobby lounge where there’s live piano and jazz. The room is spacious with large screened TV. The housekeeper pays good attention to details. The view is amazing both days and nightsThe only unpleasant experience is that they can’t finish cleaning the room on-time when we tried to check-in at 3 pm and we had to wait for half an hour. It would not be a big deal had we not landed on the plane early that day and desperate for a comfortable bed to lie down.

This was our third time we stayed at Ritz Carlton in Tokyo. The staff, specially Leon was fantastic and so attentive to our needs even when we did not know we had the needs. I cannot fault the hotel’s service, cleanliness, location and the general feel of the hotel. We will surely come back, and this time we will bring the whole family. thank you Ritz and thank you Loan.

I stay at this Ritz every time I visit Tokyo. I appreciate the high customer service standards. Everyone is friendly and willing to go out of their way to assist you. The Club staff goes overboard to make sure that you are well taken care of during your stay. The rooms are very spacious and not sure you can find better views of Tokyo anywhere in the city. Overall, the people and service here make the difference and are the main reason I will continue to return.

This hotel is very nice, never something I'd pay cash for, to be clear (much cooler hotels can be had for this rate-the Ritz is an overpriced brand,) but if you're using points (which I did) or your stay is being comped, it's very luxe. The views from the room are amazing, and the bathroom is super luxurious- 3 separate stalls for bath, toilet, and shower. The room is also very large.Two issues:1. It's kind of annoying to get to the hotel- the building it's in has a lot of shops/amenities, but also as a result, requires you to navigate through a lot of different areas to get to your room. Takes at least 7minutes from entering the building, I'd say. And you have to take an elevator to the lobby, then get out and board a separate elevator to the rooms. Not something huge, but if you're going to be in and out a lot, it gets annoying. 2. This one really struck me as ridiculous. We went to the pool/sauna hoping to enjoy them, and found that, one, you are required to wear a swim cap in the pool at all times, which feels silly and overly-cautious. We chose not to go in forthat reason. And second, the sauna is NOT included in the price of your room, as any reasonable person would expect at a hotel of this caliber. Nope, you have to pay about 3,000 Yen per person per DAY to use a dinky little sauna. My local YMCA doesn't even charge for that. This felt really chintzy to me, and gave me a bad impression of the hotel.

Spectacular property and staff. Consistent service making a wonderful experience. Rooms lovely. Spa comfortable. Concierge great. Everything perfect. Restaurant very good although expensive. Breakfast so amazing in food choices and service anticipating all needs.

The room and service were amazing. The night skyline view from my room on the 47th floor was the most stunning city view I've ever seen. The bathroom was luxurious, and the bed linens were very high quality.

This hotel epitomizes César Ritz's vision of hotel perfection. The hotel starts on the 45th floor, allowing the guest space-time to decompress from the frenzy of Tokyo, A sumptuous floral arrangement greets the guest upon stepping out of the elevator. Elegant lobby, very distinguished social and dining areas, spacious rooms and well-appointed bathrooms are just the start of the experience.What sets this hotel part from all the high-luxury hotels in the world is the caliber of its staff. The men and women are well educated, knowledgeable, courteous and professional. What is most striking is the staff's uncanny ability to foresee the guest's needs and fulfill our desires. Noemi in the breakfast area greeted us by name every morning, knew exactly what we preferred to eat, and in what order. All with a cheerful smile and in-depth conversation.Rebecca at the front desk understood that we had come to Tokyo to inhale the city and its wonders. She made it a point to ascertain that our stay would be as memorable as it was filled with meaningful plans for the day. Plus, greeting us at night with a chocolate or two!Management, of course, attentive to our comments and suggestions. Impeccable service and attention, in every way.
