user_name:
Riccardo_Iname
San Andres and Providencia Department, Colombia

review_body: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton (Tokyo) for seven days and it was an absolutely lovely week. The room had an incredible view and the food at the sushi restaurant and the club lounge was excellent. Most impressive however, was the staff at the Club Lounge. All were delightful, especially one woman, Minori Fukushima. Minori helped arrange terrific individual tour guides each day for my nine year old daughter (while I was in work meetings) and, at the end of our stay, she arranged all of our other travel plans for the next cities on our itineraries with extreme attention to every last detail! She basically was the highest level of service that one can ever hope to encounter while traveling.
user_name:
ReneeLaj
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We decided to come in three days early to rest from the flight and to see parts of Tokyo that were not on the tour itinerary. The Ritz-Carlton was so centrally located that it was easy to get around. The staff was exceptional in every way. From check in to check out, they were all that anyone could ask for. We felt at home from the start. Our room was spacious, comfortable, and had an excellent view of Tokyo. If we ever get to Tokyo again, this is where we will stay.

As a long time business traveler and Marriott Platinum member, I have stayed at hundreds of hotels over the years... This is without question the finest I have ever experienced. Supreme service, extraordinarily clean, beautiful views, every factor is a 10/10.

Our Club Tower Deluxe Twin room was massive (for a non-suite room), with full walk in closet and huge bathroom, and nice view of Tokyo Tower. On arrival, I called housekeeping for a cot, but was informed there were none available, so do book ahead if you need one.The Club lounge staff were very kind and both breakfast and afternoon tea were delicious. Having access to the Club lounge is great (for check-in and meals) as the main lobby seems quite busy all the time.As a family with young kids (age 4, 6), I had thought there may be something from the Ritz Kids program (eg activities) but we were not offered anything. Hotel pool is not appropriate for small children (no shallow parts). There is a lovely small park near the 2121 Design Sight when kids need to run around.

I’m mona a hiker and a travel blogger from Qatar you can find me on Instagram @MKAA20014.I stayed at the ritz Carlton Tokyo for two unforgettable nights . I would really like to thank Mr.Mathieu Fontana , from the front desk he was the best he always made sure that we had the best stay the most friendly and helpful front desk person I ever met ( merci beaucoup) , also I would like to thank miss.Sakifuji and Mr. Omar Driouech. the room category I stayed in was a deluxe room , it was spacious with amazing views of Tokyo skyline. The lobby of the hotel was stunning with floor to ceiling windows overlooking Tokyo skyline as well as the hotel restaurants, the view from the restaurants is amazing specially at night .

Tokyo is a city of great hotels, and the Ritz Carlton Tokyo is at the top of that list. Located in the central district of Roppongi, the hotel offers its guests easy access to most of Tokyo’s famous sites and things to do. As the hotel sits at the top of Tokyo’s tallest building, you can guess that the views are the best anywhere. You even have a direct view of Mt Fuji. If you’re someone who likes to get around by subway, the hotel sits over the Roppongi subway station, which is accessible without having to go outside.

My husband and I decided to stay at The Ritz-Carton Tokyo over our anniversary and we couldn’t have chosen better. The hotel is spectacular with incredible views, amazing decor and the most important, impeccable service. We surely recommend booking a Club room as their Club Lounge is fantastic, the food, selection of beverages, service and attention to detail are second to none. We also tried their restaurants which have just undergone renovation this year. Towers is a must try and their one Michelin Star Restaurant Azure 45 is just incredible. Thank you Ritz-Carlton Tokyo for making our anniversary trip to Tokyo so memorable!

I stay in many luxury hotels but I found that the staff at the ritz Tokyo blew me away. Everything was nice and smooth, before I got there the concierges helped with restaurant reservations and gave some great tips on local attractions. The rooms were fantastic and spacious. I’m trying to think about something I didn’t like and truly can’t. Wish I could go back tomorrow. Thx for a great stay, see you soon.
user_name:
anupNYC
New York City, New York

review_body: Service is really really good, staffs were very friendly and helpful. Location of the hotel is good, shopping and dining are walkable distance. Room was very clean and spacious. Fitness was quite big and the equipments were great Perfect

We have stayed at Peninsula, St. Regis, and Four Seasons hotels all over the world. This Ritz Carlton had the best service and breakfast. The room and views are very nice too. We started with asking the concierge to book guides and michelin star restaurants over a month before arriving and they did a terrific job taking care of everything. The rooms and bathrooms are spacious and everything is in order. The Japanese breakfast is terrific every morning, along with the usual western selections. If you go, make sure to have their croissants and Belgian waffle. The only setback is that it takes a few minutes to get out of the building to a subway station. The hotel is on the top floors of a building in a huge complex called Tokyo Midtown.

Used to stay a lot at the RC Tokyo for business, first time with the family. The staff went beyond what's expected to make this stay special ! Great room, fantastic view, best service and over-the-top buffet breakfast

My husband and I absolutely loved the friendly and sweet service provided by Ms Rebecca during our stay. She took very good care of us and made us feel so comfortable. She is very detailed and attentive to our needs.

We had a fantastic 2-night stay at Ritz Carlton Tokyo in mid-April of 2018. As we were traveling as a family we had booked a king room with a rollaway bed, and we were very happy with the room, the only real drawback was that there were too few electrical outlets - would have thought that there would be more, preferably usb-outlets too. The view from the hotel is great, Tokyo looks amazing from up high. What set this hotel apart from the rest was the quality of the staff, they went above and beyond in taking care of us, naturally focusing on making our 5-year old daughter happy. They understand that taking care of the child makes all of the family happy. We would especially like to thank Risako who is truly an asset to the hotel, she was so wonderful to all of us during our visit. Unfortunately our visit was too short, but we will certainly be back at Ritz-Carlton Tokyo!

Visiting major cities in the world sometimes gives too many choices and often harder to choose hotels and restaurants. However I do not look anywhere else in Tokyo because Tokyo Ritz is the best of the best. Located literally in the heart of midtown you have such a great acces to anywhere. Now they have Oedo-line along with Ginza-line, it is just so convinent getting around (of course easy access to Taxi too) Lobby is at the 45th floor and rooms starts from 47th & up. Needless to say the view from the room is fabulous. You get to see entire Tokyo at once. Their B/F buffet is the must-try. (Compare to US, the price was reasonable I thought. Less than $40 per person). There is alao Galleria mall on the 1st floor and below, tons of high-end stores and restaurants. Food wasnt that expensive to my suprise. Impeccable service and concierge. It was worthy for my daughter to fly from Boston for Easter break. Only complain I had was the bed. It wasnt bad but I would expect the heavenly at this level.

Everything about the RitzCarlton in Tokyo was amazing. It started with a fantastic view, continues with great service, and excellent food! Be sure to have a crossiant waffle! We are still talking about them.

This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. The rooms are gorgeous, the views are incredible and the staff was very warm and friendly. And the breakfast buffet was also awesome.. I hope I have an opportunity to stay there again.

Incredible service friendly staff. Spacious room with great view. Very clean. Delicious buffet breakfast. Just what you would expect from a Ritz-Carlton property. Very convenient location next to subway and attached to shopping. Would stay here again.

What awaits on the 45th floor lobby was unexpected...the view, for sure...but the service was even more incredible. The rooms were extremely spacious and comfortable. What's the most important thing..location, location, location!

Ritz Carlton Tokyo is just simply one of the best luxurious hotels in the world; its services and hard products are just extraordinary. Been staying there numerous times and it never fails to deliver a top notch experience. Club level is a must. The best club level experience someone can get anywhere.

One of the great hotels of the world with the best possible service, hospitality, views, food,sleep quality and everything that makes a hotel simply perfect! We will definitely be back! Rooms on the "club" floor offer complimentary food and drinks in the club lounge. A beautiful area to watch the sunset over the city from the 53rd floor.

Everything about our stay was glorious, from the moment we arrived at the concierge's desk to our departure. The rooms were beautiful, the bathroom and amenities wonderful, and the breakfast buffet and menus were the best!

Thank you for a great stayThe corner view from the suite was beyond sensational. Probably the best upgrade I ever received ;)I may also say the the breakfast was delicious.Great location, wonderful cherry blossom and good foodI will be back. Save the room for me

My husband and I stayed here for the last two nights of a trip to Japan and it was by far the nicest hotel we stayed in. The mix of East and West was much appreciated. The basic room was beautiful. Clean, spacious, lots of storage, beautiful view. The breakfast /brunch was amazing--the best choices! The Tower restaurant was pricey, but worth it. Wonderful steaks shared by 4. The bar was amazing--similar to Lost In Translation. Very elegant with live entertainment. The pool and spa were lovely as well. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Warmest hospitality I've seen in years. From the moment of arrival every staff member I encountered made me feel like I was the only guest.I tend to work in my room for hours at a a time and both rooms served that purpose quite well.The breakfast buffet is almost the highlight but there are so many I dont want to leave it there.It was all good. Best compliment I can give a hotel is to return.I certainly will.

My family and I had a great time staying at this property. From the moment we stepped in to the entrance, the entire staff was extremely helpful and catered to our every whim. Every single staff member was extremely attentive. The concierge in particular was super helpful locking down some dinner reservations for us. I managed to work via email with them for a couple of weeks before I arrived. That was extremely helpful for us. My seven year old and I were also even able to take advantage of the pool where they provided swim caps and lockers. The rooms were great and offered an amazing view of the city. Our view overlooked Tokyo tower. We have stayed at many properties in Tokyo, but the Ritz was definitely one of the best.

We try to enjoy high tea when we travel abroad and the Ritz didn’t disappoint. The view was stunning, the tea and food was amazing and the ambiance was incredible. The lobby is worth the trip even if you just want to grab a drink. Waterfalls and a grand piano just add to the experience.

The Ritz hotel in Tokyo is very clean, very professional, and an exceptional place to stay. It is located in midtown, right at a subway station that can easily take you wherever you want to go. The staff is exceptional and can make great recommendations. They also arranged a private tour for us. Our guide, Akey, was the best. Very knowledgable! We will stay at this hotel again.

The hotel is not runned by a proper GM, you don t hear him , you don t see him... but you can smell a very steing odour in the lifts and corridors and some rooms ... checked out immediately as it was the worst experience ever

I stayed at the Ritz for two nights while alone in town on business. It was my first trip to Japan so I was a bit nervous, but man, this hotel really did an outstanding job of making me comfortable. The cherry blossoms were in bloom and not only surrounded the hotel, but were inside the lobby, creating a great visual and olfactory experience. The staff was incredibly friendly, the lobby had killer views with classy music, and the rooms were large. There is no question I would stay here again - can’t recommend it highly enough.

This is a beautiful hotel. The rooms are modern and spacious. The staff shows the usual Rittz Carlton attentiveness. The bar had live entertainment; the singer was marvelous. Wehad dinner here our first night. The lobster roll was excellent.Adjacet to the Ritz is the Midtown shopping plaza. Great restaurants here as well.

The last time I stayed at the Ritz Carlton Tokyo was almost a decade ago back in 2007. Despite the many luxury properties in Tokyo, I have yet to find a favorite one like in other cities. I decided to try the Ritz Carlton Tokyo again after hearing of praises especially for the new club lounge in the travel forum. My competent travel agent was also able to secure me a good upgrade to suite so I decided to try. ArrivalI arrived by taxi after my trip to Kyoto where I also stayed at the Ritz Carlton. On arrival at around 2PM, I was escorted to the front desk for check-in. Seeing there was a queue and my suite comes with club lounge access, I request to check-in at the club lounge thinking that it should be faster. The bell boy then escort me to the club lounge for check-in.The hotel’s club lounge has since undergo an extensive renovation and refurbishment. It is now much more spacious and luxurious, and with more amenities. I was sat down on a table and given a drink. Then I waited for the staff to actually check me in and gave me the room keys. That didn’t happened. I waited for 10 mins before I got impatient and asked a staff to check-me in. Again I was told to wait at my seat. Another 10 mins passed, still no one came. I went to the reception desk only to be told my room wasn’t ready! That’s annoying. They should have told me upfront so that I could have gone somewhere instead of waiting pointlessly. Apparently, the staff thought since the room wasn’t ready, I should just relax in the lounge. I left the hotel and came back at 4PM for check-in. The club manager apologize for the delay and personally escorted me to my Executive Suite. The Executive SuiteThe suite is spacious, and have two wall to ceiling windows that really showcase the panoramic view of Tokyo. Few hotels have views as good as the Ritz Carlton, the other being the Mandarin Oriental. The first thing I noticed is that the layout of the suite is very strange. It’s the usual suite with a living room, a bedroom and en-suite bathroom. What’s weird is that the bedroom actually come before the living room on entering. Suite and Rooms in the Ritz Carlton has been refurbished and looks much nicer than in the past. The bathroom regretably still remain the same and has not been refurbished.Room amenities were adequate with a coffee machine, fast wifi, large LCD TV in both living room and bedroom and a very comfortable bed. The airconditioning was noisy when I checked-in but the hotel maintenance staff fixed it quickly. Water pressure in the bathroom is adequate but not great. The common areas and locationThe hotel common areas are starting to show it’s age, looks rather old, and is actually due for a refreshening up. There were a few restaurants in the hotel. I tried the Teppanyaki restaurant and it’s excellent with good service and great food. Highly recommended. Morning breakfast served at the Tower restaurant was excellent as well. The Club Lounge has some nice food serving and very nice in-house champagne. Other than that, I don’t actually find it very nice, especially when compared to the spacious club lounge at the Ritz Carlton Hong Kong. The tables were too close together for comfort and the food serving was not very extensive. The breakfast served at the club lounge was poor, lacking variety but one has the option of having breakfast at the main restaurant. Nevertheless, it is still a relaxing place to have a quick drink or two. The hotel is located at the Tokyo Midtown, which is a shopping complex with some nice restaurants, and provide direct access to the excellent Tokyo Subway through an underground passage. The negative is that it’s quite a long walk to the subway entrance Overall, the location is noticeably less interesting compared to Ginza and Roppongi Hills and the surrounding area. ServiceService at the hotel is uniformerly excellent. Other than the initial hiccups during check-in, it was polite and attentive. There were many foreign staff in the hotel as well, perhaps to help with communication issues since local Japanese staff don’t speak good English. The Club Lounge Manager Mr Katori was excellent and he ensured most of my request were well taken care of. Service recovery was also excellent. Once a staff wrongly sent me an email which was meant for another guest. When she realized her mistake, she immediately apologized but then followed up with a free bottle of champagne to my room. Service at the Teppanyaki restaurant where I had my dinner one of the nights was excellent. The meal was expensive of course but it’s delicious and well presented and service was very attentive. ConclusionNot much to fault here really, whether service wise or the hard product. My only gripe was I don’t really the location. It stop short of mind blowing greatness but that is probably too much to ask nowadays. A very good rating of 4.5 out of 5. I would not mind to return.

This is our first time staying at the Tokyo Ritz and it is one of the best Ritz for sure. We have experienced Ritz in Cancun and Fort Lauderdale but the Tokyo Ritz by far is superior in every regard.Unfortunately we only stayed 2 nights but we know we will return to the Ritz next year.We were kindly given room 4916 with 2 double beds with a gorgeous city view. The room is spacious with every amenity you can think of. We were greeted by a young man, Alex, dressed in a beautifully custom suit and ever so personable greeting us and bringing us up to our room.The room has auto sheers and black out drapes, hot water kettle, Nespresso, tea bags, 3 Nespresso pods, bottled wTer, and your choice of daily newspaper. There is plenty of wine glasses, corkscrew, tea cups, and even a welcoming plate of fruit and mochis.They use Frette linens so it is very silky but each bed has only 1 pillow so we had to request for more pillowsa. Surprising, they do not use duvets but instead wool blanket sandwiched in a duvet cover which is unusual for this caliber of hotel.The hotel is in a great location, imho, because it at the MidTown shopping center below the hotel is a huge shopping mall, Galleria, with 4 floors of shops, a vast array of different restaurants, Starbucks, 7/11, and a huge supermarket, Precce, which has very reasonable high end deli food items and ready made foods as well as sushi and meats.we purchased all our alcohol at Precce along with some finger foods and enjoyed it in our room as Happy Hour. We did not need to go out as I was feeling a little under the weather so being able to enjoy a glass of wine and champagne in the comfort of our own room was a real plus.The swimming pool and jacuzzi are complimentary for guests as well as the extensive gym. The Heat Experience room is additional charge. The pool is lovely and the changing room is extremely clean and luxurious. I enjoyed the 20meter pool during our stay for sure.The Ritz Carlton is all about the guest, the individual, as they make you feel very valued as a guest regardless paying $2000 a night or using your Marriott points as a Marriott member. No matter where you are at this hotel, every staff member is ready to greet and get the elevator for you. We loved our stay at this Ritz and we will definitely be returning here when we come to Tokyo again.Thank you to Mr. Busto for all his kind assistance and to young Alex for being so cheerful and welcoming always.

From the moment we were greeted by the porter, the level of service and attention was without compare. The reception by the management, front desk and concierge was incredibly welcoming. The room was modern elegance with an incredible view. The Concierge assisted with an "impossible" 3 star Michelin restaurant reservation. The Spa was a luxury treat. We look forward to many visits to this Tokyo treasure.

I used my points to reserve a room at the Ritz-Carlton Tokyo (using the Marriott website) for my daughter and son-in-law. I could not the reservation in their name on the website. I then contacted the hotel directly to let them know who the guests would be. Ms. Yuriko Suzuki in the Ritz-Carlton Tokyo reservations office made note of the change, said they would be most welcome, and told me to please contact her for any assistance at all. I did just that, with various requests for her advice or assistance (changing to club level room; info on the spa, transportation, other services) and she always promptly responded and accommodated my requests in every regard. She is largely responsible for the wonderful time my daughter and son-in-law enjoyed at the hotel. I am so pleased with the Ritz Carlton Tokyo’s service for my family members and Ms. Suzuki in particular. She is a great representative of your beautiful hotel! I hope I have a chance to be a guest there myself someday. Greg J.
user_name:
Gregory J
Mount Pleasant, SC, United States

review_body: First time at the Ritz in Tokyo and first time staying in this area (but have visited Tokyo numerous times). Enjoyed the location, convenient to transportation, and amazing views. Incredible service, beautiful spa and simply wonderful.

Stayed at Ritz Carlton Roppongi the second time. Located in Tokyo Midtown in Roppongi, and nested in a quiet environment, but just a few minutes walk to the busy Roppongi area. Lobby is located on 45th floor, with a panoramic view of Minato-ku. Ritz Carlton in Osaka is classic style, while in Tokyo it is contemporary.I checked in at club lounge on 53/F. The club lounge provides snacks and good view of Tokyo Tower during its operation hours until 10pm. The room I was staying, like the one I stayed in last time here at Ritz Carlton was quite dark. I even need a torch to look at the temperature control panel. I turned on the big TV but muted the sound so that the room looks brighter. The view is, however, great. In good weather, one can see as far as Yokohama. The bed is firm enough for me. Drapes and sheer is electric controlled. Cleaning staff worked very hard to make the room sparkling clean.Toiletries are abundant. Bath salt for bubble bath is provided and the tube has an excellent view of Tokyo. However, the quality of the shower gel, shampoo and body lotion and their dispenser are disappointed and do not live up to the Ritz name.The breakfast restaurant was under renovation at that time so breakfast was arranged in the lobby restaurant. Selection and preparation are limited. Service level in the lobby restaurant was a bit disappointed. But concierge staff at ground level was excellent.Overall Ritz Carlton is a very fine hotel which would lead to a high expectation.

I have stayed at the Ritz Carlton in Tokyo twice now and will not stay anywhere else in Tokyo. I have also stayed at the Park Hyatt and can attest that the Ritz's property and commitment to service is unparalleled. The rooms at the Ritz far exceed those at the Park Hyatt. Our room was big, spacious and extremely clean - the beds are amazing and we slept great. We also had Club access and Valter and his team were extraordinary. They were so gracious and wonderful with the 5 kids we had in tow and we really enjoyed the afternoon tea. They took wonderful care of us and kindly met our every need - from check-in to concierge service to arranging transportation to the airport. The Ritz Kids program was also amazing - the kids loved the scavenger hunt and passport program. They also loved sleeping in the tent under the stars! The hotel is really close to the train station, so we had easy subway access to everywhere we wanted to go. I would definitely stay here if it's in your budget.

As you walk into this hotel you feel very special and cared for. One gets picked up by the very friendly staff and you glide up to the 45 th level to check in. Libby is very beautiful and large and last week had wonderful cherry blossom everywhere. The rooms very large and totally function. Liked a little colour in my view , tv screens are wonderfully big with stunning views. The restaurant for breakfast is airy and has a wonderful selection to choose from. Gym is spacious and well equipped. Heat room is good too, although don’t understand why one should pay extra to use it. Other hotels have it as standard. Pool was great although it felt bland needs colour. Also no outside space at all to sunbath . Worth creating an outdoor area.Loved my stay ! Back soon

Although we just stayed here for one night on our way back from other cities, the Ritz Carlton Tokyo did not disappoint. Amazing views of the city from our room, and the club services were what you expect. As a longtime Ritz Carlton member, the hotel was exactly what I love about the brand. The staff were all lovely and eager to help and made sure all of our requests were looked after. The concierge staff were lovely and a pleasure to deal with.

We stayed at the Ritz-Carlton Hotel for a week in January 2018. The comfort of its Rooms (on the 48-51st Floors) are spacious and comfortable with, of course, stunning views of Tokyo (including Mt. Fuji, from some rooms), But what is truly exceptional is the superb service! The Concierge Desk (in our case Alex) almost begged to be of service and made our Tokyo stay enjoyable by providing both good ideas for Restaurants and Sights to See, but also the encouragement and instruction to use the Subway System, rather than expensive Taxis.

I just got back to Washington, DC after being in Japan for two weeks, spending quality time with my father and my family, enjoying good food and sightseeing. I really want to thank Ritz Carlton Tokyo for their kind hospitality, we certainly enjoyed ourselves and it was thanks to the wonderful Ladies & Gentlemen (from the front drive staff, front desk, concierge, housekeeping, and F&B outlets - Mr. Cates and Mr. Receveau Stora certainly made sure we were taken care of at the Lobby Lounge). My father and I enjoyed our room (spectacular views), and were so impressed about the service we were given and the guest recognition! We look forward to staying again at the RC Tokyo! Thank you so much!
user_name:
toshyos
New York City, New York

review_body: Luxurious rooms (great views) and great location the hotel is great for guests who want to access nearby Roppongi and Yebisu. Located next to train station and mall with many great food options nearby. On par with many of the other 5 star hotels in Tokyo.The concierge staff were very helpful and provided great recommendations. Sushi Kai Kai near to the hotel was a hidden gem!

Traditionally-attired, friendly, and efficient Guest Services staff provided us with a luxuriously appointed room which Housekeeping maintained at a just-checked-in look, paying meticulous attention to detail. The panoramic views were impressive, both from the room and the bountiful breakfast buffet.Having a late-lunch reservation at Hinokizaka, the hotel's Japanese cuisine restaurant, was fortuitous: shortly after we arrived in the Tempura room (which seats 10 diners only), a group of four departed, leaving my family and I to enjoy an almost 2-hour private dining experience!Erica, a knowledgeable and delightful Hostess, guided us through each offering as presented by our Chef, a man of efficient moves, who graciously suggested which of the myriad spice options would best accompany a given tempura dish. Nice.Concierge staff generously suggested and arranged activities and conveniences for me and my family. In fact, all Guest Services staff that we encountered were courteous, kind, and professional; SPA staff were quite personable.Thank you, Ritz-Carlton Tokyo, for a most satisfactory and memorable holiday.

Tremendous hospitality from the moment you arrive. Alexandre Prouvost will treat you like royalty. I think this is one of the best hotels where I have ever stayed. You get smiles form everyone you meet.

I don't why I didn't write a review of Ritz-Carlton Tokyo sooner! This is my second time visiting this hotel and for this trip we came to celebrate my wife's birthday. The rooms are big and have all the amenities. We had a room which offered views of Tokyo Tower and had access to the club lounge. Every staff member was over the top friendly and greeted us by name every time we entered the club lounge. I was super surprised they would remember my name in many different occasions throughout stay. They also set up an awesome happy birthday treat for my wife. Thanks again!Overall a simply fabulous stay at the Ritz-Carlton Tokyo. Every time we stay at a Ritz it reiterates to me why I love staying with them.

Of course Ritz Carlton's have a great name but this one is on point. The rooms are spacious and have views that are stunning if the weather cooperates. I was on the 48th floor and could see Mt Fuji when it was clear. The bathrooms are large and have both a shower and a bathtub and double sinks so you can spread out. The best part is the toilets which the seats are heated and have all the buttons to clean yourself, plus it flushes by itself. Magical and if your like me, will want one for your home. I ate breakfast each morning at the buffet and it was excellent. The staff is friendly and so accommodating. The hotel is well located and easy to get to from many attractions. I highly recommend staying here as it's comfort at its best.

Stayed for 4 nights on a business trip. The location of this hotel is ideal for Tokyo’s nightlife and close to business district by car. Staff are amazing and the lobby bar has wonderful views of the city from the 45th floor. Rooms are perfect. Quiet and dark. Can’t fault this hotel at all.

This was the best hotel I have ever and will ever stay at in my life. The views and lobby are incomparable. The service was impeccable - people bow to you as you are in the elevator, promptly bring anything upon request, are so nice and knowledgeable and speak perfect English. Breakfast was amazing. Also loved the live entertainment at night in the lobby. We got upgraded bc of my husband's status and our suite had views of Mt Fuji with 2 separate rooms and a corner view of the entire city. Thank you to the Ritz for making our last stop in Japan on our honeymoon so memorable.
user_name:
SCRUDELE
New York City, New York

review_body: Tokyo indeed flaunt slew of top notch hotel choices, but as a Ritz rewards member, I was curious how this Tier 5 property fared compared to other properties I’ve been to and decided to do our first 2 nights stay in japan here. I loved that everything about this hotel shouted “in the middle of the city” as it resides literally atop the fun shopping and dining area Tokyo Midtown and the Roppongi subway station. Everything from the checkin to getting assigned the desirable room to getting your luggage and checking out the facilities was a breeze with the eager staff members very much readily available to help. My only unenthusiastic encounter was with the hostesses at the Lobby Lounge who seemed very occupied and unable to help much when asked to see the cafe menu. The rooms felt imperialistic, modern and most importantly spacious with a great skyline view of Tokyo. The bed was comfortable as usual at Ritz properties and I especially appreciated the spacious bathroom very ready for a hot bath decked with a TV. Honestly though, I think what distinguished this property among others was The Club Level experience which I had heard great things about and really was also nothing short of fabulous. The wide range of food options for breakfast - from omelets to porridge to green smoothies - along with great coffee drinks and an excellent atmosphere really made this upgrade with it. Plus, this was the first Club Lounge where they had a very prompt and proper three-tiered afternoon tea set served impressively in silverware for all their guests. Just that afternoon tea experience alone (which we would have done anyway either at Ritz or Aman or Mandarian) made the club level upgrade extra worth it for us. I did notice that this hotel seem to support a lot of non-hotel guest business (I.e. extensive spa, gym memberships, meetings, etc.) which probably serves the affluent in the city and it was interesting observing and running into those individuals most who were dressed up very formally, compared to my casual and comfortable attire for traveling. All in all, I can guarantee the quality of the service, the food and the overall experience of this hotel really exceeding the Ritz standard and that by coming and staying here, you’ll get a glimpse of the very classy and convenient city living (ie. elevator ride straight to the underway to subway station, shops, restaurants, 5 Min walk to Joel Robouchon bakery, etc).

Typically luxurious room for this level of hotel, but not particularly large for the price. Also even though the hotel is fairly new the rooms honestly feel a little dated, albeit very clean. Breakfast was decent but a bit limited in selection, and doesn't include an a la carte main as some hotels of this level do. Finally while the service is excellent and friendly, I found it a bit much when while tired and checking in, 3 different staff members tried to strike up conversations with me, and 1 waited in line with me for no apparent reason. For the price I prefer the Shangri-la for everything except perhaps the location.

This was our first trip to Tokyo and the Ritz Carlton was simply AMAZING! The service was exceptional, the room was so beautiful and the staff went over and beyond to ensure our stay was absolutely PERFECT! We had a king bedroom on the club level and the views out our window were just incredible. We ate at the Japanese restaurant inside the hotel twice during our stay and both times the food and service were wonderful. The gym is large and well equipped and the spa/pool area is calm and inviting. Kevin from Hotel Management was so friendly and accommodating throughout our stay. He recommended and arranged many sites for us to see and helped us book a traditional couples tea ceremony for our 25th Wedding Anniversary. We had the time of our lives in Tokyo and owe much of that to the unparalleled service we received at the Ritz Carlton. We can’t wait to go back again!

Being a Platinum Elite customer in the Marriot Group Loyalty program helped a lot: a got an upgrade to a suite in the top corner of the tower! The service was simply amazing: the concierge helped us in the previous month to reserve any tiny, impossible to find and to reserve Michelin starred restaurant. The location is simply perfect, and there is a luxurious mall just below the hotel. The only point: the price. Everything (from the room, to the spa) is very pricey. But you are at the Ritz Carlton in Tokyo... what could you expect different? :)

From start to finish, hands down, one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in. The attention to detail in EVERY aspect was beyond expectations. The staff is incredibly kind and helpful—EVERY SINGLE ONE OF THEM. The rooms are beautiful and quiet. The views of the city are breathtaking. I wish I could just live in this hotel permanently.

From the time I arrived , I got a great services from all the staff member and management , the club lounge are more than great in term of everything , food , service , it’s really what we expect from Ritz Carlton Hotel , will come back for sure during my next Tokyo visit , thanks a lot to all the hotel team .

We had a wonderful stay at the Ritz Carlton Tokyo with our two children. We stayed on the 52nd floor with sweeping views of Tokyo in a beautiful and spacious twin room (a note for Americans - their "twin beds" are in fact double beds). The views from our room and from the Club Lounge were FAR SUPERIOR to those from the Tokyo Tower (skip this if you're staying at the Ritz!) The club lounge provided wonderful small bite options and cocktails when we returned from sight seeing. I was incredibly impressed with the attentiveness and kindness of the Club Lounge attendants. Our daughter enjoyed a Japanese calligraphy lesson in the lounge and we all enjoyed their harpist during afternoon tea. My only complaint about the lounge would be the lack of interest/help from the club level concierge team. They seemed to sit at the front and weren't terribly helpful/attentive when we asked for help with tours. Otherwise the club lounge truly was a tremendous value. We also enjoyed the pool also with amazing views of the Tokyo skyline. I will note that cloth swim caps are required in the pool and provided by the pool attendants. The pool attendants also went out of their way with a kind gesture to our children who noticed small ducks (think Oriental Trading) in their spa display. They immediately found two for our children who carried them throughout our Asian vacation.

This cafe is located on the street level of Midtown Shopping Center, at the entrance to the shopping mall. They have indoor and outdoor seating, foods and desserts. Great service and the desserts were excellent!

The Ritz is a beautiful hotel. No doubt. However the service and attitude is not up to scratch. The lobby bar is a lovely place to enjoy a drink but the service with friends was a little embarrassing as it was not 5*. The room service delivered cold food .. twice; the ‘smoking in the room’ charge was falsely charged and while rescinded was completely inappropriate. For the price, one should expect more. Suggest you try the Grand Hyatt or Park Hyatt.

If there has ever been a Ritz-Carlton to set the standard for the brand... this has got to be it! From the overwhelming hospitality demonstrated by every single staff member, who each remembered me by name on every occasion, to the incredible architecture and warm inviting decor... no detail has been omitted! The view from my room was incredible through the large picture window, and the power drapes completely black out the room any time of the day or night. The Club Level services are impeccable with 5 daily food courses. Even though two of the hotels signature restaurants are currently undergoing a major renovation, there was not a hint of this activity during my stay. The courses I did sample at Hinokizaka (Asian) including Teppanyaki and Sushi where outstanding. This restaurant is actually 4 smaller sections each specializing in a dedicated style of Asian cooking. I can only imagine what the food offerings will be once the other restaurants reopen. There is literally no reason to leave this property! I was truly impressed with my first visit to Asia!! Hats off to the exemplary Ladies and Gentlemen at the Ritz-Carlton Tokyo!!

We just visited with another couple for three nights as Platinum Members. Very little Platinum recognition, but perhaps a slightly better room. But reading reviews we didn’t expect much of anything in this regard.The property is a magnificent building and the lobby is stunning. You almost feel as if you are having tea or a cocktail in the clouds. One day you are sitting next to business people, the next day you are sitting next to a table of Geishas (as we were one evening). It’s quite the atmosphere.The rooms are very nicely appointed and we had an amazing view of Tokyo Tower. We were welcomed with a nice note and bottle of sake, so I suppose that was some Platinum recognition.The location is great and within walking distance to many restaurants and shopping. Easy to pick up Ubers.The staff was amazingly responsive and the concierge planned our entire three days for us. It’s difficult to walk through the hotel without someone asking if they can help you. Lovely.The one negative, which is largely a facet of the city and culture, and our fault for not speaking Japanese, the hotel would give us written out cards for taxi and Uber drivers to tell them where we are going - but twice we were dropped in the completely wrong place, despite the hotel card and the hotel bellman instructing the driver. Tough to say who is at fault here, but it was consistently an issue and I would expect the hotel to do a better job of sending us out into the city.Don’t miss the great lemon water in the lobby. Very refreshing.

We stayed at the RC Tokyo for 8 nights in mid November and had a wonderful experience. We were met at our car by a member of the executive lounge who took us straight to our room for check in - a great introduction to the efficiency and terrific customer service we experienced in this hotel and Japan as a whole.The qualities and strengths of this hotel are numerous. The room was spacious and beautifully decorated and maintained with a super large bathroom and a great view of Tokyo Tower and the bay in the distance. We used the gym and swimming pool everyday - working out with such an amazing view to look out on gives great motivation to keep going! The staff in the executive lounge were friendly, polite and helpful and we enjoyed our breakfast and evening cocktails there every day. We ate at all the hotel’s restaurants during our stay and they were all perfect.On most evenings we had post dinner drinks in the Lobby Lounge where we were looked after by the manager Manual Receveau Stora and Nakamura Hiroyuki (please excuse if spelt incorrectly); they went the extra mile to provide superb customer service, with dinner recommendations and special desserts from the kitchen. Thank you for looking after us so well.The Ritz-Carlton Tokyo is a remarkable hotel, and I hope I get the chance to revisit it soon.

As the SPG & Marriott Platinum Member as well as Hilton Diamond, I have consistently stayed with luxury hotels around the world, mostly on business trips. I’ve spent some time with my wife for January 2018 in celebrating our anniversary – we’ve been to Sanya Marriott, Ritz Carlton Hong Kong and Ritz Carlton Tokyo. Needless to say, Ritz Carlton is undoubtedly the best – particularly the unparalleled service standard. I stayed with Peninsular Tokyo and Prince Gallery Tokyo on my previous business trips to Japan – I believe Ritz Carlton Tokyo is still the best out of these three. RC Tokyo is everything you expect from the chain but the service, in particular, goes above and beyond the industry standards. The RC service is impeccable the moment you received the welcoming email from Mao of the guest relations team who looked after every single details of what we need. The moment she was aware that we were here to celebrate our anniversary she replied she would give my wife a surprise. We communicated numerous times in regards to every detailed question and every time Mao replied to my email instantly despite sometimes it was very late night in Japan. I knew the service team from RC would never let every customer down – and I was right: due to some reasons we arrived in very late night, however, Kana warmly greeted to us and the handsome boy Mark personally escort us to our room for personalised check in. The moment we stepped into the room, I was deeply impressed by the decoration of the room and all the anniversary atmosphere suddenly came up and my wife can’t help but almost crying. Despite we were being late, the SPA team still waited for my wife’s visit and provided her with the best SPA experience in Japan (as said by my wife). She asked me if RC Tokyo treated every female customer as a queen – I told her that’s exactly what the flagship level of Hospitality Service Standard should be set. When the next day morning we asked for direction to the Ginza Station, the staff personally walked us to the station and even showed us how to buy our train ticket. Now that's service! A good hotel is not only about hardware (I have been new hotels like Prince Gallery Tokyo where the hotel is new from outside to the room, however, the service especially cold smile and slack attitude from their staff team gave you the impression that they are just doing their job rather responding actively to what customers need). In comparison, RC Carlton Tokyo is the place where you can feel the hotel staff is smiling from their heart and serving customers like their family members. This is the sort of service that endears one to a hotel and we cannot wait to return. Great luck for RC Tokyo to have such an excellent staff members like Mao, Kana and Mark. What a pity that Mark is leaving soon due to the end of internship placement. What makes me happier that I would still be able to see Mao and Kana in the near future and RC Tokyo will be my ONLY choice for my stay in Tokyo thanks to the great service from Mao and Kana and their colleagues too. I will also for sure recommend RC Tokyo to my business contacts and personal friends as their first choice in considering RC Tokyo as their destination hotel in Tokyo.

We visited Tokyo last week for 5 days and stayed at your place . It was an amazing experience. We were served once we stepped into the hotel. The staff were very friendly and professional. They gave useful advice on a lot of tourist spots as it was our first visit to Tokyo. We had your signature afternoon tea after check in and it was exceptional. Ikuko Sato and Oya were very helpful throughout our visit and we were honoured to be served by them.

I come here for breakfast all the time, and trust me, the Japanese breakfast is bomb. The twin bed rooms are very spacious and it has the best view of the famous Tokyo skyline. The staff is also very courteous and willing to accommodate to all request.

We stayed 3 nights at the Ritz Carlton 2 weeks ago. It was simply the best hotel experience in every sense of the word. The service, from the initial greeting at the lobby, to personalized check in at the club level, to each person at the café and club lounge, was gracious, attentive and superb. The room was large and beautiful. The view from the club lounge of Mt. Fuji and the Tokyo skyline was incomparable. An example of the outstanding service: one of my daughters picked up an apple at the lounge and before she could sit down, one of the hostesses asked her if she would like the apple to be cut. When my daughter, in surprise, answered "sure", the hostess then asked if she wanted the apple cut with or without the skin. Now, seriously, which other hotel has this kind of attentive service?? My utmost compliments to the management and staff at the Ritz Carlton, Tokyo for raising the bar.... by a mile. Thank you for a memorable stay. This is now our all time favorite hotel.

With all the major luxury chains (Mandarin, Four Season's, Peninsula) having new properties in Tokyo along with some of the top Japanese hotels recently upgraded (The Palace), Tokyo has many choices at the high-end. Having stayed at them all, I think you will find the Ritz Carlton to be the best. Of course it is a beautiful property with incredible service and great rooms as are all the rest. I do think the service here edges out the others and the location in MidTown is hard to beat. You get all the dining and entertainment that you have being close to Roppongi and the Grand Hyatt, but a truly 5 star hotel experience. All the others of this caliber are in the more sedate business centers around Tokyo station.

Superlatives are missing for this hotel where the staff is very careful and ready to make your life so easy while you are the hotel to stay. All little gestures/details provided by the staff makes a huge difference hence this hotel is beyond the top. Room service is good and healthy too. Breakfast is really nice with a mix of Japanese and Western food :)

After coming from the Ritz Carlton in Kyoto, most hotels would be a let down. But, the RC in Tokyo, definitely is not it’s younger, newer “sibling.” Our family had a 3 night stay here over the Christmas holiday. In fairness, the service at the RC Tokyo was quite good. We arrived with a warm welcome curbside, from Alex, the guest relations manager, who is a tremendous asset to the property, as is Masako Ito, the head concierge. While the property itself is not so old. Since Tokyo is evolving so dramatically and so quickly, the RC Tokyo does seem a bit older, than it really is. It is supposed to be a smoke free environment, yet the lobby consistently wreaked of cigarettes. Mostly coming from their bar area. But, since it is an open layout, of course the stench would permeate the rest of the lobby, which is well appointed. Quite glam and westernized. But, pretty generic, typical Ritz aesthetic in the common areas. Nothing particularly memorable or distinctive. Could be anywhere really. One of the upsides to being in a very tall building though, are the amazing views of Tokyo and beyond. Our family had adjoining rooms facing Mount Fuji which was nice. The rooms were a good size. Not small. Not large. Just fine. The bathrooms were somewhat larger in scale than I expected based not the room size. But, both were kind of generic and somewhat dated in my opinion. Everything was in working order and no visible damage. Just...fine. Think it is time for a refresh with the interior design.The only meal we had on premise was breakfast each day. The restaurant is nice enough, although I was put off when I asked for a table one morning, and was politely shown the lobby seating area instead of a proper table, when there were clearly several empty tables. Keep in mind, we only needed a table for 4pp. When I asked, as to why I could not dine in the actual restaurant, the master d inquired if I had a reservation. Seriously? A reservation for breakfast? As a hotel guest? Alex, the guest relations manager was nearby and I asked for his assistance. The situation was quickly rectified and we were offered a normal dining table accordingly. The quality of the breakfast was fine, once we were seated. But, this experience did not sit well, no pun intended. Outside of this one blip in service though, our overall interactions with the staff were excellent throughout the hotel.In my opinion, the team at the RC Tokyo is more impressive than the property itself. The hotel is very nice. Good quality. Solid experience. Though, I would prefer to try elsewhere on my next visit to Tokyo-probably Mandarin or Aman.

I can't say enough good things about the Ritz Carlton, Tokyo. The staff was phenomenal, especially the staff at the concierge desk. We had a special request that they not only fulfilled it, but then attended the attended to make sure it all went well. The rooms and bathrooms and were beautiful and so well maintained. I can't wait to come back and stay.

Sally C
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Located in the center, very easy to walk all over Tokyo. Beautiful hotel with spectacular views. Best service I have ever had at any hotel. Highly recommend!! Was impressed with the breakfast and attached to some of the most gorgeous shops!!!

The choice was between the Ritz-Tokyo and several other highly rated properties. We chose the Ritz-Tokyo and are so happy we did. The staff was amazing. We were greeted by name constantly throughout our week-long stay. The pool and spa staff were fantastic and I hope to experience their hospitality again. The bar and restaurant was great; too many people to remember, but the gentleman that offered us the wine selection (he was from France or Spain, can't remember) gave us wonderful advice on what to drink with our meal. Overall the only hotel choice I'll make on our future visits to Tojyo.
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
Dengony
New York, New York, United States

review_body: The ladies and gentlemen who staff this property may be the finest customer service team of any hotel anywhere in the world. They are simply unmatched in their friendliness, ability to serve and desire to make certain everything about your stay is perfect.

Yes, we spent the money to stay here and it was 100% worth it. The views from the hotel are breathtaking and the service was exactly what you'd expect from the Ritz Carlton - impeccable.I highly recommend using the Concierge to assist with planning your daily activities. Reika was particularly helpful and we sought her daily assistance with shopping, dining, and sightseeing recommendations.The breakfast buffet in the Towers restaurant is a fantastic way to start your morning. Once again, the service was fantastic as well as the food, right down to the salad dressing (I miss the Japanese-style salad dressing...).I will definitely stay at the Ritz Carlton Tokyo again when I return to Japan. And I will most definitely return to Tokyo, as both the city and its people are lovely.
user_name:
Tracie O
Austin, Texas, United States

review_body: Best ritz carlton hotel i have ever been and definitely one of the very best i have been. Rooms are large sized, amazing view as they start above 45th floors, amazing club lounge with good spread, service is top notch. The gym facilities are amazing as well and it is very conveniently situated at midtown where there are alot of good restaurants. Strongly recommend this hotel to anyone whom don’t mind splurging for a great experience.

Amazing hospitality from the bar team and Kiver to make us feel like home away from homeFantastic view to see the whole of Tokyo,we will definitely be coming back here whenever we visit Tokyo. Drinks were excellent as well

On my recent visit to Tokyo some friends recommend Ritz Carlton and I decided to stay. The hotel is located above 45th floor and if you get the right room offers amazing views. The rooms are big and have all the amenities. I had a room which offered views to the city and on a clear day you can see Mount Fuzi. Waking up to a sunrise was pure bliss.The hotel had a great pool and fitness centre so definitely try them. If you are flying from Narita airport take the limousine bus which has a stop at hotel.Hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. Had a great stay so recommended.

This was BY FAR the best Ritz-Carlton we’ve ever stayed at! Superior service is to be expected when staying at any Ritz-Carlton, but this particular location was all around better than any of our other Ritz-Carlton experiences!!! Every staff member was over the top friendly and greeted us by name each day we were there. The staff was genuinely interested in each of our daily activities. The concierge went out of their way to do things that we didn’t even know they would do or expect them to do.Our corner room suite was extremely spacious and modern. The view from our corner suite was spectacular!!! With the huge windows we were able to take some fabulous pictures of the Tokyo Tower and beautiful Tokyo. Even the bathroom was big and the toilet was quite unique with all of the buttons and options! I can not say enough great things about our stay here. I wish every stay at every Ritz-Carlton was as amazing as this stay was!

My room was fantastic. The beds were very comfortable and there was a working desk and sitting chairs. Bathroom was wonderful and very big. Bath and shower. Lots of space for your wardrobe. When I arrived a was asking for a transformer for my lab top because it was 110v. It arrived in 5 minutes and also the iron was in the room in no time and very modern iron. Nespresso coffee machine. Lounge and breakfast room with a good view over Tokio (45th floor). Service in this hotel is outstanding and it is one of the best hotels is stayed for a long time.

Sitting at Narita airport and ready to go home but for some reason, I want to go back to the ritz.After a two week trip in japan, we had plenty of luxury to mid range hotels but our last two nights were supposed to be at Ana intercontinental... for most, intercontinental is a trusted brand and nothing should go wrong right? Wrong!.... the room they put us in as spire elite was last updated in the 80s (imagine green bathtub and a Japanese toilet that speed water everywhere...and we know how to use it.)Could barely sleep as all was disgusting at Ana intercontinental .. see my other review with ONE picture which will tell you the whole story ...we checked out the next day and booked two rooms at the ritz as it’s close by.Geez... we were in for a treat as highlighted below:1. People: all staff were eager to help with genuine smile.. ( yes, there are Japanese peeps who don’t smile and hate their job)... but not here. Multi lingual, genuine to ensure our stay is as comfy as possible... kudos to the teams and we did not even need to lift a finger2. Marriott recognition: did not expect to be upgraded but we were to connecting room with suites...we really could play hide and seek but we were too old and tired.3. Location: great location in Roppongi with shopping mall attached and lots and lots of shops, eateries around and parks. You cannot beat that in central Tokyo.All in all... this is one of the places to be as even regular rooms are huge but the most important thing is the service and the people who put their hearts to it... I would hire them all if I could but that tells you the story.If you are in Tokyo for any reason, it worth it for a few hundreds bucks more because you will keep wanting to go back.Kudos to the team and this will be the only place I will ever stay in Tokyo!
user_name:
Jeff L
Austin, Texas, United States

review_body: we are planning a honeymoon holiday to asia and tokyo elected as our goal. stay for 5 nights with a standard room, which in our opinion is very far from our expectations. all the staff are very friendly and trully helpful to us, specially to alex. a very strategic hotel location directly linked to the mid-town shoping center.

Excellent Service, location, food and rooms! Everything is Prefect! Me and my family have a wonderful vacation with Ritz Carlton Tokyo! We will be back and will recommend my friends to stay in this hotel again!

Love this hotel, Elegant and marvelous!Located at Roponggi and connecting with Mid-Town shopping centre.Perfect place to spend your late afternoon tea at the Cafe & Deli (after sightseeing at the city).

Located in the upper floors of a Mid-Town, Tokyo office tower, this Ritz has a lot of great features. First, the lobby area incorporates a bar, tea room and restaurant with 2-story high windows offering views over an expanse of central Tokyo. Second, the rooms are spacious and very well appointed. Third, the front desk staff is efficient, helpful and truly service oriented. Fourth, the hotel includes a spa and a gym...both of very high quality. Fifth, all of the rooms offer expansive views over sprawling Tokyo with no nearby buildings to block/interfere with that view. Sixth, there is a very large and very nice lounge area with great views (including, when clear, a view of Mt. Fuji). Seventh, there are multiple subway lines crisscrossing on the surrounding streets, so there is very good access to many parts of Tokyo without having to deal with traffic. Eighth, there are several museums located within a short walk and the complex is part of a shopping complex with four, or so, floors of food & beverage outlets ranging from pizza to fine dining.The rooms are large, the beds are comfortable, the amenities are first rate as are the finishings. All-in-all, a quality hotel.From my perspective, the location is not ideal....but that may be because I don't really care for shopping malls, the area is a quite a distance from many of the things I come to Tokyo to see and do, and it is a bit of a hassle, and not inexpensive, to travel about above-ground. That said, it is a very good hotel.
