attillathehun
New York City, New York

review_body: A standard room booked which was immense in size not only by Tokyo standards but on an international scale also.Impeccable service from the staff.Great lobby and lobby bar where trying out a local single malt is an experience on its own.

Stayed here last week for 7 nights and I can honestly say it was perfect. Upgraded us to a wonderful suite, thanks to the excellent service from Alex and Thea on the front desk. Food was excellent and lots of choice of western and local, and at breakfast Leon was very helpful.Felt like the staff were genuinely eager to help, suggesting places to go, restaurants, directions, etc.Room was immaculate, turn down service even filled the ice bucket, as well as replenishing the many amenities.Location is ideal - on the red and grey metro lines and taxi’able to most places in the massive city.Would love to go back - it was the holiday of a lifetime.

The lobby is on the 45th floor. From there the only way to go is up. Views to die for. Superb helpful staff. Large comfortable rooms and bathroom. Toto toilet with seat warmer is always a welcomed surprise. Breakfast buffet was lavish. Great restaurants. Lobby bar is vast and stunning. The hotel is attached to the Tokyo Midtown Mall. Great location in Midtown and walking distance to Roppongi Hills or quick cab ride to the Ginza or really anywhere. The concierge sent us to a restaurant that didn’t meet our needs. We thanked the owner and left to find another spot. They called the Ritz to tell the concierge that we were displeased. When we returned to our room, the attached note and candy were waiting for us. Above and beyond the call of duty. A great place. We were there for five nights. I wish I was still there!!!

I recently spent couple of days at the Ritz Tokyo, I must say that from the greeting at checking in and out of the Hotel Manager Mr. Kominami to the amazing room amenities, club lounge, wonderful restaurants with personalized service and creative offering.The Ritz Tokyo stand out of the competition, I will defenetely come back soon and recommend this hotel.

We had the most fabulous trip in Tokyo! We loved the area and felt like we were staying at the top of the world. Upon check in my fiancé and I were upgraded to a gorgeous suite on the 51st floor overlooking the Tokyo Tower. I am gold with Marriott so I think that helped as my stay was a large point redemption. Our jaws were on the floor when we saw the room- they pull out all of the stops for this place. We also had a corner unit which was very special in the bedroom as we had panoramic + views. It was amazing. The bathroom was nice and as always I enjoy a good robe. We were super bummed to find out when we were checking out there were pajamas in the closet drawer for us to use. We never found those, the bike instructions, the aux cable and the postcards until we were leaving and checking drawers for things we could have left. When we were gone one night our room was decorated in rose petals and we were left a plate of decadent handmade chocolates and sparkling waters. We loved our nespresso machine and utilized it many times while we were there. We very much enjoyed the hot tub at the spa level but found the bathing cap rule comical. My biggest and only complaint is there are no plugs to charge your phone anywhere near the bed! We are “millennials” so we typically sleep with our phones next to us. This proved to not be possible. I was also bothered that I had nowhere to plug in my noise machine. Overall a simply fabulous vacation at the Ritz Tokyo. Every time I stay at a Ritz it reiterates to me why they’re my favorite brand in the world. Happy travels!

My wife actually already left a 5 star review based on our last stay, which was fantastic. However, having such experienced appauling service at Ritz Carlton Singapore, it made me realise how exceptional Ritz Carlton Tokyo is. Not just against other group hotels. It's really world class. Please go and experience for yourself if you can. Friendly staff, great restaurant, amazing location, phenomenal club lounge (!!).

I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Ritz Carlton Tokyo with my husband, 6-year old daughter, mother and father. We stayed for 4 nights at the end of October and our experience throughout the stay was first class. From a smooth check-in, to immaculate rooms, we immediately felt very welcome. We had club lounge access during our stay, and the hospitality and attentiveness we experienced from Katori-san and his team was excellent. The selection of food and drink throughout the day was fantastic both in terms of choice and quality. They were especially kind in ensuring my daughter was happy and had enough candy! High quality service is a real rarity nowadays, but our experience with Ritz Carlton Tokyo was personal, comfortable and very enjoyable. As a family we have always regarded Ritz Carlton group highly, but the Tokyo hotel is now very much our firm favourite! We have already booked to stay again in mid-2018 and can’t wait to go back! I would also like offer special thank to Ms Fumie Sugimori at the club lounge , she was very kind to offer a nice pack of candies for my daughter upon check out, so my daughter could enjoy on her way back to HK. And Mr. Kaz, he was offering the warmest hospitality everyday every evening when we were in the club lounge. And the lazy who cooks our eggs in the morning in the club lounge, she is very passionate about her work and I think her eggs is the best I have had in hotel breakfast ! All in all, Ritz Carlton Tokyo is my favourite hotel in Tokyo !

From the moment that we arrive we felt like royalty, every single employee we encounter was outstanding from Bellman team to the ladies in housekeeping. We can't express enough how grateful we are from the moment we arrive the hotel manager Valter Gonshalves took amazing care of us and ensure we had the best vacation ever had... recomendations, tours, tuuuuttto! He is an amazing asset for the hotel and we encourage everyone to meet him and be enlightened by his attitude... thanks a lot. Marc

We were in Tokyo for less than a day transit. Best decision to stay at this property. Also, our second stay at the Ritz in less than a year.This hotel had touches of both contemporary and traditional Japanese design. Our room on the 51st floor provided breathtaking panoramic views of the Tokyo skyline. The room was more than immaculate with oversized bathroom . Quality of stay was superlative.Convenience and accessibility were major factors when we chose to stay here. With Metro lines and Tokyo Midtown mall being adjacent to the hotel ,gave us various dining and shopping options . A major downside for this hotel is no pick up/drop off at the hotel by Haneda Airport Limousine.My only regret is not being able to enjoy the hotel and property amenities/dining to a full extent but that will be an incentive to stay at this hotel during next Tokyo visit.

We had such an amazing time staying at this hotel. The room and view was beautiful.Enjoyed our Bday stay very much.We had lunch at Azure45 which was super super nice!!I strongly recommend to go this restaurant.Thank you for all the staff. Specially many thanks to Yu san :)))I'm looking forward to staying The Ritz-Carlton Tokyo again.Arigatogozaimasu:)

Tokyo is a great city and you can find excellence at all price points in the city. However, if you're looking for what a 5-star experience should be, look no further than the Ritz Carlton Tokyo.Located in the Tokyo Midtown development in Roppongi, the hotel is convenient to the business area of Roppongi/Akasaka. However, the Roppongi metro stop can take you quickly anywhere in the city.Arriving by taxi from Tokyo Station (< 1500 yen), the bell staff quickly retrieved my luggage and escorted me to the elevator that would whisk me to the 45th floor where the lobby is located. He asked my name before pressing the floor button and whispered it into a headset he was wearing.Upon arriving to the floor, a staff member was waiting for me and greeted me by name and escorted me to the check-in counter. A quick check-in process but was told my room would only be ready in a short time. No problem for me, as I was early anyway and retreated to the nearby cafe where free coffee and tea are provided all day. By the time I had my coffee in my hand, the desk staff approached me to tell me that my room was ready (they offered to escort me to the room, but I was a repeat guest and knew the way). Baggage was delivered shortly thereafter.The rooms at the Ritz are HUGE, especially by Tokyo standards. A plush bed, a small sofa, and convenient work station are all present. An extra large (60"?) LCD TV is present as well as a smaller one in the bath.For those that may get chilly in the room, a beautiful cashmere blanket is provided. One of those things you wish you could take home.The bathroom is also enormous. With two, nicely spaced apart vanities, a large bathtub, as well as a spacious stand-up shower. Asprey toiletries are provided. I know of Asprey as a prestigious jeweler and not a cosmetic company but the bath wash and shampoos were very nice.When I returned to the room after venturing out, a selection of pralines from the ground floor Ritz Carlton Deli were sitting on the desk. Delicious and beautiful. Also present was a wonderful handwritten card from the woman who had checked me in. More than just a "thank you for staying", it was more applicable to me specifically and was a very thoughtful touch.I am pretty knowledgable about Tokyo having spent considerable time there over the years but always check in about new and up and coming restaurants. The concierge staff at the RC was very helpful and provided a number of suggestions to me. I also inquired about purchasing the cashmere blanket mentioned earlier. Unfortunately, they do not sell them new although the staffperson did spend some time checking on that for me.I did not dine at the hotel this trip but I can tell you from past experience the cafe is excellent with a wide variety of western and asian selections. The lobby bar also has a wonderful selection of whiskies and even some unique wine selections.Unfortunately, my stay was only for one night and I was off early the following morning. This time, I took the (dreaded) "Friendly Limousine Bus" to Narita. While its nice to avoid needing to go to the train station and drag your luggage through that, the bus is not my favorite since the RC is the first stop it makes before stopping at 4-5 other hotels. You're driving around Roppongi/Akasaka for 45 minutes before you finally get on the expressway. It's not the fault of the hotel but I wish they could get on a different route. Of course a taxi is available but for $300 I avoid it. Haneda Airport is always preferable regardless.All in all, I love the Ritz Carlton Tokyo and look forward to my next visit there.

Thanks Ritz-Carlton Tokyo for making my first trip to Tokyo so wonderful. Before arriving, I received email from Hotel Manager Masato checking whether I need any assistance, to make sure I have a pleasant stay, she and her team really did that.Stay in Modern Japanese Suite for 5 nights, a traditional Japanese home on 47th floor of hustling and bustling city of Tokyo.The room was really well designed and well-miantained. Our room have a great view of Tokyo Tower.Hotel in great area of Ropponggi, with walking distance have nice choices of restaurants. Metro and subway station just step away.Highly recommend this hotel to friends and family. I will definitely come back to Ritz-Carlton for my next visit to Tokyo. Arigato Gozaimasu!

We had such an amazing stay !!! Everything was perfect, the room, the view, the amenities... The Staff made our stay UNFORGETTABLE ! A huge Thank you to Valter, who really charmed us. This why we choose Ritz Carlton !

We had the most amazing stay with my husband in Tokyo ! The hotel is just stunning ! The view of the city is spectacular but the most important is the service that we have received. The staff was always smiling and trying to accommodate us, it was our first time in Tokyo and it is true that we were overwhelmed by this huge city where everything goes so fast... We were lucky to meet Valter (who I believe was from Portugal or Spain) on our first day. He somehow made us directly feel better as he was very warm, he shared with us his love for the Japanese culture and gastronomy but also his passion for hospitality ! We were honestly amazed by every story he was telling us. Without this encounter our stay would have been surely been completely different. In our conversation we mentioned that we will be going to Kyoto, so he prepared for us a nice note with the most beautiful recommendation ! We had such an amazing time that we will never forget ! Thank you for everything... you made our stay !!!!!!

Excellent restaurant an a fantastic welcoming service. Greetings to the staff at the executive lounge specialy to Valter who make my stay easy and enjoyable. I strongly recommend staying on this hotel.

My friend and I had afternoon tea at the lounge on the 45th floor, and I think I will never visit this hotel again, the hotel which I had been very fond of until this day.I had had such lovely experiences here, that I took a dear friend who wanted to try some afternoon tea for the first time.When we arrived, they took 5 minutes to check our reservation. Then, when we were taken to our seats we had to wait another 20 minutes before we were even spoken to.The waiter asked which tea we would like, and when they served it it was a completely different kind. We asked politely to bring us the ones we had ordered, and what happened was unbelievable. They told us repeatedly that we were wrong, and even snickered. But how would anyone mistake the tea that they’d sampled and chosen just a while ago? The tea we had chosen were fruit teas, and we were both very sure that those did not have the scent nor the taste of the fruits we had chosen. We could even tell which other teas they had brought.The service itself was horrible as well. I have never been kept waiting for more drinks or for the bill for so long at a luxury hotel like the Ritz Carlton.As for the afternoon tea set, delicious as always, but the waitress not knowing the dishes well was disappointing.

From the moment I arrived in the hotel everything went smooth and above my expectations! I had an amazing dinner at Azure, the french fine dining restaurant. It was a special celebration, our anniversary and the team made a us memorable surprise! The table was full os roses and a special letter congratulating us. Many thanks to Maxime, Tamura-san and chef Miyazaki. Incredible presentation of all dishes, amazing Tokyo Tower view, excellent quality of food and drinks! I would definitely recommend this restaurant to special celebrations and would love to return.During my stay in Tokyo I was lucky enough to join photo walk with Trey Ratcliff, that was an amazing event held by Ritz Carlton!!!

The hotel itself is luxurious and offers a stunning panoramic view of the city line from its rooms. The service and amenities were one of the best I have experienced. But one thing that stood out was how they assimilate the guests into the hotel very warmly. I had the pleasure of spending my last night in Japan at The Ritz-Carlton and the hotel concierge and staff took the pains to know my plans and planned a very sweet personal note and gift to wish me off on my journey. Needless to say, it was a very memorable send off as well as a reminder of the great hospitality of the Japanese. And if I come back to Japan, I will definitely consider staying at the Ritz as a home away from home.

I have stayed at numerous Ritz Carlton hotel properties. This is one of the very best. The service, ambience and customer service is outstanding. When staying in Tokyo, I will only stay here in the future.

Magnificient views from the room. Incredibly friendly and helpful staff that truly made our stay wonderful. We felt that of all the luxury hotels in Tokyo this was very central and well located. The room was clean with a huge bathroom, toilet room and his/hers sinks and vanities. The breakfast is fantastic with superb service. We took advantage of the gym which at 50+ stories up has exceptional views as well. Given the high price tag of the hotel, we were slightly annoyed that to use any of the spa facilities (steam shower, sauna, etc) it was an additional cost. Personally, I think that should be included in the room rate given that the stay was expensive to begin with. Overall would recommend this hotel for a Tokyo stay in a second!
user_name:
BrookeLess
New York City, New York

review_body: Rooms offer fantastic views of the city. The staff are incredibly helpful and friendly. Being located in the Tokyo Midtown development makes for easy access to restaurants and transportation. Great workout facility, in-room breakfast selection, and lobby.

Our stay at the Ritz Carlton Tokyo was the best vacation we have ever had. From reception, to customer interaction, to the room and food ,everything was 5 stars and above. Highly recommend this hotel to everyone visiting Tokyo.
user_name:
mtronolo
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: Very nice hotel. Good location next to Tokyo Midtown shopping center in Roppongi. Everything in good condition. Room was decent sized. Nice large bathroom with walking shower. Service attentive and helpful. Very nice lobby on the 45th floor, with amazing views of Tokyo. The one disappointment was the pool. "reserved lane" for "members", which I assume is a status that requires extra payment. Need to wear a cap to swim, which is over the top - only hotel in the world I have been to that requires this. And lastly, as a guest you get access to the pool and hot tub, but if you want access to steam room / sauna / plunge pools, they charge Yen 3000 extra - which given the price of the rooms is totally over the top in my opinion. All of this should be included with room rate, given the very high room rates. At least they throw wifi in for free, but the pool/spa thing seems excessive. Other than that, a very nice place overall. Very nice breakfast buffet also.

The service was impecable ,General Mangaer John Rolfs really impress and professional that i seen in all the hotels that i have stayed, as a platinum member i got a room upgrade to. The carlton suit conner room

The Ritz-Carlton Tokyo is a phenomenal hotel! Goodness me, the level of courtesy and the spectacular facilities were a joy to experience.Without question, my stay was enhanced beyond measure by my interactions with Hector (Director of Rooms) in advance. Hector was unbelievably courteous to me in advance of my arrival, and his thoughtfulness in terms of the room that was provided for my partner and I -- in concert with the wonderful personal touches inside my room -- upon arrival were absolutely first-rate. Frankly, I was overwhelmed (in a wonderful way) but the level of hospitality afforded to me. This was even more gratefully received as, for my mother-in-law (staying in a second room) and my partner, this was their first ever trip to Japan, and Hector's extraordinary level of hospitality made their trips to Tokyo spectacularly memorable. Without any question at all, all three of us will make a beeline for the Ritz-Carlton Tokyo on our next trip back to Japan!

I’ve been to the Ritz Carlton many times: it’s in a great location (everything you could need is within 1km) and has the most spectacular view. All the food and beverage outlets are excellent and the rooms are very comfortable. This won’t be my last visit!

We loved it and will be back for sure!Our Japan trip could not have come to a better end than spending it at The Ritz-Carlton Tokyo.Location/View: Wow!Cleanliness: In Japan it is part of the culture to take of shoes when entering a home. We love the fact that you have to take of your shoes at the entrance of your Japanese Suite/home. This definitely underlines the high level of cleanliness we found. The shoe thing does not apply to the regular rooms.Comfort: The bed literally makes you feel that you are on cloud nr. 9. Room as well as bathroom were very spacious.Staff: It was not only our „Japanese Suite“ that - even though being in busy Tokyo - made us feel at ease. Moreover, it was the attentive staff that anticipated our needs and made our experience so memorable.Suggestion: Book a room with Club Access. The relaxing atmosphere is the perfect place to start your day. The knowledgeable Club Concierge gave great suggestions so that we were able to make the best out of the short time we had in Tokyo. Don‘t miss having a drink and chat with the Club Staff (don’t remember all their names)falling asleep in heaven.

I love this hotel. It's in midtown and super convenient, on top of a mall and near quite a few restaurants. Wonderful amenities and facilities and of course awesome service - What wonderful friendly staff who really take service to the next level! I think I was upgraded because I got some corner room with a beautiful view of Tokyo (esp at night). Oh and even the room service was delish, but maybe it's because everything in Tokyo is delicious? The only annoying thing is that you have to take the elevator to go up to the lobby, then elevator to go to your room.

Excellent facilities, very warm and helpful staff in the club lounge, Excellent food selections in the lounge. Great location.Perfect vacation spot in Tokyo! Magnificent views. Rooms very well appointed and clean.Close to train station .

We had an incredible visit at The Ritz Carlton Tokyo. The service was exceptional. Great restaurants, extremely attentive staff at concierge desk, welcoming team, from desk, restaurant teams and especially the Afternoon Tea event. A special note that the lobby musicians were phenomenal, day and night. Close proximity to the Mall was also very convenient. The room and care of the spacious space and well appointed room was great. Thanks with commendations to Alex and the Ritz Carlton Tokyo team.

Being a seasoned traveller for work (50+ nights a year) I've seen my fair share of hotels, and level of service... So I thought I had seen it all when booking the Ritz Carlton..I was wrong.Booked the Ritz Carlton on points to celebrate my engagement and it was probably the best decision I could have taken.. Yes, I know the Ritz is on another level of service (that's what you're paying for), but what I experienced blew us away. From the moment we arrived everyone at the hotel made us feel special and they went above and beyond to help us celebrate our engagement. Truly an fabulous experience. A massive thank you to everyone at the hotel - it was nothing short of amazing. Looking forward to our next stay!

The service is impeccable, the location is central, and the rooms are large. No complaints, you get what you pay for. However, I wouldn't recommend more than drinks in the dining area. We ordered 2 soups, a tea, and a Perrier and it ended up being $70 US which I felt was a bit high.

My partner had some business to do here in Japan, so we made a mini vacation out of it. We started in Tokyo and stayed at the Ritz. Our room was on the 49th floor and the hotel part of this skyscraper starts on floor 45. As you can imagine, any view from this altitude is spectacular. Ours, not lacking in the slightest. Both breathtaking and gorgeous. The room had a king bed and a huge bathroom, well appointed with his and his sinks, plus a bath and wc. And, if you are unfamiliar with Japanese toilets, this is a good place to learn how to use them. Find a video on YouTube to find out what I mean. You'll never use paper again. We ate breakfast everyday at the banquet. Excellent choices of both western and Japanese style eating. I had the poached egg every day because it was awesome. They use a leak purée as well as a salmon soft cheese. Omg, delicious! The service, superb and the food high quality (as with almost any restaurant here - it's clear to me now that the Japanese place value on freshness and flavor). The spa is located on the 46th floor and it includes a lap pool, which for me was perfect. Swimming helps me to adjust to jet lag like nothing else. Plus, it's not a place where kids run amok in the swimming area. Like everything in Japan, politeness is the main theme. No screaming kids, you can count on it. If you forgot your swim suit, no worries, you can rent one. One requirement is a swim cap which they also provide fee of charge. Both my partner and I booked a half hour stretch which neither of us regretted and the spa offers the full suite of massage and other treatments that you would expect. The body worker who did the stretching was an expert and knew exactly when not to stretch any further. He was both intuitive and attentive to how you responded. This, also another jet lag cure. Do it instead of a massage and you just might feel the same. Later, we even received a hand written note from Chihiro, a wonderful spa staff person who spoke fluent English and who had also lived in the US, where she welcomed us personally to the hotel and explained that she was available if we had any questions. A very sweet personal touch and I appreciated the extra effort. Don't we all?The front door staff were also professional and we were greeted everyday by Kato, a Japanese American from the islands of Hawaii. Maui, I believe, and he was incredibly helpful with tour suggestions and places to eat. You will be lucky to have him around during your stay. If I had to say anything about our trip to Japan, it's the people, if you haven't noticed yet. The culture demands that you respect one another, which is refreshing to put it mildly. And it's not just the hotel staff I'm talking about. Put on your most polite face, allow others to go through the elevator door before you, offer your seat to an old woman on the subway, and generally act as if you honor the Japanese culture, and you will have arrived. Even in the bustling train stations or at the airport, notice how everyone is coordinating their steps in order to give you passageway; anticipating how they will negotiate your presence. It's a ballet of sorts and remarkable, especially when you find yourself amidst the crowds, and it's also a metaphor for the rest of your interactions. And although one of our new friends here said that, generally speaking, the Japanese are a shy people and hard to get to know, if you step outside of your comfort zone, look people warmly in the eyes and sincerely greet them; a bow from the hips, a kind word, then you too can make a few new friends here as I did. I totally love Japan now, I hope you do too.

Beautiful hotel, fantastic location, amazing views, excellent bathroom. The hotel's location int he development named Tokyo Midtown is fantastic. There is a high end grocery store connected which is a great for a gourmet snack, among the many other higher end eateries and shopping within the development. It's an easy 5 minute walk to Roppongi Hills shopping, dining, and entertainment complex, in addition to be well situated to all of the other dining and drinking establishments that Roppongi has to offer. It's well connected to multiple public transit stops to include underground walkways to the subway. The views from the room were incredible looking out over Shinjuku, especially at night. The bed was luxurious, as was the bathroom with separate tub and glass shower and dual sinks. The staff at check-in were courteous and helpful, however they first said my room wasn't yet ready, and I simply asked if there was any other room available, and after a minute of looking we were given a ready room. I do think that I shouldn't have to ask, and it should be standard practice to double check for an available room before telling a guest they'll need to wait, however thankfully I asked and one was offered. Overall and excellent stay and would not hesitate to return to the hotel again on my next trip to Tokyo.

This is the place to stay in Tokyo! The hotel is in a great location, easy access to the subway and is within walking distance to wonderful restaurants. The rooms are spacious, beautifully decorated and have amazing views. The staff is extremely friendly and very helpful especially Alex and Masako...they made our stay even more enjoyable. Looking forward to our annual return trip!

One of the best hotel I have ever stayed. Staff in all departments are very attentive, shows attention and are focused in all details. We really enjoyed our stay with access to Club lounge offering panoramatic amazing view, gorgeous attitude of employees and delicious refreshment whole day.

The Ritz Carlton Tokyo is a real luxury in Ronpongi area. The staff are nice. The rooms are very clean. The hotel is well maintained and organised by numerous staff around the reception to attend to all guests needs.The checkin was very pleasant with a Japanese lady. The welcome was very warm which made us feel like returning home, although its our first time at this property.The room allocated to us had an amazing view to Tokyo tower, at night the view was magnificent. And during the day was breathtaking view of Tokyo. The concierge was very helpful and pleasant especially Mariko and Iwara, assisted us with all recommendations.The breakfast is excellent, except they ran out of some foods around 9.30am. We asked the supervisor Leo who rudely said we ran out and nothing could be done. This is not the Ritz Carlton attitude as he shrugged his shoulders and walked away carelessly. We did not want to ruin our stay so we ignored him. We love the Ritz Carlton Tokyo and their warm hospitality that shows good management running this property. Surely we will return.

Ritz Carlton Tokyo Executive Lounge Are they kidding?The Ritz Carlton Tokyo is a beautiful property, high up in the skies of Tokyo with wonderful views.The Executive Club Lounge is on the top floor 53. You can only have access if your room key is activated for it. Presumably exclusive, it is decorated nicely, like a living room lounge. They say they have 5 servings per day. For an additional guest there is a charge of Y-6500 or approximately USD 65 per serving for each guest. Thought that was unusual but I suppose it is to discourage all day business meetings.On the room rates, it is approximately USD200 more to have club access daily.So far so good, its pretty exclusive. I thought I would get spoiled there. OMG what a disappointment !!! I travel frequently and I could say a few things about executive lounges, but this one truly blew me away on the utterly poor offerings and moreso the poorest quality of them.They highly recommended their afternoon tea. I tried it. Before the plate came I took some champagne, a tradition for afternoon tea. It was Ritz Carlton brand, was quite sweet, despite the label showing Brut. That was the only one they had.When the tray tower came I gasped. I tried tasting a bit of each. Extremely disappointed in the quality the small sandwich of ham was not nice. fThe scones were quite small, size of silver dollar, not really scones on the dough either. In the shops I have found that Japanese companies will take an item from Europe, bring it back home and make a better, super version. But in the Ritz Carlton, sadly I found the opposite in their afternoon tea. Just terrible.A day later I stopped by for a bite at dinner time. I tried the sake, again this was sweet. I had one small glass did not like it. I wanted a different kind but they only have one kind. Despite there being several people serving around the lounge they did not come by.  I tried some canapés. There is a young girl serving udon noodles. I was able to request various spices for her to cook me a bowl. Meat was not an option, only spices. That did not go well, she brought the bowl of noodles just cooked and it was lukewarm. Ok never mind that, order another, this time requesting the soup and noodles to be hot. In fact I found most of the food cold. Ugh, really that wasn't nice. How can this be the Ritz Carlton.I took some of the vegetables and they were completely cold as were a few dim sum buns. How could everything be cold, this was supposed to the hot food area, as another small room had salad and salami cold meats.In the hot area, there were two large pots. One filled with mashed potatoes and a meat gravy, the other pot was boiling and full of brown curry and did not smell appetizing. They were hot, I could only try the mash potatoes. Two nites later I found exactly the same foods. Again, I had to ask is this the Ritz Carlton Tokyo ? OMG, how could they let this happen and sink to such low levels?
user_name:
Susan B
New York City, New York

review_body: My company's CEO and 12 top executives stayed and met at the Ritz Carlton Tokyo last week. I chose this venue for our stay in Tokyo as I have stayed here many times before and consistently received top quality service. The team at the Ritz not only did not disappoint us, but also blew us away with incredible attention to detail and outstanding execution. Everything from having a staff at each floor to guide us at check in, flawless meeting support, allowing us to park 13 MARIO carts in front of the hotel, to a nice card with Sushi key holder at check out... it all worked without a glitch to a team that stays at the best venues around the work. Special thanks to Hector, Director of Rooms, and Katori-San, Director of Club Lounge.

THe room was fantastic, a beautiful corner suite with amazing views of the city.The hotel and lobby are spectacular, and the Ritz is located in Roppongi which is close to the Imperial Gardens and Ueno Park. I would highly recommend this hotel for a business or family trip.

Visited Ritz-Carlton Tokyo for high tea at the Lobby Lounge. It's nice and sandwiches and sweets were very good quality. Service was attentive and atmosphere was great. It's a part of Tokyo Midtown in Roppongi, which is the area catering towards English speakers. Be sure to check out other shops and restaurants in the area also.

A very standard expensive hotel. Service is fantastic, the room is box standard. Positives:- excellent service- large room- nice bathroom- large wardrobe in the room- view- cocktails in the lobby bar- right by the metro station- very quietNegatives:- it's dark in the room: mood lifting doesn't really cut it- no electric plugs by the bed- very expensive breakfast with very limited Asian food choice. No point of going to Tokyo and eating eggs Benedict!- hairdryer is not for women - one cannot style hair with it- mirrors in the bathroom - typical hotel lighting when one cannot see oneself. Cannot apply makeup. - no railway station close by (being picky here)

Great location. Clean and hygiene rooms. Full amenities and comfortable bed. Excellent service and fast check in. Helpful staff. Nice views. Quiet atmosphere in the room. Fast and reliable free internet connection. Good dining and shopping within the hotel premises.

My go to hotel in Tokyo. Centrally located. Easy access via limo bus from Narita. Stunning views. Excellent restaurants. Attentive and welcoming service. Well managed and maintained. I've stayed here several times and every visit has been flawless. Special kudos to the staff at the executive lounge who make my stay special. If possible, I strongly recommend staying on the executive floor. Amenities aside (and there are many), the level of personal attention alone makes it well worthwhile. The Tokyo Ritz may be my favorite hotel in Asia.

I recently visited Tokyo celebrating my birthday. I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton Tokyo which was truly one of the highlights of my trip. The accommodations were outstanding as was the service. The guest services staff is warm and friendly and treated me like nobility. If I should ever return to Tokyo there's no doubt that I'll return to the Ritz-Carlton.

My wife and I have travelled the world extensively and stayed at many luxury hotels including the Ritz Carlton in May different countries.Although, the Ritz always rates amazingly well, I don’t know how, but the Ritz Carlton Tokyo, blew our mind away.The service was absolutely perfect, the people were amazing and it was the first time my wife and I left a hotel in tears due to the genuine love we felt by the staff all the way.Yes it is expensive, but if you want to know how royalty is treated, you have to stay at the Ritz Carlton Tokyo.Best experience ever.

My fiance and I stayed at RC Tokyo for 1 quick night on a stopover. It is in a great location at Roppongi, and the subway is within the mall.What separates this property is the level of service they deliver. We were immediately greeted on the front drive and escorted up the check in, which is on the 45th floor. There, the Guest Relations Manager Alexander introduced himself and immediately knew exactly who we were. He provided an escort to our room upon arrival, and walked us out on our departure. True first class service, and he anticipated our needs flawlessly. Our room was plush and had a wonderful welcome amenity noting our special occasion. The room was well appointed and the bathroom may have been the nicest of all RC's we have stayed at.We had breakfast the next morning which was very nice, albeit a bit on the busier side. Still, the staff there was tremendous and worked extremely efficiently. Because of the staff, and specifically Alexander, we will stay only at RC Tokyo upon future visits

Here with my wife on the start of a pleasure trip through Japan and Hong Kong. Couldn't think of a better place to arrive after a 20+ hour travel day from the US. Typically warm and efficient Ritz welcome and intake. No standing at an agent counter to check in at this hotel. kimono clad lovely young lady accompanied us directly to our suite to handle any check-in requirements. Beautiful property with soaring ceilings in the lobby and astounding views of the city (tallest building in the city). You can almost always depend on Ritz to perform and this property held up that reputation for us.

Joined my husband, who was traveling for business & we stayed here. Beautiful hotel close to the Roppongi Station & The Midtown Tower shopping mall-linked to hotel via a tunnel. We stayed on the club level floor, which had access to the complimentary lounge. Also on this level was the very helpful concierge desk. Since I was alone, I got great advice & help in booking tours from Minori Fukushima there! The room overlooked the city & Mt Fuji in the distance. Beds comfy-happy to have an electric kettle & tea in the room each morning. Everyone there was so friendly & sooooo polite. True about the country in general! Arrigato gozymas!

Well if you've read my reviews before you know I'm a big fan of the AMEX Platinum Upgrade benefit and this hotel provided yet another reason why you should use this as well. Upgraded room with breakfast included. This Ritz in Tokyo has over the top service, beautifully appointed suites and great food and drink selections. Beautiful view and a really pleasant stay. Can't say enough good things about the Ritz Carlton Tokyo.

When I stepped foot into the main lobby of the Tokyo Ritz Carlton, I can't help telling myself that I have chosen the right hotel to stay with my family for our present visit to Tokyo. The warm and classy atmosphere, augmented by the courteous and helpful staff, certainly impressed on me what a nice luxurious hotel it is. Surely look forward to coming back again when I next visit Tokyo.

My recent stay at the Ritz-Carlton has been a most enjoyable one. The suite that I stayed in was spacious and comfortable, with a spectacular view of Tokyo city. The staff at RC Tokyo uphold the professional and hospitable level that one would expect from an RC hotel. My friends and I had a great time indeed.

I arrived at 8AM off a red eye, half dead, and was expecting to be allowed to use the gym to shower and not get a room for a while.Instead, I was warmly welcomed and given a temporary room (slightly different class than I had ordered) and told to sleep as long as I wished and when I came back to reception they would give me my proper room.I have never had this anywhere. The staff where great for the whole 3 night stay. The hotel is clean and beautiful. The pool is 20 meters and has nearby Jacuzzi. Great views of TokyoThe fitness room has a lot of machines and cardio and is not crowded.Staff in pool / fitness are very helpful and attentive.I am not staying anywhere else in the future. This is now my Tokyo home :)Note: To use a sauna / steam room you need to pay for entry to the spa (open only till 10PM) and this costs around $70. I do not expect this from the RC because all other 5 star hotels where I have stayed for the last year give you access to the sauna / steam room for free.

This stay was a real treat, the rooms and hotel, are as you'd expect in this class of hotel, but the real extra factor was the service, our butler Yoshi was spectacular, totally ahead of the game, and taking care of every need before we even knew what we wanted. Sublime. The club lounge on the club floor was an absolute godsend, the food and views were exquisite. AMAZING

What's left to say about the Ritz? It's so very nice and the staff is incredibly attentive. It's on a high floor of a popular shopping center, so you'll have outstanding views of Tokyo. Take advantage of the pool and hot tub, as well as drinks or tea in the lounge. Would stay here again, for sure.
