Randy B
New York City, New York

review_body: Tokyo is an amazing place to visit. You get a sensory overload. The Ritz is a calming required retreat. Attention to detail is incredible. This makes the stay memorable. The staff can't do enough. The blend of modern with traditional works well. Worth the high price.

Having stayed in similar properties in Tokyo, I would rank this one as disappointing. I found the hotel overwhelmed with guests and poor service. Getting through check in through seeking help from the concierge staff was all met with varying levels of disappointment. Additionally, the hotel had an overwhelming, heavy, perfumed smell in the halls that literally made my head spin. The room, while nice felt outdated. The most negative aspect of this stay was the perfumed smell which was so strong it actually stayed in my clothing. I have allergies and this is not good for someone with allergies or asthma.
user_name:
running4ny
New York City, New York

review_body: This is a very nice hotel. The staff are super friendly. The rooms are very clean and the views are extraordinary. It is a very quiet hotel as well, i am not sure we heard anything the whole time from any other rooms. The location is ok - not where its all happening - but, there is a train station in the lower level mall level so its easy to get anywhere. I think the clientele were a tad fancier than we were so while it is super chic, maybe just wasn't a fit for us. overall a very nice hotel.

My wife and I had a fantastic stay at the end of a 5-night trip to Tokyo for our first wedding anniversary, staying on points for one night.I had booked a spa treatment for my wife and I prior to arriving at the hotel and, as part of that correspondence, let them know about our anniversary celebration.From the moment that we pulled up at the hotel, we felt like VIPs. The highlights included:- Being greeted by Alexander at the front door, who immediately wished us a happy anniversary and mentioned that our spa appointment had been confirmed for an hour after our arrival. It was incredible that he knew all of this just as we pulled up.- We were upgraded to a room with a stunning view of Tokyo Tower. The hotel had set up a special surprise in our room to honour our anniversary, leaving us chocolates, and making up the bed with rose petals.- The spa was excellent. Treatments were very high quality, and they also acknowledged our anniversary during the treatments.- The fitness center was extremely well equipped.- We were greeted by name during all interactions with staff at the hotel, and the overall service was exemplary.This was probably the best hotel experience we have ever had, and it sets the standard that all other hotels should aspire to.

Stayed a second time with my wife in this property.I am a RC Gold member with about 200 nights per anno but I must once again say that I rarely/ never have seen a hotel where the staff is so friendly and going the extra mile without any exception.The hotel itself is very well maintained and offers great views. The spa is top notch and I could access it for free a RC Gold.In my humble opinion this is the top end re/ what you can get from a chain hotel. If you can treat yourself with a stay there, don't hesitate. Only a few independent hotels -might - provide you a better service (and we talk about the ones in Beverly Hills or so). Best RC and top five in the Marriott Group - excellent.

Stayed here in July. Everyone writes such great things about the Ritz and so I expected to be WoWed. We had just come from the RC Kyoto and that experience was so different. For a Ritz I expected our room to be spotless just as it was in Kyoto. The carpet was worn in the room. The bathroom doors were dusty. I always do my own wipe down and if there's dirt on my wipes then the place isnt spotless. The customer service at the RC is exceptional but so is the customer service in most japan hotels. The bed was comfortable. The shower had good water pressure and plenty of hot water.Everything in Tokyo is expensive so be prepared to pay a lot. Breakfast was good but pricey. They have pretty much everything.There is a mall adjacent to the hotel. You'll find quite a few places to eat at the mall. The best place for us was a pizza joint a half block away. I think it was called Frederico Pizza. The prices were great. the pizza was amazing. If you go down to valet and make a right as you leave the hotel. go up that street and pass the light. It will be on the right just passed the stop light. There's also an amazing Mojito bar across from the hotel. Called Mint Mojito. They serve every kind of mojito flavor you can think of. Same direction as the pizza place but make a right at the light and it will be on the left side.The post office was closed the day we left. The Concierge ladies were so generous to mail the postcard for me. I paid the postage to them and off it went. If I ever go back to Tokyo I think I will stay elsewhere. Not because the service was bad but because we are gold elite members and we would get a lot more from other hotels. It always nice to get upgrades and breakfast included when your hotel membership is recognized.

I traveled Tokyo for 4 nights, and spent the last night, Aug 3rd of 2017 at the hotel. I usually don't go to hotels when traveling alone, but as my brother was working as an intern here, I thought why not spend one night with my brother?When I arrived at the hotel for check-in, I was greeted with an unexpected welcome. They already acknowledged me as a brother of the intern, and provided me of utmost services as if I were VIP. I was very surprised, because I was only a brother of an intern, not even an official staff. From the experience, I have learned that the hotel provides a great shelter along with services to not only customers but staffs including interns. Generally speaking many companies treat interns as expendables. Even though I've only been there for less than 24 hours, I could already feel and see the warmth of family-like atmosphere among staffs. The greater working environments developed, the greater services provided to the customers.

it is a bit tricky to find the reception area, checking in was quite smooth, the front desk agent was nice and showed me the room, it was non-smoking, but I smell the cigarettes so she changed me to a room on 52nd floor. I booked my trip via Amex travel, there supposed to be breakfast buffet included, but it was not on my reservation, Amex travel has missed it on my reservation. However, the front desk agent was very nice and offered me the free breakfast due to my Marriott status.throughout the stay, staffs are very nice and attentive. I love the location and everything it has. overall it is a great hotel with good service. I will definitely stay here again.

If you are looking for a place to stay while in Tokyo, there really is no need to look any further. Spectacular views of the city from my room, only bested by the views from the Executive Club and the lounge. Service was impeccable. Looking forward to my next trip.

This hotel is so stunning in every way. The employees are friendly and helpful. The views are amazing. We enjoyed the breakfast room service a few days, which was delicious. I would love to go back here in the future and highly recommend it to others looking for a luxurious stay.

I loved my stay at the Ritz Tokyo!great and friendly service, and super comfy beds :DMy room had an amazing view of the city too. The breakfast has a good selection and it tastes very good.Will definitely be staying there again.

We recently stayed at the hotel for a 5 nights. I wish we could have stayed all two weeks of our vacation. Literally, from the moment we got out of the taxi the staff and property were nothing but perfection. The minute you walk in you may notice this very light and lovely scent throughout the hotel. It just sets this feeling of extreme relaxation. Check in was so easy, our room was beautiful, all the facilities- pool, gym, spa, were amazing and so well appointed.All the staff that we had contact with were an absolute dream. Polite, helpful, warm. We had a club level room which included access to the club on 53rd floor (I think) for breakfast, lunch,afternoon tea, evening cocktails, and late night desserts--- and everyone who worked in the club- the servers, chefs, and hosts were flawless. The food was always amazing. Drinks and cocktails fabulous.The location of the hotel couldn't be better- linked by an underground mall to the Roppongi station-- from there you can get anywhere. So many wonderful itzakayas in Roppongi. Mid-town was having a wonderful summer in mid-town- with outdoor bars, light shows, and shallow dipping stream for kids and adults. It was almost like this small town feeling in the middle of this crazy bustling city. The Japanese do really know the balance of peace and nature versus movement and modernity.I would come back to Ritz Carlton again and again and again. It was the perfect start to our wonderful vacation.

Wonderful place to stay the staff and the facilities were great, i would recommend it to any of my friends for sure. I will be back, soon i hope. Location is great, theres a sub way station in the basement which was very helpful in getting around the city.

I went with my family to Japan in the summer of 2017 . We stayed at the Ritz Carlton in Tokyo because one year before we were there celebrating our 25 th anniversary and our guide took us to midtown and I loved the area and the entrance to the hotel was filled with cherry blossom trees! That is how we decided to stay at the ritz Carlton... and everything from the minute we arrived until the minute we left was incredible! The location, decor and attentive personnel was extraordinary, we definitely recommend this property for your next stay in Tokyo!

My families and I stayed in the tower rooms for three nights. The night view of Tokyo and the tower is spectacular. The rooms are clean and staffs are very friendly and helpful. So close to metro is definitely another big plus.

1) Exceptional and thoughtful service2) Excellent breakfast buffet with a view of the Tokyo Tower3) Above and beyond care - they ordered a Japanese ice skater's poster and book, as a surprise for us before we left. We were looking for that particular book the whole week of our stay. 4) Beautiful location, with great views of the Tokyo .

RC Tokyo is perfectly located in the MidTown complex which houses a vast collection of fabulous restaurants, shops, the Suntory Museum of Art, a large, peaceful park and multiple services. Roppongi Subway is a 2 minute walk away as are many bars, additional restaurants and museums. Tokyo Tower is a 10 minute walk. The Club Lounge located on the 53rd floor is spacious and elegantly comfortable offering fabulous views over Tokyo, including Mt Fuji. However it was the professional, thoughtful and friendly service in the lounge that was the highlight of our 7 night stay. The Club Lounge team were absolutely amazing, attending to every whim and desire as well as our practical needs. The Club Lounge offers 5 well stocked and presented Food and Beverage sittings from 7am until 10pm. It became our sanctuary when needing time out from our busy schedule. The Deluxe Club Rooms are generous in size, have fabulous views and are well appointed with every amenity and comfort you expect from a Ritz Carlton hotel. The team on the ground floor were always welcoming, courteous and helpful - we felt at home. The RC Tokyo is located in Roppongi close to all the Foreign Embassies and only 30 minutes from Haneda International Airport.

I echo the overwhelming amount of amazing reviews for this hotel and it's staff. It's certainly well deserved. The whole experience - from the staff, accommodations, dining, and music are top notch. How the Ritz Tokyo truly differentiated itself lies with its people and their genuine hospitality that far exceeds expectations. For instance, as this was a few day business trip with colleagues (our first time to Tokyo from the US), we wanted to explore the area during our limited free time. While on-site, I responded to the General Manager (John) welcome email inquiring about whether we should tour the Fish Market. John promptly connected me with his Purchasing Manager (Kenji) who graciously offered a personal tour at 6am the following morning to accommodate our work timing commitments. Upon meeting him in the lobby, it was to our surprise he was accompanied by the Hotel Manager (Masato) and Purchasing Clerk (Kazuki) who all led us on an unforgettable tour of the market, including navigating the subway system and finding the perfect place to enjoy a sushi lunch.To make matters even more memorable (and in the spirit of continuing to surpass our expectations), after my colleagues and I returned to our hotel rooms after work, we were each greeted with a framed group picture of the seven of us taken at the market. A sincere "Arigatou" to John, Masato, Kenji, and Kazuki who left an indelible impression for our time here in Tokyo.

Room and Service are second to none. Arrived in Tokyo for one night to head on to Malaysia. Had an amazing dinner at the Sushi restaurant (one of the best ever). Ritz was so good, I am adding a night in Tokyo on my way back to the US.

I traveled to Japan for a business trip and brought my wife and daughter for a few days of relaxation in Tokyo at the Ritz before my meeting. The three days at the Ritz were the highlight of our trip. The staff in the Club Lounge were exceptional. They made us feel welcome and provided service beyond our expectations.

This hotel's service and attention to detail is unparalleled. I thought the Prince Gallery Hotel on the other end of Akasaka was the nicest urban hotel in which I had stayed...until I spent three nights at this Ritz Carlton.

The staff made it so personal, beyond expectation. Great property, fantastic people, amazing experience! Having the Ritz as a base to come home to in the city's frenzy was a gift, could not have dreamt of a better choice!

We have stayed at many Ritz-Carlton hotels in the past and this was especially exceptional. The service of every staff member at every level was unparalleled and will most certainty return when visiting Tokyo in the future.

We stayed at the Ritz-Carlton Kyoto prior to staying at this Ritz so we had a good basis to judge this one. For RC Tokyo, I had a few emails from the guest relations prior to arriving so inquired about getting an upgraded room since I was a Gold Elite member. I felt I didn't get any upgrades at Kyoto so I wanted to see what I could get here. When I checked in, the lady from guest relations did meet us and told us we had an upgrade to a tower room. This meant a standard room that was facing the Tokyo tower. Our room was on 48th floor and view was good so I was pleased. It looks like they typically charge more for that so I guess it was an upgrade. We used points for our 4 night stay. One thing that bothers me with Ritz-Carlton compared to staying at a standard Marriott is that a Gold Elite typically has a club level room and access to the club lounge. Not here. The charge is $200 (22,000¥) more per night for club lounge access. That's crazy. So we did not get the lounge access. As everyone commenting has written, the service is excellent otherwise. The lady who showed us to our room let me know that if we wanted to use the pool, which I did, no tattoos could be visible! That is crazy! I have some on my arms, shoulder and leg so I would have to wear a full body suit to swim in the pool. Now days, tattoos are not forbidden in the world except apparently here. I am a CEO of my own company and travel extensively around the globe and this is the first time I was blocked from swimming. Crazy. So after I got over that, I looked over the room. It was decent size and the view from the oversized windows was great. It was just as nice at night time. The lobby on the 45th floor is very large with a few restaurants. It can get very smoky at night when you walk through. We ate breakfast the first morning. It is a breakfast buffet with made to order eggs brought to you table. It will cost you $90 for two. Very steep price but it is the Ritz. There are many more choices for meals in the Mid Town mall that is connected on the first floor or just within a few blocks (Mercer Buffet was good). The other nice thing about this location is the adjacent park that has things going on during the summer. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary so they did bring in balloons and chocolate that evening. Overall we had a good stay. Bed was good and shades were dark enough that we could sleep in. Shower was good also. So if you don't have tattoos and want to splurge for a great view of the city, then Ritz Carlton Tokyo is a good stay. (To Travel Is To Live)

it was a very good stay in toko and kyoto...nespecially mr;atsuya hayashi st the door.in tokyo and also miss;evonne wang in kyoto...they are really make the hotel different than other...your team have done a very good jobs...thanks

This hotel is beautiful inside and out. The location is excellent, actually the hotel is in a shopping mall. The Club staff pampered us on every oportunity. Will be back for shure. The viwe from our room was breathtaking.

Great service. Great restaurant. Great views. Typical Ritz Carlton style which is to say amazing.Probably not the most kid-appropriate hotel, but probably expected considering the typical clientele. Would stay here in a heartbeat again if was just two of us.

Becoming one of my favourite hotels in the world Close to the metro station Great restaurants in the hotel and nearby as it is located at the heart of Roppongi. Beautiful park in front of the hotel A convenient 6km and 2km jogging rout available Importantly, the staff were extremely helpful and made the hotel experience extremely exclusive. Love it

While it is a beautiful hotel in an excellent location, what sets this hotel apart from others is the phenomenal service and personal touch provided by the staff at the Ritz. They exceeded all my expectations at every level. I can't wait to go back.
user_name:
CAK1212
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I have been fortunate enough to spend time in some of the best hotels in the world and the Tokyo Ritz Carlton deserves a high spot on that list. This is an exceptional property located from the 45th floor up in Tokyo's tallest building. Spectacular views and exceptional service, even by Ritz Carlton's laudable high standards. The restaurants, bar and common spaces are wonderful. If your budget permits it, I highly recommend the suites. Truly fantastic!

Wonderful stay - extremely friendly staff with no exceptions, beautiful view of the city from 48th floor. Luxurious room, large enough to entertain visiting family members. Walking distance to Roppongi action.

Just perfect customer care and amazed hotel! Which comes with special event after just one comment at room in check in service and front water serving was amazing at all so definitely recommend this Ritz-Carlton

The club level at the Ritz was amazing. Open from 7am-10pm. The ambiance, food and staff made everyday feel special. The pool on the 43rd floor had an awesome view of town and soaking in the jacuzzi after a hot long day of walking really added to the trip. Also, the club staff was super intelligent and attentive.

The hotel is gorgeous and provides wonderful views of Tokyo! However to upgrade to the club is a few hundred dollars and it has yet to be desired. My husband is a Ritz Rewards Gold Member and in the past has all his dietary restrictions accommodated at the club. This trip however- It was a take it or leave it service. The food was also the same each meal and did not provide a lot of variety. If you get upgrades for free or use your certificate it's worth it! otherwise- save your money. It was an anniversary trip for us and we had high expectations, but were very disappointed with the food in the club and the service of the club staff.
user_name:
SRK123451
New York City, New York

review_body: We didn't have accommodations for one night so I went onto Marriott rewards to check out hotels in the area. I ultimately decided on the Ritz Carlton due to location (we wanted to go to the hedgehog cafe in roppongi). The lobby is on the 45th floor in Tokyo midtown right above roppongi metro station - very impressive lobby with cascading water, live music and friendly staff. We stayed at the club level and had access to the club lounge, which serves complimentary food and drinks to club members at basically any time of the day (food varies during time of day and is all delicious). They had a harpist there playing when we checked in. I usually get a lot of flak at hotels due to my age but the staff were so incredibly polite and nice. I really can't stress that enough. Hikari-san from communications actually wrote me a handwritten card with my pressed clothing in case she didn't catch me in the room when she dropped it off! It was a yukata I had bought in Kamakura and I was struggling with the obi; I called the front desk and they immediately sent up Yui-san (in the photo) to help me put it on. She was so nice and helpful - the bow was beautiful. They really care about their guests. All the Ritz Carlton hotels are wonderful with helpful staff but I think this one has been the best I've ever stayed at of any RC or spg/marriott rewards hotel!Unfortunately we only could stay for the night as we were leaving Tokyo the next day - next time I'll be sure to book the Ritz Carlton Tokyo for our whole stay!
user_name:
spacesmuggler
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My wife and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at this property. Overall, I would recommend this hotel, but with two caveats.I cannot commend the service provided by the RC staff highly enough. Every single staff member that we interacted with was warm, friendly and efficient. We felt that every staff member was also very focused on our needs as guests, rather than simply "doing a job".We were also very satisfied with the quality of the restaurants we tried and the pool and fitness centre. The location and the nearby mall (Midtown) are very convenient. For travellers who want to grab a quick breakfast near the hotel but not in the hotel itself, the Midtown mall offers many options.My two caveats are as follows:1. I was satisfied with the room that we were given (my wife was less impressed, it must be said!) but I was very disappointed to find that the room did not have the amenities and conveniences that you find in newer luxury hotels in Asia - in particular, there were no bed-side power outlets or USB ports for plugging in phones or other devices. I understand the Ritz Carlton Tokyo is 10 years old now and therefore the rooms were designed at a time before virtually every traveller carries at least one phone or other device that needs to be charged, so I understand why this is. I should also point out that there were a number of power outlets at the desk in the room, so you will not be searching for places to charge your devices. Hopefully this can be addressed next time the rooms are refurbished.2. The hotel has multiple entrances, for convenience, however only the main entrance is open after 10pm. For travellers who arrive at the hotel by taxi, this is fine. However, my wife and I travelled by train most days, and faced a slightly longer walk from the train station to the front entrance as we generally were out until at least 10.30pm each night. I would like to see the policy changed so that the other entrances remain open until at least 11pm each night.Overall, I did enjoy my stay and if it was possible to give a 4.5 out of 5 rating, I would do so. These blemishes prevent me from giving a perfect 5 out of 5 rating, but if neither of these complaints is relevant to you, I think you will greatly enjoy staying here.

We very much enjoyed our visit to Tokyo and a big factor was coming "home" to the RC after busy days sightseeing and shopping. Excellent location in Tokyo Midtown, with many shops and eateries just downstairs, and direct tie-in to the Roppongi station and nearby Roppongi Hills shopping area. The club level was exceptional, and we felt at home with warm hospitality and smiles, greeted by name by the wonderful club lounge staff. Mr. Katori and the excellent staff took care of us, and made careful attention to the food allergies of our daughters. The 53rd floor rooms and club lounge at the RC is the highest hotel level in Japan, and it's got views to match - an amazing city panorama and if you're lucky on a clear day, views of Mt. Fuji.

I unexpectedly decided to prolong my stay in Tokyo, and my first hotel did not have a room available for my additional dates, so I moved to the Ritz Carlton. The hotel is sumptuous, it provides everything that you could wish for and more. I had a classic Japanese styled suit. The gentleman at check-in told me that many Westerners did not like this type or room, but as I am adventurous I was keen to try it, and I am so pleased that I did. The suite was stunning, with the most incredible views, and it was very large. In other words it was perfect. I loved staying at the RC, and would gladly return!

Had an amazing stay here at the Ritz Carlton, which had a great view of Tokyo tower and the Sky tree. Breakfast was very good, and rooms were luxurious and comfortable. The location is nearby Roppongi and there's the Midtown shopping mall right below as well with restaurants and a supermarket.
user_name:
Meng Yang N
Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

review_body: First of all, it is worth saying that I stay at Ritz Carlton hotels a lot, and as such I have Silver Elite status, which would usually ensure pretty good service at these hotels. However, our experience at the RC Tokyo was subpar. First of all, I had made a reservation for a table at the bar, towards the front and with a view, which somehow had disappeared. We were offered a table at a (very smoky) smoking area, which we declined. After several minutes of standing and negotiating with the staff we were eventually given a table.The food at the bar was way below RC standards, and very poor value for money. My request for late checkout was declined, which is poor in any situation and especially so for a status holder. My room was OK but relatively small for Tokyo standards. Finally, I asked for a meeting room for an hour, as I had to make a late night conference call, and the hotel was not able to meet that request either. The bottom line is that this could have been a nice hotel, but the service I received was so poor for RC or Japan standards that I will definitely not be coming back.
user_name:
EvanK_HK
New York City, New York

review_body: Very courteous staff, made our stay very comfortable and memorable. Location is very good and easily accessible from the subway. Good food & ambience added to a delightful experience. Highly recommended !!

Ritz delivers exceptional service by staff from bell to concierge and every else. The concierge was very friendly and helpful in making reservations and suggestions for dinner and ryokans. Stayed in the Japanese suite which does kinda smell probably from all the wood in the room. The bed is very large perfect for our family of 4 to all sleep On. Breakfast buffet provided with top notch choices the eggs were cooked well. The waffles are a must try. Would definitely come back.

From the time we arrived till we left the serviced was consistently unparalleled. We were greeted immediately as we exited our airport transfer and taken upstairs to the club lounge for check-in. We were always addressed by our names and given personal attention everywhere we went in the hotel. Our room had beautiful views of Tokyo by day and night from high atop the hotel. Every furnishing inside our room was of high quality, luxurious, functional and of contemporary design. The bathroom had roomy double sinks with daily stocked amenities in the drawers of the vanity which included hair brush, comb, toothbrushes as well as the usual bath and shower products. Housekeeping service anticipates your needs and does an unbelievable job servicing your room. The club floor is well worth it. The food preparations are excellent, including a rather formal afternoon tea service with an incredible menu of teas and miniature sandwiches and desserts presented with tradition and elegance. The spa experience leaves out nothing. Not only was the massage wonderful, but the service before and after it. They even have make-up to use for those who shower after their massages. Any towels you use are picked up almost immediately and everything is pristine and clean like I've never experienced. The hotel is also located near the metro, next to shopping and a market and several good restaurants. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Tokyo. The staff is kind, professional, and delivers unbelievable service. They make you feel like a valued guest at every turn. Thank you to all the wonderful people at this hotel.

Beautiful hotel Very safe and In a Great walkable area Amazing service and spectacular views of the city skyline at times above the clouds .The piano/ jazz band in the evenings and the bar area were truly a wonderful touch .

Stunning views, perfect location and as expected, impeccable rooms and service. Club staff and concierge were attentive and interested, and were only more than happy to help with any requests. They went above the call of duty. Outstanding.

We stayed for 5 days to celebrate an anniversary and were slightly disappointed by the strong perfumed cloying odor in the halls. Rooms were very nice and service was excellent and our view from our room on the 51st floor was beautiful. Concierge was very helpful and gracious. The Breakfast buffet was good, similar quality as the top notch breakfast buffet at the Grand Hyatt but with more limited selection. The hotel is part of the high end and uncrowded Tokyo Midtown retail and dining complex. Great location and easy to get around by walking or subway.

I have never stay in hotel like this in Tokyo, the location, staff, service and room just perfect .the location of the hotel connected to mall and front park.the room is stylish.view amazing front Kuwait tower or imperial palace .

This was my third visit to the Ritz Carlton Tokyo and I have to say, the hotel, the service, the employees, even the rooms were better than EVER!! It's incredible that when you arrive at the hotel after being a return guest, it seems every employee knows your name. The level of service here is simply the best.The room was totally equipped with everything you could ask for. The bed was super comfortable and the wi fi excellent and consistent.The chief concierge Ms. Ito is the MVP of the hotel. I was in contact with her a month before our stay and she took care of all of our (changing) reservations, including getting us into some "you have to be known" places. Brilliant!The club lounge has evolved into a haven. Very quiet with that wonderful view...greatly improved food services! The staff up there is beyond professional. They take care of you before you even think of it!!A special thank you to rooms manager Hector Busto who always make our stays special.All in all, this was the quintessential PERFECT hotel experience and I recommend staying here during your trip to Tokyo. BRAVO!!

I recently stayed here with my son on our first trip to Asia. The choice was perfect for us. The location is wonderful, and so is the quality of the rooms. But what we loved the most was the sincere attention to making our stay perfect. My son has food allergies and not only did the hotel make extra efforts to modify his food, they also actually wrote a note for us in Japanese explaining his food allergy so we could show it to other restaurants when we were out sightseeing. I celebrated a birthday at the hotel and they left a lovely gift and handwritten note in the room. The housekeeping staff paid attention to how we use the room, and they modified their service to match our needs. Not only did they meet all of our expectations, but they far exceeded them. They anticipated needs even we did not anticipate and handled them proactively. This was truly a five-star experience in all regards, and even though it's one of the more expensive hotels I have stayed that it's a five star on value for me as well. You truly do get what you pay for when you stay at the Ritz Carlton, Tokyo at Midtown.

I Would recommend staying at the Rtiz Carlton Tokyo!The staff were incredible and really welcoming. Their English was very good and I had no hassles during my stay.A huge thank you to Leon, made the breakfast experience unforgettable.Definitely recommend the breakfast!

I stayed here with my family on the club level for our last 2 nights in Japan. When we arrived we were greeted and shown to the club level where we sat down for the check in. They served us afternoon tea with drinks to make the process more relaxing. The staff were friendly and made a point to address us by name.Another perk was that the concierge made all of our reservations for us and set up our transfers. This was very helpful considering we were only in Tokyo for a day and a half. Overall this hotel staff really made the trip fantastic!

This hotel truly made me feel at home and feel like a VIP and it's standard for all guests! Starting from the Bell desk to all the way up to the room I was greeted by warm welcome with a genuine smile and small but caring gestures like running to push the elevator button and wishing a pleasant stay or a nice sleep. The concierge team was efficient in getting me restaurant reservations, guided tours and directions. The club lounge was fabulous as always and the staff there was exceptionally caring and attentive. I have never seen this level of personal touch and warmth in any hotel and I have stayed in quite a few!

Hotel located in the center of Tokyo, a wonderful location with fabulous night view. You can see the landscape of Tokyo city from room, the Tokyo Tower is just right in front of you. Walking out of Hotel, this is a walking path and small park for jogging and kids playground for fun. Within a walking distance, there are heaps of restaurant and shops which you can enjoy Japanese local food. It is really worthwhile to stay in this area, a great place for relaxing and friend gathering.

Everything from beginning to end was excellent. The club level lounge was well worth it. The food and the service at the lounge was great. The view from the 52nd floor was something to see every morning.

We LOVED this hotel! I was there with my husband and children (11 & 13) for 3 nights at the beginning of our trip and one night at the end. After long days of walking through Tokyo we were always excited to enter the gorgeous lobby on the 45th floor with sweeping views of the city. The rooms were very large (we had 2 adjoining) with incredible views, the service was excellent, the staff throughout the hotel was welcoming and friendly, and the concierge staff was outstanding--very helpful and knowledgeable. The spa is a treat and my husband and I both enjoyed our services. The lobby bar is great for a drink (or you can have lunch/dinner) and we enjoyed sitting there after dinner with a glass of wine looking out at the city. There is also live entertainment some nights. We all loved the huge breakfast buffet with western and Japanese options. My daughter enjoyed the pool and hot tub (which also have amazing views). We used the subway a lot and there is a stop right by the hotel which was very convenient. The hotel is at the top of Midtown Tower with a mall and offices below so on the one rainy day we went downstairs and had lunch and shopped around and never had to get out in the rain. The area of Roppongi is the nightlife area of Tokyo so there are tons of bars and restaurants and people walking around. It doesn't have the high end feel like Ginza which was fine with us but something to consider if that is important to you. I truly can't say enough about this hotel. We did not want to leave the Ritz Carlton (or Tokyo) and we will definitely be back!

Wow, what a treat!The Ritz-Carlton Tokyo Midtown...why did we have to come home???From start to finish we were treated like VIPs here.Location was WONDERFUL, easy train access and shopping.The room was delightfully beautiful! Could see Mt. Fugi and beautiful city views.The staff really went out of their way to make us feel welcomed and happy.The SPA! wow! I never wanted to leave!Thank you Ritz-Carlton! I hope we meet again!

The room is awesome with spectacular view! Staff are all friendly and helpful and willing to offer their kindness to my little girl who had got a high fever! The best one of four RC i have ever stayed! Will definitely come again!

Excellent location and service. Room was beautiful with a stunning view of Tokyo and extremely spacious for our family of four with two queen beds. Bathroom was clean and also extremely spacious. Breakfast buffet was great and the sushi restaurant- Hinokizaka- was an unforgettable and special experience. We used the subway -which was connected to the hotel- several times to get around the city. We also enjoyed the spa, pool, and hot tub. We will stay here again in a heart beat.

Excellent keep up the good job. Everything from front desk, bell service, housekeeping, very professional. We would definitely stay here again and strongly recommend the hotel to guest visiting Tokyo.

We really nice the service of Ritz Carlton. Not to mentioned the beautiful hotel and amenity inside the Hotel. We got the double bed room and it is nice and spacious for a family of 4. Will definitely stay there again.

Lively, grand, over the top, eye popping views, extraordinary service. The hotel is situated on the top floors of an extremely tall building in Tokyo. I'm sure there is not a room with a bad view in the entire hotel. The neighborhood around the building is a very upscale residential area with a gorgeous small park across the street and fantastic shopping on the other side of the building. Our room was a traditional Japanese suite which was absolutely beautiful.The laundry and room service were so fast and efficient that I couldn't figure out how they did it- magic. Club level is very beautiful, well run and very important to have access to at this hotel as it is EXTREMELY busy on the lobby level. We spent a good amount of time on club level and the service, food, and views are incredible. The staff was very accommodating to my teens.The lobby bar is a fun, happening place with a stellar staff and good nightly entertainment. To see the lights of Tokyo twinkling below you while you enjoy a cocktail is a moment I won't forget. Book an hour or two ride around Tokyo in their vintage Rolls Royce!

The best hotel experience I've had in terms of service, ambience and comfort. Peaceful room with a great view of Tokyo city.Wonderful Executive lounge with first class service , food and drinks. The best view of Tokyo from the 53rd level which was basically 98 floor as the lobby is on the 45th floor. My sweater was wrapped beautifully on my bed after less than 20 hours for dry cleaning. Housekeeping was very efficient when I went for breakfast.

Central, elegant, comfortable home base in a great city. Service could not be better. Truly lovely experience. Top quality from room to linens, from spa to breakfast buffet. Though the restaurants and bar prices are high, our room and the overall experience were an incredible bargain.

This is the best hotel I have ever stayed at. Ritz Carlton is generally out of my price range, but it was a great time to turn in some of my Marriot points and do something special. The service is exceptional here. The smell is overwhelmingly nice, the rooms are immaculate and have incredible views. The price is extremely high, but you get what you pay for. My only complaint is the extortionate prices at the spa and lobby bar, but that kind of goes with the territory with these type of places.

My first stay at The Ritz Carlton Tokyo and I was not disappointed. Previously, I've stayed the The Peninsular when in Tokyo however, this trip fleeting and I needed to be near MidTown. From the Rooms, to restaurants, the pool and most of all the caring nature of the staff, the Ritz Carlton made my stay a pleasure. Especially the food at Hinokizaka. All the better for the remarkable view from the Sushi bar. Enjoy.

Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights for my birthday and first time in Tokyo for me.... I liked the area! It's attached to a mall and the subway station, which was pretty convenient. The hotel is located in Roppongi district (forgive me on my spelling) which is also located near a ton of restaurants and the night life. Back to the hotel.... the hotel lobby is on the 45th floor with beautiful views of the city! The reception desk ladies were so nice and attentive to me... I felt super VIP checking in. A woman dressed in a kimono outfit escorted us to our room and pointed out the highlights and made sure we liked the room. She was lovely. Our room was astounding and very spacious for 3 people. They brought up a nice birthday amenity for me moments after I checked in. Super nice of them!!! Definitely if you stay here you have to get a massage! The massages were absolutely phenomenal! I can't say enough great things about this hotel.... I'm gladly coming back the next time I visit Tokyo it was worth every single penny.

Always a great experience with the staff and accommodation. If you want to treat yourself when visiting Tokyo, this is the place to go. Located near a shopping and an unforgettable night life all within walking distance.

We stayed 4 nights and everything was perfect. The service is perfect, always available to help and warm, welcoming and very friendly. The views are amazing, even from the lobby, but even better from the rooms, ours was on the 50th floor facing Tokyo tower. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable and the breakfast is excellent. The buffet is very abundant and has many options available and additionally offers some a la carte choices of which the eggs benedict and the croissant waffle are a must. It also has a big swimming pool and gym on the 46th floor. Overall the hotel is very quiet and great to relax after touristing the city during the day and its location is just great.

“This hotel was so unbelievably good that I would say it is a seven star hotel. I liked it more than the Burj al Arab in Dubai. Better than the Mandarin Oriental Hotels, better than the best hotels I have stayed in all over the world. The service was impeccable. Everything was phenomanal. From the time I exited the taxi everyone knew my name. The attention to detail was amazing. The club lounge food was better than the Westin or any Starwood hotel. The Michelin rated restaurant was good of course. ALL the staff without exception genuinely cared about you. The view from every window was stunning. I had the best time ever. Great pool and spa treatment as well.”

We recently had the pleasure of staying at three Ritz-Carlton properties—Hong Kong, Tokyo and Kyoto. From the initial greetings using our names to personalized services—tour options, restaurant recommendations, printing boarding passes, cleaning services... to a person each staff member was extremely polite, warm, helpful—not just professionally cordial but genuinely caring. We enjoyed well-appointed and very clean accommodations plus lovely welcoming refreshments from the Hotel Managers. They were three of the finest hotel experiences we have had in over 40 years of travel.

We stayed at the Ritz-Carlton in midtown Tokyo prior to a cruise from Tokyo to San Diego. The Ritz-Carlton is, unquestionably, a 5 star property! It starts on the 45th floor of the office building and goes upward from there. You take an elevator from the ground floor to the 45th floor lobby and then another elevator to your rooms which, in our case, were on the 54th floor. Size-wise, the guest rooms are enormous for hotels in Japan and even larger than most US hotel rooms. Plus, the views were spectacular. The hotel is located across the street from Hinokicho Park where you can stroll or sit on the grass like locals. The Cherry Blossoms were still in bloom during our visit and very pretty. If you do not wish to eat at the hotel, there are numerous restaurants within walking distance just down the hill after you go under the elevated train tracks into the Roppongi district. There are also several Lawson type mini markets in the area where you can purchase snacks or items for breakfast if you wish. In spite of the steep room cost per night, there were lots of people staying here including quite a few couples with small children. Overall the stay was an amazing experience. From the Ritz-Carlton to the Harumi Passenger Ship Terminal cost about $40.

The location is perfect, finest restaurants and malls. And the staffs are just incredibly warm and welcoming. Ritz Tokyo is a must stay hotel if you're in town. Quote " your request is our command", literally they will deliver whatever you need. Been to every major five star hotel in Tokyo, Ritz is second to none.

I originally booked us the Executive Suite because it boasted views of Fuji-san and the Shinjuku neighborhood. Upon check-in, we were informed that we had been upgraded to the "bigger" Carlton Suite. Sounds great, right? Well, first of all, the Carlton Suite had an entirely different view--no Fuji-san! Incredibly disappointing, considering this was a huge deciding factor for me when I originally booked the Executive Suite. Further, and perhaps more terrible, the Carlton Suite basically had no view at all. The "panoramic" views were entirely obstructed by a humongous slab of concrete jutting out from the windows on our level. We could not see out of the living room, closet, or one bedroom window. We could only see out of the smallest bedroom window. It was never mentioned to me at any point during check-in that the view would be different or that it was almost entirely obstructed. Honestly, I feel ripped off. I booked this hotel to have an epic view for our last night in Tokyo and we couldn't even see it. The "upgrade" felt like I was conned. I could have had the EXACT SAME view from their most basic Deluxe room. So why did I pay the extra?! We certainly didn't need the space for our short stay.Also, there was a gross hair in the shower! (Not mine!) And housekeeping never cleared our room service plates despite us asking them to. Our dirty plates remained in the room for our entire stay.I wish I had booked the Mandarin Oriental or Park Hyatt instead.

Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I took my partner here for his birthday. The course meal that we had was amazing. The staff here were also very kind. The best service. The view from here was superb as well. I have absolutely no complaints. Excellent place!

I cannot say enough good things about this hotel and the service!!! NOTHING I say can explain how great this hotel was....and the staff was exceptional!! They listened to what you said and actually helped out. Example...I mentioned I had a scratchy throat (in casual conversation) and hot tea with honey was sent to my room - without my asking. I mentioned my daughter wanted matcha tea and there it was....delivered to my room (no charge)!! Wish I had had more time to stay there...one night was just not long enough:):)

The hotel is just marvellous. The are rooms are clean, big and the view are amazing, the food are very good and the quality of servive is outstanding. In this matter, I would like to mention Mr Hector Busto who exceeded our expectations with his special attention, efficiency and kindness.

Everything just incredibleGreat location in roppongiRediculous viewsStaff amazingClub level was awesome for after dinner drinksIn the middleOf tokyo midtown which has all sorts of thingsOnly thing I wish they have better coffee

This hotel is located at a hi-rise building and you have to check in at 45th floor. The view is awesome. Same as other Ritz Carlton properties, they are all beautifully made with very modern decor. I would say that they have very good hardware. When it comes to software (staffs & customer services), they are a bit blunt and rigid. Of course, most Japanese hotels have this issue but this hotel is more serious. Meanwhile, if you are a frequent especially business traveller, please don't put high hope in this hotel because they may not live up with your high expectation. You won't get much advantages by being a loyal member. In here, I want to highlight their concierge services. I have hinted many times to the concierge that I was looking for top quality restaurants especially those with michelin star or awarded restaurants. None of them can offer me any decent recommendation. Finally, I had to list out all the restaurants for them to help my reservations. During the reservations, some of them needs to be guaranteed to avoid cancellation. I am OK with this arrangement so I filled in the guarantee form they asked for. When I faxed it, the number they gave us doesn't work for overseas because it is much shorter. Secondly, I found out later than they did hold up the credit for the meals first. I was surprised as the other hotels would take it as an guarantee but they never really get the authorisation code....

They were amazing. The level of friendliness and customer service was above and beyond what I've experienced at hotels before.The managers there are extremely service focused and engaging and made my stay in Tokyo that much more special. From the arrival at the hotel through the check-out, everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. Ikuko Sato, one of the directors there, was in particular, extra helpful. She walked us to our room and gave us the walk-through of the room controls and made sure there wasn't anything else we needed before she left us to get on with helping her other guests.My wife is traveling with me and was astonished by the level of service they provided from arrival to departure. The level of detail and care is phenomenal.The room we were in had beautiful views of the city and the staff had a nice welcome gift of delicious chocolates waiting for us.If the above wasn't enough, the concierge was great and recommended a tasty restaurant for us. We asked what the best options for ramen were, and like a pro, he had the map ready to go and detailed out the pluses and minuses of each.

We stay in a lot of hotels all over the world and we will forever compare to this experience. The staff are beyond excellent and the hotel itself is perfect. Don't worry about the price just book it and enjoy

Went to Tokyo for our anniversary and had great accommodations at the Ritz. Room upgrade and welcome gift. Very friendly and knowledgeable staff. Got dinner reservations, baseball tickets, etc. for us. Overall a great stay!

The staff was incredibly friendly, polite, and helpful. They called me by my name, which made me feel very welcomed. The facilities were incredibly nice. Dining in the restaurants and lounge area was exceptional. I can't think of a single area of improvement for my stay; it was a wonderful experience overall.

We had room 5218, with views over to Shibuya. A large room with two wardrobes, desk, drinks station, fridge-style minibar, kettle. Lovely big bathroom with bath, separate shower, two vanity basins. Wifi both fast and free. A USB on one side of bed, plenty of sockets elsewhere with UK adaptors. Pyjamas, bathrobes and slippers provided. The room had been recently refurbished and looked great. The Club Lounge on the 53rd floor was a lovely area, with good food presentations including a curry every night and a chef cooking items to order. The gym on the 46th floor was quite large and had plenty of equipment, towels and bottles of water, but was quite warm.

Omg. This is absolutely the best hotel I have stayed in Tokyo in many trips. I mean the rooms, bathroom, gym, wifi is all top notch but what I like the most is that fact that they somehow managed to mix the Japanese boring Hospitality with western flair. It's not stiff and you don't feel "in the way" walking and enjoying this hotel. Again all was great and definitely back again.

Good location,just next to the shopping mall. Nice view from the hotel room, the skytree tower and the tokyo tower (depends on the room located). Good service. But there is no shuttle bus from Haneda airport. The shuttle bus from Narita airpot end the service at around 17:50 (depends on which terminal). The room is buig enough for 2 person.

Only Kyoto Ritz Carlton was better. Superb attention to detail. Staff always willing to please. Will stay again of in Toyko. Location excellent and great shopping center attached with good restaurants and bakery.

Room design: avarageView: amazingBreakfast: limited choice, every day the sameConcierge: very efficient Location: excellent Restaurant: not used/no comment Bar: nice experience for food, drinks and music

Just visited RC Tokyo because I considered the hotel for my 1 week stay in Tokyo. As soon as I entered the hotel, after a longtime searching the entrance thru the modern shopping centre, I was shocked to find myself in a totally dated decoration. It got worse arriving at Lobby with a nasty smoky stench I immediately had to leave to get into the fresh outside Tokyo air.The hotel is struck off the list of my Tokyo hotel list.

The rooms are great, service superior, location one of the best with access to subways, shops, dining. Breakfast in main dining area is first rate. The French dining spot was excellent; the Japanese restaurant was only good at best. Overall well worth the price.

What can I say. The Ritz-Carlton knows what they are doing. From the minute we arrived, until checkout 3 nights later, it was just excellent. The location in the Midtown building (Roppongi) with a park outside for the kids to play in, and with the subway more or less in the basement, just perfect. The view from the 45 floor and up, just fabulous. The room was big and spacious with comfortable beds, and the swimming pool, a bit hit with the kids. The breakfast was delicious and they had a good selection. But the best thing was the service. The kids were treated like small royalties with many small presents handed out during the stay from the staff. We could not have had a better stay in Tokyo.

I spent 2 nights here with my husband for his birthday. The service was impeccable as was the room-the view was unreal. There is a beautiful shopping concourse downtairs with lovely low key meals and shopping available. Just outside the hotel is a lovely little park (where little ones can run free barefoot) and an adjacent outdoor whiskey bar and a large outdoor cafe as well. Roppongi is a fairly good location-fun at night and close to Shibuya and the Meiji Shrine. I'd originally booked the Mandarin Oriental but switched last minute because it was so far away from the majority of the places I wanted to see. I was not disappointed>highly recommend!

The Ritz staff went above and beyond to ensure my stay was comfortable, easy and fun. I have mobility issues, but when they took my colleagues and I on an insider's tour of the fish market, they arranged for me to ride on one of the transport vehicles so I didn't have to miss out or walk too much. Overall, the staff was friendly, accomodating and sincere, remembering where I'd been on my outings and asking about my experiences later. I loved it.

Wonderful property, exceptional view, personalized experience, flawless stay. Helpful, attentive and friendly staff. Excellent location. Great pool. I enjoyed every dimensions of this eight nights stay.

My wife and I spent 5 very enjoyable nights at the Tokyo Ritz Carlton in early May , including access to the Club lounge . The rooms are beautifully presented , all with wonderful views over Tokyo , including a good view of Mt Fuji on our last morning .Service was excellent and staff were very professional and helpful at all times .We had a very good dinner at the Towers Bistro which is at the hotel reception level (45th floor) and enjoyed wonderful service from staff , especially the manager , who "shouted" me a sake cocktail after I had accepted his recommendations from the wine list .My only negative was with the sometimes limited offerings at the club lounge . Perceptions may have been affected by our experience at the club lounge at the Portman Ritz Carlton in Shanghai from where we had travelled to Tokyo , and where the club lounge was magnificent . While club staff in Tokyo were very good , it appeared at times that they were dealing with a management who were leaning towards an austerity approach .eg. pumpkin soup and pasta are not hors d'oeuvre . After a big day touring the sights , I didn't want either with my drink.Would very happily return to this remarkable hotel !

We stayed at this Ritz Carlton in Tokyo for one week. We can't even begin to describe the IMPECCABLE service we received here!!!! Unbelievable!! Their attention to every single detail was amazing!!! Beyond polite staff!!!!!!Beautiful hotel! Fantastic views of the city! If you reserve a room on the Mt. Fuji side, you will feel like you're in Heaven!!!! The Concierge Lounge was AMAZING!!!!!! Again, impeccable service!! Fantastic view of Mt. Fuji, when clear. The food they offered in the lounge was beyond words!!! Can enjoy a perfectly delicious Japanese breakfast every morning OR, they also offer European and American fare as well!!! Delicious fruits and breads and pastries!!! Making my mouth water as I write this!!The Afternoon Tea is so beautiful!!! Just perfect!!Afternoon light food is AMAZING!!! So much delicious food to choose from and above 5 star worthy!!!!The rooms are beautifully decorated with all the amenities! If you DO require something extra, you can bet it will be at your door within a few minutes!!!If you need clothes cleaned, steamed or pressed, they do a perfect job and are prompt! All wrapped and hung perfectly!!!The upstairs cocktail lounge is beautiful!! Great city views with beautiful live music each night!!Also, a great location! Nice walk to many places or a short can ride.Beyond spoiled during our stay here!!!! The next time we are in Tokyo, there is absolutely NO doubt we will stay here again!!!!No complaints whatsoever!!!!!!!!!!

Staffs treat customers differently!! I was dressed simple when I arrived and they treated me like I couldn't afford to stay at their hotel!!! they should brief and train their staffs for work etiquette!!!

review_body: The Ritz Carlton TOKYO is best ever in TOKYO! Superb!It was really busy and shot stay. When I arrive at 23:00, they did warmest welcoming me and room has completely ready as my style, I need.Super comfy and made me happy and feel lux. My fatigue was let go immediately, when I check in. Ladies and gentlemen are professional and reallyfriendly with gentle, really taking care me and help all. (Reception and club really helped me as my secretary, or family as kindness)You should try Japanese food at club with morning champagne. It promise you to start great day ahead! Gym and fitness area is also recommend, silent and clean, and can maintain your body in Tokyo.accesses good(taxi 15 min to Tokyo station, direct to Metro), direct to good quality of shopping mole as midtown, everything there.Definitely Best hotel in TOKYO.I will Not forget, they seen us off until our car disappears,Thank you RC TOKYO,

We brought a very large group of people for a business engagement, which included a few VIPs. The hotel made little effort to accommodate very simple requests. Given the size of our room block, and the general reputation of the Ritz-Carlton brand we expected a much higher level of service then we received. My team will not be returning to Ritz-Carlton Tokyo, or any other Ritz moving forward. Ps. To top it all off, I found dirty men's underwear in my room when I checked in. Ewwww!

I am a corporate flight attendant and I stayed at the Ritz in March for a work trip. The service and the hotel had amazing service by all employees especially the manager Leon. I did a catering order for my flight home with Leon and he went above and beyond for me!! He walked me all the way to the market that is attached to the hotel and spoke Japanese to the sushi chef to help me pick out sushi for my flight! Not only did he walk me to the store to help with my catering order.. he walked me 10-15 to my restaurant where I was having dinner. I was confused on how to get there so he said he would walk me there! Talk about above and beyond service!!! I would definitely go back to the Ritz! The service is A++ !!!

We stayed in the Modern Japanese Suite and it was phenomenal. I alerted the hotel ahead of time that I was celebrating my birthday and they went to great lengths to make it very special. My only regret is I don't know how future birthdays can hope to compare. I can't forget a shout out to Ito-san at the concierge desk- we had more than a few last minute requests, many with scant details, that we foisted upon her and she handled them all with aplomb. Ito-san always followed up promptly with either reservation options or much more information than we had the time or ability to research ourselves. She is a treasure!!

They have a cafe at the Lobby Level but there is one on the Midtown Shopping end. Great service, lots of savoury dishes too but cakes, coffee and hot chocolate is highly recommended. Great Free WiFi and exceptional Ritz Service.

Absolutely exquisite with service to match.This hotel is world standard with staff that wish to pamper every possible need in a most friendly way.The rooms have splendid views over the city of Tokio.On entry you travel 35 floors extremely quickly to the main lobby and reception after which you travel on a separate bank of elevators to the rooms.All the amenities are first class quality.I have stayed in other hotels in Tokio but this is by far the best.I shall return and recommend.

A friend and I stayed at the Tokyo Ritz for a quick weekend layover for 2 nights. Everything was impeccable. I've stayed at many Ritz Carlton's over the years, and this was by far the top. The service, the ambience, the room, the attentiveness of every staff member, etc. And, the upgraded room for our loyalty was out of this world. The view was incredible and size of corner room was enormous. The area where it's located is upscale, trendy, and quieter, but centrally located as well. Easy cab rides to anywhere in the city although cabs can get pricey in Tokyo. Thank you, Tokyo Ritz! We'll be back again for sure.

Easily one of the best properties under the Marriott/SPG/Ritz Carlton umbrella. The staff (both at the front desk and in the club lounge) are the most attentive and professional I have seen anywhere in the world (so much so, that you might even feel underwhelmed by subsequent stays at other--magnificent--RC properties). Ikuko, one of the directors at the hotel, is the best at what she does and helps to create an environment in which guests feel like VIPs. The rooms/suites--from the three I have seen at this property--are all beautiful and provide spectacular views of the city, Tokyo Tower, or Mt. Fuji (if the weather is right). The beds aren't QUITE as comfortable, in my opinion, as those you might find at Westin hotels, but the closets, bathrooms and amenities here are second to none and will make you feel beyond comfortable during your time at the hotel.The club lounge is one of the best I've seen and is definitely worth trying out. The food is delicious (much of it prepared by chefs who man a section that is open, seemingly, from the time the lounge opens its doors until it closes them), and the service is on another level. The views and ambiance help make it a place of calm, luxurious serenity that I enjoyed starting and ending my busy Tokyo days in.The fitness center was very well maintained and staffed and the pool--though I did not try it out--looked nice and also provided some great views over the city.The Ritz Carlton, Tokyo somehow continues to surpass all of my expectations and will stay put as my favorite hotel in the world. I hope to return soon!

When you stay at the Ritz Carlton, you expect excellence in everything. My review is based on my expectations for a 5 star level hotel.Check in was seamless- there were 4 of us and actually checked each of us in our respective rooms. So no awkward lines at the front desk. The only bad thing was that when she checked me in and signed me up to the Ritz Carlton membership (the forms were filled in already) she flipped my name so I keep getting mailers addressing me by my last part of my last name(my last name is hyphenated)... I wrote to Ritz membership but hasnt been fixed!All our rooms faced smack in front of the Tokyo Tower which was beautiful at nights. They left some macaroon treats in the sitting area which was nice. Water bottles were free of charge. I got a fruit plate my sister had ordered for me to help me recover a bit upon arrival from a long flight- but was a teeny tiny portion( my sister had specified extra large portion...she saw the portion and was disappointed)Breakfast was included in our stay so I had breakfast in the restaurant on the lobby/reception level- nice views. Great food selection (both western and Asian) but I found the restaurant to be a bit smallish.Our rooms also came with a $100 or $200 credit to the room for expenses in the hotel but we were all pretty busy so didn't get to use/apply it. I did find it odd that they still charged extra $5 for a local phone call- why wouldn't they give credit to that from that $100？Location- very convenient to Roppongi. Also direct access to the lower floor shops from Uniqlo to drugstores to Japanese sweets!All in all nice stay with few minor disappointments. Hope they fix my name in the membership!

The Ritz Tokyo is now 10 years old and parts of the room show a bit of the wear and tear and a bit outdated. But, the service at the club lounge was excellent. From the afternoon tea at check in to midday snacks at check out time, the staff were very friendly and trying to anticipate all our needs. The club lounge is what makes this hotel shine. The only bit that I thought deserved criticism is that they never mentioned any opportunity for any upgrade as part of the Amex FHR program which was stated as on an availability basis from Amex. The other amenities did come through.

1-2 problem , but no bad in myopinionThe room was good decor,Dont understen why need pay extra for the bed, when i booking 3 person?Why need pay extra for the music in the bar?Why need extra pay for the pool?

3 night club level stay. Amazingly expensive - restaurants and rooms of a very high standard but all else fairly average for a hotel at this level. Service at imperial much better; club in HK much better.

My husband and I were on our own tour - to view the Sakura blossoms in April. The service there was "tip top" - be it, advice on the various parks to view Sakura blossoms, information on Japan underground services and also providing the daily weather reports. At every turn and every step we feel that we had a personal butler on hand. Mr 'Shun' in charge of concierge and Mr Edward a Korean American intern deserves our special mention. Mr Shun on discovering that cooking is my hobby recommended to visit "The Market Place" at Asakusa. It was really a worthwhile and beneficial visit. He and his assistant, a Japanese lady took 2 days to try to do online check in for my return air ticket but was unable to do so as I provided the wrong information. My apologies to both of them. Mr Shun described in detail the various different menus offered by the dinning outlets in the Hotel, make the reservations and we really cannot describe the pleasant and rich experiences we had. Mr.Edward, seeing that we were confused by all the maps, personally guided us to the entrance of Ronponggi Station. Every morning he is there to greet us with his big beautiful "sunshine" smile. These two gentlemen went the extra mile to see to our comfort and to make our us experience the fantastic hospitality of The Ritz Carlton. It is really "the jewel in the crown" experience and we will be back.

As always another brilliant stay. Never thought hotels did anything with the questionnaires you complete after your stay but the Ritz Carlton proved me WRONG. Made a minor comment following my last stay about something missing in the bedroom. Lo and behold when I got to my room on my recent stay there it was, just for me........ Brilliant personalized service. Thank you.........

Place is conveniently located above upscale shopping center. Good restaurant everywhere and a 24hr super market. Hotel staff are friendly and attentive. Everything is clean and the room is large and comfortable. A great location to start your day in Tokyo.

Beautiful hotel, friendly customer service, spectacular room views of the city! Worth a the money to experience the Ritz Carlton Tokyo! The bed was like sleeping on clouds and shower felt like a waterfall! Would do it again in a heart beat! ❤

This hotel not only offers the Ritz-Carlton level of service and room quality but also incredible views of Tokyo. It is also a great location in Roppongi and the Imperial Palace is reachable if you walk circa 20 minutes. Impressive property. The concierge staff was also very useful. Prior to arriving, we emailed them to make some restaurant reservations.We agreed to a higher rate that included breakfast. I don't recommend doing so. The breakfast is a typical buffet. The food is not impressive and service stops before 10:30AM. On Sunday morning, we were advised that service would stop at 10:15AM and by then the staff had not replenished some breakfast options. I recommend eating breakfast near the hotel. There is a Starbucks in the building.The bigger disappointment was the pool. It was fun having a pool 50 or so floors above Tokyo. The indoor pool and jacuzzi have long chairs where you can relax. My issue firstly the noise. There were kids playing around in the pool the two times I visited and the staff did nothing to ask them to lower their noise. The other and bigger issue was 2 adults making out bluntly in the pool right by my lounge chair. I looked at one of the staff members who did not anything and thus moved to another chair. Unfortunately, they moved near my chair while playing around in the pool. Afterwards, I complained to the front desk and very disappointed by the response. I got an apology note from the spa manager. Quite honestly, I would have expected a note from the General Manager and would expect a Ritz to offer a better pool experience.

Stayed last week with the family. Although the hotel is geared toward the high end traveller and business man, the staff go out of the way to make the kids welcome. The buffet at breakfast is pretty basic and gets boring after two days, so wound up eating outside.Used the pool and that was nice and unlike a lot of hotels in Japan, they don't charge extra for using.

breathtaking views from room, bar and pool. Staff were friendly and attentive. Comfy bed and very spacious- gave 5 for value as used Marriott points! Cherry blossom cocktails were awesome! Pool was a highlight

Great location and views. Service excellent food and beverage needs a bit of attention . Staff friendly concierge a bit over worked and lacked knowledge Club level very nice again food ok. Cherry blossoms and park great.

review_body: Superb Hotel but very commercially oriented employees. Having said that the room and views are spectacular and some of the staff, especially at concierge were phenomenal. They dont really appreciate loyalty and frequent travelers.

The experience the staff provided for our trip was above and beyond anything we have ever experienced. They truly our exceptional when it comes to customer service. From the moment we arrived, and throughout our entire stay every member of the staff went out of their way to make sure all our needs were immediately addressed. From a special dinner reservation to car service arrangements the entire experience at the Ritz Carlton Tokyo was incredible. In all our travels globally we have never seen an entire team of employees more committed to customer service.

We decided to pampered ourselves with a cocktail with a view. Well, we found the perfect place for that : the Bar of the Ritz Carlton Tokyo on 41st Floor. We have been warmly welcomed by the team of the bar and they accommodated us easyly altough we were 6 and the place crowded. The french manager came to our table to ensure our comfort and even proposed his suggestion for the cocktails, remarkable service from him. We all had different cocktails and non of us have been disappointed. I highly recommend the Sakura Daiquiri at this season, so delicious, i could have so many!If you are looking to celebrate a special moment, this bar is so perfect. And the view of the city by night is unique and memorable. Thank you for this amazing experience. WOW

For my first time in Japan this was the perfect hotel. Impeccable service and very accommodating. Everything was perfect and the staff was helpful. Our room was spectacular, the food in the restaurant was fresh and so good.

Excellent hotel with incredible service. However they allow smoking in the lobby bar that makes the whole lobby smell. We had wanted to have a drink in the common area but could not because of the smell. We hear this will be corrected but not for several years. Too bad because it does not fit with their overall excellent service.

Great overall experience. Superior service. Restaurants are overpriced but good. Room sizes are wonderful. I love the location and there are plenty of things to eat fairly cheap in the mall below the building. Of course it's expensive but it's hard to find anything to complain about.

Excellent guest services, great room views, great front desk staff, diligent concierge staff, wonderful door men who actually smiles at you and say hello when he opens the door. Energetic housekeeping staff. Good breakfast options. Beautiful ladies in Kimono to greet and help you with calling the elevators-a great treat!

The room, the view, the service and the lovely, little touches which made us feel special and very welcome were second to none. If you are travelling to Tokyo this is the perfect place to stay. Situated in mid-town Tokyo and within reasonable distance of the airport this hotel has everything you could want for a short break, whether it be be for business or pleasure. I wish I could give more than 5 stars!

For context, I have over 900 nights at different "Marriott" properties (this just counts the Marriott properties), including multiple RCs, etc, etc. This is by far the best property I have ever stayed at under the "Marriott" brand (We would also even maybe say Four Seasons brand as well). Disclaimer: We are using points for the stay(s) and paid for the club lounge access. Some details which I think the frequent travelers / business travelers might appreciate (for those travel nerds / aficionados out there): - The club lounge staff are unbelievably professional and courteous. Greeting by name, great chefs / food, etc, etc. (Top floor / 53rd floor of the Tokyo Midtown tower - tallest building in Tokyo?).-- Club / Lounge access also includes 2 pressings daily. Very nice to have (check the prices).-- Club / Lounge access also includes access to the beautiful indoor lap pool, jacuzzi, and gym (46th floor).-- Club / Lounge access also includes cocktails and wine / beer.- The concierge / bell / reservation staff ahead of our stay were again extremely helpful and professional ( car and dinner recommendations / reservations), we coordinated shipping a couple boxes ahead of our stay, we were able to confirm club lounge access ahead of our arrival (you can use points to pay for club / lounge access - 20K weekday), foam pillows in the room, etc, etc. - The doors to the rooms were designed in a way where they shut VERY quietly. No slamming of doors at 3 in the morning... You cannot hear the doors shut.- Rooms are ridiculously quiet. Which I REALLY appreciate.- Full blackout shade for the full window in the room. And it does black out the room.- Night light at the bottom of the bathroom sinks for middle of the night. All controlled by a panel in the night stand by the bed.- Double vanity sinks !- We were very lucky - visiting right smack dab in the middle of cherry blossom peak bloom. They have a big park downstairs that is obviously beautiful with all the blossoming cherry trees. Couple minor negatives:- They take our towels every single time they come in to clean up or freshen up. There is a "Recycle" sign, (hang up, blah, blah, blah), but they still take them every time.- You enter the building on the street level and then escorted / directed to the 45th floor "Lobby".The 45th floor "Lobby" (where a majority of folks check in and visit the concierge, also where there is a big panoramic bar of Tokyo (i.e. "Lost in Translation"), allows smoking... As you would imagine, midday seems to be fine, but evening and into morning is pretty smoky...- The Galleria shopping is not ummmm normal shopping... $8 USD white strawberry (just one and apparently not very good).- Very fortunately we were able to find a coin operated laundry place, less then 5 minutes walk from the property. Handful of washers, 3 dryers, so plan accordingly.  Hope somebody can use the insight. Much more, but I'll stop here.

From the instant we exited the elevator upon arrival, to the time we checked out this property impressed. The service was without flaw, the room, and remainder of the property was amazing. We had a corner room and waking up to the view of the city was breathtaking. Still amazed, what a wonderful experience.

The hotel is located at Roppongi area nearby Roppongi Hills. The buffet line of breakfast provided not so much Japanese dishes. Everyone can see Tokyo Tower from the restaurant with paronamic view. It is really great.

We stayed 2 nights at the Ritz Carlton Tokyo and had been excited in advance alreday! We were not dissapointed and enjoyed our time very much. At arrival you get into the building on the ground floor and we where greeted by bellstaff. However they said room is not ready as check in is from 3 pm and we had 2 pm. When i asked if we can go upstairs to at least check if something is available he said OK. And once arrived on the 46? floor at the reception we where warmly greeted and checked in straight away! The views are from every corner of the hotel AMAZING! The room is a bit old though but very large for Tokyo! You find all amenties you expect from a RITZ. The service was outstanding during our stay. The bar is really nice and enjoyable in the evening. No cover charge for guests! We need to mention ITO from the Concierge desk she was more than helpfull. She found some special places for us and recognised us during our whole stay. She is the reason why ritz carlton is famous for its great service in the world!

We're currently staying in the Club Executive King Suite Club on floor 51 and wondering what made this hotel a leading hotel in Tokyo.
