This property is on floors 45-53 (I think) of the tower so all rooms offer impressive views... with the jet lag, watching sunrise the first morning was an awesome welcome to the city.

The Ritz Carlton Tokyo is one of the nicest hotels I've stayed at (I travel frequently and have been to many top cities and hotels).It's expensive, but worth it. I've stayed at hotels that are over priced because of location or name. This hotel is worth its high price.I highly recommend paying extra to upgrade to the Club Lounge. The Lounge is exquisite, comparable to a very high end restaurant. The food and drinks they serve throughout the day are amazing. The only regret is that because it was so nice, I didn't explore as many restaurants throughout the city, because the Lounge was so nice.The room was amazing, everything from its size (so much larger than your standard typical hotel room). Larger than other Ritz Carlton's I've stayed at too. The amenities within the newly renovated rooms make this so luxurious. The bathroom is so spacious with massive double sinks. The beds are extremely comfortable.The hotel occupies the 45th thru 53rd floors. It's one of the tallest buildings in Tokyo. Needless to say the views are quite amazing. Both daytime and nighttime panoramic views of all the major sights can be seen, as well as Tokyo Harbor.I could go on and on, but I must mention the staff at this hotel are top notch. From the moment you arrive, and throughout your stay they treat you like you're the King & Queen. They go beyond what you would normally expect even at a top tier hotel like the Ritz. I had a early morning flight (day trip to Northern Japan for a meeting). The night before I asked the concierge simply how early I would need to leave the hotel for an early AM flight the following day. They then went 1-step ahead and since I had to leave before the Club Lounge opened for breakfast (and without me asking or requesting), they had coffee and breakfast specially brought to my room before I had to leave early. Their staff is clearly trained like an NBA defense (anticipate customers needs severs steps ahead). Stay here for the amazing experience you will have, you'll be glad you did, and I promise you will remember it for a long time as one of the nicest hotels in the world you've experienced.

Stayed here for a week recently on a business trip. A fantastic stay for many reasons. Location cannot be beaten, right at midtown with shops and restaurants close by, and the metro a very short walk. Some good nightlife options in Roppongi even if it is a little seedy. Staff and service are superb, everything is smooth and every issue promptly addressed. I needed an iron to press some clothes and it was delivered in minutes. View from the rooms is amazing, I was on the 46th floor and the large window provided a great vista.The room itself was large and comfortable, plenty of space, huge bathroom with separate shower and tub. Comfortable bed, and very quiet, I slept well.Very few negative points. Obviously this is Tokyo and things are expensive. The bar in the lobby is fantastic but beware the prices. I also had a few issues with the temperature in the room - it didn't matter where you set the temperature, the heating and cooling didn't seem to work and the room was a bit warm for my liking. Overall though a great stay, I hope to return.

I stayed 3 nights for a business trip in late August.Location is very convenient, in the middle of Roppongi area, close to the subway. The hotel is in the top floors of a tower with amazing views all over Tokyo.The room quality is out of this world, plush pillows, perfect mattress, powerful shower, beautifully furnished.The food in the hotel is extraordinary, beautiful breakfast spread in a semi-buffet setting. I had the pleasure of meeting the culinary team and they are great professionals.

Once I made the reservation they emailed me and asked if I need any assistants also provided fruitful information about the hotel & my stay, very impressed when checked in at the reception by all the warm meet & greet. Status match with SPG Platinum so enjoyed the Platinum benefits of Ritz Carlton Rewards too! Location is great convenient can walk & drive to anywhere fast, will definitely stay there again next trip and must try the Japanese Carlton Suite.

Ever since a colleague recommended in 2013 that I stay at the Ritz-Carlon, Tokyo, I have stayed here on every trip to Tokyo. I have also had other colleagues stay here. From the large, well-designed guest rooms and bathrooms, to the great views of Tokyo and beyond, to the very attentive, personalized service, to the tasty meals, to the state of the art fitness facilities and more, my experience is always exceptional. I also find the staff to be very personable and helpful. I would highly recommend the Ritz-Carlton to anyone who visits Tokyo.

Great location, close to the shopping mall, traffice convenience, warm and fragrant service,the front desk and house keeping helped me a lot. beautiful nightview,superb experience. 位置非常好，周边就有本土的大型商场，交通便利。服务热情周到，前台和客房打扫人员都热情周到。房间的夜景非常美丽，非常好的一次体验。

You only paying for the name " the Ritz Carlton " !!! too expensive for what you get. they are very very very poor when it comes to the breakfast buffet ..hardly anything to eat ! the lobby is located on the 45th floor and it's very small for such a hotel if you wanna compare it with other hotels ! the swimming pool only fits 5- 6 persons because it has lanes for swimmers coming and going . they only have one shower and one toilet for all guests using the pool and the fitness center !!!!!!!!! the Location is great . staff are extremely nice and professional. Rooms are super clean with great service.

We just visited Tokyo for the first time and the Ritz Carlton made our stay memorable. The view from every inch of the hotel is incredible, we didn't want to leave our room. The staff was incredible and they made us feel at home the minute I made the reservation.

The staff makes you feel like you're home! Excellent service! My job is 75%+ travel and every time I come to RCT I feel like I'm returning home. If you're looking for a hotel in the middle of it all without the bother of the busy streets...this is in the perfect location! And the shops and restaurant in the connected to the RCT are wonderful as well. Nothings too far...just a short walk to Ropunggi!

1. The view from room and restaurants are really awesome. 2. The room is also great. 3. As a top hotel in the world, the profession of front desk does not meet my expect. I checked in at first, and the room is not ready yet. I just go out for food. When I come back to take my room key, the front desk said that they did not see my name on the computer. After their checking again and said that my reservation is yesterday. I don't know what happened to their system. It really does not meet my expect and their hotel name, Ritz Carlton.

My family and I normally stay at the Ritz properties, Four Seasons, or Peninsula. This was our 4th visit to Tokyo and 1st visit to the Ritz. We were astonished at the level of service. The club level personnel were the best club level reps we ever had the pleasure to work with. There was food and drinks non stop and the level of detail was extraordinary. The downstairs restaurant (especially for breakfast) was amazing and once again all the personnel were so friendly and accommodating. We traveled with two young children and every day there was a different origami decoration on our table. At the end of our trip, our daughters felt so honored, they reciprocated the gesture and made a 'thank you' card for the restaurant staff (we had to go out that same day to buy the stationary because they were fixated on making the 'thank you' card). If you are considering a place to stay with family, look no other than the Ritz. Well Done!

OK it is expensive but this is the place to stay in for the ultimate luxury experience when you visit Tokyo. Located in Roppongi District starting at the 45th floor and rising up to the highest hotel in Tokyo with views that are unmatched in other luxury hotels in Tokyo. Our room faced towards Mt. Fuji. The rooms are spacious and include every amenity imaginable. If you can't find something you need or desire ask the staff--it will be acquired. The lunch and breakfast options are numerous. Staff, of course, are outstanding in their service, professionalism, and friendliness. The one complaint I have is that the English language TV selections are very limited. Wifi is free and very FAST. Parking is available but expensive. Two sets of curtains are electronically operated and the TV is a giant 50+ inch.

Outstanding service, amazing views of Tokyo, best location and very good food! Traveled to Tokyo for couples vacation and loved the Ritz. The spa is relaxing and the view from the hot bath is breathtaking. Located steps away from the midtown building with great restaurants, shops and the train station.

It felt like we had returned home when we arrived at Ritz Carlton Tokyo. All the familiar faces of concierges and chef came out to greet us warmly with huge smiles of welcome. After several unsuccessful attempts in finding a specific candy my granddaughter asked me to bring home, I asked Executive Club Manager Mr. Katori where could I possibly buy this candy as well as a certain Japanese soft drink. He sent his concierge Mr. Kashibo all around Tokyo looking for it and they surprised us with a bag of candy. When we were out of the room, the ice cold soft drinks were left on the coffee table with a most beautiful card with messages from all the staff. It was a most wonderful surprise and truly touching. They made our stay truly memorable and as always, outstanding.

We have stayed in numerous hotels in Tokyo and this one was by far the best. The rooms are beautiful and the staff are so accommodating. We stayed with our three children in one room. The Japanese are so kind and will do anything to make you feel at home. They brought in an extra bed and extra towels for us.Will stay here again!

Service was outstanding - room was great with incredible views. Travel around the world constantly - stands out as one of the best hotel anywhere in the world. Only fallback - a few more English speaking TV channels please.

ndal69
New York City, New York

review_body: The moment you walk into the Ritz Carlton in Tokyo the experience is unparalleled! From the staff who is there to greet you and anticipate your every need, to the warm and welcoming lobby environment there is no better place to stay while in country. I highly recommend this property.

Great city centre location and unbelievable service.Without hesitation we chose to stay again at Ritz Carlton Tokyo. The service and experience there is truly what you need when you go for holidays. Mr Suzuki and his team make you feel very special from the day check in. Wonderful access to Aoyama and Omotesando. Restaurants like Seryna and watch stores such as FPjourne are within walk distance.We have stayed in Ritz for quite a few nights this year. We are sure next time in Tokyo we will choose this hotel again, truly marvelous

I stayed at Concierge Level (53rd floor) for 5 nights and the room, the service, the view, the service, the food, the service and the lounge...and did I mention the service? were spectacular. The room was large, comfortable, and tastefully decorated (somewhat Westernized) with an amazing view of the city. The bathroom was beautiful and huge, with all amenities, including side drawers with pretty much anything you might have forgotten. Also, I have never stayed in such a quiet room. I never heard anyone outside in the hall or through the walls. The lounge was comfortable, including a number of rooms, and serving a variety of Japanese and Western snacks, drinks and light meals throughout the day. They even provide a high tea in the afternoons that includes sandwiches, sweets, and fresh scones along with your choice of tea. This is all, of course, included in the cost of your room. So, service. The staff was uniformly lovely--warmly attentive, quick to respond to any perceived needs, and very quick to learn your name and preferences. Check-in and check-out were totally painless. My group was seated with cold drinks at a table in the lounge while two young ladies came by and took care of all of the passport and credit card requirements. They returned with keys and our bags were in the rooms when we left the lounge. Housekeeping and turn down service were perfect. Random observations: never had to wait more than a few seconds for an elevator; televisions were huge but very limited with regards to English speaking shows (mostly news shows) so you might want to bring a few DVDs in case you get tired of the view; you don't need adapters for your electronics; the concierge can exchange dollars to yen and the exchange rate was very reasonable and it was very convenient. Two truly outstanding staff members were Leon (from New Zealand) and Paul (from Florida). Bravo gentlemen.

I stayed at the Ritz Carlton,Tokyo in March, 2016. The hotel is lovely and the service is outstanding. We were shown to our rooms by a woman in a kimono which is a nice touch. You can tell that the hotel pays a lot of attention to detail. Everything about the hotel, from the flower arrangements to the food presentation is lovely. The rooms are a nice size for Tokyo and very, very clean. Everything was immaculate.The concierge staff was extremely helpful to us. Maki Hasegawa, Mariko Ishikawa, and Keiko Hirasawa were the concierges who helped us navigate Tokyo. They were excellent and we are very grateful to them for their assistance. For example, my children have nut allergies and they contacted a restaurant for us to make sure it would be able to accommodate my children (it could not, so we were happy to know that in advance). They also arranged private transportation to and from the airport. The transportation service was very welcome after a long flight.We ate in the Hotel's main dining room nearly every day of our stay for lunch or dinner and it was delicious. The views out over the city are fabulous.I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

We stayed here at the end of our holiday for 2 nights.The check in process was a breeze. Very attentive and knowledgeable. Room (49th floor) was amazing. Walked in and all we could see is the amazing view of the city centre being the Tokyo tower. They were definitely staffed at the reception and it was great.Location is a business area, but is a short walk to Roppongi where its full of neon lights.

After reading many reviews, I chose the Ritz Tokyo for my week stay. It did not disappoint! The service truly is the best, they have amazing attention to detail. The spa, lobby bar, room service, and restaurants are all fantastic! The room is very spacious and the bathroom was beautiful. The location felt very convenient, it's a 3 min walk to the station with great access to midtown (nice mall and restaurants) and a Starbucks. I would definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone traveling to Tokyo! Thank you for the great stay!

Beautiful hotel; impeccable Ritz Carlton service; great choice of restaurants; views out over the city; central business location. Modern, comfortable, well appointed rooms. Fast wifi. Highly recommended.

Great hotel in the Roppongi Hills. Hotel starts on the 43rd floor -- room featured a great view. The hotel itself is modern and beautiful hotel. Although I heard that the Club Lounge wasn't so great for diversity, etc. That said, Ritz-Carlton service through and through -- excellent. The staff are friendly and attentive. The hotel is next to a subway stop. You can take it to most places in Tokyo within 20 minutes.

My wife and I have stayed at many of the Ritz properties all over the world and are platinum members. This was, by far, the absolute best ritz we have ever visited.The customer service is on its own level and the club level has immaculate views of the city and mount fuji. My wife enjoyed the spa and it helped ease the jet lag. We will definitely return.

Staying in this hotel was an amazing experience! The staff is incredibly nice and everybody is trying to make you feel at home. We arrived from Europe so we were quite jet-lagged. The hotel thought of this already and arranged an early check-in for us which was perfect. While we were waiting for our room, the staff offered us a cappuccino in the lobby while we could enjoy one of the best views of the city!In the meanwhile, Yukiko Isaka helped us to make a planning to explore the city. She knew exactly what we wanted, offered us the nicest things to do and made the best reservations. Yukiko is definitely the best concierge we ever had and she made our trip an unforgettable one! We will definitely come back to this hotel for her!Furthermore, all the staff members always greeted us by our names when we passed by which gave you a very special feeling. They even noticed that we would be late for our dinner reservation if they hadn't seen us passing the reception yet. They thought about everything and directly gave us a call with the question if they should reschedule the reservation half an hour later.Furthermore, I would like to give a special thanks for the house keeper Seketa. When she found a little part of an aspirin, she wrote me a letter which said: Please use this water. I wish you are getting better soon! This is so touch full! In addition, the rooms are amazing! Everything you need is there and the bathroom is the most amazing bathroom you will ever see! There is also live music in the lobby every evening which created a very nice atmosphere in the hotel.We as a family would definitely recommend this hotel and hope to come back soon!

I stayed at the Ritz Carlton Tokyo a few times before and my recent was just a couple weeks ago (August 2016). In short, all my stays at this hotel were absolutely perfect. I decided to write this review to let my fellow travelers know about how great this hotel is so they can have the opportunity to experience similar great time that I had here. It really made a big difference staying here in all my visits to Tokyo. Well, to give you a little background, I'm a frequent traveler and I have stayed at many hotels around the world. This year alone, I stated at multiple Ritz Carlton and JW Marriott properties in the States and in Asia. I consider myself to have a good attention to details and this Ritz Carlton Tokyo has been really significantly exceeding all my expectations since the first time I walked into the hotel. It is the best. The service was flawless. Everything else (location, bar, room service, room, etc) was as perfect. I tried to come up with things to criticize but I honestly couldn't find anything. I haven't had a chance to try the fitness center, spa or the club lounge yet but I will try to do so next time and let you guys know what I think. I believe all these will be as perfect as everything else in this hotel. I haven't had a chance to meet the management team in person, but I think the hotel's General Manager (John) has been successful in building such a great empire and a team who passionately serve their customers. I honestly couldn't think of any hotel I ever stayed at before where service could be better. Every little thing in this hotel shows how management has been paying attention to smallest details. The front desk personnel that I have been working with in my recent stays (Thea and Ikuko Sato) were both exceptionally professional and accommodating to all my requests. I actually realized that I come to Tokyo not to enjoy the city, but to enjoy staying at this hotel. I look forward to my next visit to Tokyo and definitely going to stay at this hotel. I actually just booked my next trip to Tokyo for this October and I already booked this hotel again for the whole week!

Located in Roppongi shopping área.It has the best view of the city.Staff is perfect and food lovely.Breakfast buffet it has everything! Rooms are really confortable but of course with all the compliments that a luxury chain like RC can offer.Don't hesitate on your next stay!

The quality of service here is exceptional, even by Japanese hotel standards.No fewer than 6 people helped me from my car to my room. They all greeted me by name as if by magic, and each step of the process anticipated every need.It was beyond expectations--I wasn't given directions to the subway station--I was escorted there by a staff member who engaged in charming conversation for the entire walk. I even received a beautiful Fourth of July dessert and card in my room when I returned from dinner, as it was a holiday back home.The rooms are 100% Ritz-Carlton. Immaculately clean, top-quality materials, and everything in its right place. This is the tallest building in Tokyo by some measures, so the views really cannot be beat.

Very impressed with the Ritz Carlton Tokyo. Compared to dozens of other Ritz Carlton and Four Reasons hotels, this location has the best service hands down. Especially their Club Level service was very impressive. Like many other reviewers I was very impressed with their Club Lounge experience. It exceeded my expectation. Excellent breakfast, dinner Hors d'oeuvre including cocktails, concierge service, complimentary press service etc. Worth spending extra money.Area to improve: Heat experience/using sauna facility costs $60 including tax. Way too expensive for a small facility. They should consider charging less for their gold members or club level members.

I have stayed with my family at this hotels this Summer for more than a month, whichmight seemed to be along time, but after the service we have received from the staff atthe Club Lounge and specially the Club manger Valter Valente himself who made ourstay very special. He went out of his way to set with us and help us finding out whereto go and how to get there whether in Tokyo or the surrounding areas. We have stayedbefore at the best hotels arround the world from George V in Paris to Mandarin Oriental hotel in New York to Four season at Los Angles were they are good hotels, but the service!!!!! don't compare.Sure we'll come back.

We were initially supposed to stay at the Grand Hyatt in Roppongi but we got our own dates mixed up and they were fully booked when we arrived, so we ended up booking a 4-nights stay at the Ritz which is just around the corner. Needless to say, being Ritz Carlton the we received 5-star guest services from the hotel and the quality of the rooms and the hotel in general were top notch. Unlike most other hotels in Japan, the rooms in Ritz were extremely spacious with two sink area and a separate bathtub and shower area in the bathroom. The view from the room we got was also phenomenal - we could even see Mount Fuji from the room. Location wise - it was perfect and situated in a quiet area, very convenient and one could easily walk to anywhere within Roppongi. I've made many trips to Tokyo in the past but this is definitely by far the best I've ever stayed in - with a hefty price tah of course!

it's the ritz-carlton at its best. they know u when u arrive n throughout your stay -- they remember your wants and show u in the subtle of ways. treating u like a special guest and friend. from the little touches in the room ( they remembered I love origami n had the most beautiful paper flowers sent up), graceful service in their club lounge ( love the kimono n modern costumes) , superb food ( + the views in the Japanese restaurant).stay ... and watch an incredible sunset, bite on the smoothest sashimi or just bask in the beauty of the hotel and its garden surroundings ... btw the national art center is just a beautiful stroll away and wonderful shopping just ... downstairs. what more can I say???#❤️

My Husband and I stay at this hotel two or three times per year for business. Recently we were able to bring our teenagers with us. The hotel employees , especially those in the club lounge, went out of their way to make our children comfortable. The hotel personnel always remember us upon arrival and make every effort to have our favorite rooms available. Highly recommend spending extra for the club which provides food and drinks all day. It is also nice to have a place to go to relax while looking at this lights of Tokyo.

If you've never been to Tokyo then this is where you want to stay. It is the perfect location and I spent a lot of time investigating other hotels. This hotel is located above two major subway lines that we used everyday. It's also in the top floors of the tallest building in Tokyo. To top it off the hotel is above an amazing new shopping center that has beautiful high end stores and restaurants. The staff is amazing and specially Leon in the restaurant that helped guide our everyday plans. He greeted us by name daily and knew our drink preference. This place is a must for anyone traveling to Tokyo.

Stayed here for in-town family gathering for 2 nights. Spent luxurious time with the best, friendly and kind service you can ever imagine. Their serving policy of "Ladies and Gentlemen Serving Ladies and Gentlemen" is truly amazing that I personally thought through my professional skills wondering if I am that professional at work?My parents in late 60s were extremely happy too.

Rooms: superb. The view from our 50th floor room was breathtaking - our room faced the imperial palace and gardens so we could see the Tokyo Skytree and a 180 degree view of downtown Tokyo. We didn't use the TV when there is such an amazing view to be had. Beds were comfy, pillows felt like soft down. Two bottles of complimentary water every day. Like all Japanese hotel rooms we've stayed in the AC is super quiet.Location: superb. The bottom of the tower is a huge shopping mall (Tokyo Midtown) and a short walk to another huge mall Roppongi Hills. Roppongi metro station is a few minutes from the hotel.Food: we only took breakfast - but wow how good was the Eggs Benedict... the restaurant looks out towards Daiba and the Rainbow Bridge as well as in the Skytree direction so you could spend all breakfast just gazing out of the window. If you didn't fancy one of the items on the menu then you should be able to find something in the rest of the breakfast buffet.In the lobby is a lounge area - very nice but somewhat pricy - approx 1300 yen for an orange juice.In summary a superb hotel - one of the best (and we've stayed in a lot of 5 star hotels).

Well appointed and excellent ambiance. All restaurants and the Check In "Lobby" are on 45th Floor. Rooms from 46 floors onwards. Breath-taking views of the city. Instead of the sea view, you can take in the buildings and offices and some green-lungs tofill in what most probably cannot be the scenario of your homes.
user_name:
Syed Ahmad I
Petaling Jaya, Malaysia

review_body: This is one of the nicer hotels we have stayed at. The service and the special attention we receive at this hotel was beyond compare. We arrived by airport limousine bus, and were greeted with warm towels and champagne. The registration area is on the 45th floor, but we were brought directly to our room on the 61st floor where the check-in took place. The staff (wish I could remember her name) made sure we knew how to operate all the buttons and before she left she had made reservations for us and we knew where specific stores were in the mall below and where to go to dinner. She also arranged our transportation to the pier on the following day. Our room was breath taking with a corner view of the city below. The bathroom had a marble shower area and mechanical toilet with heated seat and blow-dry/bidet built in. Complimentary teas and chocolate & bottled water. We enjoyed an excellent breakfast in the restaurant on the 46th floor which has a magnificent view. It was amazing - I didn't want to leave. In a nut shell. If you are in Tokyo for one night - splurge - it's worth every penny!

I can't say enough about this incredible hotel. The location is perfect, right in the heart of Roppongi, right next to the Roppongi subway station, which is a great hub to many neighboring areas.The hotel is beautiful with stunning views of the city. The rooms are spacious and beautifully decorated, and the fitness center, pool, and club level are also very nice!The service at the hotel was top notch - everyone is super helpful and friendly and can't do enough to help out their guests.The food and drinks are great, and we just had such an amazing experience at the hotel. We would HIGHLY recommend it as a top choice for hotels in Tokyo.

My partner and I stayed at the Ritz to celebrate our anniversary. The staff not only welcomed us like part of the family, but genuinely understood and helped us with everything we wanted, even providing things before we needed them! By far the best customer service we received at any of the 5 star hotels we stayed at in Tokyo! And, like the rest of the Ritz family, they welcomed LGBT travelers without question :)

This hotel is lovely. The location (midtown complex in roppongi) is quite good- shopping and dining at your doorstep. I do prefer to be closer to the jr yamamote line but transit here is fine- albeit a bit of a hike and lots of stairs. The hotel lobby is on the 45 the floor with stunning views. Our room was on the 48th floor w views of Shinjuku- could simply look out the window for hours. The room is decent size for Tokyo. Huge walkin closet which helps keeping baggage out of sight. Bathroom was large and well done. Service was impeccable. I was with my 4 year old and the staff was lovely to her. Swimming pool on the 46th floor, again with stunning views. Lots of rules for the pool- kids can swim only at specific hours, must wear a swim cap etc. but appreciated the pool and the fact it was free. Overall lovely stay. A bit expensive but not surprising being a Ritz property. If budget isn't a concern... A great option for you in Tokyo.

We arrived to Tokyo at 5:00 am in the morning, what a joy to have warm & friendly staff at the gorgeous Ritz in Tokyo greet us & whisk us to our insanely beautiful & massive room on the Club level which was ready for us! The club area was gorgeous & all food/drinks we had were fantastic. Such a treat to walk into there every day & have everyone know who we were & our favorite drink.The spa & fitness center were superb, spacious, new & fabulously well equipped. Loved everything about the Ritz Tokyo.

One of the best hotel in which i have ever stayed. Staff was amazingly friendly and helpful - particularly for a non-english speaking visitor. The room was impeccably furnished and cared for. The location was great to visit the area on foot or through subway. Overall, a wonderful experience.

This Ritz hotel had very beautiful views and the ambiance was amazing. The pool and gym are beautiful. Drawbacks were the behavior of staff trying to charge for every single thing that could have/ should be included. The driver car service was not included or even offered for a fee (as it is in London and other locations of the Ritz). When checking out, I noticed the bill was grossly overcharged for more room nights than were used or reserved (and not according to the confirmation), and for other items that were not related to us. It was not easy to a manager to speak to in English. Language barrier is a big issue at this hotel. I have never had a situation like this at any Ritz before. Eventually, a week later, they realized their mistake and the bill was settled.

The hotel is located above a massive shopping mall next to several large city parks. The service was top notch even if finding the entrance from the subway was a bit difficult. The daily breakfast buffet was extensive and delicious. The room was spacious and well maintained. I would return to this hotel.

I've stayed in various hotels in Tokyo but the Ritz tops them all!1 Excellent servicing from start to finish, and with their renovations recently completed, the club lounge is larger and heartier than ever. Staff seems very happy with their new club manager, Mr Katori, who works very hard in assisting everyone despite his status as a manager. The concierges, lead by Ms. Ito , go out of their way to listen to all of our requests ; it is simply a very relaxing and perfect place to stay and enjoy Tokyo.

I went with my wife on Sept. From the moment we enter the hotel, all the staff are very friendly. They all did their best to make our stay unforgettable. We got a suite room, the his and her bathroom was huge, the city view was amazing, extra room in the walking wardrobe. And the location is great!Bob Indrasasana

Whenever I come to Tokyo I find myself trying to find a room at the Ritz-Carlton before anywhere else. In Tokyo, your experience with hotels can be hit or miss because some of the "better" hotels have also been around for close to 70 years.The Tokyo Ritz is definitely on the new side, probably less than 10 years so it is very modern and very up to date. You can even stay in a Japanese style room that feels like a ryokan within the building. But most rooms are very similar to the more "Modern" Ritz rooms, not the old almost Victorian style.Unlike many places in Japan, the Ritz Carlton does not smell smoky. The ceilings in the lobby are quite high and the lounge next to the bar is strictly non smoking, as are the restaurants so in that sense it is family friendly. If you do happen to the visit, I specifically remember Miss Ogasawa and miss Ogawa as being particularly delightful and friendly. Wada And Sato in the bar are exceptional as well.

The lounge was way far from silence or zen, it's lively and fun with live music at night time. But once I got on to the elevator, the peace was there.I didn't know who's around our room- only knew by hanging newspaper bags. It's just pleasantly quiet all the time. We, travelers, sometimes, suffer from jetlag or fatigue from business or something... such a quiet and peaceful place relived and relaxed me a lot.The room was spacious with big window that allowed us to see the great view of Tokyo. The bathroom was also very nice, having 2 washbasins avoided "grooming time fight" who took bathroom or mirror first in the morning.The one set-back was in-room dining.The price was outrageously high AND food was mediocre. In general, I use room service a lot - this was disappointing. Amenities for kids were also elegant and high-end, I personally like something cute or more kids-like, but I guess it's because of Ritz...I appreciated one lady who put on Kimono and helped guests at lobby area remembered our kid's name called by name, which was very friendly and felt very special to us. Great job, Ritz Tokyo!
user_name:
nyay
New York City, New York

review_body: This may be one of the best hotels my partner and I have ever visited. Granted, we may be a bit biased because we splurged on the Club Level accommodations. Regardless, the hotel itself couldn't have been any nicer, from the location to the furniture to the staff to the killer views. We especially enjoyed the lounge for breakfast (the omelet lady is a gem!), afternoon tea, cocktails and late night snacks. Have we mentioned the staff? Paul, Michael, Valter and Mori were just some of the many friendly, professional and courteous staff members we encountered. We're not sure if it was the Japanese hospitality or excellent Ritz-Carlton customer service training -- but put the two together, and you'll have a magical visit at this hotel.

From the moment you pull up to the portico, the friendliest of team members greet you. Quickly you are whisked to the 45th floor where the lobby is bright and has some of the best views of the city. The check in process is smoothe as it took place in our suite. The rooms and service are impeccable. The hotel is situated on top of Roppongi Station which is convenient to get around the city and outskirts.We had Club access which was a highlight for the family. The food and presentations were tremendous. The staff were extremely accommodating and friendly.Overall a great visit and can't wait to return.

Had been on a business trip to Tokyo and decided to book this hotel because of the review and I am also a fan of The Ritz, from the arrival we were treat politely and professionally, it is a plus for Japanese people considering the fact that i have been to many countries. Once you are in the bath, which is looking to the widespread of the city, your mind tend to be filled with a lot of peace and energy. The way of designing this hotel is very details which every corner is sensational

We stayed at the Ritz-Carlton Tokyo for the first, then the last leg of our vacation to Japan. The Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo was a wonderful experience from the time we set foot on the property, until we waved goodbye 12 days later. The hotel itself is so beautiful. Our room was large and comfortable. We were told it had recently been remodeled. Every convenience is there for you, including a set of Japanese pajamas. We had some impressive cocktails at the bar several evenings. The bartenders were friendly and informative. The entire staff was professional, friendly, accommodating and available throughout both our stays. We were welcomed back warmly and asked about our trip to Kyoto. We were taken to our gorgeous suite that had a wall of windows with breathtaking views of Tokyo. The location of the hotel was very convenient. The train station was right outside the hotel. There were also two shopping centers and lots of restaurants and shops within walking distance. If you're looking for a luxury stay, I very highly recommend the Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo. It was perfection!

An amazing hotel with incredible views of the city and is centrally located. The staff are brilliantly trained and provid a high of service and skill, this coupled with a smiling face and a great attention to deal make it a wonderful stay.

Fabulous hotel in Tokyo with incredible views of the city, wonderful staff and room sizes that are much larger than you would expect in Tokyo.This is not an inexpensive hotel but if you can afford it, it is highly recommended. Great people, great hotel.

The Ritz-Carlton Tokyo is centrally located and has a spectacular views. The service is exceptional with friendly and helpful staff - that maintain respect for your space and privacy. The club lounge provides many services throughout the day and has the best location in the hotel for seeing the skyline.

I have now stayed at the Tokyo Ritz Carlton 5 times, and it has never let me down. Nowhere else have I experienced such impeccable and friendly service. The staff here really care, and it results in a fantastic stay every time. I dwell on the staff because, for me, this really counts a lot. But this is not to mention all the other factors that make the RC in Toyko hard to rival. It has incredible views across the city (lobby is on the 45th floor!). The gym/spa/pool is enormous, well equipped and luxurious, also with great panoramic views across the city (makes time spent on a running machine more enjoyable!). The location is also hard to beat - right in the heart of vibrant Roppongi, an area with a lot of its own attractions, and which is also so central that it is very quick to get to most other places you might want to go in the city.Hamish A

Just another superb Hotel by The Ritz Carlton family. This one in particular is one of the best I've ever been to. The service is beyond excellent and the staff couldn't be more friendly. Everything was perfectly organized for us and we truly enjoyed our experience here. Location is awesome and the metro is just below the hotel. Beautiful views of Tokyo from the lobby and the rooms. Truly an unforgettable experience !

I booked this hotel to celebrate my 30th birthday, as you do, and it was simply mind-blowing!People are extremely welcoming, looking after you as soon as you pull up in front of the entrance.The reception, which is on the 45th floor, is magnificent with amazing views over the city.The rooms are very specious, very large bathroom with walk-in shower, bathtub, toilet, double basins, Asprey amenities.Massive TV, Nespresso machine AND they provide Pyjamas which I really enjoyed :)Everyone is very attentive.The location is great as Roppongi is quite central. Furthermore the hotel is linked to the tube station so by going to the 1st floor you can access the Midtown Tower where Roppongi station is.The spa is amazing with steam room, sauna and hot tub.Everyone really looked after me so I can only recommend The Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo!

Spent a new year night at the hotel and got the room upgraded to a magnificent Tokyo tower view. The lobby bar is very stylish with a great Tokyo city view. Room service was great ! Didn't have time for a spa service but will definitely pay another visit soon :)

If you want to be pampered and be treated like royalty, then stay at the Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo. From the time I checked to the time I checked out, the staff did everything in their power to make my stay as comfortable and memorable as possible.

My wife and I are ruined after staying here. I'm not sure how anything else will ever compare to this hotel. I have stayed at other places around Tokyo and 5-star hotels almost everywhere...none come even close to this place. From the moment you step into the lobby and they greet you by name to the time you leave and they walk you out waving goodbye, you are living in a different time and place. Immediately,they recognized we were staying on the club level so they whisked us up there to provide us with cold drinks and a light snack while they checked us in. We got in late on a Saturday and stayed around Narita. We got to the RC about 10AM on Sunday just expecting to leave our bags and walk around until our room was ready...nope. (Another side note...I lost my credit card while I was checking in (completely my fault). They even had security view footage to see if someone had taken it. Nope. They felt so bad and it was totally my fault and it was obvious. I never thought they did it but I was curious where I dropped which I do from time to time. I felt bad at how bad they felt..haha)They escorted us to our room and showed us all the features in the room. Made sure we had everything we needed. Again apologized about my credit card...again I reminded them it was my fault and life goes on. Shortly after our bags arrived...We stayed on 52nd floor with the club level on the 53rd. We had great views and didn't even bother with the Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building since our views from our room, the lobby and club level topped the TMGB building. Our room was immaculate. (We are actually building a house and going to model our bathroom somewhat from our room there.) The bed was very comfy and the TV was massive which I loved watching even if I couldn't understand what they're saying. Prior to arriving, we had the concierge make us reservations at Sushi Masuda and the sushi restaurant in the hotel (name escapes me but starts with an H- I'll write a review of it separately). This was effortless...And I'll forever be in the concierge's debt for Sushi Masuda. We ate at the Towers restaurant on the lobby level for brunch the first day. They didn't have any tables available since we didn't have any reservations but were able to seat us within minutes. I had the perfect egg and it was just that...perfect. Leon, one of the hosts, chatted with us a bit and made the experience even better. We indulged in the spa and that was unbelievable. The massage itself was the hot stone and it left me weak knee'd from being so relaxing. The hot experience, locker rooms and pool were all really nice.Housekeeping and turn down service was impeccable. They even left me a note to let me know they poured me some water for medicine since they noticed I was taking some allergy medicine. We only enjoyed the happy hour once but ate breakfast there each morning on the club level. Best French Toast Ever....There was an incredible selection of Western and Japanese food. I seldom ate lunch after eating there and stuffing my face. The service on the club level was beyond impeccable. The staff quickly learned your name and whether you wanted coffee or tea or an omelette, etc. They always walked you out and said goodbye.The only disappointing part was packing up and leaving...Somehow they even made that special. The Japanese culture always seems to go above and beyond and yet somehow at this hotel they go above and beyond that. They do this not for gratuity since almost none expect it but they do it because they want to provide a higher level of service. The hotel does just this in so many ways. I wished I had remembered everyone's name who was so thoughtful and helped in so many ways. However, I'm not sure I would have enough room if I had.

We loved our week long stay at the Ritz Tokyo and had the most wonderful experience of any Ritz we visited before. The service is attentive and personal. You truly feel welcome and part of the Ritz family. The staff remembers your preferences for everything from which tea you like to which places you like to visit. The concierge Yukiko Isaka was always happy to help with reservations or recommendations for shopping, sightseeing or dining. She became our local contact for all we needed or wanted. We also highly recommend taking advantage of the taxi card the concierge can provide to any location you need to go as the cab drivers do not speak English. She saved us with the “taxi card” several times. The breakfast at the Towers/Azure45 is excellent. We honestly ate there every morning which gave us all the strength for sightseeing and shopping. Look for Inoue Yohe as he truly loves his job and will make sure your breakfast is perfect. We highly recommend you visit the Hinokizaka Japanese restaurant at the Ritz. The renowned chef Masamitsu Taima is a true culinary artist. Our unagi was delicious and the Kyoho grape blanc mange was like eating grape flavored clouds. The experience is unforgettable. The lobby Lounge bar offers great lunch menu. The bar manager, Maxime Bernard, really outdid all of our expectations. He is a delight. Our strong recommendation after a long trip (which we had) is to take advantage of the spa services. It is clean and private and luxurious. A perfect beginning to our stay in Tokyo. The rooms are spacious with enormous state of the art granite bathrooms. The views are spectacular. The hotel is located in the middle of most of the sights so it is very convenient. We made countless friends at the Ritz in Tokyo. Some of which we mention above. We miss them all and cannot wait to return soon.

TL;DR: Excellent service, nice and spacious rooms, good breakfast, beautiful views, convenient location. Can't go wrong.My wife and I have stayed at several other high-end hotels in Tokyo, but the Ritz-Carlton tops them all. In particular the service stands out, because it feels like the whole staff is there specifically for you. Everybody is very attentive and if you have a question or request, they try so hard to help you, that you almost feel bad for asking.Case in point: There was a little incident where a kid had vomited in front of one of the elevators and although the staff tried to warn her, my wife stepped into it when she came out of the elevator. She wiped her shoes and all was fine as far as she was concerned. However, after she returned to our room, 3 people from the hotel came by to apologize profusely and pick up her shoes to get them cleaned. It didn't stop there either, because when they brought back the shoes, they also brought a nice plate with chocolates and profusely apologized some more. It wasn't even the hotel's fault that this happened.Not only the service was great though.Our room, a "Tower deluxe room", was very nice, spacious and well maintained and had a massive 65" TV. The view was beautiful and that is generally true for the hotel, because it starts at the 45th floor of the building.There is a gym and indoor pool too and they were not very busy (at least not in the morning). In fact, the pool was mostly empty, probably because it has lanes and isn't really a pool where you'd hang out. As a service they can dry your swimwear and bring it to your room. We abused this service a little bit by occasionally handing them some manually washed clothes as well, but they never complained.Breakfast was good. Standard breakfast buffet stuff and you can order an egg dish (e.g., omelet), which is included. Try the "Perfect egg", it's excellent. For the hotel: One complaint I have is that by default you don't get a spoon, but oddly you do get two knives and forks. This makes no sense, because for almost every one of the egg dishes you need a spoon. This seems like a little thing and it is, but I found myself surprisingly often having to get one, which was annoying. (We stayed for 3 weeks, thus lots of breakfasts.)The hotel is close to several metro stations and there are always taxis on standby too, thus it's not something you have to worry about either. The hotel is next to a mall with (expensive) stores and a supermarket.In conclusion, we had an awesome stay and we'll be staying there in the future again.

They did everything right. The American Express Platinum upgrades worked and though Marriott status is not officially recognized they did everything they could to make us feel special. The rooms were lovely and spacious.I used the $100.00 amenity that came with the American Express Platinum reservation to have a massage and it was excellent. The spa itself is very attractive. The concierge lounge is elegant and gracious. They serve at least three different menus per day. The lady who makes the omelets at breakfast is not only charming ,but makes a really delicious omelet. They have a vast array of both Western and Japanese food for breakfast. The cocktail hour menu in the concierge is a bit boring since they do not seem to change it, but maybe they will after they read this review. They have a gentleman who cooks Japanese noodles and maybe he could vary that menu. The bar in the concierge lounge is free and generously includes champagne as well as sake and all other drinks!!! The view as good as you can get looking directly at the Tokyo tower.  The location is Roppongi is very convenient to all transportation and many activities.Both Sachiko and Ikuko were particularly gracious and hospitable in an attempt to make our family of seven happy! They really made a difference.!

I really LOVE this hotel, and best of all was the wonderful staff. From the front desk to the housekeeping staff to the bellman staff, everyone was there to make my stay a memorable one. I love their kindness, but most of all, the staff were very discreet and highly attentive. My room was spacious with tasteful décor. I highly recommend this hotel and everything about my stay was flawless! Thank you for such a pleasant stay!!

The Ritz Carlton in Tokyo is an unforgettable experience. The hotel is beautiful with a lovely executive lounge. The staff were welcoming, helpful, and gracious. I have stayed at other Ritz Carlton hotels in the US and Germany and they are lovely as well. But our experience at the Ritz Carlton in Tokyo far surpassed any other experience we had. We will return for future visits. The rooms were clean, the staff were sensitive to weary business travelers, they were extremely helpful in making recommendations about things to see and do in Tokyo and each evening we could return to the peacefulness of the hotel and its lounge. I would highly recommend the hotel - wonderful experience.

Just visited Tokyo on business and stayed at this lovely property. The staff was gracious. The room was large and perfectly appointed. Stocked with everything you could ever need, including pajamas. The restaurant served excellent Japanese lunch. The hotel is attached to a small shopping area called Tokyo Midtown. Starbucks is very close for morning coffee. Perfect experience!

Very luxurious, with a great staff who attend to every detail. There were cookies waiting in our room when we arrived. Views were phenomenal, even though we were on the less desirable side (we used points). We asked for a top sheet, and several people came up immediately to put it on, smooth out the bed, etc. Staff was excellent. A very pampered stay.The only negative is the lounge singer. Too loud, not very good, and the same thing every evening. For a hotel of this caliber, I don't understand the low level of entertainment.
user_name:
Colleen T
Rancho Palos Verdes, California

review_body: My husband and I stayed here last week. I was highly impressed with the level of service here. 99% of our interactions were with the club lounge and the service was outstanding. Food was top notch-it was so good it was hard to pull ourselves away to eat in the city, which says a lot. Taichi-one of the servers in the club lounge was such a nice person and very helpful. I hope he gets recognized for his hard work! Valter was also amazing and so kind. Couldn't get a better view then the one from our suite. Looking forward to coming back in the future. Other countries really have a lot to learn from Tokyo and it's amazing people!!

My husband and I had never been to Japan before and planned a big trip to celebrate our anniversary. To be honest, I was a little frightened about going to a country so far away and with a language that there was even a chance I was going to be able to speak... From the moment we arrived at the Ritz Carlton the AMAZING staff started to take impeccable care of us. They surprised us with a room upgrade, flower petals on the bed with a HAPPY ANNIVERSARY card and sign, gifts of the local baseball teams merchandise when we said we were going to the game, plus so many other THOUGHTFUL surprises and gifts. MASAKO, MARTA, LEON, PAUL, and the AMAZING IKUKO made our trip so wonderful and truly unforgettable.... oh and did I mention the property is wonderful??? Like I said in my title... cannot recommend highly enough!!!
user_name:
peterpamelarose
New York City, New York

review_body: We had a long and difficult journey from NYC to Tokyo not only because it took 21 hours but also because I am a mother still nursing. I had went on vacation without my 11 month old but thought that I could just pump milk out with out issues...boy was I wrong. After accidentally forgetting a piece of my pumping gear, it was almost impossible for me to pump milk out during the flight between NYC to Tokyo. Thankfully by the time I arrived in Ritz Carlton, the first thing that they were able to help me with was provide a space for me to pump even though I was too early for check in to our room. It was a painful experience but having the Ritz Carlton provide the accommodation to me sticky was such a relief. I was in Tokyo to visit my brother and sister in law. They live there, additionally I had wanted to catch the cherry blossoms before they were gone. It was my first time in Tokyo and I was so excited to see everything and eat everything. Walking and exploring was incredibly tiring but at the end of the day, I had a wonderful Ritz Carlton room with impeccable service to come back to. It was a wonderful stay. I didn't get club access but it was ok since there was a Starbucks that I frequented daily right outside of the Ritz while I was there. There were also plenty of food shops in the area and in the concourse. The best part of this location is that it's situated right above a train station so that if you'd like to leave you can just hop on the train downstairs and go anywhere. Rapponggi is filled with plenty of foreigners, many establishments will be able to speak English so it's easy to maneuver. It has a very bustling nightlife. I was pretty sad to be checking out at the end of 5 days but it was such a comfortable place I would definitely like to stay here again in the future.
user_name:
Soo W
New York City, New York

review_body: Nothing at the Ritz Tokyo is cheap. But if you're are looking for a property and staff that deliver 100% of what you want, you won't be disappointed. The staff is as charming and professional as any I've ever met and the rooms offer great views and ultra luxury comfort.

I stayed in Tokyo in two occasions: One in the Ritz Carlton in Roppongi and the other one in the Park Hyatt in Shinjuku. I wish I had selected the Ritz in both occasions. Between these two, at the Ritz the price is better, the service is much better and the rooms are a lot much better.First of all, the location is so much nicer at the Ritz. It's in a very nice mall called Plaza and you can walk with your suitcases from the Roppongi station to the hotel.The people at the entrance are very nice and welcoming, get the suitcase for you as soon as they see you, open the door for you, get the elevator for you and you always see people if you have a question. At the front desk the check in process is quick and nice and they offer your green tea or water or anything you might want to drink in the meantime.At the Ritz, the concierge that we talked to was great. She always got back to us as she promised. She always remembered our names and was helpful and very nice.One particular person at the breakfast buffet, Iida, always remembered how I liked my tea, always greeted me with a smile and was always paying attention to see if I needed anything even if she was not in charge of the table.At the breakfast menu, I never felt rushed and people were efficient without me seeing them run or unhappy (as opposed to the Park).The rooms are much more superior at the Ritz. Very spacious. Great toiletries. Great bathtub and shower. Nice toiletries. They give you as many as you want (as opposed to the Ritz when you have to ask constantly for them)The bar at the Park might be more famous; however the hosts were snobby and they gave me an attitude when I wanted to go in. And people smoke there. Honestly, it's more the hype of the Lost in Translation movie. I went there only once even if I stayed at the Park several nights because the acoustic was bad.The lounge at the Ritz has a great acoustic, awesome views and the service was impeccable. Nice live music. Nice food. Nice drinks.The rooms are in the high floorsI can only say that if you really want to feel happy to be back at your hotel, look forward to see your room prepared or going to the bar to get a drink and want nice, kind people, go to the Ritz. Always.

We have been to many of the leading hotels around the world and Tokyo Ritz Carlton is the best we have experienced. Their Concierge Mr. Katori and Ms. Ito are exceptional and truly outstanding professionals. They are eager and happy to help in any way. The rooms are beautiful and luxurious. The Club Lounge is excellent and Chef Kazue is wonderful. We will return again soon.

From the moment you step in the door and you are warmly greeted by the door man, you can tell this is going to be 5 star service. The hotel is immaculate, the staff is always there waiting to serve, and they cannot do enough for you. The rooms are modern, and large. We had a corner suite, and the views were some of the best in Tokyo. The real star of this property is the club level. Every aspect of the club is amazing. The food displays are always plentiful, and varied, and presented beautifully. Ando, Katori, Seiko, and Sugumori stood out as outstanding, but, it is not fair, to say that the entire staff wasn't also outstanding. We would have been happy to stay in that room all week. This is by far one of the best hotels, not to mention Ritz Carltons we have ever stayed at.

The staff made my daughter's birthday and graduation a very special occasion. I had asked for bottle of champagne, and they replied with a complimentary bottle, and also asked for photos which they laminated and arranged into a display complete with personal notes, chocolates and a special Japanese treat. And the sent a cake over to the restaurant where we were eating. The Club rooms offer fabulous views and access to a serene lounge. And, the concierges can do ANYTHING you ask.
user_name:
JILLOLAW
New York City, New York

review_body: The rooms are a little bit dated, although quite spacious. Check-in was rather fast although not particularly special, just felt like any other hotel. One of their Concierges was super rude and dry on the phone. Not helpful at all!! Whenever the concierge didn't answer the person at 'communications' was more helpful. The pool and jacuzzi are really good, you can also pay extra to use the sauna. It's a cool experience if you've never been to a sauna in Japan.

I wish I could give 6 stars for our stay as we were extremely satisfied. Reservation was excellently handled by Izumi, the corner room that was assigned to us by Hector's team was very big and with a very nice view, the welcome macaroons were truly appreciated. There were balloons and welcome presents for my 2 boys which really made us feel very welcome and special. Reika San was welcoming and she brought us to our room. The gym was well equipped and my family enjoyed using the swimming pool. We had breakfast at the Towers modern bistro, the food choice was excellent and of high quality. Extremely satisfied with our stay. Kudos to the Ritz Carlton Tokyo team, keep up the great work. We will definitely come back and will highly recommend this hotel.

We loved our stay at this hotel. We had booked two rooms and they upgraded one of our rooms to a corner suite. The suite was the most spectacular room I have ever stayed in. 47th floor with incredible city views out multiple windows in two directions. The rooms were spotless and had everything you could possibly need. The gym was the biggest and best hotel gym I have seen. We didn't use the pool but it looked really nice. We only ate breakfast at the hotel but that was very good. There were not a ton of options, especially fresh fruit, but they had everything we needed. Every staff member we encountered was warm and friendly. We picked this hotel because we were using points for some of the nights. It was our first time in Tokyo so I was unsure how great the location would be but it turned out to be great for us. Right next to a nice shopping mall and metro station. The surrounding area was really nice and we felt extremely comfortable walking around late at night. Lots of nice restaurants within walking distance too. It was one of the best hotel stays we have ever had. Can't wait to return to Tokyo and the Ritz!

I have stayed at this hotel once before (2014) and I expected great things. I was blown-away-impressed with the level of service and attention to detail this time around. I traveled with my daughter, who is not yet two, and the numerous things that the hotel did to make us feel welcome with a toddler was an experience I have thus far had nowhere else. From the diaper bin in the bathroom, to the welcome cookies placed in the room with my daughter's name on them, to the fact that every single front desk employee seemed to know her name...it was awesome. This is of course on top of the spacious rooms, amazing views, and overall excellent service that you normally expect from a Ritz Carlton. I consider myself a demanding hotel guest (frequent business travel, Platinum Marriott member) and this hotel stay was the best I can remember from a staff-service standpoint. I wish I could remember more names of all the staff that helped...some that I do remember: Leon in the Tower Restaurant was very friendly and very helpful, Yasoshima-san from guest relations left my daughter a thoughtful gift before our departure, and Rieka from guest relations went out of her way to let me know that if I had any needs the staff would attend to them. Thank you to all the others who made our stay so enjoyable. I will be back!

Ritz Carlton Tokyo , as always covered the basics superbly - comfy bed, good shower, good breakfast options, large modern room - even the chairs were comfortable! + the magic views - and excellent, attentive staff.No hesitation in coming back.Leon in the Tower Bistro was particularly attentive & efficient.

About as good as it gets. Best service and staff -- total luxury, they take care of everything you need. I can't recommend it highly enough. Second time staying here for work, but would stay here for personal trip as well. Do the club level If you can, it's worth it's weight in gold.
user_name:
Tuck12345
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed for 5 nights in a basic room with my wife and 5 month old baby. Excellent, clean hotel, large room! Separate shower and bath tub. Amazing service as usual. As requested, got a baby cot. Even got a nappy bin and baby amenities. Only thing they didn't have was a baby bath tub. Amazingly friendly staff. Wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Had a large room with a glorious view on the 46th floor to meet people for business. Everything was top notch. No wait for check-in; room was spotless with no mechanical issues; I was addressed by name throughout the hotel. If I were to make one recommendation, I especially liked the opportunity to smoke a cigar in the Bar off the reception. (They had a nice selection and good smoking tools.) If I were to make one suggestion it would be to consider expanding the breakfast buffet comparable to other deluxe Asian hotels.

My husband and I stayed at The Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo on the last night of a weeklong trip to Japan for my birthday. It was a great place to celebrate and end our trip on a memorable note! Our room was beautiful, and had an amazing view of Tokyo Tower, the bay and city. Special thanks to Ikuko Sato, who we had a great personal connection with, having all been Ritz-Carlton employees back in the 1990s. Not only did she give us a warm welcome and a lovely room, but we came home from dinner to find she also sent up a lovely selection of chocolates, balloons and champagne to help us celebrate! She embodies what The Ritz-Carlton is all about - ladies and gentlemen serving ladies and gentlemen. Thank you!

Everything about the Ritz Carlson Tokyo was wonderful. The room was beautiful, the staff wonderfully attentive and gracious, the views spectacular. The food was excellent. We dined in the Japanese restaurant and had lunch looking out over the city.

This was our first visit to Japan (for both my wife and me). My wife had scheduled a 19 hour layover so that we can get a taste of Tokyo and answer the question: Do we want to make an extended visit of Tokyo in the future?The answer is absolutely. And I have to say that both the staff at the Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo played no small part in making our decision.From the moment we arrived until the moment we were escorted to our airport transportation, the bell staff, hostess, and front desk worked together to make sure that our stay was smooth and any requests were quickly met. As we were being checked in, the front desk receptionist asked if we had plans for dinner, and made note of our requests, which admittedly limited our options since my wife is allergic to both shrimp and rice (rice being the big one here!) The coordination between the front desk and the concierge to provide us with dining options was perfect. The choices were all within the walking distance that we asked for, and allowed for us to experience Midtown as we wished.The view of the city from our room was absolutely stunning. So much so, that we spent several minutes just taking it in (and my wife taking pictures, as she is a photographer). The room was flawless to us, and quite spacious. Being Westerners, we had no issues with the size of the room.The only thing I was disappointed with was my not making note of the names of the staff I interacted with so that I could give them proper recognition. Something I will be sure to rectify upon our return.Even though we only got to experience the hotel for one night, the staff and location of the hotel have made it a "must stay" for us when we return to Tokyo. I would happily recommend this hotel to my family and friends.

I visited Japan for the first time with my son this May. The Ritz-Carlton made the experience memorable. The Club Level room is well worth the extra cost and was a highlight of our stay. We got to know so many kind and helpful employees (Valter, Matsumi, Kanae, Taka, Paul to name a few). The room was perfect, the bathroom spacious, housekeeping prompt, pool and fitness areas impeccable. The concierge services helped us daily to make our travels in a new culture easy and exciting. The food was unbelievable, including the fabulous omelettes by Kanae. The location was worrisome to me going in as it was not near one of the larger metro stations. This proved to not be a problem. Mastering the Metro was safe and simple and Rappongi station was steps away. My suitcase was lost by the airlines and the close proximity to Midtown tower for shopping and food options was so convenient. We booked a day trip to the Tuna Auction offered by the hotel and the guide and experience was tremendous. We loved our vacation. We loved our hotel. We loved Tokyo.

Located in midtown, this hotel is very prestigious with humble hospitality. Decoration is a tad "business" but with style. The view from the lobby at the 45th floor is breathtaking. Rooms are very comfortable and luxurious. Breakfast buffet is colorful and delicious. The staff is internationalAnd very helpful and proactive. Loved my stay in this hotel.

we had an amazing stay at the ritz carlton tokyo; great service, location and amazing rooms! service staff was gracious, attentive and aimed to please. we had arrived before check in and were given a suite to rest prior to our official check in time which was a nice touch!!the teppanyaki restaurant was excellent as well.....will definitely come back and stay here again...

This was our second stay at the Ritz Carlton Tokyo. Once again the property was fantastic. It is Clean, with well appointed rooms friendly staff and great food. The views of downtown Tokyo and Mount Fuji from this property are also spectacular.

I have stayed at this hotel several times and have not been disappointed once.The staff is excellent, the rooms spacious for the price in comparison (Palace hotel's rooms are larger) with other Tokyo 5 stars.The best burger (A5 kobe topped with Foie Gras and shaved black truffles with a Kobe truffle reduction sauce)I have eaten anywhere even if it is $100. Excellent wines at reasonable prices.One of if not the best Sushi Restaurants in Tokyo.Amazing Tepenyaki Restaurant.Great breakfast.Good spa (Palace hotel's Evian spa is amazing)They allow long term bag storage if you have a reservation in the future.No complaints.My first choice when staying in Tokyo.Prepare to be amazed by the view from the Bar as well.

We had a unforgettable experienced in Ritz Carlton Tokyo hotel. All staff were very friendly and accommodating. From the main entrance they will greet and warm welcome the guest. Most of all, they treat all guests from high profile to ordinary guest equally, based on my observation, which is really admirable from a five star hotel. So, you'll feel comfortable and feel like home. My husband loves to stay here again and we like to try club level service, next time.

Loved pretty much everything about the Ritz. Staff was great, everything was handled without problems. Room was excellent and spacious with an amazing view and the bathroom was probably the best one I've seen on my travels. Spa was pretty okay too, even though it does feel a bit funny to be charged for it as it's just a sauna really..

The staff at the Ritz-Carlton Tokyo know how to give their guests the extraordinary experience of a lifetime. I had my first-hand experience when I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton for six days in April 2016. The staff (to mention Club Lounge, Concierge, Front Desk, Housekeeping etc.) were consistently polite, friendly and warm – as such they welcome you with bows and pleasant greetings, making you feel that they are completely attuned to you. Their sense of hospitality comes across as genuine and this made me feel “at home”. My home-away-from-home was a Club Deluxe Room. The room was clean and had luxurious bathroom amenities. The generous view of the Tokyo skyline from the room will sweep you off your feet. If one could book a room with the Club Lounge access, I highly recommend this. The 5 daily food/beverage presentation is all worth it! Overall, this was my most wonderful hotel experience! I would definitely go back to the Ritz-Carlton the next time I visit Tokyo!

Hey, you can't really go wrong with a Ritz Carlton. Everything is outstanding. This place is on top of all of it (tallest building in Tokyo). All floors are high and you will indeed get high from the views. Location is everything and you're right there on the edges of Roppongi, and that's a winner. Only the Grand Hyatt can offer similar 5* access. Street level is a long elevator ride away, and the lobby is on the 45th floor. There is a lack in grand entrance what you should typically expect from a grand hotel. There is a certain feeling of disconnect, once you make it up there and the personality of the place is somewhat lacking. A lot of high value interiors, that don't really relate to where you are. The bar is a highlight. Not every barkeeper in Tokyo will fix you a a fresh on demand passion fruit Martini on the rocks without blinking.

I choose this hotel for 1 night and for a special celebration. Everything was perfect, i was impressed by the large room, beautiful bathroom and an amazing view ok Tokyo by day or night. Only one small thing the restaurant with Sushis was full and we cannot try it...We will come back there again for a longer trip.

This is a true international class luxury hotel. It does a lot very well, but I did have a few small issues.The public spaces in this hotel are ultra sleek and polished. The lobby bar, with its atmospheric jazz music, is a relaxing place to enjoy a drink. Similarly, my friend and I enjoyed the pool space with its hot tub. The location has both strengths and weaknesses. In spite of being my third visit to Tokyo, I didn't realise that Roppongi was such a red light district for foreign tourists. When we were directed to a wonderful Udon restaurant late at night by the concierge, I felt somewhat intimidated by the men on the street peddling strip bars. With that said, this area could easily be avoided by guests who are aware of this. If the red light area is avoided, this is a very central area to stay, and access to the subway is excellent (though not quite as wonderful as the Capitol Hotel, which is above two lines).I was a little disappointed with the room. Unfortunately, we unwittingly booked a twin room (which was our fault), however, we were assigned a room that was clearly designed for wheelchair accessibility in the bathroom. I was surprised we were not told this, and it made the room feel significantly less luxurious. The bedroom space was still modern and stylish. It felt new. I have to admit, we did not complain to the hotel about our allocated room, as there was a lovely view to Tokyo Tower that my friend liked, though I feel that the hotel would be aware that in giving a wheel chair access bathroom to non-disabled clients, the customer is likely to be somewhat disappointed.The market for luxury hotels in Tokyo is dense. Compared to the Park Hyatt, this hotel feels significantly less personable. The room was ultra modern, but felt less luxurious. The location is better than the Park Hyatt, but not as Central as the Four Seasons or Capitol Hotel. I would stay again if there was a reasonable rate.

Everything was beautiful, first class and immaculate. Club level is highly recommended especially if you have children with you. If they need breakfast or a snack or flexible hours for eating, the relaxed, smaller scale Club dining room (which is included with Club level rooms) is fantastic and worth the extra room price. The hotel starts on the 43rd (about) floor, so all rooms are high up! Spa/pool/jacuzzi is wonderful. Some nice upscale shopping (even a Dean & DeLuca!) and an interesting museum in the attached Galleria Plaza--get there by exiting out by the hotel "Deli" onto the Plaza. Not where taxis/buses arrive at the ground floor entrance.) There is a subway station right at the corner of the Plaza. Overall: Such a convenient location and the concierges are all so helpful.

I am a top tier member of marriott, starwoods, Hyatt and the Hilton Hhonors. Whilst the serviice is good but the rooms are simply not up to mark and in need of a makeover. U are better off staying at the grand hyatt nearby or the conrad which i have stayed before. The only benefit I got was a upgrade to the Tower room which is the same room as the a basic room with a view of Tokyo tower. No lounge access, no drinks voucher and not even complimentary breakfast.So I cut short my stay and checked out after the first night for the Grand Hyatt since loyal members are not recognised in this hotel.

We had a great family vacation here. Great rooms with incredible views of the city. Top service, great gym, great spa, awesome food and views. This might be my favorite hotel. The concierge service was also very helpful. Close enough to the subway that you can easily get to where you need to be. M

What a great hotel. Beautiful rooms, the best views in town, amazing staff and everything is so clean and nice. I would recommend this to everyone who wants a special treat while visiting Tokyo. Absolutely magnificient.

We are a family of four, with two teenage boys. Spent two nights in January on the return from a ski trip in Hakuba. We have stayed in a few RC's around the world and this one takes the lot!! The location was fantastic for us, easy access to transport and lots to explore at night. We always stay in a club room and it's absolutely worth every cent. Our room was fantastic, very large for Japan. The view breathtaking. The bathroom particularly large. The pool area is wonderful and I had a massage in the spa which was excellent. Club level great, excellent cocktails! Limited gluten free options, but that was the case across most Japanese hotels in my experience. Thank you for making our first trip to Tokyo so wonderful, we will definitely return and recommend to others. The concierge on club level, so helpful with advice for getting around and accommodating us when our flight was delayed.

We have stayed at many fine resorts and hotels, but for a hotel in a big city experience, nothing comes even close to the Ritz-Carlton in Tokyo. The view, room, food, amenities and customer service are absolutely incomparable. Great fitness center and spa, incredible breakfast buffet, views from the tallest building in Tokyo, incredible location in the Roppangi district, easy access to subways and walking distance to so many sites, concierges who are amazing at making things happen, customer service which is second to none. I will stop there because I could go on forever. We cannot wait to plan our niece trip back to Tokyo and we would never stay anywhere other than the Ritz-Carlton after this past experience. We cannot recommend the Ritz-Carlton Tokyo highly enough!!

Very Nice property.Positive points :- all staff are welcoming- Rooms are large- Wifi connection is good- connected to a shopping mall, which has 24hrs supermarket.some negative points :- need to change elevator at the reception floor to go to the room.- jacuzzi , steam room usage with a fee and not considered part of the gym.wish, if Halal food was served in the hotel, it will be perfect.
