I spent 4 nights at this property for a business trip. The location is fantastic as it is close within 50 meters of the metros do also close to a small park and museums. Staff is very cordial and no request was too big for them. The room was impeccably clean. The hotel has great restaurants (see separate reviews). All in all a very pleasant and comfortable stay.

Our stay was amazing, sadly it was only for 1 night! Rooms and views were spectacular. We had a corner room on one of the top floors. As soon as you enter you have amazing views of the city, and if you are lucky Mt. Fuji. If you are able, I highly recommend the club level. They offered 5 meals throughout the day in the club lounge. The club lounge is on the top floor and offers a more intimate setting. Food and service was fantastic. Staff were all friendly, definitely one of the nicest hotels in Japan. The Ritz-Carlton is the definition in luxury.

Booked in for Hi Tea... oh my... heaven on the 45th floor of the Ritz Carlton. Very elegant, given a choice of teas for my daughter & coffee for me (not a tea drinker). Food to die for, fantastic service. Food platters weren't a full as others I've had but was pleasantly full by the end.

Stayed there in March for 3 nights. Great room with the amazing view of Tokyo tower, excellent location, easy access to major tourist spots, multitude of dining and shopping choices. Service is superb and club lounge is a must!

We stayed here during the recent cherry blossom season. It was our second time staying here - this first time was in 2008 - and the hotel is consistently the best luxury hotel in town. Major strengths: consistently superb and gracious service, serene decor, amazing views of the city, and extremely large and well-appointed rooms and bathrooms. The daily breakfast buffet was a highlight of our mornings. We absolutely love this hotel and the convenience of being in the Tokyo Midtown area.

This hotel is amazing! We came for a room on the spot as we were booked in another hotel (which we didn't like). The staff went above and beyond to accommodate our every need. They notice small things, like what we liked for breakfast and they brought bigger portions to our table. They noticed the things we liked to do in Tokyo and brought us small gifts representing these activities.Special Thanks goes to Katayama from the reception. We enjoyed our stay so much, we are definitely going back..

I took my wife and kids on their first trip to Tokyo. The Ritz was perfectly situated for every adventure we had planned, and an amazing oasis of relaxation when we returned. The view from our room was mesmerizing. The entire staff did a superb job of making us feel welcomed. We experienced service excellence on a very personal level by staff who would surprise us in special ways.

From the minute you arrive at the hotel, they make you feel like you are Superman.Unbelievable hospitality; Huge rooms with excellent views, Perfect beds; expensive but excellent restaurant; best breakfast ever (mmmhh the eggs Benedict...)Concierge service, reception, room service........top of the top.This not a 5 stars hotel, it is at least 6 or 7 stars

My friend and I toured Tokyo during the cherry blossom festival this spring. Most hotels were sold out, so we used points and switched hotels each day. The Ritz was our favorite hotel. The staff was beyond outgoing and helpful. The room was amazing as well as the views.The spa was beautiful too.

The best way to describe the ritz Tokyo is impressive even for Japanese service standards! The service begins weeks before arrival when a concierge works with planning out a most memorable stay! They were able to prepare a unique celebration including a small gift, fresh fruit and there very own house champagne! I was wowed by the service and most personal introduction. It feels like your own little world up here above the rest of Tokyo.

conveniently located in roppongi for all your activities, a hotel that takes great lengths to know you and your needs. it's like Cathay Pacific knowing every one of their diamond membership. the furniture is a little dated, but still comfortable and clean. i will stay here again.

The amenities were outstanding; the room was amazing; restaurants delicious and staff top notch. Everyone remembered my name when they saw me. I was also given nice mementos (yummy chocolates and some tea) in appreciation for my staying with them and eating at the lovely restaurants every day!

I recently stay at the Ritz Carlton, Tokyo, on business. I was there for 6 days. This was my second time staying at the Ritz, and I have to say...this is one of the nicest hotel stays I've ever experienced. My most recent stay was as perfect as my first. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and exquisitely maintained, the location is awesome, and the service is always 5-star (they even helped to secure a reservation at Sukiyabashi Jiro -- which was amazing!). I also really enjoyed the Club level service. I've attached a photo of the spectacular view from my room. I can't imagine a nicer hotel in Tokyo.

I am a Lifetime Platinum member with Marriott with over 1,100 actual room nights at Marriott properties and I have the opportunity to travel around the World, and I can say that the Ritz-Carlton Tokyo may be the best hotel I have ever stayed in. The level of service is unmatched. The staff is accommodating, extremely friendly and it was impressive how quickly they learned your name and call you by name throughout the visit.The room itself was large with all amenities you could possibly need...a great bathroom with stand-alone rain shower, large TV, comfortable bed, comfortable reading chair and great work space if the need arises.The property is also in a great location in Midtown Tokyo within Roppongi. There is also a Mall attached to the property that has a grocery store in it, along with a 7-Eleven, so it is also very convenient.All is all, a 10 out of 10 for sure (or 5 out of 5 as the case may be).

All that you want - and you'll get it at Ritz-Carlton in Tokyo! An amazing view of the city, the room was unbelievable and the food was fantastic! This is THE place to be when traveling to Tokyo......

Outstanding lobby with many high quality restaurants. We recommend the sushi bar and the Omakase menu. The food was amazing. One of the best sushi we ever had. The staff made us feel at home. Special mention to Okabe who greeted us every morning at breakfast. On our last day she made an origami for our son. We will certainly come back. We very much enjoyed our visit.

I feel very lucky that I have been booked in this marvellous hotel . Extreme friendly staff, really big rooms and a perfect service . And yes of course the view ! As you can see, I am normally not writing reviews but in this case I felt I have to say how great this hotel is .Don't forget your bathing suits as actually there is a big pool, with of course a breathtaking view over the city (46th floor)Next time I am in Tokyo I will explicitly ask for this hotel .

We had a marvelous stay in Tokyo at the The Ritz-Carlton hotel. Try to stay on the club lounge. My room recommendation is 5105. Thank me later. Beside the general service and views, what makes our stay unforgettable was the hotel staff. I would like to take this opportunity and give a big thank you to lounge supervisor Hideko, lounge bartender Michael and housekeeping Itoh. We made some great friends. Wonderful people made all the difference. Personalized greeting card from the hotel GM was a nice touch. Next time in Tokyo, i will be at the Ritz again and will be recommending it to everyone.

The property is exceptional - from the location in Roppongi (specifically in Tokyo MidTown which has everything!) to the lobby, the rooms etc. The service is perfection and you will be made to feel special. We stayed as a family of four (in two rooms) with teenagers. It's hard not to be impressed by the views in the lobby - however they are even more stunning from your room. The lobby has a very adult and business atmosphere, perfect for a drink and a meeting. I can't say enough!

One of the top Hotels not only in Tokyo but anywhere. Located at the top floors of the tallest building in Tokyo the quality of this property matches the outstanding views. The stunning lobby with live entertainment most evenings also includes several outstanding Restaurants. Rooms are beautiful and elegant and quite large for Tokyo. All have outstanding views but try to request a Tokyo Tower or Mt. Fuli view Room. Excellent spa and health club with a large swimming pool. The Club floor with 5 food presentations daily is well worth the additional cost. The Hotel is directly connected to an outstanding shopping center with Japanese and Western shops and a wide variety of restaurants. Several subway lines are in the Hotel Basement.However what really sets this property apart is the wonderful staff. There is always someone willing to help in any way possible. Friendly and caring the whole staff is truly a wonder.

Room was very clean and comfortable. Working space was well appointed with electrical outlets and USB outlets. The bathroom was very clean and in top quality shape. The view from the windows was excellent as it overlooks all of Tokyo.

Top notch across the board. Super friendly and helpful staff. They did everything they could to make our stay more enjoyable. This is a world class hotel and I will definitely be coming back the next time I am in Tokyo!

We stayed at the RC Tokyo at the end of Nov. 2015. I travel to Tokyo once or twice a year but this was the first time to stay at the RC Tokyo.The room was well appointed and the size was adequate. The hotel's location in Roppongi is convenient although if arriving by subway or on foot, access to the lobby and rooms can be awkward.The room size is decent and on par for upscale western style hotels in Tokyo.Personal interactions with the front staff were good and people courteous an pleasant. Having a greeter in the front / lobby was a nice touch.We had a late night flight leaving Tokyo and at checkout the front desk manager on duty (Ms. Sato?) allowed us to use part of the Spa Spa to clean up and change clothes before our flight. The gesture was truly appreciated.There were some issues though:Two different rooms had mold problems in the shower area. While the problem was dealt with swiftly in both cases, the second instance was somewhat downplayed. The front line staff were helpful and apologetic but we never heard from upper management which is disappointing for a hotel of this ranking with a problem that appeared systemic.The concierge staff were helpful and friendly and in particular my face to face interactions were pleasant. Several days prior to check in I emailed the concierge team for reservations and did not get a reply on that issue. When I enquired, they said they had not received it even though we had several interactions via email.Also, one of the reservations required advanced information to be submitted. I went down to the concierge desk and submitted our preferences but the next morning I got a letter stating that they were still waiting to hear from us.Bell staff were friendly at checkin and bags were delivered without issue. Upon checkout the bellman didn’t bring a cart and was having trouble dealing with all the items since he was alone. I saw suit coat getting crushed as he it tucked under his arm.When at the lower lobby to grab our cab to the airport, the bell staff seemed unhappy that we were using Uber. We were having trouble contacting the driver to ensure he was coming the the Ritz Carlton rather than another location at Midtown.On the last day at the hotel, I had a business breakfast at Towers. My associate arrived before me and asked for a window seat to which he was answered in the affirmative. We met at the front and proceeded to Towers to be told there were no window seats. My associate owns a business nearby and frequents the RC Tokyo so I was surprised his request was overlooked.The food was fine but for breakfast I think I’d give the edge to the Park Hyatt Tokyo.

From the moment we arrived at the motor entrance of the hotel, it was apparent that this was going to be a very special stay. I have stayed in a few very nice hotels in my travels but the Ritz-Carlton Tokyo is truly in a special class. First of all, the rooms all have magnificent views because the hotel sits atop one of Tokyo's tallest high rise buildings. Secondly, our room was huge by any standard but especially in a city the size of Tokyo. The room was also beautifully appointed, with electric controls for the window curtains at the bedside, a bathroom with two sinks, a bath tub, and a separate stall shower with an overhead rain shower head and two separate and large closets. In a luxury hotel, though, it's always about the people who work there and I have never been treated so well anywhere. People were always interested in our day and wanted to help us get the most out of our stay. As first-time visitors to Tokyo, we really appreciated this and took full advantage of it. Everyone had good recommendations--not just the concierge staff but literally everyone with whom we spoke. Whatever we wanted or needed, the staff was there to help. When I asked about views of Mt. Fuji from public areas of the hotel, I was given elevator passes to the top floor exeuctive club lounge for breakfast the next day. (By the way, this was undoubtedly the very best club lounge I have ever experienced. At breakfast, they had a chef-manned egg station; when I asked for orange juice, I got fresh-squeezed juice, a real luxury in Japan.) The spa, gym and pools take up the entire 46th floor of the building and are very well appointed. And, the hotel sits atop two subway stations and a high-end shopping mall that also has a few moderately priced restaurants. The restaurant we tried in the hotel, Towers, was excellent, too, and they have live jazz in the lobby every night, something I really appreciated after a long day of touring. When we checked out, we were accompanied all the way from the 45th floor lobby to the 1st floor motor entrance by no less than 5 members of the staff. I have never had such a warm and fuzzy feeling about a hotel stay in my life. The place managed to be luxurious and elegant without ever being stuffy. I can pretty much guarantee that you will like the Ritz-Carlton Tokyo.
Sophisticated atmosphere / great view on Tokyo / perfect food to please yourself and your guest .So relaxing thanks to some great service as well from all employees .My latest heart break in Tokyo !

This hotel is clean, well decorated and elegant. My family and I stayed for 3 nights at this hotel and it did not disappoint. The staff were amazing and went above and beyond for my family. The view from the hotel is amazing. Next time I come to Tokyo I will definitely be staying at this hotel! Wish i could give 6 stars!!!

Echo others comments about this hotel. It is superb. The staff are amazingly friendly and helpful throughout, but shout out to the front desk and concierge. The rooms are so well thought out and comfortable. Little things like great soft towels are appreciated. Fast internet in room. Also, great location to walk around (I found a fun little ramen shop out the hotel to the right about 1km) and easy access to mass transit. Only slight negative was the incessant smoking in the bar. Hard to find a place to enjoy a fantastic manhattan and breathe comfortably. Time to ban smoking inside the hotel completely.

Great convenient Location! Spacious and tastefully done room, knowledgable, helpful, professional staff, fantastic and quality restaurant selections, Club lounge breakfast buffet was fabulous. Everything was just perfect! Couldn't find any fault, will definitely return.

The best hotel I have ever stayed in on business, possible ever in 20yrs of traveling the world. Would love to go back one day and a big thank you to Aki-San for lending me a bike to cycle round the city, wonderful staff and great views, see attached, best wishes Jason Turner

Fantastic hotel, great rooms and service, shame for the pricy lounge with poor level of musicians and bad style of music not suited for this kind of hotel, nice view and service. In the heart of Tokyo nightlife

This hotel is luxurious, relaxing and near everything you could want. The staff is courteous, knowledgeable and well mannered. I really can't fault this hotel in any important way. The rooms are spacious, clean and well-appointed. The restaurants in this hotel are top of the line. it was exactly the place to stay for my business trip and hope to return in the near future. A+

Full disclosure: I do not normally stay in 5 star hotels, however, I had been backpacking for 2 months and was looking for a nice place to stay in order to treat myself for my last couple of nights before returning home to the UK.From the moment that I arrived to the moment I left I have never received better service. The attentiveness of the staff was second to none, they also all spoke extremely good English. The main attraction of this hotel, however, is the view. I stayed in a room on the 49th floor with a view of Mt. Fuji and on a clear night the sunsets are spectacular.In my time here, despite being right on the doorstep of Roppongi and the the restaurants in the lower levels of the tower, I ate in the hotel restaurants on both nights, first at Towers and secondly at Hinokizaka Teppanyaki, the latter being amongst the best meals I have ever had.All in all a great end to the holiday.

The Riz Carlton Roppongi is an outstanding hotel for business or pleasure. Well located in the center of midtown, the property is well kept with spacious rooms. The pool, health club and spa are all top notch. This stay I especially appreciate upgrades and expansion to the club lounge; the service was exquisite and the upgrades make the lounge feel spacious and modern. Highly recommend this property.

My wife and I really enjoyed this hotel. The rooms are large (especially for Tokyo) and well appointed. The staff and service was excellent. We especially enjoy the views of Tokyo from this hotel.We had a club room and took full advantage of the club lounge. We also used the concierge service for getting around the city. Both provided excellent service.We arrived at Narita around 4:30 pm on a Thursday and caught the express train to Tokyo Station. We then took a taxi to the hotel. The taxi took around 15 minutes. A very easy way to the hotel.

The Ritz-Carlton Tokyo is arguably the top choice for those wishing to stay near the Akasaka / Roppongi districts. By RC standards, this hotel is definitely top-tier. Even the entry-level rooms are spacious and modern, with all of the amenities one would expect from a luxury hotel in Tokyo. Service is impeccable, if slightly sterile, and decors is somewhat on the minimalist side by RC standards - a big plus compared to some other properties in the chain that are downright gaudy.Entry-level deluxe rooms don't skimp on space - they're 52 square meters in size, which drawfs entry level rooms in most other Tokyo luxury hotels.A real highlight of the RC Tokyo is its club lounge. It's huge, giving it a less crowded feel, and it's well staffed such that it is not difficult to draw the attention of staff there. It's gorgeous, with great food and a nice bar. If you can get club access, you should definitely do so.There are many tier-1 luxury hotels in Tokyo - Aman, Peninsula, Mandarin Oriental, Shangri-La and the Four Seasons come immediately to mind. In most cities, RC would be a notch below those brands, but not in Tokyo. A great option, including for leisure travellers.

The hotel is located in trendy Roppongi, next to Tokyo Midtown, a relatively new (10 years) shopping complex and within a few hundred meters of two subway stations. You check in on the 45th floor, which also offers a very nice and very large lounge serving (rather expensive!) afternoon tea and a fantastic bar, where unfortunately smoking is allowed and prevelant..... Our room was spacious, had a great view over Tokyo (especially at night) and a very nice bathroom with a large shower, regular bathtub and two separate sinks so wife could spread her cosmetics around. :-)We really enjoyed the pool and the sauna, both spacious and again with nice views over Tokyo. Be aware so that they charge for the "heat experience" (and add a service charge and tax). Service was great all around except at check-out where it took twenty minutes from calling the bellman counter to the luggage being delivered at the entrance... :-(

For those looking for a topnotch hotel in Tokyo, the Ritz Carlton is hard to beat. Beautiful, luxuriously appointed rooms, astonishing views, amazing service, fantastic central location. There is nothing not to like. And for an extra special experience, its worth upgrading to a Club Room which gives you access to the Ritz Carlton Club on the top floor with draw dropping views to Mt Fuji in the distance.

There are not enough superlatives to describe this property. The location in the Roppongi neighborhood of Tokyo is absolutely wonderful for exploring and has very easy to use access to Tokyo mass transit. The property itself is simply gorgeous. The hotel lobby is situated on the 45th floor of an incredible office and retail space complex called Midtown. What makes Ritz Carlton, Tokyo as special as it is, however, is its staff. They cannot do enough for their guests. The treatment that we received was as good as it ever gets. At luxurious properties, one expects a courteous and knowledgeable concierge staff. At RC Tokyo, you will get far more than that. They seem to know what you want before you realize it yourself! Same for the front desk who are equally wonderful. Traveling far from home isn't always easy. The only difficult part about staying at the Ritz Carlton, Tokyo is having to leave. The ladies and gentleman of the RC Tokyo exhibit professionalism at its highest form and they should all be so proud of the work that they do.

Stayed for 3 nights and was expecting amazing service - was very unimpressed. The bar staff on the 45th floor were disinterested in helping us, when we ordered wine they said they had run out of this type but didn't offer alternatives, speak limited English and the menus have different prices. Rang and rang for a bell boy to retrieve bags - no answer when I bought this up at checkout they didn't care. They did to be fair once I complained refund the service charges and the beer etc my husband had. Breakfast on the 45th is worthwhile

The Tokyo Ritz sits on the top eight floors of the Tokyo Midtown Tower which rises to 53 stories. The rooms are lovely and large by Tokyo standards and have views over the city to Mount Fuji or over the Tokyo Tower. Located adjacent to a new luxury mall the hotel is convenient to upscale shopping as well as a plethora of restaurants. The concierge will happily arrange sightseeing and dining reservations. The concierge lounge was comfortable and the drinks plentiful. During our stay there were several celebrity sightings by my son and husband. Definitely a first class property with the service to match.

This is the first time I am staying in a Ritz Carlton. I must say that I am very satisfied with the services provided. When we arrived at the hotel from the airport, the concierge greeted us with our names. It never happened with other hotels. We stayed in a deluxe room with an amazing view of the Tokyo Tower and Tokyo Bay. Breakfast was also excellent. This is certainly a place we recommend and would visit again.

We stayed at RC Tokyo for a week in Jan/Feb. I'm a RC platinum card holder and not easily impressed (see my other Tripadvisor reviews) but I can easily sum up our stay at this hotel in one word: perfect.The hotel, which occupies the top eight floors of the Tokyo Midtown skyscraper, performs excellent on all levels: from checking in, concierge, bellboys, lobby bar, spa and workout facilities, location, in room dining and so on. Take your pick.I would go so far as so say that the hotel probably holds the gold standard for hotel service for all RC hotels worldwide. From a business perspective, you cannot help but to admire a business organization that performs so consistently well across all levels.That takes a great management team and first rate staff members. If only all RC hotels had been run like the RC Tokyo. Can't wait to stay there again the next time we're in town.

this is my second visit to the RC in a span of three years. I love the vicinity and wanted to give this hotel the benefit of the doubt. But on both occasions I was given a room designed for the ability challenged. usually I would have no issues with this but the room does not have a shower cubicle and to the basins are very low. the shaving mirror is not designed for someone standing up. the checkin staff who is v friendly did not mention the room is for the physically challenged, merely saying that the king size bed I requested wasn't available, thus offering a double bed which I have no issues. I was trying to think of a reason why they would accord this special treatment to an able bodied person but I can think of no reason: the last time I checked in at 6pm and this time at 2:30pm so availability should not be an issue. the common courtesy should be to ask if the guest would mind such a room and this was not offered. I have stayed in many top hotels in Tokyo and visit this amazing city almost monthly. without doubt this is the least of my favourite and will henceforth avoid it.

Tokyo is an impressive city with a Japanese skyline - it feels so Japanese. Ritz isn't especially Japanese, but the hotel never fails in satisfying me! The impeccable service, the stylish rooms, and the feeling of entering my room after a long walk in Tokyo is always an exhilarating one!I hope I will be able to return, but the world is so full of possibilities!

The Ritz Carlton Tokyo is located on the top floors of Tokyo Midtown tower, one of the newest skyscrapers in the city (floors 45 - Lobby to 53) offering dramatic 360 deg views over the city. My room had a direct view across the city and over to mount Fuji.The location is ideal, at the heart of Roppongi and links to one of the newest luxury malls in the city that includes international niche luxury designers stores and a gourmet food court (Japanese and Western including Maison Eric Kayser).The standard rooms are very spacious (approx 40 m2) and furniture/decor features are typical of a Ritz Carlton: comfort and classicism. Each room has generous amenities and a complimentary expresso machine.A complete buffet or a la carte breakfast is served at the 45th floor. A large and well equipped gym (available 24/7) and a big lap pool (open from 7 am to 10 pm) are at the 46th floor, alongside a spa.In room dining is timely and delicious.Hotel staff is remarkable, at all levels and roles.A wonderful experience.

The location of the hotel is ideal for those guests who would like to explore the culinary establishments in Roppongi, there are a great number of small eateries within walking distance offering different types of local Japanese cuisines. The services rendered by the hotel, from airport meet-and-greet to hotel reception, concierge, and from restaurants to spa, were outstanding. We were impressed by the friendly and welcoming atmosphere inside the hotel with lots of smiling faces around. The guest room was spacious, particularly the bath room, and free in-room wifi was available. The night view of the city skyline from the room was beautiful.Although there is a fine imposed for smoking inside guest rooms, heavy cigarette smell was noticed through out the reception floor. This is unusual among 5-star properties in the world, and perhaps the issue could be addressed by the management.

This was our second stay at the Ritz-Carlton Tokyo. The service, as expected at a Ritz-Carlton, was impeccable. Every attention to detail is met here. From the welcome at the front desk, to the service in the restaurants, to the wonderful gym and spa facilities. My teenagers and I like, in particular, the gym on the 47th floor. Wow, what a view and an inspiring place to work out. Of course, the hot tub jetting out over the City of Tokyo below is amazing. On our first visit we awoke to an unobstructed view of Mt. Fuji. On this visit we were not as lucky due to some cloud cover. If the staff could have changed that they would have. The front desk staff even helped to track down and retrieve my wife's Ipad which she had left on a train two days prior to our arrival. Can't recommend this hotel enough and hope that we'll be able to visit again.

The Ritz-Carlton Hotel is the epitome of opulence. This is the place to stay if you want to experience the very definition of excellent service. The rooms are wonderfully spacious with spectacular views over Tokyo and the restaurants are first class. We visited all the restaurants (French, Japanese and International) and the food was amazing, especially at the Japanese. I can't say enough about the staff who were the most attentive and helpful employees I've ever come across in a hotel. The concierge service is exceptional and tourists are treated so warmly, so much more than just guests. Our stay at the Ritz-Carlton Tokyo typifies the ethos of the Japanese people throughout the whole country - kind hospitality, wonderful food and excellent service.

Room and facilities are all at a very high standard. Food services are excellent. The best part of my stay was the staff. They are attentive, caring, informed. The location is interesting and convenient. The adjoining shopping mall has a large number of high end shops and good restaurants.

Stayed at the Ritz-Carlton Tokyo for 4 days and must say, it was an incredible trip. Room was spacious and nice designed. Service was great and lets talk about the view... Amazing! We could even see the mount fuji on clear days. Gym is sufficient but again, the view makes it so much better. Food and drinks are a bit pricey but this can be expected at a luxury hotel in Tokyo.

I can't say enough!!!!! The best hotel experience! The staff is beyond amazing and I doubt there is a better view considering we could see mt. Fuji from our room. The location is extremely convenient. The views are spectacular from the club lounge which I highly recommend and that level to your reservation! The azure 45 restaurant is a must!! I can't wait to return I've never stayed anywhere better

This was a winter time holiday to Tokyo, to escape Hong Kong's mild winter. Stayed for 4 nights from 4 to 8 January 2016.The hotel is strategically situated on top of a leading up-market mall, Tokyo Mid-Town which offers shopping options and food, as well as sitting strategically atop two Roppongi underground stations - ensuring connectivity to the rest of Tokyo (buy a 600 yen pass for unlimited daily travel).The Lobby is situated on the 45th Floor. Rooms are above, and are billed as the highest and with the best views of Tokyo. They are panoramic views and can comprise views of the iconic Tokyo Tower or else even Mount Fuji, which can be seen from the gym as well. After some confusion on the 1st day checkin I was allocated a corner suite on the 49th floor with a panorama which included the 3 towers - the iconic Tokyo Tower, Skytree and Asahi TV Tower as well as of the Imperial Palace. This provided ever changing views of the city from day to night (see pictures). Breakfast is a worthwhile inclusion and is in the Bistro next to the 45th Floor lobby. The buffet breakfast is more than adequate, and then egg and hot side dishes can be ordered per a small menu. Service is attentive and they remember your name.Also, used the gym on the 46th Floor - this is adequate, but some of the machines are starting to date. It's notable as the gym is the one direction where you can catch glimpses of Mount Fuji, which can be seen over the Shibuya districts towers. The hotel stored our luggage at the concierge (at ground floor level) and then made arrangements to take us by cab in the early evening to Tokyo station to catch the NEX express train to Narita Airport.

From the minute you book at this hotel, the Pros take over. From pick up at the airport, to arriving at the hotel, the word "seamless" or "effortless" comes to mind often. I did not think the club level at the San Francisco property could be rivaled, but I stand corrected.Breakfast after a long-haul flight was served with a view of Mount Fuji and every detail is handled with perfection and appreciation by a team of professionals.

Check-in was very pleasant and the staff helpful (if not quick). Appreciated that we got a "tour" of our room, since there were some features we may not have found easily otherwise. Room was larger than we expected (expected NYC sizing for the room), but it was nice and with a great view. The two chairs by the window saw ample use from us. Loved the toilet/bidet -- want one of those back home! The belldesk staff was superb, even walking us over to the building next door to confirm that's where the restaurant was that we wanted. The lobby lounge was a nice option for unwinding, with good cocktails and a tasty burger. Live music (good) ran from roughly 8p-midnight. Well located as far as subway went. Concierge was helpful and informative with regard to best times to see the sights and getting around. Also with help arranging the limo bus back to the airport. Impeccably clean. Worth the splurge. Only nits: in-room coffee was fair; pool was closed for maintenance on 2 of 3 nights.

Amazing hotel and wonderful atmosphere in The Ritz-Carlton Tokyo. Having quick meeting with your friends at Lobby Lounge and enjoy live music next to the bar with all the views that you can see there is just priceless.

We have stayed with this hotel last week with our friends and we are very impressed with the services that we have received starting from the moment that we checked in and we were greeted by the hotel staffs with very friendly smile and we were shown to our rooms with personal escort.House keeping has been doing a great job and keep us very well equipped with hotel amenities and not to mention lots of bottled water.Since it was our shopping trip we ended up with 7 pieces of luggage and 5 adults and the hotel has arranged a Van to send us to the airport with lots of comfort.Hotel staffs are very efficient and attentive and they have transform the Japanese culture with a lot of Western professionalism.

Have stayed here for about a month now and am a long term resident in Japan with over 16 years in total. Everything about the hotel is top notch apart from two things: 1) The ridiculous rules about pool usage and 2) Weekend "tea" at the lobby restaurant. Firstly, I understand Japanese rules, customs and culture but mandating swimming caps and not allowing even the smallest of tattoos at the Ritz Carlton is laughable. Please adapt with the times. I could understand if it was at a public swimming pool but this is the Ritz Carlton. Also, if you have been to afternoon tea anywhere else in the world you will be hugely disappointed with the afternoon tea here. Super small portions, inability to change tea and no seconds for any of the small cakes/scones left us hungry and disappointed. We ended up going to an izakaya immediately after.

We had a wonderful stay at the Ritz-Carlton Tokyo. The hotel is located at one of the best parts of town on high floors with magnificent views. The lobby, bar and restaurants are splendid both in offering and service. The gym and spa are also very good. The room was big, clean, well maintained with excellent housekeeping. What makes the hotel special is the great service. If you ask for recommendations, the concierge will really help you with great and honest tips, routes and will do everything to get you there comfortably. A hotel like the Ritz Tokyo gives your entire trip a golden glow.

Stayed 5 nights.Surprisingly room was spacious with double sinked bathroom and dual closets. Great view from 50th floor in midtown Roppongi. Location isn't the most convenient with mainly the Oedo and Hibiya lines (and Hibiya will need a bit of a walk to), but manageable. Property extremely well maintained. Still can't get over the practice of hotels now with air fresheners that's just on the heavy side. Good thing it's in public places and not seeping into room; unlike Conrad in Hong Kong. Turning down service will reset bathroom, bottled water and hot water kettle as well as ice bucket. Recommended.

We had a great deluxe room with the view of Tokyo Tower. Surely this chain knows what it is doing - of course for a price. Well located in Rappongi but we used car service for all tours. Yes, 25 bucks for a drink but you know that anyway. Well trained staff, always helpful. One weird issue during check out - we asked for a bell boy and stated our 4 luggage clearly. They sent a lady so my husband had to do the lifting and carrying. Also, more western selections could have been available for breakfast like more cheese... But overall it was just top notch.

I have stayed in many different hotels in Tokyo, but the Ritz is a class of its own. Its location - starting at the 45th floor of Tokyo Mid-Town building complex in Roppongi - contributes a lot to its mystique and grandeur, and a key differentiator to the Grand Hyatt, which is in the same neighborhood, but is more of a ground floor to 20th floor type building. The view is amazing from any room since its higher than any building in the area, and the fact that the lobby is only accessible from a hidden set of elevators deep inside the building, gives it an air of exclusivity. The service is impeccable. The staff are super polite and very efficient. They will bend over backwards to help you with every little wish during your stay. The best part about this hotel is that every room is larger than most hotels in Tokyo. There is ample room for 2 king sized beds, and the bathroom is like the giant ones you find in luxury homes in Texas. There is a separate bath/jacuzzi tub from the standup shower, and the bathroom has ample room for a party. There are lots of free goodies, including a nice pair of slippers that are more comfortable than ones you buy for your home. There are two full sized closets and every furniture is nicely appointed. You can have afternoon tea or drinks on the 45th floor bar - which is a great place to meet people to impress. There are many restaurants - for every taste. The tasting menu is recommended for the Japanese restaurant. Its $150 for one person, but you get a great kaiseki with the best possible view. The only caveat is that all of this comes at a steep price, even for Tokyo standards. You can see from the cars parked in valet that this hotel is frequented by people who drive Ferraris and Rolls Royces. You can find $400-$500 rooms occasionally, but sometimes the only rooms available are $1000+. All the restaurants are also very expensive. But its worth the splurge. I would recommend even staying just for one night for the experience.

I love Japan and I love Tokyo - it is one of the most exciting cities around the world. So, I travel to Japan (and of course I dedicate many days to Tokyo) every year to spend Christmas and/or New Year. This last December, I decided to stay at Ritz-Carlton with my family and I can say this was the best hotel in Tokyo I stayed so far.First of all, it is very well located - Roppongi is a stunning neighbourhood, famous because of the very good restaurants and nightlife. Ritz-Carlton is located in the Tokyo Midtown, a huge commercial and residential complex with a convenient and upscale mall nearby. It is also very close to the Roppongi Hills complex, Akasaka, Ginza and Manunouchi neighbourhoods and the Imperial Palace. Besides, Ritz-Carlton is a few steps away from Roppongi Station (Oedo, Hibiya and Chiyoda lines), so you don't depend on taxi/car to move to any part of Tokyo.Rooms are clear and spacious, with a minimalistic-sophisticated decoration, with windows from top to floor that provides panoramic views of Tokyo (all apartments are located above of the 45th floor): from my room, I could see the Tokyo Tower, Odaiba, Tokyo bay and the Skytree, for instance (and since I was in Tokyo in December, I had the privileged view of the Roppongi Christmas illumination and the fireworks at Odaiba). Besides, my room had a luxurious and large bathroom and an walk-in closet.But what made the total difference for me was the Ritz-Carlton staff: very courteous and polite, always smiling and always trying to help and fullfil your needs. Japanese people are famous for politeness, but the attention that you receive at Ritz-Carlton is memorable: you can notice the difference by small things like being received at the door by your name, a welcome letter from the Vice-president or General Manager written by hand accompanied by elegant patisserie as a gift, Valhorna chocolates everyday in your pillow, hot water for tea waiting for you at the end of day.And what to say about exercising at the well equipped gym in the morning, with a gorgeous view of the Mount Fuji, with the support of a personal trainer?Or starting your day with a delicious breakfast, with beautiful pastries made by a talented patissier in-house?After this experience, I became devoted to Ritz-Carlton. I can't imagine a great experience in Tokyo that does not include a stay at this hotel. The only problem is that you will not want to leave Ritz-Carlton during your stay (but please do it - Tokyo is incredible and should be explored day and night).

The Ritz was the perfect location for our first visit to Tokyo. Located in beautiful Midtown, the Roppongi Station is only a two minute walk from the hotel. Tokyo's superb subway/metro system easily allows you to get just about anywhere in a short time. The hotel lobby is located on the 45th floor and has sweeping views of the city. Our room, on the 50th floor, had an equally stunning view, and we could see the top of Mount Fijii from our room. It was spacious and very comfortable. The breakfast buffet had a large selection of everything from fresh fruit, sushi, a variety of juices and hot cooked items made to order. We would definitely stay at the Ritz, again.

As a big fan of Four Seasons Tokyo hotel for years, I changed to Ritz Carlton. Staying in Tokyo's fashionable Roponggi this modern luxury hotel has been recently updated, resulting in a top luxury, extremely comfortable beautiful hotel.The reception starts at the 45th floor, tastefully decorated. As usual the check-in procedure is smooth and friendly. As a platinum member I was upgraded to the next level room on the 49th floor with a gorgeous view on Tokyo Tower. A very spacious abundantly equipped bathroom, comfy bed, Nespresso coffee machine, welcome gifts upon check in and a patient, personalized check in by a hotel staff member, this was a great start. As we were with a family of three, we suggested to pay just for one night Club Lounge access and what a joy that was. Recently updated, the Club Lounge on the 53the floor is even a bit higher than Tokyo Tower, with superb views from all sides on Tokyo city, with an equally superb choice of drinks, snacks and lovely breakfast in a very upscale interior designed space. Great reception by the Club Lounge manager, who after one day enjoying this classy treat offered us to use the Club Lounge service throughout our whole stay. The very tranquil luxurious swimming pool and sauna, great bed, superb staff service, lovely dining, this is what makes a city trip in this huge city so enjoyable. One slight point of criticism if I may. I am a fervent photographer and like to upload my photos each evening on Dropbox. For that you need a PC or Mac to connect my USB equipment with internet. Surprisingly there is even after the renovation, no business center anymore. The Club Concierge kindly providerd me with a Dell laptop that however - through heavy use - was so slow, battery dead in a short time, I wondered how do people like me that bring their iPad and iPhone but not their Mac, get this done. Something to improve I would say. Last slight point I would like to mention is the lack of modern audio equipment in the room. These days people want to connect their video and audio stream via Sonos or Netflix etc. so they can enjoy their own music and music in their hotel room. We had that service in RC Kyoto (see our review). Apart from that, again, a great stay in a great, magnificent hotel.

Stayed 3 nights in December. Room had perfect view of the Tokyo tower and the entire city from the 51st floor. I cannot say enough good things about this property. Location was excellent in Roppongi with shopping and subway right below in midtown center. The service at the Ritz was wonderful as every little detail that comes with a 5 star hotel was met. We especially enjoyed the bar with a great selection of scotches and Cuban cigars.

Per a previous posting of mine I always thought The Four Seasons Hotel Hong Kong to be the best hotel in Asia (and I stay in an awful lot). I stand corrected - The service The Tokyo Ritz Carlton provides is impeccable, in fact extraordinary. The staff all know who you are (something the Ritz Carlton attempts everywhere but rarely achieves), combine that with Japanese hospitality and Ritz Carlton service level and you can't beat the experience. Sure there are newer hotels in the region and Tokyo but for me the room style is warm and welcoming and every detail is considered and correct.

This is not the first time I Visit the Tokyo Ritz Carlton and I am happy with this repeated visits. It was a 3 days short leisure visit to Tokyo. I was a bit surprise some of staffs there recognized me (my last visit was already April in the year). The hotel was still as nice as my last visit and all staffs can speak fluent English (note that this is quite rare in Japan :p ) yet something really surprise me is that they just know my birthday. a number of staffs greeted me "happy birthday" when I returned to hotel that night ! My companion and I visited the Azure 45 during my birthday night and I have to say it is just wonderful. The restaurant treated us two glasses of house Champagne which you can't order from the menu. And we got back to our room there was birthday cards and chocolates :) *after the trip, I received a newsletter saying that Azure gained the Michelin Award . Nice Job!

Check in was a hassle with my booked room unavailable at check in, the person at the desk was not helpful in finding an adequate solution and functioned more like a robot than a person. The actual room itself was poorly designed with a small living area, far too much space in a bathroom I hardly spend any time in. Furniture looked like it came from a 1990s catalog and wasn't comfortable. Large TV was nice however, if only they spent $1,000 less on a 50inch TV and spent it on nicer chairs/sofa then I might be able to enjoy the TVLuggage wasn't delivered to the room after check in for some time, after which there were multiple disruptions. The concierge and overall staff weren't helpful and as mentioned were far too rigid and didn't think, felt like I was dealing with mindless robots.Overall, extremely poor for the price, if the Ritz Carlton charged me US$200, then I would have been highly satisfied, but at the rates they charge (the second or third highest in Tokyo), this was totally not worth it.

Superb hotel located in vibrant area. Spacious, immaculate, connected to several dining/shopping options. Attentive staff, excellent views. Outstanding spot. One of the best Ritz properties I've visited.

What I liked: The room and the location. What I disliked: Concierge service was not knowledgeable. They did not have enough professional concierge, but were using staff members to cover. I requested information about several out of the way events that the woman helping me was not familiar with and discouraged me from attending for no good reason as far as I could tell, other than her unfamiliarity with the request. For a hotel at this level, this sort of haphazard concierge service is unacceptable.Because of the poor advice I was given, our stay was not as interesting as I'd hoped. Also, my mattress was out of shape. It feels like the Ritz shortchanges their clients by trying to cut some corners. I will not stay at this property again.

My girlfriend and I have just spent a holiday at the Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo in an Executive Suite (room upgraded for my birthday) where everything was perfect from well-mannered receptionists, Club Lounge staffs and the room itself of course.We can't praise the hotel and the staffs enough. Apart from the generous arrangement from Ms. Kao Osawa, and all staffs at Club Lounge, the services from the others staffs were also incredibly formal and highly professional in all my interactions. All of my requests were handled promptly, with a huge smile, and some went far beyond expectations.It was truly a wonderful moment we had at the Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo and am sure it will be so for others.

Stayed at this property for 8 days recently, and had a room on the Club Level. The entire hotel staff was welcoming, friendly, and helpful; The service in the Club room was outstanding throughout.. On top of it, I think it's in the best location in the city... Absolutely the place to stay!

The staff not only anticipated our needs and exceeded them but was responsive to any request and consistently exceeded our expectations. An example was when asked for a Chocolate Martini in the lounge, they didn't have the ingredients that night, but went out and got them, practiced making the drink and surprised us the next night by having the drink for us.Staff was beyond friendly and willing to help in any way. Even called ahead to our next hotel to make sure we continued to receive the VIP treatment.

Stayed at Ritz-Carlton Tokyo for a weekend getaway in June for 3 nights.[Location]Centrally-located and connected to the Tokyo Midtown shopping complex & Roppongi subway station. It takes a little bit of walking around between each levels (of the shopping mall) to find my bearing, but once you figure out the way to and from subway station, it's quite easy to navigate.[Shopping & Food]Tokyo Midown is a great shopping spot in itself. There is also a food court where nearby office workers frequent, and a 24-hr supermarket for all your late night cravings. The hotel is just steps away from the main streets of Roppongi, where you'll find plenty of shoppings (Don Quixote, drug store) and even more restaurants (yakiniku, ramen, western food).[Room & Amenities]The room is huge and has breath-taking view of Tokyo City. All amenities are of extremely high quality and standards. [Gym & Pool]Beautiful facility and state-of-the-art equipment but if you have visible tattoos (like me) you might run into some problems. In Japan, tattoos are associated with yakuza (mafia) so many traditional bath/ hot spring places turn away customers with tattoos. In order not to offend some of their (more conservative) local customers, gym staffs asked me to either (1) cover my tattoos with nude-shade tapes or (2) wear a thin t-shirt over my bathing suit. Luckily(?) I only have 2 visible tattoos so I chose to tape them over. But if you don't have tattoos I guess just go ahead and enjoy :-)

Elegant hotel, lives up to Ritz Carlton brand and more! Situated in mid town, hotel is on 45-53 floors of building above Mid Town complex. Fantastic views from every room. Even saw Mt Fuji (briefly). Service is impeccable even by Japanese standards. Rooms are roomy and very comfortable. Especially appreciated large bathroom with separate shower etc. Had one night on club floor (53rd), using club for great lunch. No problems with language, all personnel spoke excellent English. Concierge very helpful with travel plans etc. Overall, great hotel experience, now spoilt for anything else!!

From the moment we arrived at the hotel, well trained staffs from the bell, reception helped us to settle down in an upgraded room over 50F+ facing eastward, overlooking the Skytree in the distance. The twin room is well over 50 sqm, with a huge bathroom, a huge 50" TV, 2 big closets etc. Big thank you to guest relations Tamaki-san who has been extremely cordial ! The in-door pool is worth a visit. Even if you don't swim, it has a jacuzzi, a cold and warm pool for relaxation on 46F.The Tokyo Mid-town is just next door offering easy shopping and dining. Easy access to metro lines in 10-15 min. on foot. I managed to catch the Frank Gehry exhibition in the 21-21 design next door !There is no doubt we will stay in this hotel again next time in Tokyo.

After a 14 hour flight from NYC, Tokyo was our first stop. Ritz is located in the Roppongi area,which has a reputation of a "colorful" night life. We were told that this is the highest building in Tokyo. Nevertheless, when we got off our limousine, we were led up to the 45th floor which is the main lobby and transferred to the 53rd floor which is the Club Lounge. Our first interaction is with Ms. Desiree Overhage who sat us at a table overlooking Roppongi Hills to relax and eat while they prepare our check in. The view was breathless! Chatting with Desiree made us feel at home, she was the source of information of things to do, handed us maps, suggested restaurants, really above and beyond when she could just refer us to the Concierge desk who by the way, also at the top of their game as we were able to secure a Joel Robuchon 3 Michelin star dinner the next day. How they able to anticipate our needs is above and beyond our expectations. Our room on the 52nd floor was absolute perfection, waking up to three clear days and seeing Mt Fuji from afar is a sight that we'll never forget. The Ritz Carlton Tokyo website doesn't do justice to what this particular location offers. The staff makes the difference. In Japan, you don't have a category called service, I believe it's completely integrated into what they do. Stepping into the Ritz Carlton Tokyo, there's a sense of hospitality that comes across as genuine , not as part of a training program. Japanese civility embodied, one has to experience it.
user_name:
flippywebsurfer
New York City, New York

review_body: The Ritz Tokyo was very accomadating to our every need. We stayed in the club package rooms, and I believe it was well worth it, and wouldo it again. I recommend staying in the club level rooms for the convince and extra accomadating concierge, breakfast, and other meals, even if you only eat there once a day. The club lounge is a great place to begin an evening before heading to a hotel restaurant as well. The staff in the hotel is awesome!

We loved our stay. The rooms were spacious and beautifully appointed. It's hard to get out of such a comfortable bed, our views from it were of Mt. Fuji in the distance. The area is one of the many great parts of Tokyo. Great nightlife and restaurants. Easy to get around town from there. The staff here are exceptional. The Teppanyaki at the hotel restaurant is outstanding, the spa & gym were great as well. Zero complaints, a million superlatives.

The Ritz Carlton Tokyo was the first hotel as part of our trip to Japan (first time here).The place was absolutely amazing!From being greeted as we arrived by taxi (somehow they new who we were without saying a thing!) to the beautiful room and amazing and friendly service at the club lounge, followed by an amazing dinner (my wife is now a convert of all Japanese food), the place was a wonderful introduction to Japan.I must admit I have been a bit sceptical of ritz carlton's before, but based on this hotel (and the one in Kyoto - to follow....) we are now full converts.Special mention goes to the girl who helped us in the club lounge (embarrassingly we never got her name) to all the food we had whilst there.Thank you so much, we look forward to coming back soon.

Location is great next to the Midtown mall. Lobby area is great for a drink with a view. Rooms are huge and views are amazing...they used to have Bulgari supplies which were nice but changed it to something that seems more female oriented...but that is trivial. Overall one of the best in Tokyo.

By far the place to stay while your in Tokyo. Rooms are spacious and super luxurious! Service was a 12 out of a 10. Spa is one of the best I've seen at a hotel. Spend the extra money and upgrade to the club level. Club experience is worth it.I'll be back.Sc

Facilities and service are exceptional. Spectacular views. Prime central Tokyo location. Modern upscale decor. Pool and health club/spa are wonderful. Hotel breakfast buffet was fantastic. Baked goods and Fruit in particular were world class. Club lounge which costs 30,000 yen additional is the best I have ever experienced. Rooms are spacious and very comfortable. Concierge and Housekeeping are first rate. It was Rated as the best hotel in Japan and it lives up to its billing.

What an absolutely beautiful hotel with outstanding service! Rooms were very spacious and the service was excellent. The view of Tokyo Tower was also stunning. Now one of my favorite hotels in Asia and certainly my favorite in Tokyo. Can't wait to return.

I travel extensively and have stayed in many top properties around the world. I must say that on my recent return visit to the Ritz-Carlton Tokyo I appreciated more than ever the scrupulous attention to detail exhibited by this hotel. Not simply the refined style of the decor and the comfort of the rooms (the view of Tokyo from my room was spectacular). But the outstanding quality of the restaurants and especially the friendliness and concern exhibited by the staff from top to bottom. I especially enjoyed the Club Lounge, which was open throughout the day offering an extensive made-to-order breakfast in the morning through to drinks late into the evening. The Club Manager, Desiree, could not have been more welcoming or more attentive. So far away, but feeling just like home! You cannot go wrong with this property.

The hotel is in a great location and is beautiful and clean. The views are gorgeous, and, most of all, the staff is incredibly helpful and friendly! They go out of their way to make sure you have an incredible experience.

I have been to Tokyo various times and never stayed at the Ritz before. I will never stay anywhere else again. The Ritz is in a class by itself - from the attentive service to the spacious rooms. Prior to my arrival, Nicolas and Hector were very helpful in securing a car from the airport and, upon my arrival, made me feel like I was a returning guest. The hotel is in Tokyo Midtown, a galleria of shops, restaurants (a Dean and Deluca and a Starbucks!), which is a great location near Roppongi. Quick cabs to Harijuku, Ginza and a subway nearby as well. The lobby (on the 45th floor) is bright, open and impressive with high ceiling and terrific views of Tokyo - as the tower is one if not the tallest in Tokyo. Gorgeous. The lobby serves terrific "western" style food - hummus sandwich and burger and there is also a sushi restaurant serving terrific sushi and other entrees. The rooms - mine was on the 52nd floor - was spacious, bright - two sinks, a shower stall and a tub. The bathroom was larger than some of the hotel rooms I stayed at previously (which were 4 start hotels). The gym was excellent too. Even though I was traveling on business, I felt relaxed, taken care of and like it was a luxury retreat. I will only stay there going forward.
user_name:
JeffG1795
New York City, New York

review_body: From the moment you arrive at this gem of a hotel, you feel the warmth of the staff- We were here in March, and when we arrived this time, they welcomed us by name- that set the stage for an amazing stay.It's very difficult to get certain reservations in Tokyo. Before my visit, I reached out to their head concierge, Ms. Ito, who was able to do the "impossible". She is a jewel and an incredible person as well. So from this review, THANK YOU MS. ITO!!The rooms are super deluxe, everything in them are deluxe as well. Great bed, great wi fi, great products in the bathroom, etc. HUGE TV, etc., amazing!Now the surprise. They redid the club level since we were here and it's spectacular. Phenomenal staff, a much better food display, and even a bartender for evening cocktails. Just terrific.All in all, this hotel is up there with the best in the world. If you're looking for sheet luxury, a bit of pampering, and a perfect location, look no further than the Ritz! BRAVO!!

We had the pleasure of staying at this property for only one night in a quick stopover in Tokyo. The hotel is amazing, beautifully decorated, and in a great location to walk around. It is also very close to the subway system, which makes it easy to get to other parts of Tokyo. The views from the rooms are absolutely breathtaking, and while it was pretty foggy/smoggy you could see a faint shadow of Mt. Fuji from our room. Must stay if you want to splurge when you are in Tokyo.

Our family stayed on a suite on the club level for 3 nights and had a fantastic time. The club level is one of the best I've seen in over 30 Ritz Carltons. The staff anticipated our every need. There was nothing I would change.

Having had a fair share of luxury Traveling , Dining and bussiness endeavors , I often travel to Tokyo , & after a 14 Hours of flight From Dubai , it's rare to find a hotel that can immediately meet all of my requirements & needs , with that in Mind comes Ritz Carlton Tokyo , it's my Third non consecutive visit & after trying out almost all the notable 5 stars hotels in Tokyo I would comfortably say that this one is the best & should they sustain this quality , surely it will be my permanent choice now on. The entire hotel personnel were full of courtesy & all about the extended hospitality The entire staff were Truely professionals ,The concierge team reacted to my requests with incredible promptness , resourcefulness and most importantly they were patient with my amendments My brief review would only serve injustice to this well managed establishment , A Big Thank you is in order to all the ladies & gentlemen Of the Ritz ,

Stayed at this hotel recently for one night. Was definitely the nicer of the two hotels I stayed in Tokyo. However, the Ritz in Kyoto was nicer.Is at the top of a tall building - great views of Tokyo - excellent service, great fitness center. The lobby had the faint smell of smoke - I don't think they allow smoking, so I'm not sure what was driving this.Great entertainment in the lobby, easy access to Narita via the bus, only downside is it's an expensive hotel.

OK, I haven't been to Tokyo before, so my title is misleading. But what a great place it is! High up and the views are magnificent. Rooms are terrific - wish I had a bathroom like this at home, great shower, roomy, and how do they get this water pressure to the 51st floor? Terrific breakfast. But it's the people. I know Japanese hospitality and caring is famous, but this is beyond belief for this first-timer. After one or two times the official greeter at the desk is your best friend. It's really pretty indescribable the lengths to which they will go.Next door is a big mall called Tokyo Midtown -- lots of restaurants on each floor, general shopping. One day we walked about half and hour through the Aoyama Cemetery to the Minami-Aoyama District, saw the Nezu Museum - quite worthwhile, terrific even, and down Aoyama-Dori and stopped in the Spiral Building to look and do some minor shopping for well chosen kitchen stuff, non-precious jewelry, etc. The Japanese sense of style is terrific. So the location is fine, as far as we were concerned.It's a great hotel!
user_name:
Budd S
Berkeley, California, United States

review_body: Located right in the middle of Roppongi, nothing is far from this place. Every shopping area, sightseeing area is very close by.The staff are extremely polite and so is the service. Top notch. Rooms are very plush and the beds are just too good.The breakfast could have been netter though, but it's a small person to person thing.

I have now stayed 3 times in the ritz carlton tokyo, spending a total of 6 weeks there in the process. I think this is definitely long enough to say with 100% reliabilty that this is a hotel of impeccable quality.The staff are enormously friendly and helpful, at every possible opportunity. The hotel itself is a stunning building, with the lobby on the 45th floor commanding breathtaking views over tokyo. You can also enjoy the views from the rooms, and from the gym on the 46th floor. Its great to be able to have a workout before starting the day, and to look out over the city as you do it.The location is amazingly convenient, in the heart of roppongi. Roppongi is itself a buzzing area; if you walk out of the hotel there are little streets nearby filled with great bars and restaurants. Or take a ten minute walk down to nishi azubu nearby for instance, for some more great bars and restaurants. It is also very conveniently located for other important parts of tokyo, like marunouchi, or shibuya etc... the hotel is within a complex that has many shops including a 24hr supermarket, as well as a metro station.I couldnt recommend the hotel and its wonderful staff more highly.One more thing, the cigar selection in the bar on floor 45 is great, and actually very reasonably priced!RegardsHamish

i speep there two mounts ago on top of the floor, the hotel is perfect the Lobby is on 8 th floor , very big where you can have also breakfast in the morning.The swimming pool is unbelievable, include the sauna .is not easy go often from the price but for sure ill go again.

I had never been to Tokyo before so I cannot comment on how the Ritz compares to other hotels in Tokyo, but it was absolutely top notch compared to top hotels in other cities that I have traveled to. The location is great. The service is just as you would expect out of a Ritz in Asia -- outstanding. The lobby area with lobby bar, restaurant and lounge is stunning. Views of the city are excellent. Club Level amenities, including breakfast, exceeds expectations, including the views from the 53rd floor with a fair amount of privacy for a club level lounge. Rooms are spacious with all the comforts you could imagine. Ability to turn off all lights in the room and put down the window shades with the touch of a button next to your bed may be a simple concept, but completely underrated in my view. You just cannot go wrong with this hotel and I didn't even have time to take advantage of the spa, pool, etc...

We can't say enough about the exquisite service we received during our seven day stay at the Ritz Tokyo. From the moment we arrived on property, every Ritz person was elegant, courteous, efficient, warm and helpful. The property itself, the rooms (we had two connecting rooms), the restaurants, the spa and the 45th floor lounge (where we ended every night with drinks for me and my husband and desserts for our teenaged sons) were all gorgeous, white glove clean and fabulously run. In addition, the free wifi was incredible, no streaming problems, no capacity issues, just absolutely the best hotel wifi I have experienced. Overall, as a seasoned traveler, I must say that staying at the Ritz Tokyo was by far the best hotel experience of my life. Thank you to the Ritz people reading this!!
user_name:
sunm659
New York City, New York

review_body: The Ritz-Carlton Tokyo is my favorite place to stay, not just in Tokyo but of all the hotels I stay in while travelling for business. Nice hotel, epic views, good food - but really appreciate the staff and service (they are both friendly and thoughtful). Highly recommended.

Sitting atop the Roppongi hills, you will have a tough time beating the exceptional location of the Ritz Tokyo. But that is just the beginning of the hotel's excellence. The service is top class, with everybody following up and focusing on making your stay better. The rooms are very well-conceived with the best of everything, perhaps the best hotel room I have seen. The views are breathtaking, simply said. The Club Lounge is newly opened so I should comment on it, as I generally try to take advantage of club lounges when I travel. This lounge is excpetional. You get personal attention, the breakfast spread is great, and there are almost always snack foods around for you to enjoy. The lunch setup could be a bit more fulsome, but everything here was service-based and spot on. It's hard to find any criticism but the cafe on the check-in level is ovrepriced and the wine pours are scant. Really not much to like about the cafe, except the beautiful setting and views. So stay in the club lounge area and experience the best of the best.

You really cannot go wrong by staying at the Ritz Carlton in Tokyo  fabulous location  lots of things to do within the vicinity  checkin is fast  staff are very professional n polite  rooms are a good size  modern hotel and comfortable  rooms are classy  room rate is not cheap  pool is awesome  gym is awesome  reception bar is very classy  elevators are fast  breakfast is excellent Almost perfection Good stay, good experience, no major issues

I have been here three or four times and I have to say in my millions of miles of travel this is my favorite hotel to visit. The service is impeccable and rooms are about perfect. Location of the hotel is wonderful for the kind of visits I enjoy and hundreds of different kinds of restaurants from Japanese to Korean to Turkish kebobs to American chains are all a short walk. The only downside is the food at the hotel can be quite expensive for what you get but even so it is usually very good and the service is world class.In all my business travel this is the one place I truly hope I can bring my wife for some personal time away more than any other.

One of the best hotels I have ever been to. The service was exellent. We got escorted up to the lobby to check in and then got offered refreshments then got escorted to our room. I would not get a bigger room then a standard because it was big enough for my family of 3. Overall exellent!

I was disappointed in this hotel. The location in Roppongi Hills is nice in that there are museums/galleries and a mall attached. The subway is also attached although somewhat convoluted. It was difficult finding the entrance to this hotel from the subway. I guess they expect their guests to arrive by car. Service was rather snobby. There was no bellhop so the person who checked us in asked if we wanted him to carry our bags up. He was smaller than me, so I declined. However at the other hotels we stayed at, the bellhop appeared and asked for our bags. The room was standard with great views of the city lights. The lobby opens onto the bar which was a great place for pre/post dinner drinks. Overall, for the price there are better serviced and better located hotels in Tokyo. BTW I'm a Marriott Gold elite member which made no difference.

Incredible view from their lobby / bar. You can see miles and miles of city lights it's incredible. But boy the drinks are quite pricey at their lobby bar. $120 for a double shot of Jamesom which is normally $10 at most restaurants and bars in the states! Most of their drinks come with a small piece of chocolate which is nice but doesn't excuse the insane price. Great place to entertain your friends and family but do some pregaming at a more reasonable bar. Otherwise you'll end up with a $1000 bill for a few round of drinks for 3 people! :)
user_name:
GurumeHunter
New York City, New York

review_body: I always love visiting Tokyo especially when staying at the Ritz. This was my third time visiting this hotel and although was traveling for work it was as always a great stay. The vicinity to great local restaurants and shopping are what draw me back to this hotel again and again. The service is superb. The only complaint is the smoke smell in the lobby and bar area. Wish it didn't smell so bad down there as I much enjoy having a cup of coffee and enjoying the views. Rooms are large, bathrooms are luxuries and beds are plush which made for a wonderful and relaxing stay. Also make sure and check out the spa on your next trip to Tokyo.

We stayed in this hotel as part of our honeymoon and received a complimentary upgrade into a sensational corner suite.The hotel is brand new and well located. Service is outstanding; staff is very friendly throughout. The hotel arranged also a complimentary bottle of Champagne for us and several other presents. The spa area is well presented and has a big pool.In summary - go there and treat yourself. Outstanding hotel.

Amazing service in every way! Before you even walk through the front doors you are carefully taken care of in every way you would expect from a top notch Japanese hotel. You are escorted to the front desk and greeted with a warm welcome by every employee along the way. Reception was able to check me in early and do a last minute room change from a king to two doubles when they saw I had three small children with me. The doormen handled the taxi's and I never once had to open my own door. The concierge handled several items immediately upon request and even went so far as going to a nearby location to get tickets to the Skytree when she was unable to buy them online due to a website error. The decor is very nice and simple. The views are incredible because the hotel occupies the top floors of the tallest building in Tokyo. Overall the hotel is extraordinary, and because of the phenomenal service, I think it may be the best hotel I have ever experienced.

My wife and baby daughter stayed here for 5 nights over the cherry blossom season and could not have been more pleased. The service was outstanding, the room impeccable and the additional amenities (crib, toys and bath kit) for our daughter made our stay much more enjoyable than we would have thought. Even with the beautiful bar and "scene" we found this hotel surprising kid friendly. For one there is a park around and behind the hotel with a small playground, which is a huge plus when traveling with little ones. The hotel is also connected to a beautiful modern shopping center with easy access to excellent restaurants. grocery stores and transportation making it an extraordinarily convenient home base, particularly for long stays.

Fully enjoyed the stay in Tokyo even one night when we temporary returned from the middle east. In addition to the superiority of equipment for both public area and guest room, we could spend the very comfortable time having a the pretty high level of service by each staff, which might not be engaged in a short period of time. The night view from the bar was outstanding especially, we could view the great fireworks in Tokyo Bay area. it is worth to seeing if you have chance.Would like to be back next time longer time when we return to Tokyo.

Comfortable, deluxe and inviting like all Ritz Carltons except this is a GRAND HOTEL in the truest sense. A destination unto itself. Not just Japanese inspired it is truly authentic in look, service, amenities and flavor. In the Ropongi! The best of the best in every category.

Although not my first choice due to location to my office, it was an exceptional hotel. Rooms were as high a standard as I have had and views are amazing. Staff really know what they are doing in efficiently taking care of their guests. Breakfast was ok in choice, although setting was sensational up 46 stories. Gym is very well equipped and pool is fantastic. Despite location, returning this weekend again.

When my wife and I were deciding where to go during our summer vacation from late July to mid August, one of the options was Japan. However, as a party of four including our two children 12 and 14, my wife and I were faced with the fact that generally, the hotels in Japan have a maximum capacity of three people per room. When I read the reviews from Tripadvisor about the Ritz Carlton Tokyo, one Swiss family wrote one comment about the Sub Director of Rooms, Hector, who in a similar situation helped that family of four to stay in a room all together. It was 10:00 pm in the In the East Coast in the U.S. Therefore it was 11:00 am in Tokyo, so I decided to call the hotel and requested to talk with Hector, who happened to be working that day and was very polite and helpful. It was the beginning of one of the most wonderful and most gratifying experiences.Hector helped us make the necessary arrangements to stay in one room at the hotel. Because of this, we were able to Decide to visit Japan and stay at the Ritz Carlton Tokyo. Our first day we met Jules Dobois, the manager of restaurants, during our breakfast time and I must say, breakfast at the Ritz Carlton Tokyo is delicious one by offering modern Japanese as well as Western food. Jules introduced himself and dedicated time to tell us about some places we should visit during our visit of seven days to Tokyo. Jules became a de facto host for us every morning and was always willing to visit our table and make us feel special. Later during our visit, we met other wonderful people who seemed to be there to make our visit a memorable one. The concierge desk is one mandatory place to stop for guidance during a visit. The ladies, all of them are so gracious and helpful that it became a pleasure to stop by and talk to them. One special person in the concierge desk is Mariko Ishikawa. She is just such a warm and caring person that it is difficult not to hold her dearest. Mariko and the staff of the concierge desk became one nice and convenient point of encounter before heading anywhere in Tokyo. She made us fell like family and we are thankful for that.Every evening, my wife and I visited the lobby Lounge, where a very nice band with singers and performers who change every night, play American Music, making us feel at home.There we enjoyed nice champagne and drinks and was a point where the four of us, the Rosales Family, spent some evening talking about the experiences of the day or as a very modern family, every one hooked to our phones chatting with our friends in America, since it was daytime here. Anyways, whatever we were doing, the music and the beauty of the salon plus the nice service from the staff made us feel specials. Shiori Iwashido, the manager at the Lobby Lounge was always making sure that were had everything we needed. Finally, Maxim, the manager of the bar, introduced himself to offer service if any special drink was of our pleasure.Thanks to Hector Bustos, who was able to make the necessary arrangements and all of the Ladies and Gentlemen of the Ritz Carlton Tokyo, plus the Japanese hospitality, we enjoyed one of the most wonderful vacations of our lives.

From the second you are greeted at the main entrance you just know you are going to enjoy your stay. The staff are so attentive, polite and nothing is ever too much for them. By the time you've got to the reception they have your paperwork ready for you. It all just works so seamlessly.The quality of the accommodation is also outstanding with so many nice small touches in the rooms from the freebies in the bathroom to the full room controls adjacent to the bed. And the beds are a dream.......Its certainly my hotel of choice when in Tokyo!

I have stayed several times at this hotel and the service seems to get better each time. The staff was extremely attentive and could not have provided better service for the week I stayed at the hotel.
