The breakfast at the concierge lounge was truly delightful each morning and the food and service at Hinokizaka was some of the best Japanese cuisine I have experienced. The rooms are first rate and spacious with every modern convenience you would expect at a Ritz in Tokyo. Finally the gym is large and has first rate equipment and a pool. The services provided you would expect at a Ritz resort so very impressive they have them at a city hotel.I also heard great things about the new Ritz in Kyoto and will try that next time I am in town. It is clear this is a extremely well managed hotel and another example of Ritz excellence in hospitality.

A very pleasant from the time you check-in to you check out again. The service level is very high and you are greeted in a very nice way when ever you meet the Hotel Staff. Very nice check-in and the club lounge has a fantastic service during the day and a fantastic view. real value for your money.

This was my fourth stay in the Ritz-Carlton Tokyo. Everytime when I stay here, I feel like I have come back to my home because of their heartful services. I strongly recommend this hotel to enjoy Tokyo more.

We recently had the opportunity to spend 4 days at the Ritz-Carlton Tokyo on our trip to Asia. Though I have not stayed at any other Ritz hotels, this was probably the best stay I have ever had at a "chain" hotel. High class, and excellent service.Originally we had opted to split our time, first at the Ritz and then at the Conrad, but upon arrival at the hotel, after being escorted to the temporary club lounge and experiencing the the service there I quickly changed our reservation to stay a few more days. It was a decision we did not regret.We were staying on the club level, and the deluxe room that we had reserved was far more spacious than we had expected. It had many fancy features and quite frankly I appreciated every aspect of the room including the "space-age" toilets, haha. The housekeeping kept our room refreshed everyday and during turn down service.I used the gym everyday and the Ritz gym is definitely one of the better hotel gyms I have been in. I was impressed with the equipment that was made available. The pool looked very sharp but I chose not to partake as I have tattoos and I wanted to avoid any awkwardness.What impressed me the most was the club level lounge and staff. the current lounge is under renovation so they have taken up residence on a lower floor in a suite. Despite this it was extremely comfortable and the 5 times a day food offerings were of very high quality. the breakfast options were quite good although I think I especially appreciated afternoon tea service the most. The lounge always had people there but I never felt that it was over crowded.The staff in the lounge were really good. By the next morning they knew my drink preference and we were almost always greeted by name.In particular, Seiko-san, Katori-san and Hideko-san went out of their way to secure us a hard to get restaurant reservation, very patiently answer my questions about the Sumida fireworks and other tourist sites and even went to buy me some small souvenirs of a Japanese cartoon I was looking for when I could not find it at the store. I was really impressed by their service.Overall we left the Ritz-Carlton Tokyo feeling well taken care of. The next time I come back to Tokyo, it will definitely be on top of my list of places to stay.

As per the other reviews, this hotel is in a very good location (same building as a shopping mall and close to Roppongi) and the service is of very high standard. Being in Japan though, the latter is almost taken as expected as Japan clearly has one of the best customer services in the world!However, the room and atmosphere of the hotel were nothing worth remembering, especially for a Ritz-Carlton and when compared to other Ritz-Carlton properties such as the one in HK. This was my first stay at this hotel and unfortunately I did not leave it with a "Wow" experience which is a pity as the staff was very professional. As per my first comment, staying at any other hotel at a lower luxury level and rate would still get excellent level of service.

Wonderful and typical service for a Ritz. Consistently greeted and staff was very helpful. Lobby is on 45th floor so it offers a great view. Location in Tokyo midtown provides walking access to subway. Check out the light garden down the street.

We have stayed in Ritz Carlton Tokyo the 5th time in the last 2 years, we have truly enjoyed our stay, although there was a little careless mistakes in the first few times during my stay. However, once their Club Lounge Manager Ms. Desiree Overhage took over to look after our stay, there was no disappointment at all. Desiree is a true customer service oriented front office manager, she is responsible, always cheerful and extremely helpful! She is a very important happy factor to our nice stay in Ritz Carlton hotel. Room: We stayed facing Fuji mountain this time, we did stay facing Tokyo Tower last time but my preference is to face Fuji mountain as it is facing southwest side with nice sun in the afternoon. Very clean, spacious room, luxury bathroom.Service: Efficient and very thoughtful. i have asked them to make dinner reservation for dinner for all the nights we were staying there, they were very thoughtful and printed maps for each restaurant and how to get there for usClub Lounge: although it is currently under renovation and they set up a temp club lounge on the 49/F which is adequate for usCheck in: Efficient and quick, i think because i have already contacted Desiree in advance for my check in, so it was smooth Check out: it was also very efficient and they gave us very nice red beans biscuits and water for us to enjoy in the car on the way to the airport  Overall i highly recommend Ritz Tokyo, it is with great location, connected to the metro and taxi price is reasonable to everywhere within Tokyo City.

This is my 3rd time staying at this hotel. First time bringing the wife for a work/casual trip. Love the convenience of this hotel located right in Mid-town (shopping mall) making it convenient for the wife to get acclimated to Tokyo being her first time there. Extremely spacious room and bathroom and wife loved the his and her's sinks. Staff was incredibly helpful. Concierge helped find some Ikebana classes for my wife and was very accommodating my request for late checkout. Hotel gym was more spacious than I expected but loved the view of the city from the gym.Would definitely recommend this hotel to any travelers to Tokyo.

All parts of our stay at this hotel exceeded our exectations, which were high. They really made an effort to make us feel welcome and after the first day, they knew our name and preferences, always willing to assist in a warm and friendly way.

My family and I stayed a week at this hotel. Reservation service was excellent and the hotel assisted with transport arrangement before we arrived. We were greeted at the airport by the hotel staff and upon arrival we had guest service staff escorted us all the way to our rooms. Our rooms were bigger than expected, very clean and the amenities were superb. We enjoyed the house pyjamas...View was spectacular. Guest service was quick to respond (whether in-room dining or housekeeping). Concierge was extremely helpful for dinner reservation, kabuki shows as well as bag transfers on the shinkansen. Location is excellent for day and night activities -shopping, night life, atrractive sites and also subway connection.The restaurants (Hinokizaka and Azure 45) offered excellent fine dining and menu choices. Service was top notch. Service at the Club Lounge was superb, in fact, anticipatory of our requirements and likes (i.e., staff paid attention to what we requested the day before). We enjoyed the rooms, amenities and guest services but most of all we enjoyed how we were treated - we felt special and important. When we returned to the Ritz Carlton Tokyo after 4 days in Kyoto/Osaka, we felt as if we were "returning home" - we were warmly welcomed like old 'family' members! Now, that was special!

My wife and I stayed here during our stay to Tokyo in July. The hotel lobby is located on the 45th floor of the hotel. The downstairs staff quickly took our bags out of our taxi and brought them to our room for us. The front staff was helpful, but did not go out of their way to be overly friendly. Upon our visit to the hotel, the concierge was great making reservations for us and incredibly responsive to e-mails, however, once we were there, they were never available to answer any of our questions or to give us directions. The front staff said the concierge would call us up in the room when they were available, which never happened. Every time we went down to them, the concierge was on the phone and could not help us. We were surprised there weren't two people working at the desk or that someone else at the front desk couldn't help us. We were placed on the club level floor, with a room overlooking the city. The room was recently remodeled and was spacious, clean, and had a huge television as well as bathroom! All in, the room and view is what you're paying for! The hotel is conveniently located in Roppongi. There is a subway near by, and the hotel is located attached to a mall with several restaurants to choose from. Upon check out, we were surprised to see on the bill an additional $40 tax each night on the bill. We had stayed in other hotels in Japan, and had never seen this tax before. When we questioned the front staff, they said it was a housekeeping tax, and all hotels in Japan have this on the bill. We paid it, but were definitely surprised to see this additional fee and why it wasn't included in the room rate or at any of the other hotels we had stayed at while on our trip. All in all, for the price you are paying to stay at this hotel, the service needs to be upgraded. They have already upgraded many of the hotel rooms, which are top notch for Japan or any other region, now they need to do the same to their level of service.

New York City, New York

review_body: My family of 4 stayed in a Club room in May for one night. I have to say this was the best stay during our week-long visit in Japan. We came from Mt. Fuji, and arrived at Ritz-Carlton around 11am, and our room was not ready. But the front desk and club lounge staff were very nice and friendly, and led us to the club lounge for snacks and waiting for checkin. When we decided to go out to visit Senso-ji Temple, we left our luggages at the lounge. When we came back later at night, our luggages were already well placed in our room! The club lounge is great. There are plenty of offerings. If you are too tired to go out dining, the lounge is a good option. The room is spacious and very clean. The view from room was fantastic. The staff were all very polite and helpful. The only thing I was a little disappointed was Mt. Fuji could not be seen from the club lounge that day. But that's because of poor air quality, not hotel's fault. Overall, we are very satisfied with our stay at Ritz-Carlton Tokyo, and definitely will stay here again during next visit!

The front desk is so kind and friendly.They input your all favorite thing and do it.Their hospitarity is the best in tokyo.Breakfast is pretty good.It is so delicious buffet and so many items.Please enjoy it!

I travel a lot for business and pleasure (at least 10 times a year for the past 25 years) and this is one of the 3 or 4 best hotels I have ever been too, and the nicest Ritz-Carlton I have ever been to (beating San Francisco, Beaver Creek (CO) and Naples (FL)). The service is amazing - top notch and even above traditional Japanese service. I would wholeheartedly recommend. Our room had views of the Imperial Palace and large swaths of Tokyo. Can't say enough nice things about our experience.

I recently took my family on a trip to Japan and we stayed in 3 different hotels in Tokyo and Kyoto. The entire trip was wonderful, and everyone we met were as nice as they could be. But I do have to say that the staff at The Ritz-Carlton Tokyo took hospitality to a whole new level. Being in Japan, you expect everyone to be pleasant. It's the Japanese way. But when you add the caring and attention to detail you get at a Ritz-Carlton, you get something extra special. The hotel itself was fantastic, occupying several high floors in the tallest building in Japan. The views were phenomenal, the restaurants outstanding, and the rooms perfect (love the heated toilet seats!). But again, you expect that at The Ritz. However, the staff took the time to get to know us, without being intrusive, and especially took a shine to my 18 year old son. They found out that he likes Anime, and the next morning they left a gift bag on our door with a very kind note and several Anime phone charms, one from his favorite show. That was totally unnecessary, but very much appreciated, and showed that our conversation was not superficial but genuine interest. Our last night we talked to another young lady in guest services about Japanese script, and the next morning we found another bag with yet another very personal card with my son's name translated into Japanese characters. Again very much appreciated. Our 2 week vacation had many memorable moments. But every conversation we have had with our friends about our trip starts off with the wonderful staff at The Ritz-Carlton Tokyo. Thank you Yukari, Yumi, and everyone else in Guest Services for making us feel extra special!

The Ritz Tokyo continues to be my favorite hotel in Tokyo. Rooms are spacious and service is attentive. Their gym is also a good size and, if interested, has a good jogging course around the hotel. The hotel is situated in Roppongi hence very convenient for shopping & dining. Even if your work place is in Otemachi Financial District, a taxi ride is 15-20 minutes. There are good hotels in Otemachi but I prefer to be able to pop out after work for dinner & drink in Roppongi, Azabu, Akasaka or Nogizaka Areas.

This is a nice luxurious hotel -- closer to the new Roppongi business district than truly downtown (Marunouchi). This is also a nice area for a holiday stay. Close to the midtown shopping center and Roppongi hills accros the highway.

Great services and staffs and convenient location. To the subway only takes a few minutes walk. Room is spacious and cosy and efficient housekeeping. Will definately stay again my next trip to tokyo..

My wife, mother-in-law, niece, and 9 month old daughter spent several days at the Ritz-Carlton Tokyo earlier this month and stayed in adjoining Club Rooms during our short stay. I had also stayed overnight in May during an unanticipated layover in Tokyo. I am a lifetime platinum member with SPG and recently was given platinum level status with the Rewards program as a result of my status with United Airlines - so I thought I would give Ritz-Carlton Tokyo a try…My wife and I have previously stayed at other Ritz-Carlton properties, so we are familiar with their service level, but from an overall perspective I have to say that my experience at this hotel on both trips was nothing short of amazing. Location - For the family trip, we had selected the hotel due to the convenience with the hotel being in Tokyo Midtown. The access to a covered shopping center with ample places to eat as well as a specialty grocery store made it very convenient with a 9-month old baby. It is also very close to Roppongi area – including the Roppongi Hills shopping area.Staff – From arrival at the hotel to check-out, our experience was what you would expect from a Ritz-Carlton x 2. The staff was not only very attentive and polite, but made it a point to go out of their way to genuinely make our entire family’s experience special. From our arrival, our family was whisked away to the Club Room by Ms. Ikuko Sato – Front of House Manager and assisted with check-in by Mr. Yoshikazu Katori – Club Assistant Manager. Both of them deserve special mention as their service level was exceptional. After our departure, I sent an email to Mr. Katori with a question and received a response within a few hours – amazing!Club Room - We were not expecting much with the Club Room being located in a temporary location due to a renovation of the permanent Club Room, however the hotel did a good job with setting up the temporary location. The view from the room is fantastic with views of Tokyo Tower and Mt. Fuji.Room – We had requested adjoining rooms with a crib in one of our rooms and got exactly what we requested. The hotel/staff were ready with the crib, comfortable bed linens, an amenity kit, and diaper pail in the bathroom. The size of the room was spacious and allowed our family (4 + 1 baby) to gather in-between outings.Given the above, I am looking forward to my next trip to Tokyo and stay at the Ritz-Carlton Tokyo.

Great Staff and Services. Rooms are large and clean. Convenient location in Roppongi Hills and its only few minutes covered-walk to subway station. Lots of restaurants nearby.About 1200 jpy cab ride from Hamamatsucho monorail Station (15 mins monorail ride from Haneda International Terminal)

My 12-yr old son and I spent a week here on a leisure travel trip (neither of us speaks any Japanese). We were in a "Japanese Carlton Suite" on the 48th floor with views to the East (e.g. Tokyo tower). I'm not sure if the Ritz' building or the Mori tower building sits higher in Tokyo, but either way, with the Ritz being situated on floors 45+, the views here are unparalleled in Tokyo. Just amazing!The entire staff was more than helpful. Concierge helped with dinner reservations at a variety of places weeks in advance of our arrival. Housekeeping staff did great and were very friendly. Laundry service prompt and on point. Club Lounge staff was polite, engaging, and attentive. Bell team was on top of everything (cars, directions) on the ground (always well stocked towel/bottled-water station for early morning runs too). Overall this was probably the most impressive personnel experience I've had at a hotel (Leela Palace in Bangalore, India a close second). Managers all the way through to housekeeping team all had plenty of English at their disposal. So much so that by the end of the trip I'd gotten lazy, and jet lagged, enough that I started greeting folks in English.Special callout to Desiree (Club Lounge manager) who brought an extra level of cheer, graciousness, and professionalism to everything. To top it off, she pulled together translation cards for a few dietary things I wanted to convey to restaurants in real-time. Seira Nazaki, and her partner in the club (forgot her name), pulled a wonderful hand-written card together with common phrases for my son. So generous!The hotel is clearly a big deal for locals. High-tea in the lounge is a popular, formal, thing, and as more informal travelers, we were a bit out of place at times. Others would be making an event out of the experience while we were just passing through kind of thing. That would be my only gripe about the experience... while all the on-site restaurants accommodated our lack of formality with graciousness (thank you), there weren't any less formal locations we could retreat to when back at the hotel. The Club area was the closest thing, but even there most people would dress up.The hotel is also a wedding ceremony/reception destination, so you wind up interspersed with a whole other level of formality (tuxes and gowns) at times. Everything is immaculate and painstaking attention is paid to it all.Awesome bar off of the main lobby/lounge. I'd certainly recommend staying here; incredible experience through and through.

I am a firm believer, an amazing hotel makes your travels truly memorable. The Ritz Carlton Tokyo did just that and delivered on every expectation and made our trip truly memorable. My husband and I had an amazing vacation in Tokyo and the Ritz made it an extraordinary time. The entire staff really sets this hotel apart from others and you couldn’t imagine the level of service, it was 5+. We were lucky to celebrate our wedding anniversary and the entire hotel congratulating us on our anniversary everywhere we went: restaurant, spa, pool, club lounge, restaurants, everywhere! Also, we emailed the hotel prior to our arrival for restaurant recommendations, trains, visits, points of interest, everything you could imagine and they were so accommodating and prompt. They also recommended and booked all our restaurants reservations including the hard to get hard to get reservation of…Jiro! The concierge staff really exceeded our expectations. We stayed in a club room with Tower view and were amazed. Believe me, I researched every hotel (5 star) and debated where to stay, I am so happy we decided to stay at the Ritz. Roppongi is a great central location to explore all of Tokyo and this hotel goes above and beyond, everything was outstanding. For those reading this, the Ritz isn’t the most modern in design but it is the most elegant, understated and refined place you can stay in Tokyo. At first I was worried about the location but in fact the location is perfect. It is exactly centrally located and so easy to explore Tokyo via all the subway stations. Buy a Pasmo card and download the Tokyo Subway app, it works even w/o wifi. You can access the entire city within 10 or less minutes. We would love to thank the entire staff but also thank Yuzuko, Nozomi, Yuko, Keiko for making our trip truly memorable! どうもありがとうございました

Class act...what to expect during your stay at the Ritz-Carlton TokyoThis is my second visit to the Tokyo Ritz. I spent a few nights there on business a few years ago, and the hotel made such a good impression I wanted to return. I was not disappointed.Room: A standard room with a king bed on the lower floors is, I suspect, much larger than your typical Tokyo room. The bathroom is large by any hotel’s standards. Well appointed and sparkingling clean. Plus the view is wonderful. Roppongi lies at your feet.Service: Stellar. Exceeds expectation at every turn, from room service to the spa staff. In fact, the attentiveness at the spa is almost overwhelming...I’m not complaining mind you. The are just really on their game.Location: Tokyo midtown. Heart of Roppongi. A decent walk to the Roppongi metro station, but not bad. The shopping complex at the base of the RC tower includes a 7-11, pharmacy, coffee shops etc. The hotel is a great base of operations for business or leisure travel.Cost: Oh yes, the cost. It’s a Ritz. You pay and pay handsomely for everything. From the drinks to the room to the food. You are paying for the location and great service. But then again, it’s a Ritz Carlton. If you want service like this at Holiday Inn prices, keep looking.The Spa: I’m not a spa guy, but I loved the well-appointed spa. It’s expensive, but the facilities are nice, the pool is great...very refreshing, and then there is the service...stellar again.The Bar: Nice bar, awesome view, epic scotch collection, and great service. But note that smoking is allowed, and it makes the whole lobby a bit smoky.Bottom line: If you have a bad experience at the Ritz, and you can not find someone on staff to make it right, then I suspect you are very hard to please. Service is not on the list of nice-to-haves at the Ritz, it’s top-of-mind for everyone you encounter. I will return. By the way, I was on the 47 floor during a recent sizable earthquake in Tokyo. The building shook plenty exactly the way it was designed to do, with no detectable problems. The hotel immediately implemented safety protocols and kept guests informed of the hotel's status.

The views are great. The rooms are large. The gym is quite decent. The pool and hot tub are lovely. Amenities were fine (the Nespresso machine was my favorite in-room amenity). All as one would expect for about US$650-750 +/- a night for a standard room. The staff is stellar and kind and creative and generally fantastic.The breakfast, while expensive, is varied and delicious buffet on the top floor of the hotel in a restaurant with breath-taking views of Tokyo. Service is attentive and you feel like royalty eating up there whether you choose more American-type fare or more traditional Japanese food, or both. We went there 3 of our 5 days at the hotel we liked it so much. It was a real treat. What's not so hot: you aren't going to be bowled over by any particular amenities--they're all about what one would expect, minus a little. For instance, when we stay at the Washington, DC Ritz, they always put a little welcome "gift" of some sort in the room. No such thing in the Tokyo Ritz. My husband is a "frequent flyer" with Ritz and even though he's not Black Label Super Platinum Diamond level I just expected a little more somehow. Also some odd choices: for example, irons are not in the rooms (perhaps you can ask for one though--I didn't bother). The lobby is also a let down. It looks enormous and impressive, but upon closer inspection, it is 95% restaurant or bar seating that guests cannot just go and sit in. There are a few chairs near the check in desk and consierge for guests, but they have no view and aren't really set up for you to sit in and relax for any period of time--they are more utilitarian in purpose--not lounge like. In fact, one afternoon we were willing to pay for the $18 cocktails and have a snack so we could sit in the posh restaurant/bar areas with the views, but we were told there was no seating available for us because they were full (its a big place for ladies-who-do-lunch and business lunches/drinks from what I could gather). I found it a little off-putting that no tables were set aside for hotel guests paying a king's ransom to stay there. Given how huge the area is I also thought the hostess might say something like "would you mind waiting just a few minutes for something to open up?" Nope. Another odd thing happened at the pool. It was mid-afternoon and empty except for the two of us. We inteded to dunk in the hot tub and take a quick swim, so we plopped our towels and robes down on two chaises on the pool deck and the pool guy ran up to us explaining that those two empty chaises were "reserved for members" and directed us to identical chaises further down the row. "Members" of what I do not know, but did it really matter? The place was empty and all the seats were identical. For the life of me I have no idea why the guy cared enough to have us relocate. Sort of odd choice in terms of customer relations. Decor was also a bit different than I expected. It is contemporary-ish, but grandma would be very comfortable and feel just hip enough. For example, in the bar area is a water feature--a sort of square pond--with a raised lucite platform in it that a piano sits on that someone plays during tea time. I found it kind of cheesy. Rooms also were tasteful but bordered on stuffy. Bottom line: if you gravitate toward Ritz standards of service and like their type of "safe" luxury, you'll like this hotel just fine. If you are more a boutique hotel kind of person and want anything remotely hip, you won't find it here. It isn't a failing of the staff at all--they are top-drawer and wonderful. Its more about the choices of decor, set up of lobby, and lack of imagination in terms of amenities.

review_body: We stayed at the Ritz in Midtown, Tokyo for a week at the end of May, 2015. The hotel is very clean and it has a nice location in Midtown, Tokyo. We used the Platinum American Express services to book this hotel. For those who are members, a room upgrade is given upon availability. The woman at the front desk did not offer us an upgrade which was extremely disappointing considering that we were paying $500 for a double bed room a night. She informed us that she gave us a better view of the city. I do not care about views, especially if I stay in a hotel for a week. The front desk people need better training and if the Ritz-Carlton in Tokyo participates in the Platinum American Express Program, they need to get on board with the room upgrades. The hotel was not fully booked as we have noticed during our one week stay. They could have given us a better room but they chose not to. As far as room service and service staff - waiters, waitresses, concierge and the cleaning crew, they have been wonderful. Very helpful, professional and friendly. In particular we wish to commend the following individuals for their exceptional service and professionalism:  Inoue Tatiana Adelia Yuriko Ohori These people made our stay a memorable experience and we thank them from the bottom of our hearts.

The location of the Ritz was great. Tokyo is huge but Minato is fairly central so you can easily get around to all the major neighborhoods that a typical tourist would want to check out. The staff is super friendly. One tip: get the concierge to book all of your restaurants! Especially if they are special michellin star ones, the hotel can make it all happen for you! Beautiful room with a view of the city and though Fuji was meant to be in the background the clouds and or smog didn't let us see it! But the room is clean, comfortable and standards high just as you would expect.

This hotel is the best we have ever stayed in anywhere. We travel a lot, almost entirely in 5 star luxury hotels, and are considered "tough customers". We are typically complainers, but this time only compliments are in order: this establishment is in a category of its own.The staff could not be more helpful and pleasant. We particularly appreciated:- The entire concierge staff- The reservations staff and the front desk night shift, who were patient and smiling as we fiddled endlessly with our room selection and dates (we are staying 8 nights with a gap at the week-end)- The "executive club" hospitality team who were so welcoming and gracious- The housekeeping staff, so invisible and discreet that we suspect the hotel may employ ghosts for this task - The tempura restaurant team where a delicious lunch was served morsel-by-morsel by a private chef!  The room is a model of serenity, luxurious comfort and practical convenience. The views, breathtaking.We give this hotel a perfect "5 out of 5 " - "outstanding" in all categories. We would never ever consider staying anywhere else in TokyoApparently the hotel was recently rated "Best in Japan" by Conde Nast. We would rate it "Best in the World". We will definitely be coming back.

We had the pleasure of staying at the Club Level and were amazed at the graciousness, professionalism, and kindness of the entire staff. Our visit to Tokyo was memorable in part because of the hospitality we received. The property is truly exceptional and exceeded our expectations in every way.

Stayed at the club level for 4 nights for the first time, best chocie I've made for my Tokyo trip, great location with few prime shopping centre nearby and walking distance to galleries and some top restaurants in Tokyo.My room was spotless clean and tidy everyday as you expected from Ritz Calton but the service standard I received in Tokyo was truly beyond any Ritz Carlton hotel I've been. Exceptional team of staff from the concierge to the club lounge staff, everyone was so attentive and friendly and it made my stay unforgettable and defiantly this will be my only hotel in Tokyo when I return.

Excellent top tier hotel centrally located in Tokyo. Large room and bathroom that was very well decorated. Great concierge service in fixing a business suit issue. Great views of Tokyo from bar/restaurant floor. Not inexpensive but worth price at today's foreign exchange rate.
